description:
Came here with my friend during lunch rush hour and the line can get super long. Luckily it's like Chipotle-style so they make it right in front of you pretty quickly.

I ordered the banh mi with lemongrass pork. The sandwich was huge! I couldn't finish it and it was my dinner. We also decided to order and share the 3 fresh-rolls which was lemongrass pork, grilled chicken, and garlic shrimp. 

Definitely worth the price since portions are huge!
author: Jenna W.

description:
I've been here a few times & love the food here. It's fast & fresh. The employees working here are nice. They have great iced tea. Also cucumber water for free. 
I've had the vermicelli bowl & it's huge & yummy. Could hardly eat it all! The rolls are great too. Got those to go & the girl separated them with lettuce leaves so they wouldn't stick together in the to go box. 
Glad I stumbled upon this place. I'll be back again & again.
author: P P.

description:
$13 for a bowl of fast Pho??

I found it watery and not very savoury or flavoursome. On the menu it has a lovely description but it really isn't very nice.

Ive tried the beef and chicken pho and when I ordered the chicken pho there wasn't much chicken. It felt like they were running out of 'braised' (its practically boiled dark meat) and that they'd tried to stretch it out. 

The last time I went in I requested the grilled chicken in  the Pho that they used for the sandwiches & the lady refused to make it happen so I left.

I wish I'd wanted to try something else on the menu but I am a pho-natic & I really wanted the grilled chicken.
author: Julian I.

description: We can here to have a quick lunch. The place is busy and noisy. Great rolls and bowels. The price is right, but if you add any extra toppings  ...they really charge you EXTRA. Few sitting place inside. Not good for large groups. Probably good for to go. The soup bowl is average with thin noodles, basil leaves, onion with jalapeños. The taste was average. They will charge you extra for any sauce  you want. I did not like that idea. Service is relatively fast. Good for quick bites. Not one of my favorite Vietnamese place to eat. Hope they give free sauce and be more customer friendly.
author: Khondker I.

description:
BUILD YOUR OWN SPRING ROLLS. Is there really more to life than this?

Seriously, I've been waiting to visit a place like Freshroll. Pick your own protein (tofu, pork, shrimp or chicken) and pick your own fillings (cucumber, noodles, bean sprouts, carrots, etc.). There are four sauces to choose from (Grandma's peanut sauce, citrus ginger, sweet & sour chili, and Vietnamese vinaigrette). Three spring rolls are ~$10. They also have banh mi sandwiches, rice or noodle bowls, and pho noodle soup. Unfortunately, they ran out of the broth for the pho when we arrived.

I got the lemongrass pork for all three spring rolls. Inside, I got extra noodles, extra cucumbers, crispy shallots, and scallions. You're allowed five total (noodles are included by default). Avocado is over a dollar extra, so no thanks. I also got a couple containers of the peanut sauce. The sauce was nothing spectacular, and it was freezing cold -- but the rest of the meal was quite good. I would absolutely try this place again.

Still, good food doesn't overshadow shoddy service. Most of the employees were nice, but one woman in particular was very clearly not happy to be working late on a Friday and wanted to go home as soon as possible. She was packing up the chairs and tables despite over 15 minutes to spare til closing time, when customers were still walking inside to order. Definitely a weird vibe from her.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
Was in the area for conference and wanted to grab a quick bite. I like that they have low(er) carb options. You don't have to get noodles or rice paper. I got mine with salad, chicken and all toppings. I asked for extra cilantro and they gladly gave me some. I got the Vietnamese vinaigrette, which tasted like the sauce that comes often with Bun. I like that it was sweet, sour and savory. The portion was large and I was stuffed. 

Service is fast! So even if the line is long, you will get your food and be on your merry way quickly.
author: Eriko M.

description:
Vietnamese fast food that offers both vegan & meat options. Surprisingly delicious + 4 kinds of homemade sauce to choose from! 

Ordered 3 spring rolls w/ standard veggies for ~$11.50 (after tax). (One of each flavor: Lemmongrass pork, Chicken, & Crispy tofu). They are seasoned well, of a good quantity of meat, & very tasty! 

Lemmongrass pork was my favorite. The meat was fresh & marinated, & Lemmon flavor comes out perfectly (plus the fried onions). Tofu was a more of a plain flavor, so I chose the Ginter citrus & peanut sauce to dip in. 

Meal options include pho, bowl, sandwich, & Springrolls. They are very aesthetic & colorful for the appetite! 

Will def come back for another quick bite!
author: Jess W.

description:
Freshroll is so good!!! I got a chicken bowl with brown rice and lots of toppings (jalapeño, pickled veggies, cucumber and more), and my dad got the lemongrass pork and was equally thrilled.

This is a small location, so you'll have to be a vulture to get a seat, but there is a decent amount of seating to choose from, you just have to get lucky with the timing. 

The line moved quickly and servers were all friendly.

Great food. Will be back!
author: Nic Z.

description: This place is awesome! I wish they had this in Chicago. This place is essentially fast food vietnamese food. It is chipotle style - you choose a style (pho: soup noodle, bahn mi sandwich, rice paper rolls, or noodle), protein, toppings and sauce. I stopped by here for lunch during a conference at Moscone Center and it did not disappoint. I had the dry noodle with lemograss pork and all of the standard toppings. It was delicious and all for about $11. It is pricey, but you are in San Francisco in a prime location so I did not expect anything less. They also had some interesting ice teas that in hindsight, I should have tried.
author: Patty L.

description:
I've only been here once during GDC so it might have been busier than normal. But i was more than disappointed. 
They were so dirty!!! The tables were dirty, the floor was dirty, flies everywhere, it was really gross. When they were making my rolls, they were trying to do it so fast that my rolls were super ugly and ingredients were flying everywhere. And it's not cheap either!!! :/
I don't think i would ever go back.
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
I came by to grab a quick bite to go while at a conference at the Moscone Center. This place is sort of a choose-your-own entree where you choose the item you want (bowl or rolls), the protein, and then add-ons. The menu was fairly intuitive, although it probably helps to be familiar with the cuisine. There were a couple of people behind in mine that didn't know what "the works" entailed. I ordered the rolls and you get three gianormous rolls in one order! They looked like baby burritos, seriously. 

Unfortunately, my rolls had too much pickled veg in them, which threw off the balance and made them hard to eat. The bites that didn't have as much acid were great- just wish the entire box was balanced better.
author: Sally C.

description:
Aside from not having enough seating this is a great little shop to stop for rolls and or a sandwich.  We tried both.  

Not sure what the deal is with the sound in here but I had trouble placing my order.  While there is no music it seems there is a large fan that makes a lot of low noise so the staff can't hear you.  I had to ask what type of meats are available like 5 times.  People were looking at me a little strange because I was the tall guy yelling "Meats?  Meats?!"   It could just be that the lady didn't understand English and that's fine but come on, in a sandwich shop "MEAT" is a word you should know, right?  (Not picking on immigrants cause there's way too much of that going around)...  

The food was totally great and filling.  Nice and fresh.  Maybe too many carrots.   Plan to spend $10+ a person.  The free cucumber water was popular with us and everyone else with it being so damn hot outside.   

The tables by the windows need to have sunscreens because if you do not have enough places for people to sit, you need to at least make sure the places customers can sit they need to be out of the blaring sun.  

Oh and the restroom key has a huge dirty disgusting looking clip board attached to it.   I would suggest latex gloves if you have to pick that thing up.
author: Greg D.

description:
My vermicelli bowl was fresh, light and tasty. I liked the plump shrimp, fresh veggies and herbs, and the peanut sauce. I felt healthy and light after eating this veggie packed bowl along with their organic coconut water. 

This is a very casual, Chipotle style eatery, with tables inside and out.
author: Kat M.

description: They are always always busy but they were so fast. I needed to order 6 orders of rolls for a meeting. They were quick and friendly. They even gave us extra sauce since people on my team couldn't decide. The rolls were awesome. My favorite was shrimp with peanut sauce. After two i was full so it was a perfect meeting snack.
author: Desa D.

description:
Overpriced hipster Vietnamese food. I'm going to stick to my Pho places that are named "Pho", followed by a number (example "Pho 45"). I like the concept of a Chipotle-style service with Vietnamese food but the food turned out to be subpar. I wasn't a fan of their shrimp spring rolls and I wasn't a fan of their Banh Mi. I also sampled my friends Pho and it was very underwhelming due to lack of flavor.

The pros of the place are that the toppings are fresh and service is quick but that is about it...
author: Ralph V.

description:
Yes, the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. That's pretty accurate. 

Pros:
- Very customizable spring rolls. 
- Made on the spot. Lots of other places will have the rolls prepared in advance. 
- MASSIVE rolls. Like small burritos. 
- Reasonably priced, considering how big the rolls are. 

Cons:
- Meats weren't very good. I tried the pork and chicken, both were dry, not very flavorful. The meat did look like they had been sitting there a while. But I went at 11:45am... shouldn't everything have been pretty fresh, ready for the lunch crowd?
- Actually, that's it. Just the meat. But that's kind of an important part, hence the 3 stars. 

Pro-tip: Add the "crispy goodness". Just do it. Yes, you have to. You're welcome. 

Verdict: Good place if you want spring rolls or just feel like a light but filling lunch. I'll be back.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Decent option for a quick and moderately priced meal near the mall! We came here after a late afternoon movie to get some bowls to-go. Their salad portions are quite hefty - even with the standard 5 add-ins (I'd recommend at least the pickled veggies and fresh cucumber slivers), my bowl was brimming to the top! 

The chicken on top was generous, and charred just enough for some extra flavor. You can select two sauces, and I found the sweet chili sauce + peanut sauce makes a great combo of sweet and savory. 

Freshroll isn't any more expensive than Mixt, Lemonade, etc. especially with the amount of food you get. I was stuffed for the rest of the day!
author: Denise L.

description:
While in SF for work, I needed a quick lunch near my hotel. Of course, I pulled out my handy Yelp app and came across Freshroll. I LOVE spring rolls and bowls of any kind so decided to give it a shot. My original intent was to get the spring rolls but when I saw the bowls being packed with loads of noodles and veggies, I opted for that! 

The bowl was packed with half chicken/half beef, a TON of noodles (so filling), lettuce, cilantro, crispy onions, green onions, cucumbers, bean sprouts, and a lime, It was so fresh! Then, you can pick your sauces. Of course I got one of each. Anyone else a sauce freak? They have a peanut sauce (on the sweeter side), a sweet chili sauce, a Vietnamese vinaigrette, and a citrus dressing. My favorite for the bowl was the Vietnamese vinaigrette but the mix of all were pretty good. I also added some hot sauce to give it a kick. 

All in all, I was really impressed with the portion size and freshness. However, the meat was not for me. The beef was REALLY tough and the chicken was just eh. I would probably go vegetarian on my next visit. All in all, a tasty, healthy, quick lunch in the city.
author: Hailey P.

description:
I ordered "fresh rolls" with the standard fillings, grilled chicken, and peanut sauce. The total came out to $11.94, which I thought was pretty hefty for just 3 spring rolls :/

All of my spring rolls had giant holes in the wrapping, so I couldn't eat them by hand like usual (had to use a fork). The grilled chicken lacked flavor, which was partially made up for by the peanut sauce, which I thought was pretty tasty.

By the end of the meal, I didn't feel super full, which is disappointing for a meal that costed almost $12. While this meal wasn't horrible, I feel like the expensive price knocked down a star since the meal was already subpar.
author: Cassie Z.

description: Perfect lunch spot to grab a quick bite. My Vietnamese bowl was delicious, and the staff was friendly, even during the lunch rush. It had a lot of great flavors and felt filling and healthy. A perfect, balanced lunch.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Chipotle-rized food done right. Fresh and bright vietnamese food served fast for the lunchtime rush. 

Choose 3 rolls, sandwich, or bowl + choice of lemongrass pork, chicken, shrimp, or tofu plus all the lovely veggie fixings that give Vietnamese cuisine the brightness and texture contrasts. I like an old school pork vermicelli bowl and Vietnamese vinaigrette. Perhaps a little sweeter and less fishy that the traditional nuoc cham but still lots of lovely flavors while keeping the whole meal still light. 

Best of all, the lines at Freshroll move pretty quickly and efficiently so you'll be in and out in no time and tucking into lunch.
author: Jon L.

description:
I've been to this place twice now and this is a great place for a quick lunch! This place is kind of like a quick serve chipotle style Vietnamese place. You get to choose the format (spring roll, sandwich, bowl, or pho), the type of protein, toppings, and sauces. 

I've only tried the bowls so far and think it's really great for what you get, both food and value wise. For around $10 you can get a big bowl of noodles/rice/salad with protein and veggies. 

Tip: you can do half salad half vermicelli for the bowls! 

The lemongrass pork is really good and my go to protein. But I think I'll give chicken a try the next time I go. I usually just get the standard toppings and peanut sauce for my bowl. 

Highly recommend for a quick lunch!
author: Nina W.

description:
Everything about this place screams cheap fast food quality food. Not sure why they went with the branding they did but it certainly kept me away for a while. I probably still wouldn't have checked it out if it weren't for a coworker's suggestion. 

Since my first visit a few months ago I've been back a handful of times. While yes it is technically fast food it's actually pretty good. I haven't ventured from my favorite: tofu/veggie rolls with the ginger and the peanut sauce. However, the bowls do look good. The set up is similar to a Chipotle, you go down the assembly line and they add whatever options you'd like (this includes things like bell peppers, cilantro, pineapple, cucumber, and avocado - this is extra of course). 

Portion sizes are generous and I am never hungry after eating here. The restaurant itself is clean but nothing special. I prefer to get my food to go and head over to Yerba Buena when the weather is nice. At lunch there can be a bit of a line but you can order online. 

Overall I feel like this is great for lunch with fresh, healthy options for around $10-12.
author: Tarah P.

description:
Whenever it's cold and/or rainy, I come here for a quick bite especially for pho noodle soup.  If you're still hungry, snack on the crispy taro chips.  You may find more authentic places with larger portions at lower prices, but this is an efficient chain that helps me access comfort food when I crave it.

Service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  There is ample shared seating and a restroom near a hustling and bustling area.  Parking can be tough on the street, but you can use the structure across from the Metreon.
author: Jenny L.

description: It was fine with various options. If you are looking for a quick bite, it would be good.
author: Yeonjin L.

description:
Stopped by here for a snack-ordered the great combo of tea and taro chips for $3.99.

A light snack that was both interesting and tasty. One of the few taro chips I have ventured into and was not disappointed at all! 

The tea was both refreshing and not too sweet-had a nice flavor and was both rejuvenating and energizing! Definitely a refreshing experience to help boost me through my day! Also great takeout packaging!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
The Food
I ordered the lemongrass pork, tofu and grilled chicken for the rolls. They were made in front of you. The fresh rolls are pretty standard, it's not bad but it's not crazy good. ​I had it with the grandma's peanut sauce and it was okay.

Atmosphere
The place is medium. A lot of people eating by themselves (nothing to be ashamed). It's a quick service.

Service
The staffs were okay. 

Overall
Not sure if I would crave for it but If i was really hungry and this place is around the corner, I would go.
author: Cindy W.

description: I love the fast food Vietnamese concept and the fact that I can get vegan spring rolls quickly. The spring rolls here are always good with fresh ingredients and perfectly cooked vermicelli noodles. The tofu is fried at this location (versus the other locations that bake the tofu). While not as healthy, the fried version of their tofu tastes infinitely better! I've never had a bad spring roll from this location. Only feedback I'd give is that I think it would be great if they could make a Vietnamese vinaigrette without fish sauce.
author: Christina M.

description:
I'm taking a star back because I recently ordered their tofu sandwich and it nearly cut my mouth. The tofu was so thick that chewing became a mission. Next time I'll ask them to slice the tofu in fourth and reduce the amount to half. 
I don't even think you should have that kind of soy intake. 
I kid you not there was like 8 bricks of rock hard tofu!!!
author: Gina B.

description: Really great concept and we'll executed. You need to be specific if you don't want cilantro or something else in their standard mix. Fresh and tasty shrimp and veggies. Will definitely be back.
author: Beth M.

description:
I had one of the noodle bowl here, and it was surprisingly quite good, especially since it was a Meal Pal option.

The veggies tasted pretty fresh, the herbs were a little on the skimpier side but they tasted fresh too, and the pickled daikon/carrots and meat tasted awesome. While it may not be the most super authentic Vietnamese noodle bowls I've had, they tasted really fresh and tasty and I overall quite enjoyed it.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I've always loved food places that has a build-your-own type of concept. Combining that concept with Vietnamese food, is an absolute dream come true!

Freshroll Is cheap, convenient, fast, and delicious. Often times there are too many options on the menu, and food places like to over complicate them. Not with this one! There are 4 menu boards with 4 different steps (style of food, protein, veggies/filling, sauces), so it's easy for new comers/tourist to understand. And it's great for people on the go, it takes 5 minutes (as long as you know what you want). Everything is under $10, so it's cheap and affordable. There's also an array of delicious sauces to choose from. They also have tofu as a vegetarian option! Best of all, you can see how fresh they are made with the open kitchen concept it has! Though it is a let down they only do pho after 3pm during the weekdays, but it is all day during weekends! 

This location is pretty great as well. Located in downtown SF, next to the Metreon mall, it over looks the busy highway and streets of SF. They're also tables outside, as well as tables inside looking out to the beauty that is San Francisco. 

PRO TIP: Come here around 11:30AM or past 130PM to avoid lunch rush hours!
author: Oliver B.

description:
Quick, affordable, and assembly-style setup...Freshroll is a clean and modern way to get your banh mi or pho!

Shared a tofu banh mi with a friend, as we were shopping around and needed a quick pick-me-up. The tofu banh mi is yummy and service is fast and with a smile. We were debating between boba at Sharetea next door or a vietnamese sandwich here--I'm glad we came here, as the line was much shorter and the meal filled us up, even splitting it in half! They have other sauces sriracha and fish sauce if you need it, and serve-yourself water and a clean restroom. 

It's right by the theaters and close to Union Square for shopping. I highly recommend coming here to eat because there aren't huge crowds, and plenty of space to relax and eat your fresh food. This is my kind of "mall food" choice.

Would totally recommend coming here for a simple meal if you want something light and need a seat in clean tables and chairs.
author: Jodi H.

description: Really fresh and nice chipotle style concept. We were visiting from out of town and considering the amount of food options in SF it was nice to just go and get something quick walking distance from our Union Square hotel. Price was excellent too for the city.
author: Gabriel C.

description:
Interesting concept but pretty meh food!

Went here on a weekend around lunch time. I was pretty intrigued by the concept of a Vietnamese subway-style place. There wasn't much of a queue. The recommendations were clear on the menu board which was a nice-to-have. The indoor was bright and green and felt "fresh".

I got the Vegetarian fresh rolls with crispy tofu and most of the recommended stuff. It was very very average. The rice wrap used for the rolls were pretty soggy. The stuff inside was not particularly great. The tofu was okayish. The peanut and chili sauce were solid. The portion was pretty good but the food was very average.

I have to caveat that the last time I had fresh rolls was in Vietnam, so I couldn't help but compare to that.
author: Vignesh B.

description:
This is one of my favourite lunch spots in San Francisco. I got introduced to this place by my teammates. Given I am a vegeterian, I was  initially a  bit spectical about  the quality but oh boy I was so wrong. Their noodle bowl with fried tofu and veggies  is probably the best thing I have had and it costs around 11$ only :D . I like it so much I go this place at least once every week.
They also have coupons where if you have eaten bowls 5  times, you get a free drink next time and when you have eaten 10 times you get a free bowl.
In a nutshell if you are looking for a healthy vegeterian option other than salad with a great taste, this is the place for you
author: Abhishek A.

description: For under $10, the three fresh rolls were a good deal considering how much larger and more substantial they are than rolls from typical Vietnamese joints that are 90% noodles, lettuce and bean sprouts. You can pick different meats for each roll so I ordered two with chicken and one with lemongrass pork. The chicken was bland and some pieces were dry, so I'd probably stick with the pork next time. The addition of pineapple as one of the toppings was a yummy pairing. This is a good spot to get a quick, cheap bite in downtown SF.
author: Tina H.

description:
Wow, this place is incredible. I can not believe I haven't run into this type of food before but it's like Vietnamese fast-food.

The star item of course is the fresh roll, wherein you actually get not one, not two, but three massive rolls of fresh veggies and protein and rice-based goodness.

You cannot go wrong with the peanut and sweet chili sauce, especially if you mix in a little sriracha.

The other MUST get item is the homemade taro chips. Delightfully crunchy, perfectly salted.

I think I must have come here three times in the week that I discovered it. If you like to order shrimp rolls along with your pho, you will probably love this place.

On top of all this, the price is not bad for the amount of food you get and it's probably healthier than the majority of other fast food out there.
author: Terry L.

description: Great little spot to eat fresh and healthy! You move through the line as they make your bowl, rolls or sandwich -- like Chipotle. I love that you can see and choose what goes inside your food. It's a great spot for a quick bite. I only wish they had healthier versions of sauces too!
author: Hasti M.

description: Came here for a late breakfast. This place is great for a quick, light meal. The pork and chicken was flavorful and savory. The limeade was very sour, which is exactly what I wanted/expected. The peanut sauce was a little watery compared to other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to. Overall, I thought the food was good but not amazing, though might be because I live in an area with a lot of authentic Vietnamese food. A solid 4/5 in my opinion, and I would definitely come back for a light meal.
author: Kevin H.

description: Great fast-food type Vietnamese spot. Right downtown and gets pretty crowded at lunch. Choose your base (banh mi, noodle bowl, pho, etc), then choose your toppings and sides. I went with the pork banh mi with a side of chicken broth. They do not have Pho during the week for lunch, so you'll have to come back later or on weekends. Good, fast service, and a tasty sandwich. Overall, if you're looking for a quick fix, I would recommend. Not as authentic as traditional places, but it's fast and reasonably priced.
author: Matthew M.

description: Vietnamese chipotle? A good add on for a healthy lunch spot in the city. Everything seems to be fresh ingredients. Very simple and straight forward menu. I had their tofu rolls, although it's fairly bland tasting, the sauces make up for it! Oh their Vietnamese coffee had a weird taste to it. I personally do not recommend it but they have other refreshing looking drinks to choose from
author: Danica V.

description:
Fast, good, big portions...and fresh! One roll would be enough for a quick lunch to keep you going the rest of the day but they have a 3 roll deal to sweet to pass up. Needless to say you will get your fill. The Banh Mi (typical Vietnamese sandwich) is made on a crispy baguette with your choice of protein and veggies; so are the rolls. You get your choices of sauces which are all very good, but if you really want to taste what you are eating they are to be used moderately. The saying goes: " Too much peanut sauce kills the roll! "
Cost relative to freshness and tastiness... yes tastiness :) this is perfect for a quick lunch.
Bon appétit!
author: Matt V.

description:
3 trash rolls for $11. 

If Houdini were straight-jacketed, blindfolded, and hung upside down by the ankles while descending into a tank full of piranhas all the while trying to wrap a roll, well, that's this place in a nutshell.

Vermicelli on the outer edge of the ingredients makes it look like a bunch of squids squished up against a window. On top of that, the rolls are wrapped like fat mini burritos. What on earth is going on here?! The wrap was also dry and not hydrated properly. The peanut sauce tasted like a supermarket generic brand balsamic vinaigrette. All wrong. Just all wrong. 

This is pretty much the chipotle of Vietnamese food. The ingredients for the rolls are also soooo Americanized that you can't even complete an authentic Vietnamese roll. Just like chipotle.

If your Vietnamese food isn't being made by Vietnamese aunties, or at least Vietnamese people or Asians, well, you might as well just tell them to give u the ingredients and do it yourself. If you see college kids doing it too, just starve yourself and call it a fasting diet. Spare your wallet. 

My friend and I came here due to hunger. What a tragedy. If fresh roll ended up at the oscars, they'd win every category for tragedy.
author: Gregory F.

description:
This spot has some really good Freshrolls, you also have the options to get a bowl or sandwich.

When the line is long don't hesitate the wait isn't long at all! Well worth it if your truly interested in fresh food!


Ps. Side note employees hair should be kept out of the face and pulled back.

Pps. I'll come back again!
author: John J.

description:
Hella 5 stars. This place is great after a movie and you're starving to death but don't want to feel heavy. I like the ordering system which is kind of like how you order poke, element by element. The salad bowls are satisfying and they put all the dressing/sauces on the side. 

Lots of seating inside and a few tables outside. I recommend this place for a fast meal that's ~$12 and healthy.
author: Sarah L.

description: All fresh ingredients and perfect portions! You can build your own spring roll or get it in a bowl! Loved both! Their lemongrass pork and chicken is delicious. Quick, fresh and delicious! I personally like the Vietnamese sauce/vinaigrette with my dish. Highly recommend.
author: June R.

description: This place is so tasty and a great bang for your buck. I always get a bowl and the flavors are always fresh and delicious. This is always a go to for lunch during the work week!
author: Alexandria D.

description:
By far my favorite place to visit when I want some filling, fresh spring rolls. I went on a Saturday around lunch time (1 pm) and the line was LONG. Only thing I didn't enjoy about my visit was I was super hungry and had to wait about 10-15 minutes in line just to order. It wasn't the worst though. 
I ordered their 3 freshrolls with lemongrass pork and "the standard" veggies, which included my choice of sauce. This order was about $12. 
The freshrolls were a good deal in my opinion for a SF eatery and it made me full. With a Sharetea nearby, my meal is complete. The peanut sauce is the traditional sauce to eat with the spring rolls, try if it's your first time going! 
Came here twice already, would go to again!
author: Bianca A.

description: Delicious and satisfying. Had to return after peak lunchtime, crazy long line, but the staff was cranking the meals as best they could. Had the fresh rolls.
author: Craig S.

description: One on my favorite eating spots to eat. The food is fresh, there's a ton of gluten free ( gluten-free )options and the price is great!!
author: Fresh E.

description:
Modern and clean, the food is tasty and the service is quick. 

Why I was here //
I came here with my bf before heading to Target which is nearby to this place. We had just come back from the farmers market and I was craving something quick to eat. This place is very close to the Metreon which is right next to the Yerba Buena art center. 

Restaurant & Service //
This pho place is cool in the sense that you can customize you pho, noodle bowls, and spring rolls. Servers are young and friendly. Food is super quick and for a Saturday afternoon it wasn't overly crowded at all. 

Food // 
-Pho Bowl // 9.99 with steak add 0.99 // Pho was decent, not amazing but if you are looking for a quick pho fix, this place will do the trick. 
-3 Freshrolls // 9.49 with shrimp mix/match add 1.25 // I didn't really care for their spring rolls, they were ok and seemed a bit too pricey for what you get. 
-Taro chips // 1.99 // I thought these were super tasty and worth it! You can even ask for a sample and they will let you try it out. 

Overall// 
This place is a cheaper option in the FIDI area, not amazing or super authentic Vietnamese food, but still tasty and quick. I gave this place 5 stars mainly for how quick and easy it was, since I was hungry and really craving soup.
author: Emily T.

description: Tofu sandwich with standard is my calling, if only they could have a little softer bread but great food
author: Anjana P.

description:
Solid lunch spot, the line gets long unless you come before 12 but they move quickly. 

It is subway style serving. I usually order the bowls, note you can get half of two bases, I usually go half salad half noodles. Meats both chicken and pork are good. I get the standard make sure to get the onion crisps! Sauces I like the Vietnamese, you are allowed two pe4 order if you are as indecisive as me.

I have also tried spring rolls which are large but I don't enjoy for lunch. 

Everything averages to about $10 without extras.
author: Kevin Y.

description: I wish I could like this place more, but I really didn't like it. Not sure why it got such good reviews because the dishes were so plain and bland. I got a pho, some fresh spring rolls and their signature taro chips. I didnt like any of them. The portion was small, garlic shrimp was tasteless and broth was plain. Price is high for the food. I don't recommend this place
author: Laura S.

description: I guess it is more of a healthier options around. Got rice bowl which was pretty decent but not something out of the world.
author: Sharad B.

description: The food is really delicious, served with fresh ingredients that make me satisfy and I will come back here again for sure. It doesn't take long time to order and pay for my meal, just a few minutes to choose what I want to eat then I can enjoy right away.
author: Mia N.

description:
Great place to get quick Vietnamese food, albeit a small menu. The main items are spring rolls, banh mi sandwiches, and vermicelli noodles. They roll the spring rolls in front of you like chipotle or subway which is cool. I ordered the lemongrass vermicelli noodles which was good, but pretty basic. The lemongrass pork was great, but I did not like most of the sauces they had available. The ONE sauce I did like was the CITRUS GINGER, ooooooh I'd get that next time! The food is nothing AMAZING, but still great for a quick fresh Vietnamese meal when it comes down to the spring rolls, banh mi, or vermicelli bowls with great customization options that you don't get from Vietnamese restaurants. 

The CITRUS GINGER sauce, I recommend! I was debating between a 3 and 4 star and I'd give this place a 3.5. Fast service, small store with limited seating, good food (nothing near amazing, just good).
author: Andrew S.

description: Wow. So impressed by Freshroll. The concept of a made-to-order spring roll place is genius and I wish there was one in the Twin Cities. I love how you can customize your own rolls with anything you want. You get three rolls in their standard order. I did shrimp, avocado, jalapeno, cilantro, and lettuce. It was awesome how their peanut sauce (and other sauces) were on the side so you can help yourself to as much as you want (this was awesome for a peanut sauce lover like myself). Definitely more of a lunch spot but I came here for dinner and it was still pretty filling. I will be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Emily Z.

description: The pork banh mi is delicious! I come here all the time. I also love their limeade.
author: Chelsea D.

description: In town for a conference and wanted something light but packed with flavor, since I had hours to go and needed to stay awake and alert! Found Freshroll during my jaunt to Target the night before. There was a line out the door but it moved pretty quickly. I saw smiling, chatty patrons  enjoying and ordering salads, rolls, bowls, and soups. Everything looked great and I settled on the crispy tofu rolls....excellent choice! The restaurant is set up "Chipotle" style, where customers make their selections and the food is assembled in real time, for your viewing and salivating pleasure. All the fixings sounded great but a few regular customers recommended the "standard" (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumber, crispy shallots, and pickled veggies). I added jalapeño, pineapple and avocado. OH MG palette heaven! I didn't have breakfast so I figured I'd be able to eat all three rolls...wrong. 1.5 rolls and near full, but managed to finish two. The rolls were so delicious, I went to the store the next day to buy the ingredients to recreate them at home lol. I ordered the citrus ginger dipping sauce which was amazing. I started to ask if I could buy a container of it. Excellent food, will definitely return if I have business in the area again.
author: Candace C.

description: great option for a healthful quick lunch. i opted for the three rolls- chose shrimp x2 and chicken. THey were quite good but important thing to consider: they are MESSY to eat. i had a work event at the convention center and literally could not eat these things without looking like a slob. had to "deconstruct" my rolls which definitely was not how they were intended to be eaten.
author: Steph G.

description:
Freshroll is a Chipotle style Vietnamese fast food place. They specialize in spring rolls, but you can also order rice/noodle bowls and pho. Although not super traditional, it's a convenient and cost effective meal that is relatively healthy and super fresh. It's one of the few Vietnamese places you can go to in the near vicinity where one can eat without worrying that a "temporarily shelter challenged" person will stab you, because it's in the Metreon and near the Moscone center.

There is limited seating, and the service is quick.

I've ordered everything. I like everything.
author: Sean W.

description:
I've been ordering group lunch for work from Freshroll for years. We typically use the location in Fidi on Bush but we had other business in Soma nearby so we ordered from that location. The online order was placed at 11am. This location opens at 11:30am. Knowing that it's prime lunch rush time I gave a little leeway and showed up at 12:30 (even though the order was supposed to be ready at 12) when I arrived I was told the order wasn't ready and hat it would be another 10-15 minutes. I asked why since I placed my order before they even opened and the person behind the counter said they were very busy. So I waited 15 minutes and checked in again. I was at this point told that the food wasn't ready and they needed another 10-15 minutes. The line was out the door and I get it. I've worked in kitchens and deli's during lunch rush. But this was just poor service. There were people that came in after me that were sitting down and eating. Meanwhile I had a team of hungry workers. The order was finally ready at 1:10- sort of. They didn't get all the drinks and I had to grab my own from the drink case. The ones I ordered were not in stock. 

This is not a worker issue. This is a management issue. If you have a customer spending over $100 on spring rolls and you don't have the decency or capacity to communicate the errors with them or support your team to push through everything, then maybe you should not be managing a business. Nobody attempted to make this right with me. And when I asked the person behind the counter why my food was over an hour late, he pointed to the line out the door and said "as you can see, we're a little overwhelmed" BUT WERE YOU OVERWHELMED AT 11AM WHEN OUR ORDER WAS PLACED? OR AT NOON WHEN IT WAS DUE? SO OVERWHELMED THAT YOU COULDN'T CALL WIH A HEADS UP OR OFFER TO COMPENSATE FOR THIS ERROR???
author: Rubie K.

description: Great place to pick up takeout for a picnic at Yerba Buena Gardens around the block. Fast service. Fresh made to order food. I got 3 fresh rolls with 3 different proteins.
author: Quyen Q.

description:
Place - clean and easy to find. It is the part of Metreon building. Tables are not many inside but in Metreon and park there are many seats to eat. Menu is easy to read and you can easily oreder. 

Taste - basic but all ingredients are fresh. Protiens are chiken, pork, tufu and shrimp(add $1.99) My favorite one is garilc shrimp but they only put 4 shimps in each roll. Almost 10 choice to put in roll and you can chooes 5. There is customed vege or you can chooes your own. I alway put pineapple, mint, lettuce, cucumber and bell pepper. There are 4 sources, chilly, peanut butter, vinegar and giner. I like peanut butter one. 

Price and Service - service is good and price is reasonable.
author: Da Won L.

description:
This place is so my jam! Quick and easy, plus delicious! Funny thing is, I'm not even a fan of traditional spring rolls...  But these spring rolls are Chipotle style. Basically you choose what goes in them, so it's your own fault if you don't like it! 

I ordered two, one lemongrass pork and the other shrimp. They are huge, and I finished one and kinda picked at the other. I chose wisely though, because I loved every bite. I'm also a fan of the sauces you can serve yourself. My fave was the citrus ginger!

Final note, always add the crispy element!
author: Rachel C.

description: When I was traveling to San Francisco for work every week I would roam around the city and I randomly discovered Fresh Roll while walking back to my hotel - I was skeptical at first but decided to try it out. Since then I've been hooked. I used to get the fresh rolls here about once a week because they're made fresh (duh), quick and easy, healthy, and absolutely delicious! The meat is 100% all natural and the vegetables are locally sourced whenever possible. There's a number of different house made sauces you can choose from as well, and you can add on a side of yummy taro chips (which I did tonight). It's also not too expensive which is a bonus in this city, especially around the financial district. I always get my rolls with crispy goodness in the middle - and you should too when you check this place out. The only thing is that the customer service I feel is sometimes hit or miss.
author: Emily T.

description: We came here after visiting the SF MOMA and grabbed a quick bite! The bowl serving was large and came with 5 add-ons. I got the pork (delish and well seasoned) with pineapple, salad, pickled carrots and turnip,  and cucumber. My friend got three rolls with crispy tofu, grilled chicken, and grilled pork in them. Delicious!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Pretty cool concept - fast-food BYO Vietnamese food, with options of building rolls, a bowl or pho. Much like all the other BYO places, pick your protein (their lemongrass pork is their signature, but you can also mix & match and get 1/2 pork and 1/2 chicken, for example), then pick your veggies (pick 5 if you're not using their preset list). They have a few choices of sauce that you can use for your entree, including Vietnamese vinaigrette and classic peanut sauce. On average, the entree is about $10.

It was very refreshing as the all the vegetables are very fresh and overall, the meal felt a lot lighter than my typical meat-heavy or carb-heavy meals, yet it was surprisingly quite filling. The pho might a bit richer, so go for rolls or a bowl for a lighter meal :) Also the bowls come in plasticware, so you can easily ask for a lid to take any leftovers to go. 

Overall, they're located in the same building as the Metreon, but they face the outside, just across from Moscone Center West. Pretty heavy foot traffic, but quite a few tables inside, and you can always get it togo. Pretty decent place for fast Vietnamese food!
author: Jennifer W.

description: I came to this place by chance since my favorite Japanese restaurant in Metreon had some issues with friers and grillers. However, this place did not disappoint! Although Freshroll is a fast food place, they serve all of the essential Vietnamese main dishes, including pho and rice wraps. I tried the pho with rare beef. Overall, the size is a bit smaller than I would have liked, but the chicken stock and beef are fresh and tasty. The pho noodle itself is also well-cooked. Note that all of the vegetables are dumped right into the soup, unlike other Vietnamese places, so you would have to specify whether you want jalapeno pepper in advance or not. Other than that, Freshroll does not have any appetizers, which is the only downside. If they add fried Vietnamese egg rolls, that would be excellent. The quick meal came out to be about $15 for one person. Enjoy!
author: Sam K.

description: Grabbed a quick bite here. I ordered three rolls with chicken and the rolls were fresh and light. I had the peanut sauce and sweet and sour sauce, and thought they tasted quite good together (surprisingly). One roll fell apart while being made, so he rolled it again from scratch. When I got the rolls, two of them were stuck together. Overall, good but I was hoping the chicken would have more flavor.
author: Catherine W.

description: Excellent fresh ingredients, and their peanut sauce is amazing! Extremely efficient service, too. A San Francisco must!
author: Heather E.

description:
The food was good. I got 3 fresh rolls with 2 shrimp and 1 crispy tofu. Chicken broth and taro chips. It's taste so good especially the crispy tofu. But the reason I gave 3 stars is the cashier girl with glasses make me super uncomfortable. 
After I told her I would like chicken broth and taro chips as well she gave me a detested look. I don't want be mean but she made me feel I eat too much and I shouldn't eat that much. While she's putting my soup in the bowl she sighs a lot too. I was like what did I do deserve that? There's no smile on her face for the whole time. I'm working at restaurant so I understand customer services is not a easy job, but if you hate it that much, here is a advice go find other job. 
I still gave 18% for the tips, it's to other workers.
author: Icey Z.

description:
After a very long travel day and a sleepless night, I wanted a comforting meal and nothing beats a big bowl of pho in my book. I found this place after a quick check of Yelp and what options were in the area. With 4 stars, it must be good. 

The restaurant is similar in concept to chipotle--pick your item, pick your protein and veggies, pay and wait a few minutes for your bowl to be assembled. I ordered the rare beef pho all the way, but had it packed up for carry out. My hotel was just a couple of blocks away, and when I got to my room to unpack the meal, the broth was still piping hot. This was really good!  The broth was nice and fragrant and very tasty. The veggies were fresh and the jalapeños added a perfect background heat. If I lived here, it would be on my regular rotation.
author: Pam W.

description:
Such a great store to grab a meal during the work week. I had worked in the area for almost 1.5 years before I finally ventured into the restaurant. Not quite sure why it took me so long, but I had definitely missed out on a good lunch spot for the rotation.

The two options I usually opt for are the rolls, and the salad. Two of the rolls are honestly enough for a meal, and then I save the other one for a snack later in the day. Most of the different types of meat that I have gotten have been tasty, and for sauces I've usually gone with the vinaigrette. 

Sometimes the lines cam feel a little long, but relative to the other stores around I feel the wait is worth it.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
This is one of my go-to lunch spots!
The variety of choices they offer is always great. Everything tastes fresh but I feel depending on the person, you do get more or less meat. I've also had their noodle soup before and it's a quick fix when you are craving some pho. 

The place has plenty of seats inside and a couple on the outside.
author: Alice L.

description:
Good location.
Delicious food.
Friendly staff.
Clean environment.
Affordable prices. 
What else can you expect.
author: Hui C.

description:
Freshroll is basically choose your own ingredients for spring rolls or bowls, where you can pick the protein, toppings, add-ons, and sauces. These aren't completely traditional Vietnamese spring rolls with options like avocado and bell peppers, but it works with simple and fresh ingredients. An order is about 3 rolls that are each cut in half. I'd probably ask for them not to cut it next time since most of my rolls were falling apart, making it more messy and less portable which is something I like about spring rolls. 

To be honest, it's on the more expensive side for what it is, but it's SF so maybe it's understandable. There's definitely quick and friendly service, so there's a speedy turnaround time for the tables as well. All in all, pretty fresh and tasty food for slightly higher prices.
author: Mimi T.

description: I really enjoyed these healthy Vietnamese rolls. They're like mini burritos but they use rice paper instead and fill them up with meat, veggies, noodles, avocado, etc.  Highly recommend!
author: Brandon H.

description: Great food and healthy but a little expensive, not sure why they ask for tip when its self service!
author: Jay G.

description:
I happened to be in the FiDi area for an unrelated reason, and figured I'd drop by and check out this establishment. I'm gonna start out by giving their spring rolls a 5-star rating. I figured I'd try out one of each--pork, chicken, and tofu. Imagine my surprise when this carnivore actually liked the crispy tofu the best! The rolls are hearty, made by hand to order, and the vegetables are very fresh. 

Service is quick as well; this is a great place for a fast bite. The lack of the five star rating comes from the rather utilitarian decor and the fact that the pho was okay. Overall, outstanding place to grab lunch on the run, though not really the place for a date or formal meetup.
author: Andy C.

description:
I've walked past this place a few times in the past and have always wanted to check it out. I love the whole idea/concept behind it and how clean the place is. I must compliment the layout of the store; more specifically, the front tables near the windows...seeing the delicious food customers ate when walking by did half of the convincing for me-haha! 

My friend and I ordered the 3 Freshrolls with Grandma's Peanut Sauce and Vietnamese Vinaigrette. The portion size was decent (bigger than avg. spring rolls), but the sandwich and pho noodle bowl would arguably be more worth it for the same price. 

There are plenty of seats open (depending on what time you visit) and there's also a station filled with condiments, napkins, eating utensils, water, etc. The only main issue I had was that the sauces lacked flavor/fell short; the Vinaigrette, especially, wasn't exactly tangy and did not hold well with the spring roll. The freshrolls also fell apart easily which made it a messy meal.
author: Joanne H.

description:
I got a single roll with tofu for $5. Great place for vegans -- tofu and plenty of vegetables. 
The service was great -- I got as much of the toppings as I requested, and when the roll ripped the server got a new one and remade it (I've been to places where they give it to you ripped anyways). The peanut and chili sauces were delicious. I haven't tried the bowl for $10 but I saw someone getting it and it looks like a lot more food than would be in 2 rolls. I would definitely come back, and try the bowl next time.
author: Yuliana H.

description:
Great for a quick lunch! Even when there's a line, Freshroll never fails to run through customers quickly. 

I always order a bowl with brown rice and crispy tofu. I love 'The Standard' toppings (except for jalapenos and cilantro). Portions are HUGE. Rarely do I finish my order - the leftovers are a plus. :)

Pho availability is limited - it's afternoons only and weekends all day, I think? I haven't had it yet but thinking of ordering it someday. 

Don't expect authenticity when you come here. It's simplified Vietnamese food. Definitely lacks in flavor with some items, but it all passes for a quick, affordable lunch. $10 may seem steep for a meal, but it's San Francisco and at least the portions are big.
author: Shanise M.

description:
Food was ok. I ordered a sandwich, and there was a lot of food on it. But it got cold really quickly. Also the cashier wouldn't give me any sauce and was rude about me asking.

Side not, for some reason it's so hard to hear the people behind the counter, something is up with the acoustics in the store.
author: Abhay D.

description:
I would not recommend this place if you are looking for a great Vietnamese Sandwich. I ordered the lemon grass Pork with cilantro, pickled carrots and jalapeños. My husband ordered the Grilled Chicken with the same veggies. 

Their bread was solid as a rock and so dry that you would literally need to dip it in a broth or water just just so you could eat it. The meat was stringy with a jerky texture. This was the worst Vietnamese sandwich I have ever had. The bread of a Vietnamese sandwich is what makes it amazing, my opinion was that this was the absolute worst. I do not suggest eating a sandwich here.

 Maybe their pho, rolls and bowls would be great, I will never know because I will not be back.
author: Cynthia W.

description: Really good shrimp Vietnamese rolls, terrible Banh Mi. Fire the baker. Get some good bread. Also the staff can't seem to not put Jalapeños on things. Two items ordered, literally said everything except Jalapeños please 6 times. Banh mi has got them on it. It's not so hard people, but you have to pay a modicum of attention. Limeade was good too, didn't try a bowl, but suspect it would be good too. I threw away the roll and ate the filling of the Banh mi.
author: Andrew M.

description: OK, i have to say I am a fan.  This place is similar in concept to Chipotle, but Vietnamese food.   I've only had the bowls, and I prefer the green papaya option (additional fee) instead of rice or noodles.  Food is fresh, tasty and healthy...what you would expect from Vietnamese food.
author: Matt V.

description: Chipotle must be getting tired of people stealing their concept of pick your meal and toppings and go down the line to the cashier. But on the note of Freshroll this was a great stop. A huge fan of their fresh rolls as they were huge and filling!! I got their rice bowl and boy oh boy was I not mad about my portions. What I will say is why there is a star missing is that I would like more protein options as well as different flavor profiles. If you mix the sauces and the marinades of how the meats are cooked its basically the same thing. Granted they are sticking to the authentic Viet. flavor profile but to open something different to the public you want to have something different that stand out. Other than that this was a great lunch spot! Looking to try more of their menu!
author: Ankita C.

description:
Great place for some fresh, quick to go, Vietnamese food; especially iif you are working or happen to be in the SOMA or Fidi area.

Love their spring rolls, and also love the fact that you can get your rolls made to order (think Subway but Vietnamese style. I will say that it is a bit pricy for three rolls, but hey, it is SF. 

Their drinks are good too. 

Must try!
author: Sonia A.

description: These spring rolls are definitely very packed so you can probably share with a friend if you both are not super hungry. Only con is that they do taste a little dry...
author: S O.

description: I had the bowl with chicken. It was average even for a licnh spot near work. I would recommend the rolls instead! They are lighter and have more flavor.
author: Haya D.

description:
This place serves food pretty quick & is next to Metreon, but I don't think it's special from any other place that I tried in Chinatown.

When I came, I tried the Vietnamese sandwich and the three Vietnamese spring rolls. It tasted alright and I guess the bright spot was that the bread had a nice crunch to it. But, I probably wouldn't come back because the price is too high for what it is.
author: Victor L.

description:
My first time here... not disappointed at all... food tasted great, and the interior looks clean, nice and modern.... services was good and fast.... price was reasonable too.
Will definitely come back again!
author: Kristin L.

description:
Freshroll has been a staple in my workweek diet since the second week I started and was introduced to these delicious vermicelli bowls. I've since graduated to salad since they give you a LOT of rice noodles and I can never finish! The same can also be said of the generous amounts of meat included in ever bowl, salad, or roll. I usually donate around 1/3 of my lemongrass pork to my coworkers with larger appetites, and still come away very satisfied. 

I've had their tofu option before, and unfortunately it's just not as good as their lemongrass pork which really sets them apart from other Vietnamese restaurants. I'd suggest maybe going elsewhere for vegetarians since there are many places that make their tofu options much better.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I went here this afternoon craving spring rolls, but my excitement soon faded after seeing the worker had to patch up a hole in the wrapping with another piece of wrap. By the time we had paid for our things and sat down all three of the rolls ended up with holes in them. It didn't taste awful, but it's really hard to enjoy when all the contents are spilling out of three different holes. Good thing I don't come to the area often.
author: Joann P.

description:
Great Fast Vietnamese food, thats good for the tummy and good on the wallet! I got a great little vegan meal out with co workers on my first night in town! 
It was fast cheap and delicious! I got a little Vegan Bowl.
Service was great, the menu is extensive, they have lots of hot sauce choices and can make pretty much anything vegan! 
Order time to when I was done eating was like 10 minutes! Solid, fast, and good I would ROLL back here anytime!
author: Patrick T.

description:
The Vietnamese version of Chipotle! You can choose from the three classics: spring rolls, banh mi, or pho. I usually get the spring rolls, which comes in three. Size can be deceiving - it looks small, but one order is enough. 

If I'm feeling spendy, I order the shrimp (for an extra $2) and avocado (extra $1) and that usually comes out to be around $15. But if not, my go-to is the tofu (that comes out around $11). You can pick up to five toppings and they have a pretty sweet selection: parsley, cucumber, bell peppers, crispy shallots, lettuce, carrots, pickled veggies, and so on. The last step is picking out your choice of dip: Vietnamese vinaigrette, peanut sauce, sweet and sour sauce. Side note: if you guys are feeling pho, that's only available M-F after 3.

If waiting in line isn't your thing, you can also order ahead online (huge plus for those ordering on their lunch break). Quick, easy and healthy. Can't go wrong with Freshroll.
author: Rebecca L.

description: This place rocks. Fresh delicious healthy choice for lunch. They are not sparse on the meat and the greens are very fresh. It is a bIt of a wait but it moves at a pretty good pace. The interior is clean and modern and they have good technology at the register and the menu.
author: Ken A.

description: Balanced (nutritionally), reasonably priced, and great portions! It's pretty hard to find restaurants in SF with the combination of these three.
author: Andrew L.

description: Got both chicken bowls and pork wraps... all so delicious!!! Place is nice and clean.
author: Talivaimaila S.

description:
Decent enough.  Since we wanted something else from the Moscone West center, we went across the street to this establishment. 

Think Chipotle but with a Vietnamese flair.  Picking your own ingredients for a roll, bowl... and then pick your sauce. 

Not a lot of seating, but people move quickly in and out.  

next time for a quick bite, will revisit.
author: Balinor I.

description: This is by far one of the best lunch options in downtown SF! I am a huge fan of Banh Mi and these sandwiches are some of the best I have ever had. The salads are also top notch, I'd suggest getting some of the great vegetable extras as well. Best of all, these guys are super quick - I'm in and out within 7 minutes!
author: Sebastian S.

description: Really great place to grab lunch. Centralized, fast, good food. Highly recommend if you are in the area and hungry. Don't forget the extra sauces!
author: Joshua F.

description:
The Chipotle of Vietnamese food - of course! So genius!

I came here twice last week for lunch, and I cannot get those rolls out of my mind - if you're used to buying the fresh spring rolls from Trader Joe's or other grocery stores, this place is well worth a couple extra $$'s. They run $3 per, but are big, and come with chicken, pork, or tofu (or shrimp/steak for extra). 

With three rolls for around $9 and unlimited access to their menu of sauces (peanut sauce + sriracha if you're looking for a twist) - it's pretty much impossible to leave here hungry, and I've learned to save this place for my binge days. 

It's your average sit-in casual eatery, and the folks working the rolls + bowls are friendly and fast. Right next to the Metreon, this is a great stop before a movie or during your work break. 

Looking forward to trying the fresh noodle bowls once I'm ready to move past the spring rolls. For a fresh, fast, and delicious lunch, check this place out!
author: Laura B.

description:
So, I as promised, I am updating my one-star rating based on how they handle my refund request.  I got a response to my request within 30 minutes, and I am getting a full refund.  They did apologize as well and offered me a discount code for the inconvenience. :)  That is good customer service.  Now I have to try them out!


I literally just now went to pick up an order I placed online at their 4th St. location and when I got there, I was greeted by 2 health inspectors telling me that the place was closed and that they should not have been taking online orders. I have requested a refund (even the health inspector urged me to do so).  I don't like to give low ratings, so I'll update my rating based on how they handle my refund request.  Funny too because my coworker and I were there to try their food since we were considering having them cater our next company event...
author: Chari A.

description: Amazing noodle bowls here. Everything in them is so fresh and delicious. I normally don't order chicken at these places because I'm wary of how good it will be, but omg it's so flavorful and tender! Their sauces are delicious too (I normally get citrus ginger and sweet/sour, but I've heard the peanut sauce is great too). Big portion at a reasonable price!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Ok, so not from San Fran but was looking for a gluten friendly place... 2/5 is generous.  

I honestly would NOT eat here if you have any food allergies (BECAUSE YOU MIGHT DIE THO) 

The serving/ portioning area was a mess... the place didn't look clean... tables weren't wiped... OH YEA... and I felt like shit for 3 days because they probably don't know what gluten is (they seemed clueless). 

THEY EVEN SAID THEIR PHO HAS GLUTEN?!  HOW SWAY?  How?? 

I Do not recommend.  

Get your crap together Goldman Sachs or whoever owns this chain.
author: N N.

description: I like this place. Sometimes the line can be long and sometimes the service isn't the best but it's a solid option to get a somewhat healthy meal to go.
author: Betty L.

description: I was excited to try this place and was extremely disappointed in the service and food. Personally feel that the meat was dry and was quite hard to chew, the fish sauce seemed watered down, peanut sauce wasn't up to par as the ones I've had at other establishments. Overall, the most I can give it is 1.5 for food and -10 for service.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Okay, so I finally made it to Freshroll after raving about the banh mi I had at Outside Lands last year. 

So. Much. Disappointment. 

I got a vermicelli bowl with un-fried tofu (big mistake on my part and can't blame anyone but myself for making that terrible decision) and it was horrible. The choice of crispy tofu didn't excite me so the employee was nice enough to tell me they have un-fried too, but it was my fault for expecting anything more than plain ass tofu. 

None of their four sauces or the other ingredients could save my bowl. It was so bland and blah. No thank you. I ate a little corner, gave 50% of my noodles to Shawn C. and threw the rest away. 

I tried Shawn C.'s shrimp bowl and that seemed okay. I think you can make an okay bowl here as long as you don't get the goddamn un-fried tofu. 

I guess the taro chips for $1.99 are good, but I'll stick to the $10 sandwiches at Outside Lands from now on thanks.
author: Laverne N.

description: To go place for Banh mi in FiDi. Bowls are great too. The place to grab quick Vietnamese lunch.
author: Tejas D.

description: Haven't been here for years and I must say....a bit disappointed. Did FreshRoll go under new management since 2012? I ordered 3 lemongrass chicken rolls and all of them were ripped open in the middle when I got back to my desk. Might as well got a salad. The "lemongrass" pork also was dry/hard and didn't even taste a bit like lemongrass. Your customers are paying a premium for your rolls, we expect premium quality.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Found this on Yelp and thought with the high-stars it would be awesome!

Turns out, it's not bad, but not really as great as I had hoped.

The place is located in the middle of Soma, right next to the food court of the Metreon. A lot of foot traffic, and so there a lots of customers inside. The menu is pretty standard, basically Pho but with a fast-food-style menu and ordering style. You choose some meat, some veggies, and broth, and they mix-and-match it behind the counter to you while you pay at the cash register.

The portions are ok. A medium sized plastic bowl--nothing like the giant ceramic bowls of bowl you usually find in pho places. The meat is also ok. A medium amount of beef and chicken.

Overall, a good place to stop by for some quick pho if you are in a hurry.
author: Henry L.

description: This spot used to be my go to...maybe I went on a bad day but none of my rolls were fresh :( I had lemongrass pork and shrimp
author: Kelly A.

description:
I tried this place with my friend last Saturday early in the afternoon. There wasn't any line which was nice. My friend ordered a Vietnamese sandwich and she absolutely hated it. The bread was over toasted and stale. She couldn't even bite into it. 

I ordered the three spring rolls - 2 with pork , 1 with chicken. What upset me about this was that it didn't taste like an authentic Vietnamese spring roll. Overall, we didn't have a great experience here.
author: Kristen L.

description:
Decent rolls, bowls and banh mi! I came here during a conference at the Moscone Center and the location was really good. 

I got a noodle bowl. The serving sizes are pretty decent but because protein goes in your bowl first and then all the veggies are on top, and the bowl then is really full, you basically have to eat your way down through the veg to get to the proteins and it's really hard to mix it all together. The ingredients were fresh though, and the grilled chicken I got was pretty nice. I also really liked the pickled vegetables.

There is seating in the shop but when it gets busy the line is pretty long and slow moving and then seats are limited.
author: Jo L.

description:
What the hell.
How does this place get such high ratings.  Wow, worst food. And restaurant people want $15.00.  They can't even get the order right.  Even subway doesn't screw up like this.  Ask for Cilantro and none added.  Asked for Avocado and because it wasn't in the fridge just below the counter, doesn't even want to look in the back fridge.  

Wow.  I think restaurant workers should at least attend a vocational school to learn basics 

Was really looking forward to this place.  What a disappointment.
author: Jim S.

description: African american lady serving me was very disrespectful. horrible service horrible food
author: Alex B.

description:
FOOD: The food is fine--rice noodles are reasonably fresh, toppings are out in front of you Chipotle/Subway style. I like that you can dial the flavor up or down with the sauce bar. 

Vegetarian alert: I would not recommend the tofu, as it sits under the fried food heat lamp and is more like a desiccated deep fried mystery than tofu.

Value-wise, I would rather eat elsewhere near the Metreon--I was surprised to find that a place that seems so casual and low budget will still run you ~$15 for lunch post-tip. Perhaps this is my bias coming from authentic Vietnamese food for much less :). 

SERVICE: Friendly and fast! I think the best selling point of this place is decent food at lightning speed. 

AMBIANCE: Casual, with big windows that face out on the street if you're looking for that fish tank feel (especially at night). If the restaurant were full, it'd be quite crowded--probably far nicer to take your lunch out and eat it in the park.
author: Helen W.

description: The taste of the the food is not right.  The chair is cold and uncomfortable.   I haven't had such bad Vietnamese food for a long time.
author: Stink C.

description:
Fast Vietnamese take out food. Tried this place a while ago because it was convenient and don't
think it was too memorable. I was pretty surprised at the unexpectedly high prices. I could just go to the Tenderloin for authentic food.
author: Chelsea W.

description: I was looking for a quick bite while staying at the nearby Marriott Marquis on business. I saw that this place was about a block away and had some great reviews. I went there at about 12 PM on a Tuesday afternoon and I was surprised to see that the place was fairly empty. There are a few options to pick from...sandwiches, bowls and wraps. I chose to go with the wraps which was rice sheet rolls and come in a set of three for about $10. I ended up choosing the pork which I regretted because it was very dry. The chicken would (at least looked like) it would have been a better option. After you choose the meat, you can add on veggies. Finally you are given the option of a few different sauces. I chose sweet and sour which was great. The staff was very helpful and patient during the entire "choosing" process. The rolls were good, but as I mentioned before the pork was dry so that kind of threw off everything. I am not sure I would return, if I do I would probably go with the chicken.
author: Jason P.

description: I felt like eating from here was both satisfying for my hunger level and healthy at the same times. Its build your own kind of deal where there are lot of green options to go with your protein and that is balanced well with some rice noodles. So be it a bowl or roll, this serves as a good stop for refueling. It is quite quick to get your order even when there is a long queue. They also have different sauces that you can choose as per your taste. I went for sweet and spicy, I think, which suited my rolls. The taro chips are another great addition to complete the meal. They feel healthier, I am not sure if they actually are, but serves well to have those who like something crunchy to snack on. I their taste..it is quite unique.
author: Tejashree M.

description: This place is a regular Vietnamese pho/banh mi place, nothing special, but filled me up. It's decently priced and the service was good. I had a banh mi sandwich and it was pretty tasty!
author: Pamela Q.

description: Here for quick bites during RSA conf. Got three fresh rolls, good size rolls with healthy balance of vege and protein. Kinda fast healthy food style. There are dining in options too.
author: tammy l.

description: Simple, fresh made to order. Had three spring rolls - one each of chicken, garlic shrimp and tofu. Might think twice about saying yes to the jalapeños next time (WOW!) but the crispy fried shallots were delicious! I found the peanut sauce to be a bit too sweet. Great alternative to the conference vendors in the Moscone Center!
author: Christy K.

description: Freshroll was actually my first introduction to banh mis so I feel like that in itself added a star to my review. My rating is more like a 3.5 to be honest. I've had the sandwich with cripsy tofu and the vermicelli bowl with tofu here. Both are pretty good, but not super memorable. I did have to add some of the sauces they have on the side to get some flavor going though with both dishes. The sandwiches already come with "Namnam sauce" with is tasty. I like adding crispy shallots to my sandwich for extra crunch and flavor. Service was swift and attentive and the staff was informative about veggie friendly items which I really appreciated. The place itself was pretty clean when I visited so no issues there. I do have to say that I have had better vegetarian banh mis at other establishments, but Freshroll is located in a very convenient area so it definitely gets points for that.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Props to Freshroll for using 100% natural, hormone & antibiotic free meats. Not legit organic, but pretty darn close. This is a rare thing in the fast food world! 

They offer 3 basic options: spring rolls, bowls, and pho. Pho is only available after 3pm weekdays, all day weekends. It's all made assembly-line style, so you build you meal as you go down the line. It's not as smooth as Chipotle's system, as the line gets backed up and a little chaotic. But the end result is DELICIOUS. And CHEAP! 

Love the 4 sauces you can choose from (take all 4 if you like!) and the option to order a side of pho broth for $2. 

A heaping bowl of fresh, healthy Vietnamese food for less than $10? I'm into it. Check in on Yelp for 10% off!
author: Nique F.

description:
YUMMM!! I'm a huge fan of viet food and this place definitely satisfied my Viet food cravings that night. 

You can create your own bowl, spring rolls, sandwich or bowl of Pho. I got a bowl & shared an order of spring rolls with my boyfriend. 

For my bowl, I got vermicelli noodles with the standard veggies, pineapple & chicken. The spring rolls also had the chicken & standard veggies. The sauces are self serve! I tried the carrot ginger, thai vinaigrette & sweet and sour sauces. The thai vinaigrette is like any other fish sauce served with spring rolls at a Viet restaurant. The carrot ginger sauce and sweet & sour are probably my two favorites here! The ingredients are all super fresh!! 

I definitely recommend this place if you love Viet food & customizing your food because the food here does not disappoint. :) BRING ME BACKKKK!!
author: Winnie L.

description: I saw another post calling this store the Vietnamese Chipotle, which I agree with completely. Everything's Vietnamese inspired at best. I ordered a sandwich, the meat and bread was dry. I would not recommend this place if you are looking for authenticity.
author: Vy D.

description: My experince was not great, bad cutomer service and the young girl servicing the counter was rude, she only care about upsell and charge you more then anything, everytime!!! THIS IS THE THIRD TIME!!! Great chain but this location need clealiness and better food handling process...
author: John L.

description: Solid lunch spot. Nothing here is going to blow you away, but the service is fast, the food is good, and the serving you get is enough for two meals.
author: Brett P.

description:
I've gotta tell you...I was really surprised with my experience at Freshroll. At first glance, the branding wants you to believe that it's a "chain/cheap" kinda place (a Subway of sorts), but the food isn't anything like that...it's good. Basically, whomever decided to pick the current brand guidelines should be fired immediately. 

Ok, now that's out of the way on to the food. I opted for the noodle bowl with chicken and all the standard vegetables and it was solid. Btw, it's an assembly line much like Chipotle. My favorite part was the array of sauces you could choose from depending on your mood: Peanut, Ginger Citrus, etc. I had a side of the Pho broth (note: they don't serve Pho until after 3pm on weekdays) and it was good. Not earth shattering, but hit the spot none the less. 

I see the appeal for those SOMA workers who are in a rush, want something that isn't too authentically Vietnamese, and hits the spot. I'll be back.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Visited some friends in SF recently and decided to stop by for a light dinner. I appreciate the concept of building your own bowl or rolls - most of the ingredients looked fresh and the workers were efficient. 

Prices were typical SF - ~$10 for a bowl or 3 rolls and there were diff protein options such as chicken, pork, crispy tofu and various options for a bowl (i.e. rice, vermicelli noodles) I would say the flavors were decent, but definitely not authentic to standard Vietnamese cuisine. 

The biggest damper on my meal was a piece of hair I found in one of my rolls. Considering all the food was put together in front of me, it was either someone who prepared the ingredients in the back or the employee prepping the rolls. I did notice that none of the employees had hairnets.

Good place to stop by for a lunch or dinner in the area but not a place I would revisit given the number of other options in the area and my own personal experience.
author: Evelyn T.

description:
Freshroll will be my go-to spot if I am in the Metreon or Yerba Buena Gardens area. It's a bit pricey but very "fresh" as the name implies (and yummy!) Both times I've ordered the Fresh Rolls with tofu and got the standard toppings (pickled veggies, sprouts, carrots, lettuce and crispy shallots.) They serve them in a portion of 3 or you can buy singles. The tofu is well cooked, not too oily, and all the veggies are fresh and crisp. They tend to always have a line but move it along quickly and I've found the staff to be very friendly. On my last visit I went for the combo and added Taro Chips and a Jasmine Lychee iced tea for an extra $2.99. The chips were good, but probably not worth the calories on my next visit. The ice tea was refreshing but almost a little too sweet. From now on I will save a few bucks and stick with what they excel at-the rolls with rice paper. 
Other note worthy points:
-Limited seating but you can take your food to go and grab seats in the larger Metreon food court
-Sauces are on the side and self serve with small cups-I'm a fan of "Grandma's Peanut Sauce" and the Citrus ginger. I love that you can mix and match
-Cash & Credit Card
author: Jennifer N.

description: Great place to grab a quick bite before a movie (theatre next door). Menu is simple, affordable and the ingredients are fresh. They used to have the sauces out to grab but now you are limited to 2 pre portioned sauces (which is fine, actually, anyway).
author: Rob M.

description:
What a fantastic idea to apply the "Chipotle" method to Vietnamese food. This place was surprisingly good, especially for an Americanized version of Vietnamese food. Now I have to preface this with the fact that I am Vietnamese myself and I hold Viet food in the Bay Area to a different standard.

My favorite thing to order here are the spring rolls. I usually get 2 grilled chicken and 1 crispy tofu. It comes with 3 per order, but I could honestly eat 10 of these. They are that good and packed full of veggies. My boyfriend got the banh mi sandwich and the lemongrass pork filling of pretty tasty, but the bread was not the best. It was a little flimsy for my taste. We prefer either a stronger baguette or a flaky Viet roll. I also tried the beef pho which was pretty good, but the broth was a little lacking in flavor.
