I wasn't too surprised because it is very Americanized.

I also tried all of the sauces and I can say hands down that the peanut sauce is the best. It was so delicious on the spring rolls. The rest of the sauces are kinda bland though, so there isn't much use for them. The service is great, but they work so slow.

Overall, I love this place, but I don't love the high prices. Regardless of the price, I will definitely be back.
author: Theo T.

description:
Yes, finally a fast food spring rolls!!! After reading some of the Yelp reviews it sounded promising.  My husband and I decided to give it a try.  The place is connected to the mall so you have to park in the parking garage. The place is a decent size.  

The server didn't ask us if we have been there. We were puzzled at how to place an order.  So you have four options:  
1.  spring rolls (3 pieces)
2. Sandwiches  
3. Vermicelli bowl (dry noodles)
4.  Pho bowl (soup noodles)

We decided to try their spring rolls.  So how you order for spring rolls is you tell them what kind of filling (chicken, pork, tofu, or shrimp for $1.15 extra).  We ordered shrimps.  The shrimps they served wasn't the big shrimps that are made for this dish. Then you tell them what kind of greens.  We order the combo which comes with everything like bean sprout and jalapeños.  (The jalapeños has some kick though). Then they amaturely roll up the goodies. It's almost like they intentionally make it look bigger so you feel like it's worth $10.  It's hard to eat bc the food just fall apart. Both the filling and sauce lacks flavor.  When a spring roll is rolled correctly the rolled is tight with lots of filling. Easy to hold, eat and enjoy.  Don't expect that here. Very disappointed. But kudos for their first attempt of a fast food spring rolls.
author: Hollie H.

description: Not Vietnamese food. They just borrow the name. The food the food tastes horrible. Just like a dollar instant noodle you get from Walgreen..
author: Kelly D.

description: Theres a reason why Vietnam consistently ranks low in terms of prevalence of obesity and overall body mass index (BMI). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_body_mass_index#WHO_Data_on_Mean_BMI_(2014). It's because there's a major emphasis on fresh vegetables to supplement meats and refined carbohydrates. Fresh roll does it right by offering savory, delicious meats paired with bean sprouts, cucumber, lettuce,and pickled veggies. I am a big fan of the lemon grass pork sandwich. The customizable options lets you enjoy authentic vietnamese food with a modern twist.
author: Tony H.

description: I hate to be writing this review because I love coming to Freshroll for their pho...except this time my pho came with a bug (possible tiny cockroach), legs fully intact and all  I was already halfway through when I found it. Sad to say I will not be coming here again.
author: Sonia T.

description:
I love this chipotle concept for Viet food!
You go down the line choose whether you want the rolls, the bun noodles, or the banh mi.  Then you choose your protein and they put the whole meal together in front of you

Everything is really fresh and pretty authentic surprisingly.  I would recommend this for anybody to have especially for lunch.  

It's a bit pricey for Vietnamese food.
author: Bing C.

description:
So. Many. Sauces!!! If you're a sauce fiend like me, you'll love Freshroll -- aka Vietnamese Chipotle. The interior of the eatery is clean, bright, and spacious (but small). Think trendy froyo shop. They have a giant sign above to show you how the ordering process works. 

I usually get the vermicelli noodle bowl with the works. They give you a decently sized portion (but not huge). Sauces available: peanut, sweet chili, citrus ginger, Vietnamese vinaigrette, hoisin, and sriracha. I can never choose just one and I end up trying them all. But if you're getting your meal to-go, they limit you to two. I would suggest getting one you know you like, and then one to try out. Peanut and citrus ginger are my favorites! 

As for seating, they have several 2-person tables inside, as well as one-seaters at the window. They also have a few tables outside. It's never been full for me, but I've mainly gone for dinner, not lunch. 

This place is quick, healthy, and as cheap as you can go for the prime location. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Christine L.

description:
I think the concept of Freshroll is great - healthy, customizable, fast Vietnamese food. 

However, I think it didn't taste that great. I ordered a chicken pho with everything and it lacked depth. When I normally get pho, I feel satisfied and warm, but I didn't get this feeling from here. The iced vietnamese coffee I got was solid though. No complaints there.

They have an assortment of sauces on the side as well as free water.
author: Tabitha H.

description: I find it oddly difficult to find a good grab-n-go bowl of brown rice, tofu and vegetables in the SOMA FIDI (pls message me if you have recos!), so I occasionally seek this place out. I only go here if I can get here before the noon rush, though; otherwise, the line is out the door and takes a while. The peanut sauce is quite yummy. The tofu is meh. It is crispy, which is nice, but it hasn't been cooked with any flavor. This is fine by me, because I can dip it in the sauce. But then I don't have enough sauce for the rest of the dish. Overall, I find the ratios of stuff a little off for my personal tastes -- a little too much rice, not enough tofu. The other thing that makes me not love this place is that the tofu is in long strips, the vegetables are in long strips. My bowl would be way easier to eat if the stuff was chopped up a bit. I mean, I don't really want to attempt eating at my desk at work with long strips of carrots hanging out of my mouth every time I take a bite. There is no easy way to cut them. I'm sure they do it this way because it is the same ingredients for the rolls or for some other good reason. But it irks me just enough to make me not love the place.
author: Stacey B.

description:
Freshroll; a solid lunch choice! It's fresh, tastes healthy, feels healthy! It's better than a salad! :) Set-up is like chipotle but for vietnamese spring rolls and noodles.

LOCATION
-Metreon, but not on the inside. Entrance is outside on 4th st, next to Split bread and Noodles & Co.
-Pretty small restaurant, although they do have a good number of seating inside. However line gets crazy and seats get crowded around noon, so come early if you can. I'm usually running late so there is always a long line, but it tends to move quickly.

MENU
-Rice bowl: most people come here for the noodles but I actually love going for a rice bowl with brown rice. Next choose your protein -I like going with pork. I get all of the veggies -bean sprouts, carrots, lettuce, cucumbers, and cilantro. Oh, and jalapenos. Yum! 
-Spring Rolls: Comes in a set of 3 and are way more filling than they appear. Must get it WITH crispy goodness, the added texture is bomb.

After you pay, you get to go through the glorious sauce options -fish sauce, sweet & sour chili sauce, sriracha, peanut sauce, etc. 

PROS
-If you're ordering to-go, they have sauces pre-poured in little cups for you to take
-mini water station & cups set up next to the sauces
author: Grace J.

description: The pickled veggies are too sour to make the whole fresh rolls sour.The meat are too dry and overcooked.The bowls are messy with no flavor.
author: Le D.

description: A little sloppy in terms of service but not unfriendly. In terms of food prep, you get what you pay for. Everything thrown in instead of the bean sprouts and basil etc to the side. Decent pho to hit the spot when you're downtown and in a rush. Restaurant could have been cleaner too - esp the restroom. Id still go if I have a pho craving and I'm around the area running errands. It's alright. For the price - you pay for about the same for a bowl of pho at a proper Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Isabel R.

description: Ordered 3 Freshrolls for $10 - 2 lemongrass pork and 1 grilled chicken (personal favorite). Great option for a non greasy, filling lunch. Would definitely recommend and come back when I'm in the area.
author: Hansel S.

description:
The service is always fast and the food is great so I keep coming back. 

I find that the 4st location is always pretty dirty. The tables are sticky and they aren't bussed often (sat here for 25 minutes or so to eat and nobody came to clean up a spill). Also kitchen is a bit grimy. Ordered rolls, and the black tray that the maker pulled from the shelf had old food particles on it. I looked at the other trays and they were all dirty in the same way. It was unappetizing to watch her dip the roll skins in water and put them on they tray.

Would appreciate it if the restaurant and kitchen were more hygienic
author: Tim G.

description: I went here with my team mates and its just a block away. We went there at about 12 PM on a Wednesday afternoon, even though the place was fairly crowded, it moved very fast. this is Chipotle kind of a place where you pick what you want to go with your wraps, Sandwiches or bowls. I ordered roll/wraps with tofu(me being a moody veggie), I am not a huge fan of tofu, so asked to add a piece of it (by default they add two) and opted for avacado which costed a dollar more. You get three rolls in your order and believe me I was full after two. They tasted really good with sweet and sour sauce. I really loved their service as well. I will definitely come back here and will not miss ordering Taro chips, tasted from my teammate order and chips were to die for, so crisp and yumm.
author: Geeta D.

description: Tasty, healthy, fast and the staff our great - what more could you ask for? Authentic ingredients and flavors.. yup, they have that as well.
author: Dennis M.

description: Love the fresh rolls with shrimp and peanut sauce for a quick, healthy lunch. It gets pretty crowded, especially during lunch, but the line usually moves fairly quickly. They have like 3 small tables but this is more of a take-out spot. Cheap if you order a regular item with no extra charge add-ons (like shrimp).
author: Alka M.

description:
I've come here so many times and am still loving it. Upping to 5 stars because of the super generous portions and amazing yelp check in discounts. I've recently also tried the pho, which really hits the spot on colder days. The broth is very flavorful and the steak is very tender and high quality meat.

Overall, solid spot for a quick lunch or affordable + delicious meal anytime!
author: Sophia H.

description: This place used to be good when they first opened, now it's going downhills. It has the most disgusting workers who don't wash their hands after handling cash and roll up your food. They wear the food gloves to pick up trash and clean the floor and go back to make your rolls. It's completely not sanitary and they don't understand English to know what you are talking about.
author: Bonnie W.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend at lunch to try out this place on the weekend. As I walked in the seemed to be some people in line. There's a couple options that you can do one of which being a sandwich the other being a roll and the last being a noodle soup. My boyfriend and I were trying to be healthy so we decided that we were going to order the bowl with salad.  You first begin by picking the base so you can have either solid, 
 rice vermacilli or salad. Next you pick the protein you can have pork, chicken, shrimp for an extra fee, or crispy tofu. I wanted to try the chicken and the tofu so I asked if I can I have both and the person said yes and gave me a scoop each. My boyfriend order the chicken but he only got one scoop which is actually less than the amount that I received for my order. You could have the works which basically includes everything or you can pay a little extra and pick five items that you like.  You then top it off with whatever sauce you like and I tried the traditional vinegar sauce that the person at the register recommended. My boyfriend tried the sweet chili sauce which was amazing. I want to suggest that fish oil he sauce that I had it was a very tasty which I felt like it ruined the entire bowl for me. Don't get me wrong. It was OK but I felt like the sweet chili sauce really made the flavor come out and it really made that that's what it was. At this location you can also order taro chips or a side of chicken soup which was for a small fee.
author: Amy Y.

description: I loved the concept of this cozy and bright restaurant. Although the space was small, all the ingredients were fresh tasting and service was also fast. I loved that we could customize our own viet style spring rolls and could also pick what sauces we wanted. I loved the peanut sauce and the pork spring rolls the most. Will re-visit this place in the future!
author: Louisa Z.

description: Like its name suggests, the rolls are loaded with fresh ingredients - crunchy veggies, well-cooked noodles and proteins. Three for $9 is a good deal. The peanut sauce was my favorite. It would be even better if the sauce were a little richer and sweeter.
author: Dex Y.

description: Overpriced for what it is in my opinion. They trick you since most people will add protein to their bowl of noodles and lettuce which is another $2. Overall my bowl was like $14. I can get something cheaper in sunset or lil Saigon. But I guess that's the price you pay for being in a prime area.
author: Josephine L.

description: I'm a vegetarian so I got a bowl with vermicelli and tofu. It was alright. The tofu didn't feel freshly made. Personally I probably wouldn't ever want to go back for this specific dish since it wasn't noteworthy. It was probably pretty standard in terms of taste.
author: Karishma M.

description: Location of this place is great and it was fairly easy to find parking a couple blocks away. The staff was very efficient and fast and you can't beat the prices! Everything is under $10! I got a bowl with tofu and it was a nice fresh meal. They pile on the veggies but still give you a fair amount of noodles. They have a good variety of sauces to go with it too. The peanut sauce was soooo good and they give you a good amount in little containers. I would come back here again.
author: Charlotte K.

description:
They stick to their name-- the food here is FRESH. 

Came her with a bunch of my lady co-workers for one of our biweekly lady lunches. I went with the crispy tofu rice bowl with "The Standard" set of toppings. Fleshing out the toppings of you: beansprouts, lettuce, cucumbers, pickled veggies, jalapenos, cilantro, and crispy shallots. They have a range of sauces you can choose from so I went with the peanut dressing and the citrus ginger dressing. 

To be honest, I wasn't expecting much from this bowl. Nothing about it was too exciting, but let me tell you, first bite, I was in love. The vegetables they serve here are fresh. I'm talking straight-out-of-the-ground fresh! I believe it was the beansprouts that had me hooked: crunchy, light, sweet. The pickled veggies were on point as well! What tied the entire bowl together was the variety of textures and flavors in the toppings. The crunchiness, sweetness, saltiness, tangy-ness, spiciness of the toppings made the entire meal and experience. 

Although the service wasn't the fastest (definitely slower than Chipotle which has a similar layout), the food was worth the wait!
author: Nicole A.

description: I am sorry to say this,but I really feel the food are not delicious,I don't like them,they don't have soup,tasted terrible.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Is the adult version of yoloing trying out restaurants with low health score rating? Despite the  warning on yelp, I decided to take the risk and eat at Freshroll. Good news, I didn't get sick and this quick meal was actually super filling  (can't beat your mom and pop's vietnamese bun tho). 

I ordered the vermicelli noodle with lemongrass pork, "standard" veggies (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumber, crispy shallots and picked veggies), with their Vietnamese Vinaigrette sauce. I wished the Vietnamese Vinaigrette had more flavor... it tasted like a mellow version of the fish sauce you would receive from a Vietnamese restaurant. I also tried "Grandma's Peanut Sauce", but this sauce also tasted very bland. On the plus side, I appreciated the fried shallots, which gave the bowl more life.

Overall, the convenience of a "chipotle styled" vietnamese restaurant means you will be sacrificing flavor for convenience. Definitely worth a try if you are craving a quick vietnamese inspired meal, but not a place I will go out of my way for. 

Tip: remember to check in on yelp for 10% off!
author: Eva L.

description: For $10ish post-tax you can get three summer rolls with your choice of meat and any two sauces.  Honestly a pretty decent deal, especially if you're trying to be healthy!  I recommend the lemongrass pork with the peanut sauce.  The rolls don't look like much, but they're actually jammed (like REALLY jammed) full of veggies and stuff so they're quite filling.  The amount of stuff in the rolls could amount to a decent sized salad.  The line moves a bit slowly, especially during lunch time--my boyfriend was able to make a trip to Split Bread and Starbucks next door before I even paid.  But if you've got time to wait in line, I'd say Freshroll is one of the best options around Metreon.
author: Amy X.

description:
Was looking for a quick easy meal and reviews pointed us in this direction. I can say that for people who love pho, this is NOT a legit pho place. The rolls were okay - we ordered rolls with lemongrass pork. The taste was bland.

The pho was not good. We ordered the rare steak pho and it had no taste at all. The soup had no strong beef flavour; it tasted like water. The meat was okay. 

The jasmine lychee iced tea was also watery tasting. For something that is around $2.49, don't waste time buying it as again, no flavour and just plain watery. You can have better tasting tea by buying those Arizona cans for a buck. 

The only good thing about this place is the place looked somewhat clean, that's pretty much it. Definitely not coming back.
author: Lea M.

description:
This has been my go to lunch spot for so many years. If you're looking for something healthy yet flavorful this is great. 

I love the noodle bowls and also the rolls are great to grab and head into a movie at the metreon.
author: Anicia A.

description:
I was attending a seminar in the area and wanted to check out one of the many places to eat, so I thought I'd check out Feshroll with a couple others from the seminar.  I got the chicken bowl with a cup of broth and they were delicious!
Choose from the rolls, sandwich or the bowls.  Too bad the pho wasn't available until after 3 pm. But I decided on the bowl with cold vermicelli noodles (or choose brown rice, white rice or salad), chicken (or choose pork or shrimp) and the veggies: bean sprouts, shredded fail in and carrots, cilantro, lettuce, cucumber and fried shallots. Jalapeno peppers are optional. So this was the standard bowl or you can build your own.  
I would definitely come back again when I'm in the area.
author: Brenda D.

description:
Healthy lunch option, but overpriced.

I ordered the tofu spring rolls. The rolls are much larger than typical Vietnamese spring rolls, making 3 rolls very filling. I only had two, and I was already full. I liked how crispy the tofu was and the addition of fried shallots. The peanut sauce was watered-down, in my opinion. 

Even though Freshroll is one dollar sign eatery according to Yelp, I typically get that amount of food from an authentic Vietnamese place for half the price.
author: Lisa T.

description: My girlfriend frequents this place since we live nearby. Today we stopped by to pick up some food for her on the way home. As someone was helping her, I stood to the side waiting to pay once her order was finished. However, before the order was finished, an African American female employee murmured something to me from the cashier. I walked closer since I didn't catch what she said and said "sorry, what was that?" She proceeded to respond with lots of attitude, "FOUR....TEEN.....DOLLARS....TWENTY....ONE.....CENTS", speaking to me as if I were a 2 year old. I told her that my girlfriend wasn't done ordering yet since she was planning to order extra condiments. This employee does not apologize, and again instead of waiting until my girlfriend was done ordering, she doubles the cost of the order and asks me to pay nearly 30 dollars. I told her that is not what my girlfriend was ordering, and to please calculate it correctly according to what she was still in the process of ordering. The employee then scoffs at me and walks away, leaving another employee to help us complete our order correctly which came out to a total of $15.31. This new employee helping us apologized for her behavior, and I asked him for the rude employee's name, but he said that he could not give it to me. I would recommend management to quickly get rid of the African American female employee that was treating us horribly, otherwise I'm sure that she will end up turning away a lot of valuable business for this establishment. We will not be stopping by anymore, especially if she is working. For reference, this all happened on Sunday June 24, 2018 at around 8 pm.
author: Kevin C.

description: The Yelp consumer alert on cleanliness never gives you the warm, fuzzies but I enjoyed my bahn mi w/ lemongrass pork, which clocks in at $6.99 pre tax. The bread is nicely toasted but still soft, and stuffed to the brim with pickled veggies and meat. If you're sensitive to the smell of fish sauce, you might want to go light on the pickled veggies; there was a slight smell of funk but that's what gives it good flavor. The seating area wasn't the best well kept, so it's best to grab and go!
author: Julia K.

description: This is our go-to dinner spot when out adventuring downtown. The sandwiches and wraps are always quick, tasty, and fresh!
author: Margaret L.

description: Solid "Fusion" Vietnamese food. I live nearby and have dropped by here a couple times when running errands. It's not the most authentic spot - but I'm a fan of the banh mi nonetheless. The pho is ok - broth was a bit lacking, but I was impressed how well they packaged it up when I ordered it to-go. It didn't leak or anything! My friend tried the noodle bowls and said they're solid.
author: Larissa M.

description:
Shmeh....

$12 for 3 smaller than normal spring rolls (if you include shrimp as one of your fillings)?? No thanks. I guess I should stop being surprised by this price living in SF.  Tastes decent, but this is your typical build-your-own-"insert food" place.  I'd only go if I was really craving Vietnamese food and didn't want to walk far from the area.
author: Mon T.

description:
Friday, 11:58 a.m. Metreon mall. 

I SAT there, facing the street through the glass, looking into my very well packed bowl of vermicelli, sprouts, and chicken. I dabbed my selection of peanut sauce, one of the several you can apply at checkout, onto my fork, and noted how plentiful the ingredients beneath me were. 

11:59 a.m.

I also noted how long it was going to take me to finish my monster bowl of noodles and chicken. Once more unto the breach.

12:00 p.m.

I heard no skidding of DeLorean tires, Police Box arrivals, or any other machines of the sort, yet when I looked up from my bowl, there was most definitely a line of people stretching out the door and around the corner, as if Freshroll was [fan line for autographs at Something Con] or [rumoured dining establishment for Famous Musician, et al]. Clearly something there was popular. I mean, I liked my noodle bowl quite a lot, but I wasn't sure it warranted teleporting that many people into the joint. You might accidentally 'port a leg or arm inside the grill or cash register, right? Yeeg.

12:01 p.m.

Yet for the price and food volume, not to mention tastiness, I would say Freshroll was totally worth it. 

Please excuse me, dear readers. I must continue eating these noodles. Nom.
author: Edison C.

description: Got the three fresh rolls option and it was pretty bland. On top of that the employee that served me gave me very little protein. If you want good spring rolls you might as well go to an authentic Vietnamese restaurant for a cheaper price as well.
author: Daisy L.

description:
Based on Yelp reviews, I picked Freshroll to cater a lunch meeting for 20 people at work.  Everything started out great - they were quick to respond on email, quick to help me come up with a menu, quick to make changes, and quick to provide an estimated cost.

I wanted to make a last minute change to the order, so I called them on the morning of the lunch. It turns out they hadn't processed my order, so it wasn't on their order list for the day.  Good thing I called then!

The delivery came on time, and they set it up with serving trays, serving utensils, and labels on all of the items.  I ordered the family style setup, which came with half noodles, half rice, protein (chicken, tofu, and shrimp), and all of the toppings (lettuce, bean sprouts, crispy shallots, pineapple, pickled veggies, cucumbers, jalapenos, and cilantro) and sauces (peanut, sweet and sour, Vietnamese vinaigrette, and citrus ginger).

So other than the morning mishap, everything seems great right? And only 15 people showed up, so there'd be plenty of food right?  Nope!  The food was bland, the protein was not nearly enough, and we were buried in noodles and rice at the end.

2 stars for good setup and delivery, but the mishaps and bland food mean you should go elsewhere for your catering needs!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
So, here comes another observation on local food culture: what's the obsession with Americans to customizing their food? Here at Freshroll you can get your Vietnamese-themed lunch made-to-order. You pick the style, the ingredients, the substitutions and then they'll make it for you. It's pretty much the Chipotle concept. 

What irritates me about this so much is that it takes sooooo long and for some reason it takes especially long here. My German efficiency-trained mind was going crazy when I was watching the inefficiency and waste of time being done onto me when I came here for lunch today. So, I ask you: why - at a salad place for g's sake - can you not prepare some salads and offer them ready-to-go? In fact, we ordered the "standard" bowl with no substitutions whatsoever and I would've loved to just pick that off the shelf and go to the cashier straightaway. Fine if you want to have a second line for those picky folks, but whyyyyyyy do you make me stand in line while I could already be happily eating my lunch in the nearby park? We have only a limited time to have lunch after all! Grrrr. 

Food is actually quite tasty, especially the bowl. Make sure you get the peanut sauce and dribble some of it over the rice. Yummy!
author: Uli B.

description: Freshroll viet definitely ain't fresh. We stopped by for a quick bite. Not sure why there's so many high reviews but the protein option didn't look appetizing. Usually, when you walk into Chipotle the meat is hot and looking real good where you're like yes! I want barbacoa today. Well, none of the protein options were like that. The strips of pork and chicken looked questionable and the shrimp seemed like it was sitting out for awhile. I went for the tofu which was a bit stale. Definitely not piping hot or crispy from the fryer. It said a lot when I asked for nuoc mam (vietnamese vinaigrette) & they didn't even know what that was. Also surprised they don't even serve egg rolls with these bowls. Definitely doesn't do the vietnamese vermicelli bowls justice and not repping too well in my opinion. They should check out east coast's rollplay.
author: Anh N.

description:
...super good rolls.  Friend had the bowl and said it was equally good. 

While not a big fan of tofu the crispy tofu was super good.
author: Marie B.

description: Got a ROCK in my noodle bowl. Disgusting. Never eating here again. I have been a loyal customer for years, as this place is convenient to where I work. I didn't have time to go back and complain in person but I will tomorrow. F*ing disgusting, dangerous, horrifying, there aren't enough words to describe how gross this is. Don't eat here!
author: Krissy K.

description:
I heard this place is heavily compared to "Asian Box," but seeing as I had never been to an kind of Asian-chipotle-esque place before, I was really eager to try Fresh Roll.  I am from Northern Virginia, which is crawling with amazing pho places, and every time I get pho, I have to get the "summer rolls" to start.  I was so excited to see build your own rolls on the menu!  What an innovative and easy concept-- I am surprised this is the first time I had seen it.

I had the rolls with "the standard" (I had actually asked for a little of every topping but quickly changed my mind when I was told it would be two dollars extra :P).  The meal came with three rice paper rolls filled with your choice of meat, rice noodles, lettuce, bean sprouts, pickled vegetables, cucumber, and cilantro, which is pretty standard for any summer roll you may have had before.  I had the chicken, which I thought was very flavorful, probably due to the fact that it was most, if not all, dark meat.  I loved trying all the sauces as well.  My favorites were the sweet chili sauce and the peanut sauce.

I also got an order of the taro chips, which the samples at the cashier had tempted me to do so.  The portion size was a little disappointing given the price ($2 for the size of a small fries, but remember, chips have larger volume then fries do).  The chips were hit or miss-- some were crunchy, some were a little soggy. I question how fresh they really were or how long ago they had been fried.

The three rolls were quite large and very filling.  For a $9 meal I was sufficiently satisfied and full for the rest of the day.  I am glad that I can finally get summer rolls outside of a restaurant setting, but they are not much different than you would expect.
author: Michelle W.

description:
This place was delicious! Was great to find a healthy (and quick) option for lunch in the area. The fresh rolls were very good and plenty to eat...and all for under $10! I had both the lemongrass pork and the grilled chicken...the char on it was perfect and the overall seasoning was great. The choices for sauces were great too - citrus, peanut, vinegar, sweet chili sauce....YUM! 
Highly recommend coming here.
author: Valerie W.

description: I've only had their pho before (both chicken and beef) and it's amazing! The broth is super flavorful and extra hot (just the way I like it!). It's a smaller portion than I'm used to for pho but the fragrant broth makes up for it! Can't wait to try the rest of their options - I've heard the bowls are really great too!
author: Cynthia H.

description: There was an ant in my noodle soup. Left and got Chipotle. Don't come here!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jordan H.

description: This is a great place for a quick bite. Both the spring rolls and sandwiches are quite good. Even with a line, they're able to get you out the door pretty quickly. Definitely a good, quick lunch spot.
author: Rob R.

description: Love this place! Been going for a few years. Rolls, bowls, pho all solid and full of flavor! The sauces used to be open season but now you choose them at checkout. Highly recommended for lunch and/or pre-dinner!
author: Sean R.

description:
Decent choices, but there seems to be a bit of grunge factor here maybe because of all the traffic, but it's probably a lot healthier than many of the other choices on this extremely busy strip that borders Moscone Convention Center. For about $10 you can get a lot of food, like for example 3 very large spring rolls. Meat quality seems about 3 star, nothing too fancy. It's cafeteria style and they often rush the orders and produce an average quality appearance on the product. 

It's fast food.

Most people here go to-go.
author: Frank O.

description:
I have returned to Fresh Roll quite a few times over the past year and now it's grown a lot on me. I have added this to my regular lunch rotation.

My new favorite dish--VERMICELLI NOODLE BOWLS! Such a large portion for the price. I get it with lemongrass pork or crispy tofu with all the standard veggie fixings, plus pineapple and mint.

Another great choice are the CRISPY TOFU SPRING ROLLS. The tofu is slightly fried on the outside, which gives it a nice crispy texture without being too crunchy. I like to dip mine in the peanut sauce, sweet and sour chili, and just a bit of Sriracha.

Helpful hints:
+ Order your lunch online for advance pickup.
+ if you want to split your order into multiple types of protein, write it into the "notes" section of online order.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Cool place. you can customize what you want to put in your bowl. I haven't tried if i can do the same in their pho soup. i like what i ordered. I will definitely eat there again if i'm in the area.
author: Sel E.

description:
If you're starting to feel yourself getting sick or you just want to warm up your stomach on a rainy San Francisco day - you can pick up a cup of chicken pho broth at Freshroll for just $1.99. I recommend getting two servings of it - to make the trip worthwhile. And while you're waiting for them to put your pho broth into a plastic take-away container - you can load up on the taro chip samples at the front counter. 

Easy affordable deliciousness.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I've been a loyal customer for 1.5 years, but the time has come to move on.  The quality and service of Freshroll has steadily declined since my first visit and now it's terrible.  

For those new to Freshroll, it started like the Chipotle of Vietnamese food.  They offer sandwiches, spring rolls, salads, rice bowls, noodle bowls, and Pho soup - all with the same set of ingredients.  Pretty tasty for the most part.  

But overtime, Freshroll has become more like the "Subway of Vietnamese."  The quality of the food has only gone down a bit, but the service has dramatically declined, and prices have slowly risen.

I'll share just what happened today (Mar 13, 2015) as a representative example.

They have made the menu so complicated in order to price discriminate.  Gone are the simple days of "Choose your type, choose your protein, choose your toppings.." Now every permutation of items has a different cost.  Shrimp costs $2 extra, Steak costs $1 extra, Fried scallions is $1 extra, avocado $1 extra, etc.  

And, if you go over 3 toppings on the sandwich, they charge $0.50 per topping!!  You get 5 toppings on the salad, but the 6th will cost another $0.50 each.  Of course, $0.50 isn't enough for avocado, so that's an extra $1.00.  When I asked for extra jalapeño, there was an obvious pause as she decided if that would cost an extra $0.50.  (It used to be that toppings were all included in the price.)

After fighting my way through the line like a broken record, "Yes, that's fine, I'll pay the extra fee..." I get to the checkout.  I ordered a side of taro chips for my two entrees (for a friend and me), and then I asked for sauces.  They said I could only get two pre-packaged sauces.  I remember being annoyed by that during my last visit, but I assumed at least it was 2 sauces per entree - no, two sauces per order, and no extra sauces for ordering the taro chips, which are presumably designed to dip in the sauces.  

Of course, when I went to pour my own sauce, they were out of my favorite, the Orange Ginger sauce.  When I asked for more, I got a frustrated, "I told you, only two sauces" look.  After he realized they had run out of self-service sauce, he begrudgingly got me two more sauces.

Rather the sauces to me, he tried to cram them into the salad bowl.  This is pretty disgusting, especially given the slovenly appearance of the clerk, but also that he had been handling money without gloves - the same hands that carried the bowl and shoved it deep into my salad.  

Between the nickel-and-diming and the poor service, I was already pretty disappointed.  So imagine my frustration when I get home and notice there are no taro chips!!  

I was tempted to go back to get the missing items, but I decided to pass - I don't think I want to step foot in Freshroll again.
author: Greg B.

description:
This place's concept is the 2 things I absolutely love: spring rolls and bulls-your-own style, so I knew I just HAD to try it out.

First off, the place looks nice and clean. They make your food in the assembly-line-style similar to chipotle's process. It's pretty quick, and it's always nice to watch them prepare your food. One bad thing though, is when it gets crowded, the cashiers tend to be a bit slow or inattentive as it seems there is no specific assigned cashier. There's 2 cashier spots but sometimes only one is filled despite the growing line.

The food is good! I got the 3 fresh rolls with lemon grass pork. For fillings I got lettuce, cucumbers, pickled carrots, and avocado (avocado is +1 dollar). The food is nice and fresh, they did a pretty good job with the pickled carrots too. It's also pretty clever of them to put lettuce leaves between each spring roll so they don't stick together!

It's a pretty nice place to stop by for an early dinner or late lunch (I came during those times and the line wasn't as long). Hopefully in the future they solve the slow cashier problem!
author: Crystal J.

description: The Freshroll banh mi Sandwich was perfect for a casual lunch next to the convention center!  It lived up to the name and tasted very fresh with nice sauce, lean pork, and toasted bread.  It was nice that the employees took their time to put the sandwich together which made the experience better!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I had heard about this Chipotle of Vietnamese food for a while, but I didn't quite understand why or how it was so popular. I definitely understand more of the hype now.

First of all, it may have a Chipotle-style assembly line, but I wouldn't recommend coming if you're expecting a super quick, fast food-style meal. Their assembly line may be reminiscent of fast food, but there's nothing fast food about it. Ingredients are FRESH, and lines take longer than expected, only because it takes a bit more time and care to compile all of those fresh ingredients for your meal, particularly for the spring rolls.

My boyfriend and I opt for either the spring rolls or a noodle bowl (usually one of both so we can steal bites of each other's), both with lemongrass pork and "the standard" fillings. The term "the standard" is deceiving because it sounds like you're getting the bare minimum, but it includes a generous amount of a bunch of different fillings. Seriously, they completely stuff the spring rolls and bowls. So much so that sometimes the spring roll rips open, and then they tear the whole thing apart and re-roll it in a new spring roll wrapper for you. 

One of my favorite things about this place is THE SAUCES. Omg. They're all SO good that we usually dine in, just so we can grab all of the bottles and make sure that we have enough. My boyfriend's favorite is the peanut sauce, but I love all the others just as much. Do yourself a favor and try all of them.

When available, I like getting a side of the chicken pho broth. It's flavorful without a drop of oil/grease, and perfect for chilly days.

Their check-in offer doesn't show on the Yelp app, but make sure you show the cashier your check-in anyway for 10% of your purchase!

Overall, it's simple, no-frills Vietnamese food done well with super fresh ingredients at a pretty affordable price. I'll definitely be back.
author: Sara L.

description:
So much love for this place.

Essentially "healthy fast food". Love the vermicelli bowls and the pho. Can add fresh jalapenos to make it spicy! Always leave this place satisfied but not stuffed. Absolutely perfect.
author: Roxanne A.

description:
This place serves good, freshly made spring rolls that you can customize. The spring rolls are huge, so I managed to only eat 2 out of the 3 that I got for lunch and saved the third one for later. I liked being able to try out the different sauces they offer, since they serve four different ones, but there wasn't a particular sauce that stood out to me as great. The peanut sauce is pretty good. 

This restaurant is relatively inexpensive for the amount of food you get, but if you start adding on extra ingredients (shrimp costs extra, for example), it comes out to be more pricey than you anticipated. There is also a very long line here to order during lunch time on weekdays, so you might spend more time here picking up your lunch than you had planned. Overall, it was a pretty good choice for lunch in downtown SF, but it is more trendy than authentic.
author: Molly M.

description: Amazing. The lunch line at my conference was ridiculous so I came across the street to Freshroll. So glad I did. There was a line but the counter help buzzed right through. Really fresh ingredients. I chose the rolls with a different protein in each. Easy seating. Yum.
author: Eileen C.

description:
I pass by this place all the time, but never really thought to try it out until I was craving a new spot today and was on my way to Target.

The concept? Build your own Vietnamese dish. You choose a base and load 'er up!

They are named for their fresh rolls (Goi Cuon), but you can do it as a banh mi or a vermicelli bowl instead.

I opted for the Vermicelli Bowl with crispy tofu. The tofu itself? Extra crispy.
The toppings? Plentiful and stays true to traditional Vietnamese flavors. Pickled veggies, lettuce, bean sprouts, cucumber, mint, cilantro, green onions. They get more creative with pineapple, fresh carrots, bell peppers, and avocado. They took away the Thai Basil as an ingredient, but they offer fried shallots for $1 more.

I love mine with extra herbs, so pile on the cilantro and mint please! I opted for the extra fried shallots, but he barely sprinkled any on so I don't know if it's actually worth it or not. At least they don't skimp on other ingredients if you ask them for it.

I added a side of taro chips for $2 and that was probably the best thing about this place!

Once you pay for your bowl, add your choice of sauce. Peanut sauce, sweet chile, a 'Nuoc Mam' of some sort, and a ginger-tasting one. All are vegan except the mam, which is fish sauce. Even though the peanut sauce was probably best for spring rolls and dipping, I liked this one the best and used it to dress my noodles. Of course, don't forget about the sriracha!

It has a clean and modern decor, and it is in a very central location. So be wary of peak lunch/dinner times and convention days where the lines can grow very long.

Freshroll in the end was very tasty, modernizing the traditional Vietnamese cuisine and putting it in a fast-casual setting.

Lastly, they have cucumber water.
I'm sold.
author: Lanie L.

description:
tl;dr: Reliable though not exceptional food, that is fast and cheap. I will definitely keep it on my lunch list, but not at the top.

Experience: Nice, clean and efficient. I have never actually eaten in the shop, because how can you beat the park 3 minutes away!

Food: I have had the Banh Mi sandwiches a couple times and while never disappointed I have never been over the moon. Basically the flavor in the sandwich is not as captivating as I look for in Banh Mi. The rolls are definitely better, and are in fact quite good, but not a recurring food for me. If you do try this place out, which you should, order those.
author: Cameron C.

description:
I'm a man on the go.  I don't have much spare time, so catch me when you can.

I eat on the go.
I want to be the first person on the golf course so I can finish a round in 3.5 hours.
I talk on the go.
I do everything but "go" on the go.

I was thinking fresh, fast food.  I was thinking the Asian version of Chipotle.  I just needed my food quick dammit!

Then I was stumped.  I looked at the menu board, and I had to think of how to put this puzzle of my meal together.  Just do it for me, but make it quick.  I didn't expect to think and work for my food.

Food quality was ok...gotta go!
author: Ron L.

description:
Came here with some co-workers for lunch the other day. At first glance, this place looks like some sort of cheap Subway meets Lee's Deli type place. But don't be deterred by the cheesy green exterior. This fast casual eatery is quite the Saigon surprise. 

The concept is like an "Americanized" Vietnamese Chipotle. Choose your style of food (soup, sandwich, bowl, or spring roll); choose your protein (chicken, steak, pork); and then select the sauce you'd like to pair with it. I wound up ordering the spring rolls with grilled chicken and paired with sweet and sour chili sauce. But if you want other sauces, they have others to choose from on the counter. The spring rolls are filled with a delicious medley of lettuce, bean sprouts, cucumbers, cilantro, pickled veggies, and jalapenos (optional). As you can tell by the healthy ingredients, this is far more healthy than your average burrito. I was also amazed by the generous portions for just $9. My 3 spring rolls were the size of a baby's arm (ok, weird comparison, I know - but you get the idea). Truth be told, I could only get through two of the rolls before I finally caved in to my full belly. 

* For you pho lovers, please note that they only serve pho after 3pm on weekdays.

My only gripe with this particular Freshroll was the cleanliness of the place. There were many tables that were in desperate need of bussing. It's not exactly appetizing when you sit down for lunch and have to wipe down the table with a napkin and dispose of the previous diners' plates.

All in all, this is a solid SOMA lunch spot. I look forward to coming back soon and trying one of their chicken or steak bowls with veggies and served over Vermicelli noodles. I'm drooling just thinking about it.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Needed to grab a quick lunch on break from class. Stopped here due to the low health score rating and ordered a pork salad.  The service of the salad being made was fast, but the handoff to the non-existent cashier was long. It must have been 5 minutes before the cashier was back at the register.   She was doing another chore, yet there seemed to be a disconnect in communication.

You can add which ever sauce to your salad. I choose the vinegar sauce and spicy sauce. Sorry cannot remember the exact names. The pork was tasty and the salad was a good size.  If there were noodles in the salad, it would have been way to much.

I waited for the ill effects of the low score to hit me in the afternoon, but nothing did. Maybe next time I will try a bahn mi.
author: Marck N.

description: Great portions for the price range. Ordered the bowl with tofu and brown rice with tons of toppings (including pineapple and spiralized radish and carrot)!  All but one of the sauces are vegan :)
author: Vibhu K.

description:
I wanted something light and refreshing. When my craving brought me to spring rolls, I figured I'd finally check out Freshroll Vietnamese.

*3 Freshrolls ($7.95): Grilled chicken, Garlic shrimp (+$1.25 for mix/match), Lemongrass pork, Fish & Peanut sauce

The freshrolls looked pretty. I also liked that I could mix and match the proteins which was nice. My favorite in terms of flavor was the lemongrass pork. The shrimp had a very subtle garlic flavor. The chicken, a slight grill flavor.

So I have two gripes about this place. One, the rolls fall apart super easily. Especially the shrimp one. The ingredients kept falling out of the rolls as I ate them. A little messy. Two, the size. These rolls aren't very big. If they didn't keep falling apart, they could have probably been consumed in 3 bites each. Maybe 2 if you take big bites.

I do like that they offer variety for the fillings and they have a good assortment of sauces, but I don't know if the rolls are made well enough to justify the price. For me, I think I can find better rolls elsewhere. And for less than $10.
author: Elena N.

description:
Very cool twist to the Vietnamese sandwich and spring rolls. A Chipotle type of restaurant where you can choose your type of entree (bowl, sandwich, spring rolls). You can decide what toppings you want inside. They have their recommendations or you can select your own toppings. 

Customization is the new trend and this is no let down. Their portions are actually very big compared to other places. What makes everything even better are their sauces. There are 4 different types that you can choose that are all good.
author: Justin Y.

description: This is my go-to banh mi spot only because it's close to work. Their pho and rice bowls are pretty good too. They have a variety of sauces to choose from. Service is quick and there is always lots of seating available with a big window for people-watching on 4th street.
author: Erin C.

description: their rolls are giant ! Delicious, healthy and clean. Also recommend the taro chips ! 3 rolls + taro chip, my routine ~
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Food is really good
Except is really really slow
Seem like she is having a relationship with my lunch:)
author: Dan D.

description:
Came here with my younger sister after we finished shopping at Union Square, just to see what all the hype's about.

The place is clean & modern.  The layout is kind of like a Vietnamese "Chipotle meets Fresh Choice".  You walk up to the line, tell them what you want...a fresh bowl, fresh rolls, sandwich or pho bowl.

My sister went with the fresh bowl and I decided on the 3 rolls.  I didn't know which meat I wanted exactly, so I went with one of each: lemongrass pork, grilled chicken and garlic shrimp.

The concept is great, veggies are fresh, but everything's on the bland side so you kind of have to add extra hot sauce or whatever else you need to adjust the flavor to your personal liking.

Parking is way too hard to find around this area to come out just for a simple meal, but I have to give them credit for trying...
author: Sivilay T.

description:
The food was average. It's what you can expect from such a place where all ingredients are prepared before you order them. The food wasn't very tasty.
The staff didn't meet my expectations. It was hard to understand them, they didn't follow the instructions and they weren't very friendly. I hope they have better people during the day when they're busier with people who want lunch.
author: Dario S.

description:
Pretty much an average chain. Kind of like an asian Chipotle. They have pho but not until after 4 or 5pm so we had the bowl. Brown rice is a healthy choice and getting the standard is a decent deal. To be honest, I wasn't full when we left so it wasn't too filling. Not a bad alternative if you're in a rush to get something to eat. 

The pork was good but a little on the sweet side. The chicken was as well.

There seemed to be plenty of seating inside but it wasn't busy when we went. Seems to be popular with the business folks during lunchtime.

UPDATE: I went back one additional time and tried the pho. It didn't knock my socks off but it was plenty filling and had good flavor. I'd rather go to a local place to get pho than this chain but in a pinch it did the job.
author: Jess A.

description:
Good food at a decent price.
Ambience: Very small place with counter ordering and pick-up. Your best bet would be to get take-out as there is always a line out the door and it's crowded. 
Service: So-so. You'll have a 15-20 wait in line but then it's not so much because they are slow, but that they prepare everything to order which is a definite plus.
Food: You can order bowls, sandwiches or rolls. All are good and the real plus is that you can have them made to order so add or lose things you want or don't want.
Price: Very good value.
A good choice for a healthy lunch on the go.
author: Geoff A.

description:
The No1DP heard about this place as he thought it was an interesting concept - the Vietnamese version of Chipotle. He took me here after noticing that I was craving pho.

This looks to be one of the more unique lunch options if shopping at the Metreon. It's a simple dining spot with indoor and outdoor seating and the corner area closest to the entrance is a prime spot for people-watching along 4th Street.

The restaurant aims to serve all-natural meats and locally-sourced vegetables. Their sauces are available to add after getting your food. I like that their model keeps the menu options simple, limiting to 4 different types of orders of Vietnamese food: 3 Freshrolls (spring rolls, $7.95), The Sandwich (Banh Mi, $6.95), The Bowl (think rice or vermicelli bowls with choice of noodles or white/brown rice, $7.95) and pho ($8.95), which is supposed to be sold after 3pm. The No1DP and I came at noon and though we ordered different items, we noticed that some people eating before and after us were eating pho. If this applies only on weekends, this should be made more clear. 

No1DP ordered 3 Freshrolls containing 2 garlic shrimp and 1 chicken. Though he liked his rolls, he was surprised that jalapeños were quite spicy and had a hard time getting through his rolls.

I got their garlic shrimp rice bowl containing lettuce, jalapeños, cucumbers, and scallions. You can get an unlimited amount of vegetables. Meat/rice/veggie combination was good, shrimps had a decent amount of garlic and veggies were fresh. I was also surprised at how spicy the jalapeños can be and though my bowl was delicious I also had a hard time getting through my bowl at times. The Crunchy Goodness (fried scallion topping) added a much-needed crunch. 

No1DP got me a small side of pho broth. One of the lighter broths I've tried.

I would recommend this as a quick lunch option if around the area before shopping or seeing a movie at the AMC.
author: Isabella B.

description: I had the tofu pho on a cold, rainy SF night after the movies and it hit the spot.  It's probably not the best bowl of pho you can get in SF, but it was perfect for this night with lots of cilantro and basil, piping hot - perfect!
author: Maile N.

description: Super delicious and fresh! Love that you get to choose what goes inside your roll. Sad we didn't get to try the lychee iced tea since they were out. 2 orders of rolls, 6 in total, were enough for 3 adults.
author: Jordan C.

description: This place is super great. I was wanting a salad and my daughter was wanting Asian and this was perfect! She got the bowl and I chose the fresh rolls. How delicious! So fresh, so good and filling as well. Plenty of veggies to satisfy and protein choices as well. I wish there was one in my area!
author: Melissa D.

description: Could be a little cheaper. Easy location, fresh ingredients. Place is a little messy, slow to clean. Staff is nice.
author: Mercedes G.

description: Love love.  I felt that I was eating healthy and it was super filling.  All meats we're good.  Loved the shrimp the best.  Ginger sauce was smashing!  Taro chips also awesome.
author: Jodi L.

description:
I've been to Freshroll a couple of times now and I can say it is a very solid restaurant. Everything costs about the same, around $10 if you don't add any extras and everything tastes pretty similar. The food is surprisingly filling, but to a person who likes eating chicken and meat like me you might end up with a rather unfulfilled feeling a little after you finish eating. The line to the restaurant is always super long! It goes out of the doors most days during lunch so my suggestion is to go during off-peak hours and the wait shouldn't be long at all. 
I recommend this place if you are looking for food with a very "fresh" taste to it as it is very good and probably the healthiest food I have eaten in a while.
author: Itzak H.

description: Rude employees. I don't recommend this place. The food is tasteless. Specially the African American employee who gives you look if you take extra second to order food. If you don't like your job leave it ....
author: MR R.

description: I'm not sure why I haven't gone here sooner.  I work right down the street and walk by every day.  Actually, I did go once to get the roll but for some reason it did not leave an impression.  However I decided to give it another go because I am getting bored of going to the same places for lunch.  I'm glad I did because this experience definitely left an impression. I got the standard bowl with brown rice and tofu.  However, the tofu was not a hit for me.  It was a little too overcooked so the next time I went I got pineapple instead.  Very tasty! I also got the taro chips, which I am addicted to.  This spot is definitely going on the lunch rotation.
author: Megan M.

description: For a fast food Vietnamese, this was pretty good.  We ordered shrimp and pork spring rolls and also Philz to-go. Everything was packaged nicely, fresh ingredients.  Would go again!
author: Anne C.

description: Used to be my favorite spot until yesterday. The cook was texting and also handling raw chicken and also confronted employee why is she washing noodles in handwashing sink, she said main sink was broken. Will NEVER eat there
author: Marion B.

description: My favorite lunch spot when working at the convention center. Lines can form quickly during lunch so get there early.
author: Renee M.

description: Was not expecting such great flavor out of such a modern, clean, streamlined restaurant. If you are looking for traditional it might not be the place but the sandwich tasted classic and it was completely loaded. Loved it!
author: Phillip W.

description: I am in San Francisco for a Pharmacists convention. I have been here 2 days and have eaten at Freshroll both days. Friendly staff and great fresh food. I love the Pho soup bowl and the price is reasonable. I sent some student attendees over for lunch today and they thanked me for the suggestion.
author: Charlie B.

description: This place is average at best. It is a quick bite which is nice however the bread was stale (when I ordered they actually picked through the bread basket trying to find a less stale roll) and the meat was dry. I had really high hopes for this place. I would not recommend this place unless you are in the financial district and want something quick and convenient. Even then, there are other places you could grab a bite.
author: Erni S.

description:
When moving to a new city, it's always wonderful to see some familiar faces. The other day, a close friend of mine from Las Vegas came to town and wanted to grab lunch. I quickly jumped to the opportunity to reconnect with a friend from my past. The good thing was they were moving to SF VERY soon! They also suggested this place as they've visited this joint time and time again. I was super excited to try something new! 

Holy freshness! I loved the first impression I got from this place. We're talking about the Vietnamese style Chipotle. You approach the restaurant and think, clean eatery. The bright green colors makes a very vibrant restaurant. Nice modern table tops, high tops and window seating. In this eatery, you stand in line, just like Chipotle, walk through a line and pass through wiindowed food casing, like Chipotle, and choose the items you want, just like Chipotle. You can either choose: 3 freshrolls, a freshwich, the bowl or pho noodle soup, starting at $6.95. From that point, you can then choose the protein, veggies and sauces. 

For my visit, I got the bowl for $7.95. I started with brown rice, half of  lemongrass pork and half grilled chicken, added avocado for $1, "the standard" veggie combo minus pineapple (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, jalapenos), basil, carrots, scallions and pickled veggies. For my sauce, I got the Vietnamese vinaigrette. The flavors were on point! I think the vinaigrette and pickled veggies really tied everything together. The basil and scallions for me also solidified the vietnamese flavors. The meats were marinated nicely and really brought that savory side of the dish. 

All in all, I really liked this place! It was quick, easy and had so many options. The lines are long, but I promise you, they move quickly. I work a couple of blocks from this place, so you know I'll be back very soon. If you're in SoMa, come check them out. You will NOT be disappointed!
author: Rockne H.

description: Very tasty fresh spring rolls made to order. I was there yesterday and will be back tomorrow!
author: Michael M.

description: I seem to be on a Vietnamese kick lately, so here goes.  You order cafeteria style (like a Chipotle) with a choice of rolls, sandwiches, bowls or pho with toppings and additions of your choice.  I got a bowl with some protein and some other stuff.  Why do you care what I got? Just pick your own stuff and stop being so nosy! The point is, it was fresh, well-proportioned and really tasty.
author: Denis S.

description: Got the bowl with salad & tofu. All veggies were fresh and the ginger citrus dressing was really tasty. It was busy, however the line moved along quickly. The only complaint was the fried tofu was kind of  hard and could've been fresher.
author: M S.

description:
Awesome fresh ingredients and huge portions! I ordered a bowl with vermicelli noodles and grilled chicken with the standard toppings. My bf ordered a bowl with the garlic shrimp. Total came out to $22. 

I would come back whenever I'm in the area.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I really like this place. I've been there many times since moving to SoMa earlier this summer. 

Quick, fresh, clean, and consistent. 

And the broth isn't crazy salty like some Pho I've had elsewhere.
author: David F.

description:
Pros: *Decently priced. $20 for a bowl of Pho and a Chicken salad. 

Cons: *Small portions on both items.
*Service was poor, unfriendly staff.
*Quality of food was subpar, broth was not as flavorful as others I've tried.
*Steak (pho) was too well done. 
*Chicken (salad) portion was extremely small. For reference, about 6-10 small pieces, if that.
author: Kevin And Daniela H.

description: Always fresh, filling and tasty. I love these fresh rolls. I pick three meats: chicken, pork and shrimp. They come with vegetables of your choice and sauce of your choice. Three rolls in the order, just perfect size to fill your stomach and not feel overstuffed.
author: Lisa J.

description: Went for lunch. No pho until 3 pm. Vermicelli bowl had decent ingredients. A little pricey.
author: Lawrence P.

description:
Good setup for ordering food, you get to see them making the food behind the glass barriers, and the food itself (I ordered the chicken vermicelli salad) tasted near to authentic (the ones in Vietnam had a bit less sauce, but really I wasn't complaining because the sauce is the best bit). 

Took a few minutes (~10 minutes) to make and deliver, which is a bit slow considering it's a cold noodle salad, but the wait was worth it.
author: Rachel R.

description: Incredible fast,  fresh and delicious vietnamese food!  And the environment is very clean, the price is cheap, it is a good place to stop by and have a quite bite!
author: Amy C.

description: It's Americanized Vietnamese food. Chicken and pork were both over cooked and dry and super lean. Fresh veggies though. Decent peanut sauce. The rolls were rolled double the size of normal ones. Most busted before finishing eating them making it quite messy. Sandwich bread was extra thick in relation to the filling.  Too much bread. In general Not worth going out of your way to come here.  Service was ok. No complaints. Nothing stellar either. Would not return nor recommend
author: jacko l.

description:
This was a great surprise! It was right around the corner from our hotel. We were looking for a snack and saw that it had great reviews so we decided to give it a try.  

The fresh rolls were huge. We shared 3 rolls and it was a great snack. You choose your protein. We tried pork, chicken and shrimp. My favorite was the shrimp but my mom liked the pork. The meat was a little hard because I think since it was like 2:30 it had been sitting out for a while. But it still tasted good. 

They also allow you to choose your own add ons. It was nice trying jalepeno on some and cilantro on others. All the veggies were very fresh. 

What I enjoyed most was trying all the sauces. I think the Vietnamese vinaigrette was my favorite but the ginger sauce was a close second. 

I enjoyed it so much, I may go back tomorrow!
author: Jordan M.

description: I really loved freshroll.. Tasted great. But not anymore. worms in the bowl. And its not isolated incident. Saw another yelper say the same thing. May be fly maggots or some tapeworm. Be careful! They dont take care of their food safety!
author: Betty L.

description:
One of my favorite places to grab a quick meal in San Francisco. Freshroll is essentially the Vietnamese version of Chipotle. You order the type of food you want (fresh rolls, sandwich, or bowl) and can then customize the meat and veggies that go into it. It's fast, healthy, and delicious!

I definitely recommend getting the 3 fresh rolls for $7.95. My go-to is always the lemongrass pork with lettuce, basil, cilantro, scallions, bean sprouts and pickled veggies. The rolls are made in front of you, so you know the food you'll be eating is going to be fresh. I've also tried their chicken pho broth, which was delicious. Their lychee iced tea was also on point, so I wish there was a stronger fruit flavor to it.

The only reason I'm docking off a star is the price. Last time I came to Freshroll, I paid more than $13 for the 3 fresh rolls, soup, and a drink. While I would be fine spending that sort of money in a sit down restaurant, I thought that the price was slightly ridiculous for a place like Freshroll. I understand the food is healthy and fresh, but more than $8 for three rolls that normally could count as an appetizer? Overall, I will eat here occasionally when I'm in San Francisco, but I'm glad I don't go to the city often.
author: Joy L.

description: Stopped in here to try something new and was completely wowed with how great the food was. Very fresh and flavorable. Had one of the Chicken and Noodle bowls. Was so good I was back there the next day for dinner lol. Prices very reasonable for the area.
author: Rich B.

description:
By day 8 in San Francisco, all I needed was something involving lots of salad and so Freshroll it is. Freshroll is a Vietnamese place where you order at the counter and they whip up your food in front of you. I went for 3 Freshrolls with chicken and was impressed with the amount they manage to jam into that rice paper roll. 

They only lose a star because the guy at the end of the fillings ripped a sheet and then had to do one all over again, and I was in a massive hurry so this really annoyed me. You get two sauces with your freshroll and I agree, peanut is the best. 

I really liked that you could request a change to the fillings (hell no to cucumber) and overall, they were pretty damn delicious. I would actually aim to go here more often next time I'm in SF as it was the perfect pre-traveling meal.
author: Briony C.

description:
The best way to describe Fresh Roll is that it's like Chipotle but with Vietnamese food. You pick your protein and what it comes in (salad, sandwich, or Spring rolls), and then the toppings.  All the ingredients are pretty true to Vietnamese dishes and actually are fresh. 

The lemongrass pork is my favorite and gets the flavor more accurate than some non-assembly like places.  You can add bacon to and dish, not really Vietnamese but still amazing. They also have pho here, and it's not bad, not great either.  

Taro chips are also amazing! Of all the spring rolls/bowl/banh mi places that have opened recently, Freshroll is my favorite!
author: Veasna H.

description:
More like a 3.5 but let's round up for the sake of healthy, fast food! Headed to Freshroll with co-workers and I was intrigued by the concept. Think of it as Subway for all your summer roll needs! You pick your base ingredients (ex: Chicken, beef, shrimp) and then you have your "artist" add all your extra veggies. You even get your choice of self-serve dipping sauces to choose from. 

Pricing is around $8-12 depending on your protein choice and in San Francisco I think anything healthy around the $10 mark is a deal. Initially I was really interested in grabbing a hot bowl of pho but they don't serve it until after 3 pm, which was a total bummer. Still I enjoyed my three custom made summer rolls and found them to be quite filling. It's like eating a rolled up salad and now you don't have to worry about the carbs in the bread of a sandwich. Note, I was hungry an hour later, but at least it's better than slamming a big Mac into my body and regretting it afterwards.
author: Emi H.

description: Came here for lunch.  Good food...fresh....enjoyed lunch here. The bowls were good and the spring rolls good too
author: M G.

description:
My family and I came across this place looking for a snack before dinner. It's fresh with great service to ensure that - I didn't even notice but a fly had touched my food momentarily and the cashier immediately threw it away and made another one. 

We ordered a bowl and the three spring rolls with lemongrass pork and were very satisfied. They have 4 sauces that you can get for yourself and compliment their food well. Their standard option was great and seemed authentic enough.

Would definitely go back!
author: Margaret K.

description: This place was just what I needed today after a long conference day where the food options were stale pizza and/or airport-esque pre-packaged sandwiches. This place is quick and a create-your-own style. I got 3 fresh rolls and picked my filling and dipping sauces. Very satisfied. Service is speedy and the line moved fast.
author: Martha E.

description:
Food: 2.5
Service: 1
Environment/ambiance: 2

Overpriced and under-flavored.  Three spring rolls (although large) were $10, with an additional charge for shrimp. Peanut sauce was ok (a bit watery but good flavor), and overall I enjoyed the shrimp and pork but overall I feel I can get better food for less money elsewhere. 

Since most people were eating pho the first time I went, I decided to go back a second time with my husband to try the pho and we both had the rare beef. The meat was the only good part of the pho. It lacked flavor, even with jalapeños.  Restaurant was out of chopsticks - I was told they were "upstairs" but none of the employees went to get more (there were five employees there at the time). I ate my pho with a fork and spoon which was odd but it worked, I guess. The restaurant was dirty, with food scraps on most tables, and none of the employees seemed to care. As closing time drew near, chairs were actively stacked around us as we finished our meals. Very unprofessional.
author: Brooke P.

description:
Service at the counter is great but the service within the food line is terrible.  The cashiers are always nice and friendly.  The food line employees are also friendly but forgetful...asked me 4 times if I wanted jalapeno.  Really...you can't remember after asking 4 times in addition to the cashier reminding her.  Food is hit or miss...either very skimpy or generous.  Pork was bland...didn't rasre any lemo grass.  Million dollar question....would I continue to come back?  Nah...better options nearby.

The taro chips needs a little salt.  Taro is already lacking taste so without salt, it basically eating fried cardbard.  Also invest in a on better container for the chips.  Its in a french fry bag and plastic wrapped...so tacky.
author: MickYee M.

description:
Got food poisoning. Should have listened to the poor food rating score on Yelp.

First off, walking in it looks like a chopped up and butchered version of Vietnamese culture. Some type of glorified, white washed version of Asian cuisine. Should have figured - they didn't call anything by their original names:

| Pork sandwich instead of Banh Mi lol

Furthermore, the person who made my sandwich did a terrible job. While toasting the bread, it caught on fire and got burnt.  The meat served looked old, like it was cooked in the morning and served later for lunch. Server packed pickled vegetables to the brim, scraped up the leftover the fell off the sandwich and threw it into the sandwich container. 

This place is garbage.
author: Geronimo Carlo R.

description: This is dank! I will always come here no matter what! Best noodles ever!
author: Nico R.

description:
In a nutshell:
+ Order ahead for lunch and save yourself a hungrier-you.
+ Noodle bowl + protein + fresh veggies + sauce = aWeSoMeNeSS.
- Lunch line moves slow (turn around if there's a conference in Moscone).

It'd be crime if I don't rate this place 5-stars given the number of times I've come here. My colleagues call me mad for coming here so often and I'm guilty as charged.

I'm a vegetarian and I always get their Noodle bowl w/ Tofu - I LOVE IT. The tofu is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside - just right - (yummy!). The veggie add-ons are usually fresh (you can tell that they're fresh). Veggies used to be unlimited, but now only the first five are free (although, they're not picky about charging extra). It's mostly to shoo away the "everything on it" folks who throw it half-full into the bin. I've tried their rolls (you get 3 of 'em) couple of times but it just didn't feel right to me. I might even go as far as calling it slimy and ughughughugh, but whatever suits your food preferences. It's all good here.

Lunch times are crazy busy and gets even worse when there's conferences in Moscone. They work through the queue pretty slow (one might even describe it as watching a movie in 0.5x (half the) speed). I've grown wiser and always order ahead for to-go. Yerba Buena park is just around the corner and is calling out to you.

The staff pretty much recognize me now and wave a friendly "Hi!" but I don't remember this always being the case (understandably because there's a million people waiting in line to get their afternoon grub). The evenings are much saner and you can blissfully stand in the queue.

I'll definitely be back (to pick up my order ;))
author: Venkatesan P.

description:
The name Freshroll fits in the sense that yes these are super fresh rolls - made right in front of you (this was a treat to experience as my typical (and frequent) spring roll-making parties happen behind closed doors). However, they were not as tasty as I had hoped for - I'm going to slightly blame myself for going the standard route offered up by Mr.Rollmaker. I'm not your standard kind of eater. If it has flavor, I always want more - - whatever you're working with, load it on.

Okay, so the rolls may not have me running back but the bowl will for certain. I had went in planning to order pho only to learn it is not on the menu all hours of the day, so in its place I had the chicken vermicelli bowl loaded with toppings like cilantro, Thai basil, sprouts, jalapeños, peanut sauce, and a variety of other toppings that seem to be escaping me at moment. SO GOOOOOODDDD!!!! If only I could run out and nab one of these bombass bowls in Indy. It was extremely flavorful and refreshing all rolled into one (get the roll pun, har har).
Setting: the large windows and light and airy vibe paired beautifully with the fresh eats and open kitchen. I look forward to making this a stop the next time I'm in San Francisco. Oh, and the price is your standard $9-$12 SF lunch.
author: Brittany S.

description:
Love this place! It's like a Vietnamese Chipotle. You can pick between Vietnamese spring rolls, sandwich, bowl or pho.

I got 3 fresh rolls for $7.95 with chicken. They have a "standard" set of toppings/fillings, but I went with my own pick. Decent portion for the price and pretty healthy. The chicken is tender and seasoned well, and the toppings are fresh.

Apparently there's also a stamp card according to another Yelper, but I wasn't aware of that, so keep that in mind!
author: Jessie L.

description:
Quick and easy. That's the moral of this story here -- great for lunch. All the fixings are prepped in the back, but they assemble your salad/noodles/pho/sandwich in front of you. The guy serving us was super friendly, and kept a convo going while prepping our food. The menu is simple, but versatile enough to cater to different palates.

I went for the sandwich -- lemongrass pork on warmed french bread with their spicy "NamNam" sauce. They make it easy and offer "The Standard" toppings, listed on the menu as lettuce, cucumbers, cilantro, bean sprouts, jalapeños, and pineapple. You want more toppings? Just ask. I tossed on some pickled veggies too. They had basil, scallions, carrots, etc. It was filling enough for lunch and I ate a few bites of a freshroll too. I realize I'm just not a huge fan of tofu -- it was a thick, crispy slice in the roll and overwhelming for me, but a light, fresh option if you want a mini-meal in a roll. I dipped it in the sweet chili sauce. 

Side note: the pho is only available after 3pm.
author: Breanna B.

description:
Decent option for a light lunch. I like their spring rolls, and the fact that I can get them delivered quickly via Caviar.

Only withholding a star or two for now, because I felt it was a bit overpriced for what you get.
author: Melissa T.

description: Ordered the sandwich while I was there. It wasn't very traditional or authentic, but the portion size was generous.
author: Tao Y.

description: As many have mentioned it's like the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. You can get either 3 rice paper wrapped rolls, bowl (vermicelli, rice or salad), or pho. I usually opt for the the salad bowl with protein and the standard toppings - pickled veggies, cucumber, jalapeno, bean sprouts, bell peppers, toasted scallions. Extra toppings like pineapple are $0.50 more. Definitely fresher and quality ingredients than your hole in the wall Viet place, not super authentic interpretation but not far off either. Nice light, healthy and quick option for food at just under $10 for lunch. The line might seem long if it's a little out the door but they're efficient at getting people through speedily, and not in a Soup Nazi way either. Just don't go when there's a conference at Moscone. :)
author: Truc N.

description:
My girlfriend and I stopped by this popular spot for an early dinner/ late lunch around 4 pm and we found it to be hit and miss. 

Pros:
- At this odd hour there was only a couple of other people in the restaurant so we were able to order and start eating very quickly!
- It's a very clean, casual atmosphere 
- Lots of heathy options on their menu for all types of eaters (vegetarians, vegans)!
- I ordered the pho with chicken (8.99) and it was amazing. The chicken broth was incredibly flavorful and the bowl was pretty big. I can eat a lot (like 1.5-2 chipotle bowls a lot) and this pho bowl was pretty filling with the noodles, chicken, and broth
- Lots of different condiments that you can use to add more flavor to your meal!

Cons:
- My girlfriend ordered the fresh rolls with portabella mushrooms, lettuce, carrots, jalepenos, bean sprouts, and noodles wrapped in Vietnamese rice a paper. For $8.49, the value for the fresh rolls really wasn't there. The food was not that filling and not very flavorful.
