The pho was SUPER bland, really some of the worst I've ever had. They also serve the hot pho in plastic bowls.... But it really tasted like nothing. I feel like I added two dressing cups full of hoisin sauce to add some kind of flavor. So disappointed. 
We did have the rice wrap rolls which were very tasty & the taro chips were super yummy! 
But my lychee iced tea and pho were left untouched - didn't even finish them :(
Not again.
author: Callan B.

description:
I go for the bowl with brown rice, chicken, pineapple, pickled veggies, peppers, scallions, and shallots with their peanut sauce.

They have a variety of different items (rolls, bowls, pho, sandwiches) and lots of vegetables choice and sauces.

Line was long but moved fairly quickly with their assembly line of employees.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: You can customize your own bowls! Small inside and busy during lunch so order ahead.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Yes, it's a chain. Yes, the atmosphere is a little fast foody, but I love the food here a lot. It's great to have fresh healthy food options for people who work or are in this area frequently like me. Brown rice is always a plus. Lines can be long but they go pretty fast.
author: david w.

description: Very surprised by a fast food vietnamese joint. Had the sandwich and the bowl to try both, and was very satisfied. Lunch hours can have quite a line, but it moves pretty quickly.
author: Ryan A.

description:
This place is basically like a Vietnamese Chipotle and it's super awesome!

Just like Chipotle, there is an assembly line of workers that put everything you want into your meal. First, you'll choose whether you want a fresh roll (spring roll), noodle soup, bowl, or sandwich. After that, you'll choose what carbs, protein, and greens you want. 

I like to get the bowls because it gets me stuffed and the fresh rolls. I usually eat my bowls with brown rice and lemongrass pork or grilled chicken.

My favorite things about this place are the pineapples they put into the meal and the Tangy Citrus Ginger sauce. I personally don't like ginger, but I'm in love with the sauce! I mix the sauce into my rice bowl and use another to dip my protein in.

All the workers here are pretty friendly which is always a plus. They should seriously make this joint a chain like Chipotle.
author: Derek T.

description:
I was traveling on business for Oracle Open World.  This is conveniently located across from Moscone West.  My first day's box lunch was such a hassle and ordeal that I told myself I was going to treat myself to an awesome lunch the rest of the week to make up for it.  Freshrolls definitely did the trick!

There was a long line the day I went but it was worth it.  Just a little unpleasant as SF was in the middle of a freak heat wave.  I got 3 rolls with lemongrass pork.  It was so fresh and I loved being able to customize the ingredients.  I chose the peanut and sweet and sour chili sauce.  I couldn't decide which I liked better so I would literally alternate bites in each to get a terrific taste each time.  I washed it down with a lychee ice tea while I had a "picnic" outside during one of the keynote presentations.  It was super delicious!  I only wish I was in town longer to eat more!
author: Maria K.

description:
Love me some fresh roll. Sometimes this place really hits the spot. It's clean and the food is always great. I love the sweet red dipping sauce. Sometimes you get unlucky and have a super slow employee making your rolls who makes them messy and they fall apart but it's still yummy. 

My fave is the shrimp roll with scallions, pineapple, cucumbers and carrots.
author: Dani T.

description: Fast and OK banh mi sandiwch = fulfilled my desires for something that was relatively inexpensive to eat during the early evening hours. I got the pork banh mi and unfortunately have had much better - holla at HANCO's IN PARK SLOPE, BROOKLYN, NY!!! No other pork banh mi sandwich has come close to theirs. In any case, ordering was quick and efficient and you get 10% off for checking-in on Yelp.
author: Linna F.

description:
This place was surprisingly very good for being an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant.  I mean ... who serves bell peppers and avocado with their spring rolls / vermicelli in Vietnamese food?!  Such a Californian thing to do, haha.  

This place offers nice healthy portions, and if you're trying to get the best bang for your buck, I'd go for the vermicelli/rice bowl. It's like Chipotle, so you can pick as you please with all your favorites and they literally have no hesitation about piling on as much as they can!  Of the meats available, the lemongrass pork was probably the best and would be my recommendation.  I also liked that they offered a tray of taro chips during lunch for people waiting in line to try.  Lightly salted and tasty!!  

The spring rolls were a bit on the expensive side though ... almost $8 for 3 rolls?!  I know they're larger than normal spring rolls, but holy jamoly.. you could buy at least 2 more spring rolls with $8 at a normal Vietnamese restaurant.  I don't think it's worth the price you're paying, but if you're feeeeeening spring rolls, I guess this will do.  The add-on crispy wonton wraps are a nice touch and it reminds me of Brodards in SoCal.

I also got the lychee tea, but it was nothing too memorable.  It had more of a longan flavor than lychee flavor to me.

But overall, I think I would come back.  Not a bad lunch place and the service is super friendly!  The smell of the grilled meats also gets you as you walk up/down 4th street!
author: Carena N.

description:
I like how this is a togo vietnamese restaurant and they have a seating area too. It's quick, easy to order, the prices are good, and the staff is always super friendly (like seriously props to the person who hires them!). Located outside of the Metreon (a couple of spaces down from Chipotle) and is central. I give this place two thumbs up. Just overall amazing!

My favorite is the beef pho but I still have to try the Bahn Mi and the spring rolls. I come here to satisfy my pho craving when I want it ASAP since it is not a sit down and order type of restaurant. 

You stand in line, the menu is on the wall, you order and tell them how you want your food, pay, get your ticket/receipt, wait, they call you number and BAM your done. 

I'm a happy customer who will be returning more often since it has been a little chilly out in the Bay Area lately.
author: Mariah T.

description:
I felt really sick today and got out of the AMC in the Metreon craving soup! Thank god this place was open since I didn't want something heavy (clam chowder). 

There are 4 options: 3 rolls, bowl (vermicelli, rice), pho and salad. You decide what protein you want and then you pick the veggies!

Although I have had way better Vietnamese food coming from SoCal, this place didn't disappoint. They could do a way better job if they put more protein in their options.
author: Silvia L.

description:
PIT STOP- SF CONVENTION CENTER
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Stunning Good to Great Vietnamese Fast Good Food just around the corner from the SF / Moscone Convention Center!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

       I was Shocked & Awed on how good this little modern unassuming place is.

       Forget the (boring) rolls, get either a nice hot bowl of Pho or a very savory Vietnamese Sandwich.
       
       Compared with all the other choices near the Convention Center, this place is amazingly tasty, fast, & inexpensive.

       This is one of the few places where the Yelp Hype is spot on, and points you to a place that you want to go back for more, the very next day!  Especially when you are stuck in a boring Psychiatry Conference (the annual APA), in the Convention Center.

       I went here two days in a row, and ordered both a Sandwich and a Bowl of Pho each time....
  
      I was so overjoyed to get such a great Vietnamese fix!  

Q&A: 
~~~~

       1) How does their stuff compare to that of glorious Story Rd. in SJ?  

Actually, very well...just as fast, but most likely far cleaner (& modestly more pricey)

       2) How is the atmosphere?

Very modern, clean, utilitarian,  and "Chipotle-like".  Service is probably better than in SJ. The seats are hard wood, but the view of people walking along the sidewalk on a bright sunny day is alot more entertaining than that in SJ.  A great SF people watching area.

      3) Is it authentic Vietnamese food?

If the test is by taste, I would have to say so.  Vietnamese purists may defer.

     4) Is it the best tastiest cheapest bargain near the Convention Center?

An unqualified----

YOU BET!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

P.S.- If you desire a more serene Zen-like atmosphere with both upscale food & prices, then the nearby Samovar Tea Lounge, with their amazingly tasty Duck Sandwich (with Tea & other goodies), cannot be beat.  It is directly on top of the Convention Center / Yerba Buena Park.
Come here to meditate on great food, stellar service, & atmosphere.

P.S.S- Hopefully, Freshroll opens franchises everywhere.....like down in San Luis Obispo...
hint....hint. :)

P.S.S.S- I am sure the Rolls are fine too.  I just have no room left over after eating both a Pho & a Sandwich...maybe next Conference.
author: Paul M.

description:
Great place to get some fresh Vietnamese food in downtown SF at a very reasonable price.  My wife and I both got the bowls and we felt we got decent portions and the quality was better than we expected.  

I would skip the "Crispy Goodness" (3 fried scallion rolls) as they really didn't add much too the experience other than just increasing the cost by $1.  

I sampled some of the homemade Taro chips and enjoyed them, but I was too full to place a full order of them.
author: David L.

description:
I got three fresh rolls with chicken and all the veggies today at 11:45 a.m. when lunch hunger hit me early. The line was short, they move quickly and the food was filling, $9, and decent enough. I was turned off by the wraps, which start off as textured squares and are brittle, plastic-looking things. The employees on the line dunk them in water to make them soft and pliable by the time they hit your lips. It made me question the edibility as I watched this go down, but tasted fine. Secondly, the food was all right smothered in peanut sauce. Without it? Kinda bland, sorta day-old lettuce tasting. But the peanut sauce was dope. 

If you're downtown and want lunch on the go, and like sauce, hit this place up.
author: Jillian S.

description: This place is the one stop shop for you're Vietnamese to-go meals! Just like chipotle where you ask for toppings on you're sandwhich or bowls as you go. Pricing is quite fair for downtown SF, much to my surprise. Although this will never beat an authenthic Vietnamese sandwhich shop, it is perhaps the closest alternative to it. There are also refreshing flavored tea here as well.
author: Daniel T.

description:
When it comes to worktime lunches, I like to keep it simple. I don't have time to pore over a giant menue, wait forever, or eat something so rich and heavy that I feel like crap for the rest of the workday. Freshroll really seems to understand that philosophy and has perfected a super easy yet still fresh and tasty option for those who want some quick Vietnamese food. You can go for a roll or bowl, hence the name, and choose your veggie and meat toppings. I had the pork on the cook's suggestion and it was juicy and flavorful. I was also obsessed with their lychee iced tea... I could drink a gallon of that a day! 

The people who worked there knew how to be helpful and friendly while keeping things moving at an impressively quick pace. We started with a line out the door but I found myself up to the counter ordering in no time! Definitely a great choice for this area when you don't feel like a sandwich or burger. And I felt just the right amount of full afterward, like with this nourishment I could charge into any conference room and OWN it!
author: Christina P.

description:
Came her today for the first time. Luckily no lines so ordering was fast and easy. I ordered the pork lemongrass spring rolls and lemongrass pork bahn mi sandwich. 

The spring rolls were good and fresh . My only issue was they were kinda sloppy. I'm used to tight spring rolls that stay intact when u bite into them. These were big and loose rolls so it got really messy so it was hard to enjoy, other then that they were yummy.

The bahn mi sandwich was also very good . I liked the fresh bread and all the fresh ingredient it came with. All the flavors go really well with each other. Cilantro, fresh jalapeños, cucumbers, pickled carrots and  we added fresh avocado. My only complaint was I wish there was more pork.  Sometime I would take a bite but couldn't taste any of the meat. I could taste everything else which was good just wish there was more meat.

Overall I enjoyed it. And would come again if I was in the mood for spring rolls while in the city. 

Friendly service also :)
author: Mayra M.

description: Fresh food and healthy options. Loved the peanut sauce and generous portions. Ordered the sandwich and loved the crunchy bread. The location was very cold (doors wide open in December) and not too pleasant to linger and eat. Wished that we had moved to the nearby shopping mall with our take out to enjoy the meal before all the meat went cold in the winter air.
author: Rosaline O.

description:
I always order 3 fresh rolls here. I'm Vietnamese, but never really liked spring rolls -- until I found this place. I know it's not authentic, but that could be why I like it so much. It's kind of like the Viet version of Chipotle.

The food here is cheap and you don't feel gross after eating it. Great for a quick, healthy, cheap dinner. I come here on nights that I don't feel like cooking. I love the different sauce options. My favorite is the citrus ginger.

You can even order online ahead of time. There's a loading zone right in front where you can park for 5 minutes while you run in to get your food.
author: Paulina L.

description:
I walked past Fresh Roll almost every day to work - so I finally took the time to online order (about 30-40 min in advance, which skipped a very busy lunch line!). 

The best thing I can compare Fresh Roll to is a healthy vietnamese Chipotle. From what I saw you go through a line, pick your preferred style (bowl, roll, sandwich, or soup) and then add your ingredients!

I got a chicken bowl with the long grain jasmine brown rice, chicken, lettuce, basil, carrots, sprouts, and tangy ginger sauce. I was surprised at how much food came with it - I absolutely could not finish it. 

For the price, this is my go-to healthy Asian option in SF. I didn't feel gross after eating it, and it was really convenient.  If I ever move back to SF, this will be one of my first lunch time spots!
author: Suzannah S.

description: I was really craving some spring rolls after work, so my friend and I ate here. We ordered 3 spring rolls (shrimp, lemon grass, and chicken) for about $6 and a bowl of steak pho. The rolls here are pretty decent, made fresh in front of you, and satisfied my cravings. But the steak pho was oily and we just didn't enjoy it at all. Next time I'll go to Chinatown for some legit pho. I know this isn't an authentic Vietnamese restaurant, so I won't be too harsh. Overall, I would come back for spring rolls but not the pho. Like a lot of reviews said, this is like a Vietnamese chipotle!
author: Corinna T.

description: Was at Yerba Buena Gardens for the going to museums with my kid and needed to find someplace where we could get a quick healthy lunch. What good fortune that we found this place. My son was able to choose which ingredients he wanted and our rolls were created in no time at all.  The rolls, and accompanying sauces, were delicious. We will definitely come back again!
author: Anne W.

description: Simply Delish!!!!  We just happened upon this place...best decision ever. Pho is amazing! I highly recommend this place!
author: Marissa H.

description: I highly recommend the sandwich with chicken!! It's reasonably priced and filling. I love the toppings too. The only down fall is they charge 99 cents for other veggie toppings.
author: Amy L.

description:
Another "Puzzle" Food restaurant where you put together the "pieces" from a menu on the wall behind the counter to create a meal, or AKA: 

Vietnamese Diner meets Chipotle Mexican Grille.

Pick one of 4 styles of basic Viet diner meals: 
Sandwich (aka Banh Mi)
Spring Roll (aka Goi Cuon)
Soup Bowl (aka Pho)
Dry Bowl (aka Bun)

There are more AK's in this place than a Russian supplied insurgent militia's automatic weapons. (AK47)

Perhaps the most popular is the Spring Rolls. You get 3 of these per order. They have a large white formica board on the counter, and the worker places 3 square rice paper tiles, wetted, on it to form the wrapper. (These are usually round in most Viet places, and unseen in the kitchen). Then they add your protein choice (i.e. lemongrass pork, chicken, etc) to each square, then a deli choice of veggies, and then they wrap it for you, just like Chipotle, except smaller and 3 times. 

I ordered the Banh Mi (pronounced Bun Me, like the other sit down Viet-Resto-For-White-People on Fillmore near California, called Bun Me, haha, I get it!). They toast your french roll and add your Puzzle Pieces to it. I went with as many authentic Viet ingredients as I could, just to get a comparison of a real Banh Mi, like form Saigon Sandwiches or Lee Sandwiches in the South Bay. 

But to keep their close ties to their inspiration, Chipotle Mexican Grill, they asked if I wanted Chipotle-Aioli sauce on it? I said ok, just to try the "fusion" puzzle sammie.

It wasn't bad, but for $7.95 for a sandwich you can get for $3.50 in a Viet Sandwich store, it was weak. 

It wasn't so bad that I left in pieces, but I did leave puzzled.  

Why pay double for assembly line Viet sammies for twice the price? 

I guess the nearest Viet diners are a few blocks away in the T-Loin. Actually, there is one across the street trying to serve sushi, aka Viet Diner dreams of Sushi, but it is a nightmare. 

OK, the rent here in the Metreon is expensive, and there are actually some Asians who stop in here, either curious, or wanting a small hint of familiar flavors and foods, and not having a lot of time to eat and think twice. 

But mostly it is conventioneers from Moscone, or busy/hungry people who parked in the City lot at 5th and Mission, or Techno nerds who are used to eating puzzle food and who's employers are smaller and don't have their own kitchen, or people who work down here and have tried the dozen places in the Metreon, the dozen more in the Westfield Mall, and the dozen more close by, already, and are bored. 

Once they get bored of this place, they can go next door to the original Puzzle Food.... Chipotle!
author: Wanugee N.

description: Totally underestimated this place for some reason. I'm a big eater (as in I eat a lot) so I think I thought the servings would be too small or it wouldn't fill me up or something. Boy was I wrong. I actually planned to come here, try a roll, and then get some Chipotle as my actual meal. So that's what I did, I came, got a roll, took it to Chipotle but then the line at Chipotle was long so I got hungry and decided to taste the roll. Wow was I surprised. Immediately left went back and ordered another 3 rolls, plus a bowl which ended up being way too much food but was all so delicious. I would settle on just the 3 rolls next time and it would be enough. Can't wait to move to SF so I can frequent this place much much more.
author: Neechi M.

description: Super convenient.  The beef pho and pork bowl were excellent.  It's set up like s chipotle.  The service was good.
author: Eric P.

description:
It was a perfect storm. First of all, no matter the length of your flight, food seems to be a thing of the past if you're not in first class. So, no matter the fact that the length of my trip was longer than had I flown to another continent, there was no food to be had for me on my journey from Miami to San Francisco. Add to this the paucity of delicious Asian food offerings in the Magic City and you have for one starving and pho-on-the-mind Johnny T. I knew that one of the first things I would do upon landing in the city by the bay would be to get *some* sort of Asian food delight.

Luckily for me, Freshroll was near my hotel and favorably reviewed by friend and colleague. Done... and what a good idea it was. I don't know whether it's because I'd gone months without eating any sort of [fill-in-the-blank Asian ethnicity] food for nearly a year, but I was very impressed with Freshroll. Yes, it's a Vietnamese Chipotle [point of order: how awesome for Chipotle's branding that they're the default when it comes to make-your-own ethnic food?]. But don't take anything away from them. You *will* dine on delicious food. Plus, it's fun to make things up as you go along.

Step one: choose your vehicle (roll, bowl, sandwich, or soup). The vermicelli noodles were calling my name. Plus, I like to slurp my lunch whenever I have a chance. Step two: protein (lemongrass pork... stop here. It's all you need to know). Step three: vegetables. If you have a hard time choosing, the standard order is lettuce, sprouts, cilantro, pineapple, cucumber, and jalapeno. Yes, ALL that. In your bowl. Because I'm a special snowflake, I settled on carrots, jalapeno, pickled veggies, scallions, cilantro, and peppers. Step four: sauce. You have the choice of peanut, ginger, sweet & sour chili, and some sort of vinaigrette. I said 'and' and not 'or.' Don't limit yourself. I settled on the first three. Just when you think you're done, there's a drink to be sipped. Be like me and suck down a jasmine tea/limeade mix. Holla!

But, wait. There's more. Make that isht a combo!! That means you get the drink AND a cup of chicken broth to go with your concoction. Add to this wondrous plate a bottle of the rooster and you are good to go. Granted, I was starving and Vietnamese food-deprived, but I tore the meal up. Despite mixing everything together, I was able to - pretty easily - pick out the various ingredients and flavor profiles. My lunch was filling, satisfying and kind to my wallet. That's a lunch made of win. I'd gladly come back.
author: Johnny T.

description:
I'm not a big fan of going out to eat, getting takeout, or anything that costs more money than cooking a huge amount of cheap, bulk food and slowly eating it for the rest of the week. When people come to visit and ask me where to eat, I have a really, really hard time recommending places, because I just haven't gone out enough.

But I do know Freshroll.

I have taken so many people here. It's the only place I go to eat if I happen to be downtown during a mealtime. Freshroll ALWAYS brightens my day. I always get the same thing--3 standard chicken fresh rolls, hold the jalapeños--but I've tried their pho too, and that was pretty good. I've gone here with friends and family who have tried the other options and liked them, too. It's just so easy, and you always know what you're going to get, and it just feels so light and refreshing.

The taro chips are also very good, but I usually only take a sample. 3 fresh rolls is filling enough for me. I have tried all the sauces, but my favorite is their peanut sauce. I could eat that with a spoon! My boyfriend's absolute go-to is the ginger sauce.

I only have one complaint for a small handful of occasions when I received rolls that were half the normal size. One time in particular, my rolls were VERY obviously smaller than my boyfriend's. You'd think they could at least standardize the size if two people next to each other are filling the rolls at the same time, but unfortunately sometimes you just get unlucky. Regardless, it still tastes amazing and I keep coming back.

I will never say no to Freshroll!
author: Katie V.

description:
service: 4 stars
quick, free water and hot sauce bar so you can get as much as you want without waiting

food: 3 stars
decent. good for a fast casual restaurant that serves vietnamese food but nothing special. could get more food for the same amount at a traditional vietnamese rest (but you'd have to wait)
noodle bowl will get you the best value. ask for half of each topping to get more food.
author: Jackie W.

description:
Note, does not really have pho (as you see in some reviews/the photos). They will give you pho broth $2, but you have to pour it in yourself to the vermicelli (not pho noodles) bowl, and it's not authentic.

3.5 stars overall, mainly because it's the "Chipotle" of Vietnamese food and has fresh ingredients, big bowls and a GREAT spicy ginger sauce. It's as non-Authentic Vietnamese as it gets, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.

The line is long everyday for lunch, and it doesn't have Eat24 pickup (ugh!), so you have to wait 20ish mins at noonish to get your $9 meals.

3 spring rolls for $9 is pretty pricey.

The tofu is a bit dry and boring, but the chicken and pork are great on the vermicelli bowls with all the veggie toppings. Get that. Get the spicy ginger sauce, it's delish and prob the only reason i'd come back. Not bad at all, but very Westernized Vietnamese food.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Pretty good place. 

Totally overpriced Vietnamese food since I could totally get the same stuff a couple blocks down for half the price - esp the Banh Mi style. 

I got the dry noodles with the pork and some great topping. The addition of pineapple as a topping is great. It's a great sweet ending and a palette cleanser. 

It's probably not the first place I would have chosen for a lunch with my friend, but it was a great choice!
author: Nina Y.

description: Quick, fresh, and inexpensive. Noodle bowl, which was more or less a deconstructed summer roll, was $9.49. You can customize (I didn't), add avocado (should have), etc. as per their board, pho is only available after 3 M-F(? Not sure about weekend availability hours), and they do sandwiches as well.
author: Teresa G.

description: I really didn't expect much from Vietnamese fast food, but this place is surprisingly good! Albeit, it's hard to mess up spring rolls and a vermicelli noodle bowl. What really made this place good was the fish sauce that you get with the noodle bowl, it tasted just right. If you're hankering for some Vietnamese and you're downtown SF, definitely check this place out.
author: Will C.

description:
My friend is on this weird ass diet and eliminated A LOT of places that she couldn't eat at, but decided on this one. She keeps calling it a Vietnamese Chipotle, which when I got there totally made sense.

They have wraps, bowls, sandwiches and other things and I chose a set of 3 wraps with one of each meat (pork, chicken, tofu) with a little bit of all the veggies.

The pork and chicken were good. Had a nice grilled flavor and was flavorful. The tofu was surprisingly not as bad as I thought and had lots of flavor too. The overall wrap was good and was pretty fresh. I think how good it is depends on what combination of ingredients you choose - "everything" seems like a good choice. There are also 4 different sauces that you can go for it. The peanut one is the best :)

I also got a lychee green tea. It was pretty good - just not sweetened. 

Overall, a great place to get a healthy meal that you create.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Get the rolls if you don't know what to get.  The lemongrass pork and chicken were so good.  The tofu and the grilled shrimp were just ok - I'd skip them.  The ginger sauce is really good.  The taro chips are yummy.  I would definitely come back.
author: Chris L.

description:
Dear Freshroll,

You used to be my favorite take out place in the area. Key word is used to. What used to be a great bargain with loads of fresh vegetables has diminished greatly these past years. What used to go in your standard provided lots of great taste but the limitations now has diluted your product. The quantity of produce in your bowls has gotten smaller as well and the care your workers put into creating the dishes worse.

After I redeem my last card I will move on to cheaper fare I can get at my local Vietnamese restaurants. You still get three stars as my Asian Chipotle alternative if I'm in the area but I will not go out of the way for.

I miss the old you,
Ed
author: Ed T.

description: Was in the area for Oracle OpenWorld. Everything was complete mayhem, but this place got through the line quickly.  I enjoyed my rolls, but the lemongrass pork was way overcooked.  The sauces were delicious, and I loved the concept. Wish we had something similar to this back in Colorado!
author: Bella S.

description: This is one of my absolute favorite places for pho it's so fresh and so good! I always have the pho with chicken I also get the grandmas peanut sauce and sriracha on the side I love it so much I dip the chicken and sometimes put some in the pho for extra flavor!
author: Rita A.

description: Solid fast casual Vietnamese fare.  Didn't want to waste time on fast casual pho (c'mon!), so my wife and I both had bowls.  I had the pork and it was pretty good.  The different sauces and the fresh veggies made it an above average fast lunch.
author: Mike F.

description:
This is DEFINITELY the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. It's OK and fixes the craving, but it's nowhere near to some authentic Vietnamese dishes. 

I wandered in craving a bowl of vermicelli. They have all the right fixings, but it just doesn't have that taste. I got everything except the jalapeños. Vermicelli bowl with chicken, cilantro, cucumber, sprouts, romaine lettuce and pickled veggies. They have you pick what kind of sauce it comes with. One is the traditional sauce, another is peanut, another is chili and I think the last one had something to do with ginger. Anyhow- I took the traditional sauce because how better to compare to the typical vermicelli bowl?

The chicken was pretty bland. Nothing special about it. It tasted like it was stuck on the grill without anything added to it. Honestly, the only flavorful part of the dish was the sauce. But I expected it to be Chipotle-ish anyways.  

Overall, this place is good for a fix and it's reasonably priced. But it's not the same as the pho hole-in-the-wall spot. Perhaps I'll try the rolls next time!
author: Samantha N.

description:
Boom! FTR, third customer. 
Disclaimer, I love Vietnamese food and seek it out as often as possible. 


So far so good! Grabbed lunch at this place on their opening day. Staff were super friendly, good hiring! Ordered the salad with chicken, extra pickled veg, pineapple ( extras $), jalapeno, cilantro, and mint. 
The end all and be all for me with a salad is the dressing. A great salad with a great dressing is heaven. 
I'm happier than Elaine. from Seinfeld with her " big salad".
Topped it all off with a Vietnamese coffee ( slightly sweet which is a nice change from the sometimes bitter counterparts).

$11 total which isn't cheap but is comparable to the lunch spots in the area. 

Being that there really is no good pho to speak on in the FIDI (gristle and old meat anyone?)
I can't wait to try theirs. The problem? Theydon't serve it at this location!
That's a big bummer, wish they would change it. ( hence the three stars)

Even so, working in the building, I can see this being a regular spot for me.
A trip to Hanoi might be cheaper... :)
author: Amy P.

description:
I've come to appreciate Freshroll, and it's becoming a once or twice per week staple.  It still has it's share of challenges, but everything is trending in the right direction: 

- It feels like a healthy lunch (even if it isn't since I put pork on anything I order here).  The brown rice bowl fills you up and leaves you feeling pretty good about yourself at the end of the meal.  I love that they don't nickel and dime you picking which toppings you want: I just get all the veggies and call it a day.  

- Don't bother with the chicken -- it's underseasoned, bland.  But did I mention the pork?  It's good, real good.

- The "vietnamese vinaigrette" isn't very vietnamese-y.  It's mostly sugar, and could use a serious helping of fish sauce and chile to give it some flavor.  I find myself dousing my bowl with Sriracha to help things out.

- The online ordering system is a great alternative to standing in line.  There's no signage about how you're supposed to pick things up: just leapfrog the line and bully your way in.  (I also don't understand why they force you to enter all your credit card info online... and then ask you to pay with your card when you actually pick it up.  Kind of a waste of everyone's time, no?)

Freshroll has dramatically improved since it first opened, so I'm hoping they keep the improvements coming.
author: Laurence W.

description: Love the rolls, chicken broth, taro chips and more, but there was one time the dropped something that was not eatable on my roll during the process. Watch out before you eat otherwise food is good.
author: Anya C.

description:
I'm in love with Fresh Roll! It totally saved me from starvation or yet another protein shake and bag of almonds on my recent mid-week work trip to the city from LA.

Week day lunch time lines are long but move quickly as the food is prepared to order assembly line style right there in front of you so by the time you make it to the register to pay your order is all ready to go. It may seem packed and busy but the seats have a high turn over rate and I had no trouble at all scoring a solo seat by the window.

How it works:
1. Pick your style
2. Pick your protein 
3. Pick your veggies, as many as you like 
4. Pick your sides, drinks, sauces

Having subsisted off of protein pwder, packets of almond butter and almonds for the last day having flown up from L.A. and not having any good dinner options available due to the rain, I was famished. I ordered a brown rice bowl with shrimp plus an add on of extra protein (chicken). Tip: It's cheapest to specify the order this way. I asked for every veggie option except for the carrots and pineapples and added avocado on as an extra. No sauces just in case any contained hidden sugar. Free cucumber water for my drink. The total with all of my add-ons came to just under $14. A bit pricey for an every day lunch but luckily my company was covering this under my per diem.

Freshroll was a dream come true for me and fit my lifestyle diet perfectly!
author: Amber B.

description:
This place is pretty good but quite overpriced if you want more than 6 small pieces of tofu. The manager is really nice but the general employees don't provide very good customer service.

Also can you guys please implement a max per person rule? There is a woman in front of me right now who is ordering at least a dozen rolls from a sheet of paper, holding up the whole line...
author: Natalie S.

description:
I just tried this place! I got the 3 roll special with the lemongrass pork, and the taro chips. I picked the sweet and spicy sauce, and the citrus ginger. 

All I can say is it's AMAZING. Healthy, tasty, and fast - don't be dissuaded by the long lines, they've got a good rhythm behind the counter and will get you in and out quick.
author: Loryanna M.

description: Great steak pho! Savory broth and meat. Quick service, kind staff. Clean and quiet when we stopped by.
author: Dillon D.

description:
Welcome to Vietnamese chipotle. First, you can choose from rolls, bowls, or sandwiches. Next, you pick your protein, and last you pick your ingredients. Sound like a similar concept? 

This place is pretty good. I like the options you can pick. It's like an Americanized version of a Vietnamese fast food restaurant. Service is fast and nice. Food is pretty good. I tired all their meats and my personal favorite is the crispy tofu. 

I would definitely come here if I worked in the city. Although, my only complaint about this place is that food is a bit pricey. For 3 spring rolls you pay almost 8 dollars. That's a lot for Vietnamese food!
author: Stacey L.

description: What a great, fast casual concept! 3 large spring rolls, freshly created right in front of you. You get your choice of protein and you can mix and match among the 3 rolls. I did 2 chicken and 1 tofu. Outstanding! For $9 I was stuffed. The cucumber self-self water was a nice bonus touch. I will def come back the next time that I'm in town.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I enjoy coming to this place to get a quick lunch or dinner because they are pretty fast with their service and I don't feel like I just ate half my daily allotment of calories. If you haven't been, it's pretty much the "chipotle" of vietnamese spring rolls, though you can get other things like pho or rice bowls. I think. I've never tried those, but I've heard they're good as well.

A-OK? Why just ok? Well for almost $10 you get 3 rolls, which aren't small and they do contain a decent amount of your meat choice, but I could get a lot more food for the same price next door at chipotle. Oh well, it is good food nonetheless and I'd say it is worth it. 

Their prices recently went up, too. Supply prices or production prices must be rising  because they changed their topping inclusions. What used to be their "Standard" mix of toppings has turned into their "choose 5 toppings and we'll charge you for extra" additions. And lettuce is included in part of your 5. Well that just decreased the variety in my roll... So on to my gripe:

Also, for only having 5 toppings they sure seem to skimp on portions. I know, you can't over stuff the rice paper or the whole roll will explode. But really, I asked for cilantro as one of my toppings, and i got about 1-3 little leafs per roll. How is this even going to add to my taste experience? In one bite I'll get a taste of freshness, and in the next, just vermicelli and lettuce. Want jalapenos? One bite of meek, mild mannered innocence and the next an onslaught of arsony on your unsuspecting mouth. Want one half of your roll to taste completely different from another bite? Well then this is perfect for you. 

Seriously, if you are giving me a choice of vegetables which are definitely much cheaper than the meat you are providing me with I would like a light but healthy smattering of them across the length of my roll. Not one small cilantro leaf, or two slices of jalapeno, or a single small lonely pineapple shoved into the afterthought end of my roll. I would be happier with my $10 if I got more even toppings.

In the end, though, I enjoy the taste and decent satiation from Freshroll. The biggest factor is WHO is rolling your roll. The best flavors and toppings won't hold together a roll that is exploding through its torn wrap, and much like the Chipotle burrito that an employee tried to fix with an extra tortilla your rolls will turn out sad looking and limp.
author: Kevin S.

description: I liked the food and really enjoyed the sauce choices. However, I thought it was overpriced.
author: Malissa D.

description:
AMAZING option for a healthy, fresh and quick meal in the Union Square area of town. After a few days of boozing and traveling I was really craving some veggies and opting for one of their "bowls" really did the trick.

The concept is fairly akin to a Chipotle in the sense that you pick your protein and then choose what veggies you want to go with-- I opted for the lemongrass pork which was fantastic and got pretty much the kitchen sink on top (sprouts, pineapple, cucumbers, jalapeños, carrots, bell pepper etc). They also let you choose as many dipping sauces/dressings as you want and their citrus ginger dressing is out of this world.

The rolls looked superb as well so if I'm in the area again I would definitely try these-- highly recommend this if you're looking something great (and inexpensive!!!) to eat!
author: Elliott W.

description: They completely messed up or order. supposed to be too go, instead made it for here. Messed up the order. No apology. Long wait on a Saturday. I won't be back.
author: Jerry T.

description:
Yummy for my tummy. The bowl, the wrap, and even salad is delicious. It's fresh (obvi) and filling. Totally worth the 11.00 you end up paying. The customer service is always on point. The dude with the ear gages and dreads is so efficient and kind- trust, that's a hard to keep up during the lunch hour, especially when this place is swarming with the marine bro types. 

Make sure to ask for the NamNam sauce. They're def not stingy with their bowls, sauces, or hospitality.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description: I am giving a ONE STAR because they wrapped my fresh rolls VERY SLOPPY. Their quality of the food is good, but the people who roll them for me does a horrible job at it. My rolls came loose and everything fell apart! I mind as well get a bowl if it was going to be this sloppy. I have posted a picture of it.
author: Sandy C.

description:
Literally every single table was dirty. No chopsticks available. Got the pho, terribly bland. No fish sauce. Worse pho I have ever had. 

Don't sell pho if you don't have chopsticks
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Delicious Vietnamese Good food fast!  Prices are SOMA normal, but the food was definitely worth the cost.  I ordered the Lemongrass Pork rolls and a side of chicken phi broth/soup.  Loved it all!  Chipotle-style service, busy at lunch time but line moves fast.  I like the customization options and service was friendly and fast.  
Being Vietnamese, I'm a huge critic whenever a place tries to be fusion/mainstream, but this place definitely hits the mark, keeping real on the Vietnamese flavors (not even neglecting the "Nuoc Mam" or what they call it "Vinaigrette"). Lemon grass pork was on point, not too fatty, with good flavor.  Really enjoyed the broth, chicken flavor and all pho-spices really showed that they simmered it long enough (without the MSG). 

I can't wait to try more options, definitely a fan of this place.
author: Mykael N.

description:
I love love love their vietnamese rolls and chicken pho.
The booth isn't too salty, the portion is perfect. 
You can pick and choose different kinds of ingredients to put in the rolls.
Pairing it up with their grandma's peanut sauce. 

Perfect for lunch!
author: Alui L.

description: Good concept and good flavor, but the pork was so gross! 50% fat and nasty hard things. Would try again but will stick to the tofu!
author: Lauren H.

description: Amazing rolls!!!! I'm visiting San Fran for business and stumbled upon this little place. The fresh rolls are fantastic. The ingredients are fresh, clean and everything is well made. The Vietnamese vinaigrette is delicious and light. I highly recommend it!
author: Dar O.

description: Good fresh food, at a reasonable price considering it is SF. I would come again. Don't be discouraged by the line. The workers are trying their best.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I just ordered some spring rolls and a noodle bowl online. when I arrived 15 minutes later they hadn't eve started my order and there was no one in line. I could have just walked in an ordered myself-- it probably would have taken less time.

I found a hair in my roll and it didn't seem like one that came from the top of someone's head. neither of the workers had a hair net on and both had long hair and one had a crazy beard. 

they were both very nice but I just didn't get the impression that the place was that clean or that fresh. also my rolls were ripped so I had to eat them with a fork which defeats the purpose of ordering a roll. 

the pork was dry but the chicken was really good. I'd rather order from a legit Vietnamese place next time
author: Desiree L.

description: The pho is bad. They didn't have chicken but didn't tell me until after I had already paid. The steak wasn't great either. The noodles tasted like they weren't cooked all the way and the broth was ok. I also got a Vietnamese iced coffee and it had a plastic taste to it. All together I wouldn't come back here. The service wasn't great either. They cracked my friends credit card because she swiped it so hard. I would go to any other place but here for Vietnamese food.
author: Amy C.

description:
Freshroll is incredible and deserves five stars!!!. This place is going to be next Chipotle, but in a Southeast Asian Cuisine sort of way. 

Those behind this must do lunch institution are very strategic about the business model, but not compromising quality. I'm sure some day we will all see these nationwide, but for now you need to  come to them, before they come to you. 


Who knew Vietnamese Food could be so trendy and cool! For all of those who visit Union Square, this is a mere city block away and a great visit!
author: Matthew R.

description:
I look at the number of check ins I have at this place  (115 at the time of writing) and weep quitely. How can someone put together boiled vermicelli and some raw vegetables and make it taste so good?
I first visited this place, as an intern, with my colleagues who were raving about it. I was largely underwhelmed because my palette at that time was used to heavily flavored food. I begrudgingly accompanied them a few more times whenever I didn't feel like choosing.
When I returned as a full timer with a more mature palette I started appreciating this place better. At one point of time I couldn't get enough of it with my frequency of visits going up to four times a week. I usually get the vermicelli bowl with veggies and tofu. Here is a breakdown of the ingredients: you can choose a base, from vermicelli, white or brown rice follwed by veggies which is either a standard offering or your choice of 5 and you top this off with a choice of sauce. I usually get lettuce, cilantro, bean sprouts, pickled veggies, pineapple, crispy shallots I was wondering what makes the food taste the way it does, well, to start with you have the vermicelli which is bland and soaks up the sauce providing a good base for the rest of the ingredients to build on. Then you have the jalapeño being hot, the pineapple being sweet, the picked veggies being sour, the tofu being a little salty and the crispy shallots being a little bitter. There you go! A mix of five major tastes known to mankind. I am not sure if all of this thought went into the making of this dish but the outcome is so good and healthy. 
You can switch the vermicelli for brown rice if you are looking for something with a low glycemic index. I have also tried their namesake, fresh rolls, which is good, but not as filling. Their banh-mi sandwich is definitely not the best I have had because I feel the tofu in a banh-mi sandwich should be a little soft and juicy as the rest of the ingredients are dry and theirs clearly is not. All in all, this is a must try if you are near the AMC Metreon, what more, you might even find me standing in the line.

p.s. A lesser known fact, this place has a loyalty card and a 10% off with Yelp checkins. I could have literally saved 200$ with this knowledge.
author: Shrihari M.

description:
This became one of my go-to lunch spots during the week back when I worked near the Metreon. I can only speak to their rolls, but they are pretty damn good and a great alternative to yet another sandwich.

I understand the new pricing policy, but do you really need to remind me every damn time that the 6 veggies I'm requesting is going to be an extra .50 cents? I get it already. Also they always seem to have new people working there and not all of them are very good at their job. I've come away several times to discover rolls with busted rice paper, which makes it that much harder to eat. Slow is okay, but sloppy is not. If you mess up, redo the roll. Don't just hope I won't notice until I get out the door. 

So 3 stars mainly for that one girl with short hair who is stingy with the veggies and the numerous busted rolls I've encountered. The ingredients are fresh (though sometimes the avocado is not) and I love the idea of custom spring rolls. 

I always get the shrimp and pair it with the citrus ginger dipping sauce if you are looking for a recommendation.
author: Lisa A.

description:
A Vietnamese Chipotle. 
Good idea, ever cuisine should have one of these.
Portions are decent. 
"Crispy goodness" (aka deep fried scallions) is good but I liked the Crispy bacon much better as a crunchy element.
author: Augusto M.

description:
Freshroll = the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. Freshroll really meets the needs of a foodie & health-conscious city like SF. 

Here's the deal: You can customize your own bowl (with white/brown rice, vermicelli, or salad), spring roll, or banh mi. Pick your protein (pork, chicken, tofu) and choose from a large variety of veggies. I really love the flavors of their lemongrass pork! Also, for those craving soup, they serve pho in the afternoons. 

Best of all, there's quite a selection of spices/sauces to choose from to accentuate your meal; labels are boldly paced on the sauces to indicate what's vegan/gluten-free/etc.. It's really simple to eat deliciously and vegan/gluten free if that's your style. 

Lastly, whether you're ordering a "freshroll", banh mi, or bowl, all of them are under $10! Not bad for a lunch in a busy part of town. Grab some cheap/yummy grub here and venture off to Union Square, SFMOMA, or the Moscone.
author: Helen W.

description:
As a wise man once said, DVR stands for Delicious Vietnamese Rolls. 

enough said ;)
author: Kayla O.

description:
I found Fresh Roll of one of my pointless lunchtime walks, that usually involves me walking around trying to find one place to eat that doesn't have amusement park styled lines. If there happens to be an event, such as a Salesforce hoedown, getting any sort of meal will take so long you might as well just go to Walgreen's and grab a bag of chips and drink. This was one of those days where the line was small, and not many people in it. 

The food is good, filling, and they have a good crispy tofu for the vegetarian/vegans out there. I also like how they have a few choices of dipping sauce. I have yet to try anything but the rolls, but I imagine everything there is worth the price. Honestly the best part is the good service, and Yerba Buena part right around the corner to eat your food and relax.
author: Josh G.

description:
Tastes good, but kinda expensive for what you get. Staff is weirdly friendly (medicated or maybe brain-washed?  I don't know-it's not normal to be that chipper...kinda creeped me out) and it's super clean. 
The pho with steak had excellent broth, but not a ton of meat. Bean sprouts and Thai basil were already added. Overall a decent lunch place by the Metreon, but cost about $11.
author: El B.

description:
Delivery review only-

The pho broth is good... but pho could use some additional fixings. Also, our delivery order didn't come with hoisin or rooster sauce- normal flavor additions. Overall- pretty good.

Pricey for pho.
author: Amy L.

description: They have a solid fast food version of pho here. I prefer actual sit down places with variety of meat options, but you can't beat its proximity to Union square. I want to try Banh mi next time.
author: Carol K.

description: I love this place! I don't care that it's a chain restaurant. Sometimes it's hard to get pho at some of the local places because real "pho" is made with beef broth. I don't eat red meat or pork, so I like that I can have chicken broth instead of the beef broth (although, vegetable broth would be better, but not many places do that). Everything else appears to be the same as typical pho. The service is very fast and staff are friendly. This is my go-to place if I want pho and am not up for doing a trial and error with a new place. Very convenient to the Moscone Center, for those who are in town visiting.
author: Tracy T.

description:
I came here for lunch during work with the team and did not really know what to expect since Vietnamese food is definitely a hit or miss in the Market area. When I asked my co-worker how she would describe Freshroll she said, "It's kind of like the Chipotle for Vietnamese food" which I thought was super interesting. Nonetheless, the food we had was great despite it's minor, tiny lack of authenticity (which wasn't a super big deal to me at that time). 

They had different sauces for you to choose from ranging from their own special sauces to the more traditional fish sauce. I had the lemongrass pork fresh bowl with noodles and it was amazing! Ask for basil in your fresh bowl to spice things up a little more (they don't have it out as a regular option). I also heard their Pho broth is pretty bomb as well, but they only serve Pho after a certain time (5PM I believe); definitely going to aim to try that next time!
author: Brian T.

description: Love this place! It's quick and easy, but still healthy and delicious. I thought the pork was better than the chicken in my noodle bowl, and all the sauce options are great, my favorite being the vinaigrette sauce. Plus I got a 10% off bonus for checking in.
author: Nicole Y.

description: Really bad service and the food is very overpriced for the amount and quality of the food. Pho is only rice noddles with meat no veggies at all, oh never mind one piece of jalapeno and a branch of cilantro. Will not recomend eating here not even for a take and go since the employees at the bar are really slow workers .
author: Andres I.

description:
This place was kind of like a Chipotle or Subway-type restaurant, but for Vietnamese food. Found it by chance on a desperate search for food places still open late at night on a Friday when I was at the Moscone Center for a conference.
All I can say is that I wish there was a Freshroll in the suburbs of Seattle, because I only had it once and I've been craving it again ever since. Got a vermicelli noodle bowl with tofu and all the fixin's, and a jasmine-lychee iced tea.
 It was a little messy in there from people not bussing their rubbish or leaving food residue on the tables that wasn't really consistently being cleaned up by staff and it crowds up easily, but I'd still go back again in a heartbeat. Great flavor, good prices, just overall a great place!
author: Jannah M.

description:
I went to Freshroll today and got some rolls to bring home for dinner tonight. I just finished the chicken and lemongrass pork rolls and they were good!
The rolls held up well during the day in the fridge and the roll didn't dry up at all. The veggies and meat inside tasted fresh and the vietnamese vinagrette sauce went perfectly with it.
I liked the concept and selection here (either rolls/sandwich/bowl or pho). They definitely seem to prepare more rolls but wouldn't mind returning to try one of the other options. 
There was a little bit of wait when I got here during the peak lunch time but the line didn't seem to take too long. Prices were also reasonable (under $10) and I found the rolls to be filling. 
Would definitely return again- located outside of the Metreon near Chipotle.
author: Miss H K.

description: How have not left a review for this place?  I come here every chance I'm downtown. It's basically a Vietnamese version of Chipotle but better. I always get the chicken vermicelli bowl standard- add pineapples. Only down side is they charge .50 more for pineapples. Go before 11:30 and it after 2 bc it could be a half a hour wait to get your food.
author: Sam S.

description:
If you're looking for "healthy Vietnamese themed Chipotle" this is your place.

As others have indicated the selection mirrors that of Chipotle exactly and the pricing/model/line situation do as well. Though I think this is the first location to open I would not be surprised if it proceeds on to chain-dom.

In any event, I usually go for the chicken rice bowl. You can jam on a close to salad-bowl like quantity of toppings on top of it and create an every-bite-is-a-different-flavor kind of situation. Pretty solid. (And pretty "healthy-ish" I think?)

Main drawback is the slow nature, particularly if there's a Moscone conference going on. The line sometimes goes out the door / down the block and despite the very significant number of staff behind the counter this place doesn't quite have fully efficiency figured out yet. Things just don't move that fast.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Food was okay. It's a Vietnamese chipotle and it was very quick at the busy lunch hour.
I'm pretty hard on Asian fusion because there are seldom who do it right. This place squeaks by with okay food.
author: Krystle L.

description: Really yummy food, healthy option and extremely tasty service.  Overall the service was quick and enjoyed the veggie bowl!
author: Victor D.

description:
Three rolls, three flavors: chicken, pork and crispy tofu.  I loved both the chicken and pork but the "crispy" tofu was not crispy.  The pork was really flavorful and tender and that protein selection will be my first choice the next time I stop by. The sauces were really tasty.  I mixed the Vietnamese vinaigarette, peanut sauce and sriracha all together because the sauce fiend in my head told me so.

Service was excellent.  The cashiers and "roll crew" were cheerful and they made my meal really fast.  It's just outside of the Metreon building so you can fill up here before going to the movies and save money on popcorn/junk food.

Tip: If you're trying to do low carb, ask them to skip the noodles and substitute with bean sprouts instead.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: Really tasty and fast, but a tad expensive (a single roll came to over $5). I'd try it again though for a full meal!
author: Neal C.

description: Nothing special about this place. Came here on a Sunday afternoon (~4 PM) -- slow service & unorganized. They can't handle volume. Also, cashiers are completely clueless.
author: Lyn M.

description: It's Vietnamese food they got that right but there is room for improvement.  Food and staff could have been better.  They sort for compost.
author: Mario L.

description: Excellent offering at the Metreon. Obviously walk and bike friendly. Plethora of indoor and outdoor seating. Clean restroom. The banh mi tofu is the sandwich! So happy they provide the condiment sauces, a must-have in current day market. Good value.
author: Wilson T.

description:
If you don't feel like eating at one of the many places inside in the AMC Metreon, then this is just right outside its doors.  Chipotle style ordering really is the perfect way to describe it so I'll jump on that bandwagon.

I decided to get the 3 rolls for $7.95.  When they're first making it, you'll probably think "wow they could add a little more noodle to that" but after they add the meat and veggies, these spring rolls become plump little suckers.  I got both the lemongrass pork and the chicken and prefer the former.  Pork pieces were more tender and flavorful.  Towards the end of when they're making it, you'll probably think "wow they roll these things super slowly."   

The biggest disappointment has to be the sauces.  They're very watered down -- the peanut sauce didn't taste peanuty enough and the Vietnamese vinagrette didn't have enough fish sauce.  Hot sauce is Sriracha and luckily they don't dilute this.  What I do like is the number of vegetables you could put in your spring rolls.  The list literally keeps on going and I feel like I'm eating something healthy.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Fresh, easy, convenient, and delicious! 

One of my favorite places to grab a healthy lunch. I love the freshness of the ingredients and flavors of the sauce and proteins. 

I would definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Derek F.

description:
I'm a huge spring roll fanatic. And this place definitely lives up to the name.
It's located right between the metreon and moscone center so its perfect for people who need to grab a quick lunch.

Freshroll gives off a chipotle style vibe via vietnamese cuisine. I highly recommend their lemongrass pork and garlic shrimp spring rolls with the standard! The pineapple complements everything so well. They also have a great selection of dipping sauces to choose from. My favorites are the peanut sauce and the spicy ginger one. The rolls are reasonable portions too. 

Inexpensive, clean, and friendly service....And healthy, Vietnamese food! 
Checking it out is a must :)
author: Kimly N.

description:
I stopped by here with a girlfriend who went once before, liked it, and recommended that I try it (and she can have it again).  Overall a great value for a fresh, light lunch.

We got a Vietnamese sandwich with chicken and all the fixings and a noodle bowl with the lemongrass pork.  The sandwich was so good and everything a Vietnamese sandwich should be.  They put a lot of chicken in, more than what you will get elsewhere for this style of sandwich.  The sauce, pickled veggies, lettuce and jalepenos were good as well.  The bowl was great as well.  The lemongrass pork was very tasty, and I like that they put pineapple and red bell pepper into the mix so there is some sweet/tartness to it.  I liked putting the peanut sauce and sweet and sour sauce in with the noodles.

Overall great - I'll dine here again for sure!
author: Tracy L.

description:
OMG...PLEASE COME TO LA!

Ok, this obviously isn't super authentic Vietnamese cuisine (I think another reviewer's "Vietpotle" term is pretty accurate!). But it makes for a healthy light lunch, and was so tasty!

I got the 3 rolls - 2 with the lemongrass pork, and 1 with the chicken. Just enough meat to give you the protein to stay full, but not overwhelming. I got the "standard" toppings minus the pineapple. Everything in the ingredient area looked pretty fresh, and tasted that way once I got my meal.

The sauces are pretty decent, and it's nice being able to have so many options. I recall seeing peanut sauce, a citrus ginger sauce, Sriracha, a sweet and spicy sauce, and I think one other option. 

You can also get a banh mi sandwich and the rolls in a bowl form.

After my 3 rolls, I felt full, but not yucky. All in all, this made for a flavorful, light lunch. My coworker and I were actually joking about eating here for every meal while we were in SF. SO good.
author: Aubrey S.

description:
You have 4 steps to customize your meal. 
I got the freshroll sandwich with lemongrass pork. It was delicious and a little on the sweet side. The bread was crunchy and a little hard to eat since it is so big. The pork went really well with the nam nam sauce, pickled veggies, cilantro and jalapenos. 
We also had the taro chips that were very crispy and lightly salted. 
Pretty good bite for lunch.
author: Kristy K.

description: This is one of the best fresh rolls I've ever tasted! So true to the name, a nice, light meal when you get the three fresh rolls. I chose chicken and the "standard" toppings. You can choose multiple sauces and I liked the peanut sauce, but I loved the Vietnamese vinaigrette. I only wish I could return for three more. Yum!
author: Danielle S.

description:
I stopped by Freshroll after an interview downtown. The line was long (like all lines downtown at lunch time), but moved fairly quickly - I think I waited for about 10 minutes. I ordered the 3 rolls. I tried one with tofu, pork, and chicken. Pork was the best! The rolls were delicious and filling and light. 

I like this place because the menu is simple - choose from rolls, a bowl, sandwich, or pho - but all options sound delicious.
author: Allie E.

description:
My go-to place to get food when I'm at work when I want something quick and easy. The menu has plenty of options to choose from and makes ordering easy. I always get the fresh rolls with crispy tofu. I love that they make it in front of you so you can choose what type of vegetables you want. I'm not a fan of mint/basil leaves inside my rolls, so I never ask for any. 

I also come here when I need a caffeine fix that a Starbucks espresso can't handle. I love their Vietnamese iced coffee. It's the perfect blend - not overly sweet, not too bitter but strong and keeps me awake until I have to get off work. 

A big bonus is that they're not skimpy on sauces. They have sauces pre-packed when you're ordering to-go but they still have containers next to their sauces if you want extra. I love their peanut sauce that I mix with sriracha to go with my fresh rolls.
author: Liezel D.

description:
Hmm it really depends on what you are looking for, but here is my breakdown:

Food: 3.5 stars. Nothing spectacular, and especially given all the great vietnamese spots near union square, its a shame to settle for something so mainstream. but nothing is wrong with it, it is just very "fast food" vietnamese.

Service. 5 stars! super friendly and helpful staff.

Environment: 4 stars. Pretty clean and spacious, there was plenty of seating if i wanted to eat inside.
author: Thach N.

description: Super vegan friendly. Love their vegan banh-mi with citrus ginger sauce and sweet and sour sauce!!! I would highly recommend this place =)
author: Shalini P.

description:
I was jonesing for something that wouldn't shorten my lifespan by 2 years and someplace that accepted credit cards. I had noodles on my mind (when do I not?) and I get on my trusty Yelp out and lo and behold there it was- refreshing rolls and bowls just around the bend and someplace that takes pity on those who are cash-challenged. 
You can't beat the location, the people were so friendly and my tofu rolls were light, healthy and satisfying. But what really counts when you have spring rolls isn't really what you have inside, especially when you choose tofu- it's the sauce. I chose peanut (classic but so necessary) and ginger. Get. The. Ginger. 
I had a cup of pho broth for good measure and I'm sure glad I did. Those taro chips were calling my name but I didn't want to look like a pig. 
What a great alternative to meat and grease!
author: Amanda W.

description:
Good fast food, but they got greedy. 

I live right by this place and used to come by here for lunch all the time. It was a great for a semi-healthy pick me up since you can get a quick noodle bowl with a bunch of veggies (an americanized Bùn). The best part is you could customize it however you wanted.

Unfortunately their pricing changed in February and it's gotten more complicated. In addition to having different pricing for meat, which they did before, you also have to pay for additional veggies. Plus pineapple is no longer included! It's $0.50 / extra veggie for the bowl and the same ones are $1 for the sandwich. The person who makes your food wont be telling you this so be prepared to do some math.
author: Artur R.

description:
After watching Wreck it Ralph, we were looking for a lunch spot and noticed this restaurant along the side of the Metreon entrance. So many new places are popping up around the Metreon and we figured we'd give one of them a try! I don't usually eat Vietnamese food since I kind of just associate it with pho (which usually isn't vegetarian), but Freshroll seemed like it had veggie-friendly options. The interior was bright green, clean, and modern looking with a good amount of seating. Their concept is similar to Chipotle's where you choose the inside fillings, but here you pick whether you want it in a bowl, sandwich, or spring roll.

What we ordered:
- Crispy tofu sandwich ($6.95): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freshroll-vietnamese-rolls-and-bowls-san-francisco?select=ZMcZKO332231gTuVUUYk-A#ZMcZKO332231gTuVUUYk-A
- Chicken bowl + vermicelli noodles ($7.95)

The "standard" toppings that they recommended for my sandwich included pickled vegetables, jalapenos, cilantro, and Nam-Nam sauce (but you can also pick your own). I'm not sure what the sauce was made of exactly, but I liked it a lot! The bread was perfectly crispy and although I don't think the tofu was seasoned much, the flavor of the other ingredients more than made up for it. For a couple dollars, you can make your meal a combo and get a drink + pho broth or taro chips, which we did. The limeade was super refreshing..I'm a sucker for fizzy drinks. If you get the pho broth, you can make your own pho by dumping it into the bowl! Great for this cold winter weather.

This is a nice sit-down restaurant for a quick meal!
author: Jessica C.

description:
My husband is obsessed with Vietnamese food, but I can only eat it about twice a month. I hadn't hit my quota for the month and I had just flown in and was absolutely starving. My friend recommended this place, calling it the Chipotle of Vietnamese food. I was in the mood for something fresh and quick so this sounded perfect. 

It is a cute and clean little shop. The menu was easy to follow and the staff was super friendly and forthcoming with recommendations. I quickly settled on a bowl with vermicelli noodles, pork, and the standard. I love that all the sauces are bottled and out on the counter, ready to use. I was able to try 2 of them and use as much or as little as I wanted. I really enjoyed the standard vinegary fish sauce and the ginger sauce. I used the vinegar sauce to soak my noodles in the bottom of the bowl and the ginger sauce as a kind of salad dressing on my vegetables. I really enjoyed the pork as well, I wasn't sure if it would be as charred and full of flavor as normal Vietnamese pork, but I was pleasantly surprised. I found the bowl in general to be really flavorful and fresh. I felt great after eating it; I was ready for the trek to my hotel. I really love the concept of fast healthy Vietnamese food, now if only they would open one in Vegas!
author: Jessica P.

description:
After receiving a message on Yelp from Freshroll owner Nam H telling me he had "adjusted the menu to allow an 'unlimited' number of vegetable toppings," I was excited to return. Today I chose a brown rice bowl with chicken -- just as succulent as the pork, I am happy to report -- and topped it with salad, cucumbers, pineapple, red bell peppers, cilantro, pickled veg and avocado. When I dug into this bountiful creation a smile spread across my face, one that only this level of deliciousness could incite.

I really appreciate that my vegetable topping kvetching was taken to heart and such a high impact change was made. After today's vegetable-full (and super satisfying lunch) I'm singing Freshroll's praises and plan on being a regular here.
author: Miriam W.

description: Healthy high quality low cost great spot!! Love their pork bowl.
author: Machiruda Y.

description:
The pork and chicken freshrolls are great. It's just a shame that it takes so damned long to get them. I've been to Freshroll twice now, and I walk by all the time. Appears that the line is getting longer and longer. I'm kind of shocked that a place with such a limited menu has a gigantic line.

Three rolls are definitely enough to fill. I'd also recommend getting the scallion roll as an option, I've found that without it the rolls feel like they lack substance. None of the sauces blow my mind, I generally just get sriracha.
author: Bill H.

description: We were ready for lunch after our trip to SFMOMA and thought we'd try this spot. It's clean, efficient, and friendly, but basic-- especially for the price. None of the flavors or dishes were stand-outs, and I'm not a huge fan of the choose your own everything concept because I like a place to actually recommend particular combinations of ingredients and flavors, not just assemble it. For instance, I asked which of the sauces they would recommend with my tofu rice bowl and they looked confused, then just pointed me to one that is "very popular." My recommendation? Skip this place, and head over to Little Saigon/TL for some amazing Vietnamese food that's not only cheaper but also far more delicious.
author: Heather G.

description: Great concept, simple menu, I had the 3 spring rolls and was very satisfied. If there were one in the Peninsula I would go all the time.
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
DUDE! We almost did not buy anything here. My girlfriend said that they don't give enough food, but she was WRONG! Each order was more than enough for us and it was under $10. The Decor of the place was also really fancy, I really like it.

We ordered Fresh Rolls. 3 of them in a package, and we get to pick different order for each. 
LemonGrass Pork was SUPER GOOD... It has a very unique taste that I haven't tasted anywhere else.
Grilled Shrimp was also SUPER GOOD! this place is amazing!
Crispy Tofu was okay. If you are not a herbivore I'd recommend getting 2 Pork and 1 Shrimp. 

Next we ordered the Bum nai Sandwich. The sauce melted my mouth and I finally understood what Buddha felt like when he reached Nirvana. It was pure bliss. And the best thing about the sandwich is that you don't have to pick anything! I hate choosing stuff to put in the FreshRoll, so this Sandwich really made my life easire.

Our last order was a vermechelli bowl. It was okay.

For our side dish, we got Taro Chips. It was $2 for a tiny packet, but it's well worth it I think. It's probably the best taro Chips I've ever tasted.... so far. 

We really enjoyed the place here, will come back again!

Update** I was contacted by FreshRoll and told that if you're feeling indecisive about your Freshroll, you can choose "Standard". It comes with cilantro, cucumber, jalapeno, pineapple, and sprouts. Yay!
author: Song Z.

description:
God damn, I love this place! It's so, amazingly fresh, light, and delicious. I love the bowl of pork with the salad served "standard". It's affordable, the portions are perfect, they serve you free, fancy water with lemons and cucumber and mint infused in it.*  If this place was in a more convenient location, I'd eat here daily.



 *Side note: My mom, whom I adore, truly, calls water prepared in such a manner "Sassy Water." This makes me cringe and wish it had a name that was anything else, basically.
author: Logan B.

description:
One of the very few places open on Easter Sunday!

My friend and I decided to come here after several options fell through because they were closed. 

Seeing as this place had 4 stars on Yelp, we thought, "Why not give this place a try?"

We both ordered the pho with steak. Service is incredibly fast as we got our food less than 5 minutes of placing our order. 

I'm not a huge fan of pho so I can't tell the difference between "good" pho and "bad" pho, but I was pleasantly surprised with how tasty the broth was.

Most "to go" pho places aren't very good, but I really liked this place! I'd definitely come again. Worth the high reviews on Yelp :)
author: Jenny T.

description: Chicken pho & the chicken fresh rolls that you get to customize ... Yum! The perfect ending to a snowy Tahoe weekend & I even had leftovers for lunch the next day. I think I found my new pho place in the city  definitely tasted fresh and not full of msg.
author: danielle a.

description:
I ordered a lettuce bowl with two meats. The chicken, was well, chicken. It was fair. I also got some of their crispy tofu as well. I do believe the name to be misleading. There was nothing crisp about it. Think of a fried under seasoned paper bag with a sponge like texture. 

Their taro chips which they deem as a "must try", written up on their menu in the restaurant is also pitiful--another falsehood. They are hard, tasteless, and a scam at $2.

My mom purchased their spring rolls. She thought they were just, "OK", and overpriced for the skimpy amount of meat they include in the rice paper.

Also, to add insult to injury, I found a hair in my food. Mmm, delicious. 
Although they gave me a refund upon pointing out one of their employee's fallen soldiers, I would not return. This place leaves so very much to be desired.
author: Nadir G.

description:
06.07.12

I've heard good buzz about this place, and decided to play hooky with a long(ish) lunch to stroll down to the Metreon and check it out.  The menu is simple and limited, and for an indecisive person like me, makes it quick and easy to come up with my perfect lunch.

Step one: choose your style (roll, bowl, salad, sandwich)
Step two: choose your protein (chicken, pork, tofu, shrimp)
Step three: choose your toppings (you get three for free)
Step four: choose your sides/add ons/drinks
Bonus step: choose your sauce

Coming from a building where Spice Kit is right downstairs, the menu is familiar and I got my order down without holding up the line.  Chicken fresh rolls with green onions, jalapenos, and pineapple [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/l1oXDZh6vE-cYreeAcfRBw?select=U_yR_gxuKYyPcLu4SB_I-A#U_yR_gxuKYyPcLu4SB_I-A].  Great balance of sweet, spicy, and savory rolled into a handheld dipping machine.  What's not to like?

Don't let the size fool you - I thought I wasn't going to be full from three rolls, but here I am at my desk struggling to stay awake from food coma.  Good thing I added a cold-brewed iced coffee!

Once Target opens and foot traffic rises, I'm sure I'll need to elbow my way through.  Until then, I'm going to enjoy these lunch breaks and leisure strolls back to the office.

Total damage: $11ish
author: Jenny L.

description: I tried this place out for their Vietnamese sandwiches & it did not disappoint! I had the chicken with pineapple, cilantro, mint etc - SOOOO good. Only complaint would be that the ice tea was too sweet.
author: Diane D.

description: food was great! line was long but went through in about 5 minutes. I orders the spring rolls with the pork and it was
author: Taylor T.

description:
This place is good. It reminds me somewhat of Chipotle (just next door) when I first ate there 10 years ago, except better, and with Vietnamese spring rolls. The price is just right.

Just get the 3-roll combo and mix/match your type of meat.
author: Nathan Y.

description: This place is the best. Everything is delicious. Everything is refreshing. The peanut sauce is some of the best peanut sauce I've ever had at a Vietnamese restaurant. I wish there were some of these in Massachusetts. I ate here 4 times in 4 days. Great stuff every time for amazing prices. We'll come back here every single time I come to this district in San Francisco.
author: B G.

description:
Food was delicious. 

Huge shout out to Ari. She is amazing. Promote this women. I walked in and dropped a large order in the middle of lunch time. In other words, I was a huge pain in the ass. She took charge, organized her team, and filled my order quickly! Thank you!
author: C B.

description:
This place is most definitely NOT A CHAIN. I keep hearing or seeing ppl on here say that. It's a restaurant created by two hardworking guys. So, ppl against chains, don't fear - check this place out! 

I haven't been to this place since it was originally opened, but I just went again and it's still the same. Yay for consistently excellent food and service!
author: Kelly B.

description:
This place is great.  I've been several times.  I really enjoy introducing Fresh Roll to those that enjoy Chipotle, but haven't been to the Vietnamese remix version of one.

My parents were in town, so I thought that'd bring them.  For my lunch, I went with Lemongrass Pork in the Sandwich format.

So, I love sauce, and Fresh Roll has 4 proprietary, self-prepared sauces to choose from, which is exciting but also stressful.  See, when confronted with many sauces, I need to try them all!  In fact, I need to try each of them with the first few bites of my meal in order to crown the winner and proceed move exclusively with that sauce for the remainder of the meal.
