All the sauces were pretty good, but in this case, for me, I went with the factory manufactured Sri Racha for the remainder of my Lemongrass Pork Sandwich.  Only Tony the Tiger can express how great this sandwich was.
author: Sebastian N.

description: This place is a pho/banh mi version of Subway. It took me a while to get that haha. You choose what meat and veggies you want. They're okay. I had to add more stuff like oyster sauce to my soup to make it taste decent. I've had my fair share of pho spots and this isn't anything. Especially for the price. $10 for a bowl of soup? Not worth it. I guess location is convenient though.
author: Jah L.

description: For what it is (fast food, Vietnamese-style), you can't beat the fresh flavors and cool wraps that magically appear when moistened with water at Freshroll.  We managed to get up here after the SF Giants parade, and ordered pretty much one of everything, including the pho.  Have had better soup noodles, but the meat was tender and the decent broth was perfect for a brisk Fall evening in the City.
author: Sherri C.

description:
As someone who eats authentic vietnamese food weekly, this place screamed NO. My friend loves this joint, and I decided to give this spot a try. I went with a order of 3 spring rolls and I was just unhappy the whole time being here. The shrimp in my spring rolls were tiny bite sized shrimp. 3 spring rolls that top off at around $8? DUMA ! What. Is. This. Madness. Easy and healthy Americanized Vietnamese food aimed toward people in downtown is just all this is. I'd rather be "healthy" and walk my way over to Tenderloin for some "real" vietnamese food cooked in a dirty kitchen, mind you.
Service on the other hand was very good and the establishment seemed fairly clean.
author: Jenny Y.

description: I generally like the food at FreshRoll, but the service at this location is notoriously terrible. What prompted me to finally write a review was when I recently went to pick up a lunch order for a 12:00 meeting for 10 people. We had placed our order online at around 10:30 for pickup at 11:45, well outside their requested 45-minute lead time. When we arrived at 11:45 and the staff started quizzically picking up orders that were for 1 or 2 people and looking at the labels, I knew we were in trouble. Turns out that they had received the order -- they eventually found the printout -- but hadn't bothered to make it. My coworker and I had to stand and wait for 15-20 minutes while they made our food, and not once did anyone (1) apologize, (2) let us know how much longer it would be, or (3) try to compensate by offering us a free snack or, literally, ANYTHING to demonstrate they were sorry for wasting our time. Finally we got the food and the meeting started 20 minutes late, after everyone sorted out their food and figured out how many mistakes FreshRoll had made in preparation (extra avocado requested and paid for not actually on the salad, etc.) because they were rushing. There are plenty of food options in the Metreon and nearby (as well as in the Westfield Mall food court) don't bother with FreshRoll.
author: Gaelen X.

description:
I love having this healthy and filling option relatively close to work! And so do a lot of people, as it's really crowded at lunch and the line usually extends to the front door. You can choose from rolls, bowl, banh mi, or pho options.

I usually get a bowl, and ask for half brown rice and half rice noodle, chicken, and all the toppings. Everything is super fresh, and I love all the sauces they have: peanut, citrus ginger, vietnamese vinaigrette. I usually dump a mix of the citrus ginger and vietnamese vinaigrette with a dash of sriracha and hoisin sauce.

Pho is only available after 3 PM, probably because it would hold up the lunch-hour rush. I would definitely come here more often if pho was available during lunch!

Tip: Get the stamp card! So many people in front of me always pay without a stamp card and I wish I could get their stamps :p
author: Jennifer W.

description: Not good pho - plus deceptive pricing - 8.95 became 10.50 - hug? - chad the manger did not get it - don't bother if you want Vietnamese
author: S R.

description:
Walked by on 4th the other night around dinner time and stopped in because the place looked clean (I think I could have eaten off the floor).  I ordered spring rolls with the crispy goodness... no matter what you do be sure to get the GOODNESS cause it seals the deal!  Protein was fresh, service was fast and it didn't break the bank... I can't really say more since I usually only come on Yelp to bitch about shitty restaurants.

Stop in if you want an alternative to a trendy grilled cheese or overpriced burger.
author: James F.

description:
Not your typical ethnic/American mashup restaurant gone wrong. Freshroll is surprisingly better than what I expected for Vietnamese food in the area, especially with the Chipotle-esque concept of ordering. 3.5 overall. For nearly $10 for a vermicelli bowl with just ONE type of meat, I'm not in a hurry to come back.

VERMECELLI BOWL
The noodles were quite good and fresh, considering that it sits out in a tray behind the glass. Lemongrass pork was the most interesting meat on their menu (and I used to make that back in my college days). They were generous with proportions and it had a nice chew and flavor. I was pleasantly surprised that they serve pickled vegetables too.

LYCHEE JASMINE GREEN TEA
This was pleasant. Not the best I've had but it's not bad. The flavors are subtle and the tea refreshing. 

It's nice to know that the food choices near Metreon is expanding and bringing in decent ethnic foods. It's even better when I only had to pay $1.80 for a meal and a drink, all thanks to PayPal!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Freshroll has actually been a spot I've been consciously avoiding the past few months, for no real reason in particular. Perhaps it was doubt about food establishments inside shopping centers. Or, perhaps, it was doubt about how filling spring rolls could possibly be. But, in dire need of food before an event I was hosting this past Saturday, I finally dropped in, looking for something a little healthier than my Super Duper burger the night before.

The process is simple enough: decide if you want spring rolls, banh mi, or a bowl; then choose your protein, veggies (including premium options), and sauces. The standard three spring rolls with basic veggie additions will run you a cool $8.63 after tax, which is a good value considering it made for a good two meals, personally.

And while they won't blow you away flavor-wise, they're quick, convenient, healthy, and actually fairly tasty, and well worth considering if you're looking for lunch or a light dinner in the area.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A fairly new and spacious venue, the only thing that might be a minor accessibility issue are the high glass display cases, which require that you speak up a bit in order to project your voice over to the person putting your order together.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment, but I imagine they're completely accessible.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Quick, delicious and relatively inexpensive...this place is a go-to for both lunch and dinner. I've had both their spring rolls and their vermicelli bowls and both are great options. You come here and order food Chipotle-style; for both bowls and spring rolls, you have the option of meat (chicken, pork, steak, shrimp, tofu) and unlimited sides. As a result, the spring rolls can get pretty big (comes with 3 per order which is actually a good portion). They also offer a variety of sauces for your rolls or bowl. 

Overall, I'm a regular here and definitely recommend! The location is also convenient- it's next to the Metreon by the movie theater and Target.
author: Lillian C.

description:
Pretty good lunch for the workday crowd. Kind of reminds me of Spice Kit on Howard and 1st Street. It has that sustainable / contemporary feel to the restaurant, and you do pay a slight premium on the food for that. The food here will run you $7+ after taxes. Normally banh mi or fresh spring rolls are $5 or less. The plus side here is that all the dishes are completely customizable, and everything tasted very fresh, just like the name advertised. They also have a good selection of (unlimited) sauces that you can even take back to your table or take to go. 

As everyone says, get the crispy goodness - fried greed onion roll for 75 cents extra. Adds that extra kick that you can't get anywhere else. You won't regret it! 

All in all, seems like a very passionately put together establishment! One of the waitstaff even came over to our table to personally ask how our experience was. They also have a suggestion box on the front counter! Clearly they care a lot about their customer satisfaction.

NOTE: This place is not in the Metreon food court; they are past the Metreon/AMC on 4th Street, between Mission and Howard.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Went to try this place the other day, since I heard good things from fellow co-workers.  The line moved well and ordered the Freshroll Grilled Chicken Sandwich.  It was filled with plenty of chicken and pickled veggies, carrots, cilantro, etc. and it was very tasty.  My co-worker ordered the Lemongrass Pork Sandwich which he said was also very good.  

There are so many items to choose from on the menu, that I'll have to go back.
author: Lon H.

description: Honestly there's better Vietnamese food in Toronto/Seattle, but this is probably "as good as it gets" in SF. Overall, just pretty good healthy food - you just feel much better after eating here. My biggest complaint is that pho isn't served during lunch hours. Lemongrass pork is the best meat they serve in my opinion, and it's very good value for the price.
author: Max Z.

description:
Really good quality for a fast food type place. The ability to customize spring rolls, bahn mi's, & pho is a great concept. Its like a vietnamese chipotle, but with better quality ingredients. 

Somewhat pricey for the portions. Although the spring rolls are large and there's 3, it wasn't quite enough. And for around $8.
author: M. G.

description:
I wanted to like this place, I really do. I lived in Vietnam for a few years and just madly love the food. 

The first 4 times I came here the line was so damn long I didn't even bother. Finally when there was no line one happy day, so I ordered some spring rolls and a bowl of chicken and noodles. Boy were these guys overpriced! And the flavor left much to be desired. 

I've been trying to figure this out for years, but I've yet to see this rule go wrong, "the higher price the Asian food, the more blah it is."
author: Evie D.

description:
Awww I use to be a regular here but after multiple bad experiences I come here about once a month if that. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE, CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! Customer service had gone waaay down, they are now worse than subway. They are short, barely listen to your questions...  yet they speak English so you are wondering why are the prices so high. It's Vietnamese food and it is not organic, if you are gonna charge way more than average than at least execute well. 

Food is yummy, and they have brown rice. They pretty much made Vietnamese food more eatable for people who might be new to it.
author: Tim V.

description:
Was excited because of the high Yelp reviews and general proximity for my lunchtime travels (I'm a huge spring-roll aficionado), but unfortunately I just ended up generally disappointed. 

The pros: neat theme (they build your fresh spring rolls to spec)... and there are a lot of ingredients to choose from. The square rice-paper sheets and automation of the system are also nice.

The cons: long wait (it takes a long time to assemble custom meals with lots of ingredients)... and there was something unsettling about the way that the individual assembly boards were being passed around by the employees and then stacked on top of each other at times... meaning that your raw food was being placed on top of a board that might have just had full contact with the bottom of another board. Yes, I have high standards when it comes to restaurant cleanliness... but I just don't want food poisoning, and with raw food I think you need to be extra careful with your prep methods. (If the wait hadn't of been so long, I wouldn't have had time to scrutinize their tray swapping as much...)

In the end, I probably waited 20-something minutes to walk out with my three $8.69  custom spring rolls... and I just didn't think the experience was special enough in any way to warrant the time or money involved. I don't see myself returning here.
author: Zoe H.

description:
OMG.  It has been 5 months and I am still thinking about this place.

The easiest way to describe it would be to say it is a Vietnamese Chipotle, but it even more complex.  Choose your wrap, your meat and your fillings.  Choose any sauce at the end of the line and take it to your table.

I LOVE all the fresh ingredients, complex flavors and sauces.  It seems, and must be, a healthy meal.  

Tight space, but usually tables are available.

Please open one in KC!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: jennifer j.

description: This place is not good. It's kinda like a fast food Vietnamese place, almost like a Chipotle for Vietnamese. But it is not fast food prices. The actual sit down restaurants are cheaper than here. I got a bowl with chicken and "the standard." Which to me, was not tasty at all. The chicken had no flavor and it was just over rice, cilantro and pickled veggies. The only sauce that looked ok was the peanut sauce, which still had a weird taste. My 1 year old daughter ate all the chicken because she likes things with no flavor bc that's all I give her anyway. It was 10 bucks for the bowl and didn't even come with a drink.
author: Jamie B.

description: Super fresh and delicious ingredients! Very yummy bowls and rolls! I've been several times, and the quality of their food is consistent.  One of my fave places in this neighborhood to meet a friend for a casual lunch.
author: Jaching H.

description: Come get a  of crap.  Food served by untrained juveniles serving shitty prepared look alike wraps and pho soups. Bland unflavored and watered down chicken stock... Comes with each every order. Dirty tables and nasty counters... Eat once, don't come back.  You won't miss it...
author: Mike P.

description:
if you're in union square and want to find something quick, easy, less expensive.. and somewhat healthy, then try Fresh Rolls!

They have pho noodles, Vietnamese sandwiches, rolls 3 (shrimp, pork, chicken, vegetarian), and vermicelli bowls.

I would recommend the pork for the meat. Garlic shrimp is made of small pink shrimp so it adds more sweetness to the roll.

Overall, nice casual Americanized Vietnamese fast food place.
author: Sarah K.

description: I came here today for lunch with a couple friends and a slug looking bug came out...most disgusting experience I've ever had at a restaraunt. The manager was nice about giving us our refunds but it took us over half an hour for us to get our money back. I posted the video if anyone wants to see. I'm definitely not coming back ever no matter how much I liked the food in the past. I still feel sick just thinking about how we could have eaten that thing....
author: Tim P.

description:
3.5 overall 

This place is set up like a grab & go place so you would think it'll be fairly quick service.  Ever go to Chipotle?  Very similar process.  Assembly line making process.

I timed how long I waited in line to get to the order counter.  15 minutes today around 12:35pm as it's located at the Metreon and across the street from Moscone convention center.  

That gave me a lot of time to study the menu posted above.  The steps are outlined. 

I went with the three rolls for $7.95.  One chicken, one pork, and one tofu roll.  There's a shrimp offering too, but the shrimp looked scrawny and cost more. The rolls don't appear like they'll fill you up but they actually do since there's a lot of roughage.  I went with the "standard".    You also get choice of four different dips. I got the peanut butter and sweet and hot chili sauce. Skip the peanut butter sauce.  Too watered down.  

The meat is skimpy but combined with the roughage and the rice paper wrapper, eat slowly, let 20 minutes pass, and your brain will tell your tummy you're good.  

They also offer a pho bowl with choice of the same ingredients or a Bahn mi sandwich that looked tempting.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Lee's Sandwhiches meets Subway. But cleaner, and friendlier. 

Found out while exploring the new Metreon's 18 dining options.

Great atmosphere, staff and food! Will come again.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Fresh roll is really over price quick vietnamese deli food 
You get 3 rolls for basically $3 per roll 
Food is ok
I do like it Because its quick and easy and good walking distance from mascone center
Meat sometimes is a hit and miss 
I got some burn pork in my roll today 
I would think if you charge this much per roll
Definitely don't skimp on quality.
Overall not bad for this area and my asian taste buds
author: Mochi A.

description: Yesterday, Hubby and I split an order of rolls with crispy tofu and a soup bowl with chicken. The sprouts, herbs and veggies were fresh and yummy. We liked it so much, we're skipping breakfast and returning today for lunch!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: Wish I can give you 0 stars!  While getting my pho fix... My chicken was partially raw... Wtf??! First thing in the restaurant industry is not to serve raw meat!! Argh. Never returning again. fck that, I will go else where. Plus, they are skimpy with their rolls. It seems smaller and smaller each time I order it.  For $9... I will go to a pho restaurant instead..
author: Ann L.

description:
The lemongrass pork freshrolls here taste delicious! I got the 3 for $7.95 plus the taro chips. The service was a little bit slow (the line was quite long), but it was well worth the wait in my opinion. Everything tastes so fresh and makes you feel healthy. 
+ Delicious and tasty food
+ Fresh ingredients, healthy
+ The sauces are yummy too
+ Convenient location (in the Metreon, opposite of the convention center) 
- Slow service and long line
- Portion was kinda small (for the Freshrolls)
author: Xin W.

description:
Somehow, this was my first visit to Freshroll. I've been here for three years. The hell?

Line moves kind of slow which isn't great, but worth it. They have great food, they customize for you, and then you have ultimate control over your fish sauce, peanut sauce, whatever.

I'm a vermicelli noodle salad fan, and that is just what I got. The meat was a little light, but eh. 

The good: tasty food.
The bad: slow service, but whatevs. You get to watch them work.
author: Amanda B.

description:
OMG the shrimp sandwich is TDF.  I would come back just for that.  GET IT (if you're not allergic).  I also really liked the pho broth - something I've never seen anywhere before (just the broth, no noodles) - tasty.

The wraps are a really great concept (think spring rols) - but the sandwich was so amazing, I think the wraps were a little overshadowed.  The are big wraps with lots of "stuffing," which was appreciated. 

Lastly, the taro chips are AMAZING.  Couldn't stop eating the samples...
author: Vicki C.

description: This is another one of my once a week lunch spots. I've tried many versions of the fresh rolls and I'm never disappointed. The line on 4th street is hella long, but sign -up for TryCaviar. Love love love!
author: P F.

description:
This would be a four star review if it weren't for the kinks in the customer experience that make it a really long wait in-person and a high chance online orders won't be completed correctly. As I write this, I'm waiting for an order for a 6-person group to be completed that never started until I came to pick it up 45 min after placing the order. I asked if we could get a discount for the inconvenience and the woman shook her head and said no. So, I decided to finally write a review. I attributed the kinks in the system to its being newly opened, but it's not getting resolved over time.
Online order experience has pain points too.
The people are nice. Food is good and feels clean.  I hope they improve their process.
author: Sara Z.

description:
This place is like a Vietnamese Chipotle.

The fresh rolls are huge. But they also fall apart easily. 

Plenty of seating and food options to mix and match. Not bad for a fast food place, but I would only come here for a quick work lunch.
author: Katrina L.

description:
While I didn't try their other offerings, I was pleasantly surprised by my pre-movie Vietnamese sandwich at Freshroll.  Sure, it did cost $5, but given their downtown location, that might be expected.  

My banh mi was quite generously filled with grilled chicken, pickled veggies, jalapenos; topped with a spread that really brought everything together. 

The only thing I disliked was that the chicken did have some fat and gristle on it, which was mildly unappetizing.  But all-in-all, Freshroll seems to be a solid place for a budget meal at the Metreon.
author: Joanne G.

description: Had a sandwich at Outside Lands last year and my friend and I couldn't stop talking about it. We kept saying, "We have to find the place that makes them, we just have to." Not being SF natives we didn't. But I was planning a trip to SF and decided to take the day off from work and find the place. Through some research I found this place and had another sandwich and omg! It. Was. So. Good. I stayed in town for one extra day just to get another sandwich and it was totally worth it.
author: George O.

description: Unfortunately, I rarely do this but I'm changing and demoting my review to a 3-star rating. Came here on a Monday lunch hour and it was so slow and rolls didn't taste great and got charged more than I should have. This place doesn't operate well with a crowd. Won't be going back soon!
author: Priya S.

description:
Food was pretty decent. That's what gets this place any stars. 

Here's what irked me. 

Me and 2 friends came in at 8. The place closes at 9. The lady mopping the floors is already putting seats up for some reason even though the place is still getting a lot of traffic. So since we didn't have a place to sit, we took some seats down. 

The lady gets annoyed when she sees this so she starts passively aggressively mopping and cleaning all around and under us... Knocking our chairs and asking us to move so she could clean wtf. Keep in mind it is still 45 minutes to closing at this point and there are at least 10 people in line ordering food. I had to ask her to go clean another area so we could eat in peace. 

Eventually the others working in the place told her to put several seats back down because other guests wanted to sit and eat.
author: Tony P.

description: Decent fast casual Vietnamese. Noodles and chips - what more could the mother of a toddler ask for? Of course I would rather go to a real Vietnamese pho restaurant, but you can't beat the proximity to our hotel.
author: Sharon Y.

description:
Wow I wish I had one of these by my house in Vegas...
Walking to the Museum I had fresh veggie rolls...sooo glad I did!
I had to start making them at home ;)
Yummmmmmm!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
My experience with Freshroll has been AMAZING. 

I've eaten at Freshroll numerous times, and I love everything I've ordered, including the pork, chicken and tofu spring rolls and bowls.

Healthy, fresh, and satisfying, the spring rolls at Freshroll are made-to-order, and they give you a generous helping of veggies. YUM!

The entire eatery is very well organized.  It's a great place for a snack or meal, and I love how customizable the menu is for customers. You get to choose from a variety of options, including rice and salad bowls, vermicelli bowls, banh mi, and Vietnamese spring rolls. They also have great toppings and fresh ingredients, including pineapple, yummy crunchies, jalapenos, avocados, etc.

The taro chips are icing on the cake and make for a light, healthy and addicting snack! I can eat those delicate taro chips forever. YUM.

CATERING- (10++++/5)
My fiance had Freshroll cater a surprise birthday party, and Freshroll was a complete hit at our party.

First, ordering is super easy. My fiance worked with Nam, the owner of Freshroll, who is the best. When my fiance picked up the order, which consisted of several trays of spring rolls, sauces, chips, etc., the Freshroll team was very prepared, organized and helpful.

Each tray was sealed and wrapped with saran wrap and the tin foil cover was labeled to indicate what type of spring rolls were in the tray. 

Each item we ordered also came with a cute card that explained the hormone-free, organic ingredients and items. We put the card labels next to each item so it gave the whole presentation a very polished look. :)

The sauces, by the way, are delicious! For the party, they gave us big containers of Grandma's Peanut Sauce, spicy sauce, ginger citrus sauce and the regular banh mi / spring roll dipping sauce. 

BIG THANKS TO NAM AND FRESHROLL
We have to give our sincerest thanks to Nam and his team. We had a great experience, and I love that Freshroll is our go-to eatery as well as catering restaurant. :) Thanks for everything!  Freshroll definitely lives up to the hype and buzz.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Chipotle Style Vietnamese Rolls and Bowls!!!!  

Freshroll is newly opened on Metreon.  The place is clean, organized and bright.  

Came here on a Tuesday around 1:15pm.  There were about 5 people in front of me.  Not too bad.  Although all the staff was still in learning and training, everyone was so friendly, polite, professional and efficient.  

The menu is very simple.  The three main style of the dishes are spring rolls, bowls or Vietnamese sandwiches.  Then you pick your meat, veggies and sauce.  Just that simple!

I got the 3 fresh spring rolls with chicken and pork ($7.95).  The pork actually was very good.  Flavorful and tender.  The chicken was little bit dry but still ok.  I got the standard veggies so I could try a little bit of everything.  All the veggies were very fresh.  Interesting that they put pineapple to it.  I also added crispified onion (extra $0.75) to the spring rolls.  Never had that in spring rolls but tasted pretty good.  I picked the peanut sauce and it was ok.  Just little too sweet for me.  The amount of food was very good.  I thought I could finish all three but  I only could finish 1.5 rolls.

If you want something quick, simple, healthy, fresh and reasonable price food, Freshroll is definitely a good choice.  I can't wait to try their bowls next time.
author: Liza T.

description:
Freshroll is one of my go-to quick dinner places when I am staying in SOMA. It's a Chipotle-style assembly line applied to delicious Vietnamese staples like spring rolls, banh mi, bun bowls, and pho. There are so many options, it's easy to try something or fall back on your favorite. Even when there is a line, service is quick and the food is always fresh. 

I recommend the lemongrass pork - not too fatty and has great flavor. I also love that they offer pineapple as one of their toppings - while it is different and non-traditional, I think it adds a little special something to the dish. 

They also make homemade taro chips, which are so delicious! Their jasmine lychee iced tea is lightly sweetened and so refreshing. Don't miss ordering these as a combo with your meal.
author: Rachel C.

description:
This place makes great Banh Mi sandwiches. I had the lemongrass pork at lunch today. I had to wait about 25 minutes in line due to the lunch rush but all in all it was worth it especially for the reasonable price they charge. They also offer complementary water that had sliced cucumbers infused which was a nice touch as it was a warm day today. There are several different sauces at the counter available to try. But I didn't even need any as my sandwich was perfect.  
I have had many different varieties of banh mi sandwiches and this place is one of the best for that. I have not tried the other items but the toasted bread and now I'm now I'm sauce they use was delicious! 
My only caution would be if you get it to go make sure you eat it in a well ventilated place. I took mine back to Moscone Center and was trying to eat it before the conference and the guy next to me kept staring at me like I smelled like a homeless person. Eventually he got up and left before I was halfway through my sandwich.  Undoubtedly it was because of the smell from the marinated veggies at least I hope... They sure do stink but they sure do taste phenomenal...
author: Leilani O.

description:
Was jonesing for pho. Came here based on Yelp ratings. 

This is not a traditional pho restaurant.  It's more of a fast sandwich place (think quiznos) that also sells pho. Pho is only served after 3pm.

Broth is very clean, not heavy on anise flavor.
Beef is an extra $1, which seems silly to me.  Only one size option (no large).

Friendly staff. 

$15 for a bowl of beef pho and iced coffee ain't a great value but it was tasty.
author: Jacob S.

description:
A great alternative to the regular sauce and fat laden lunches in the city. It is just as they claim to be, fresh. Service wise they can get a little lost although it is "subway style" and should be stright forward, however they make it up with politness. 

I have tried both the chicken pho and garlic prawn rolls, both are good but not authentic. The best way to describe things here is watered down flavour in general but still quite enjoyable. I found it a little pricy at $8-10 a meal and not sure why they expect you to tip when there is no real service, you pick up the food off the counter and clean after yourself. 

The taro chips here are a must try. Also skip the peanut sauce (not so peanutty) in favour of the citrus tangy sauce.
author: Nora B.

description:
Passed by w a friend on opening day and decided to give it a try. I ordered something w the crispy goodness and my friend ordered the meat lovers. They were obviously still getting into the swing of things, so it took us forever to figure out the menu. Not docking them points for that since it was Day 1, but hopefully they'll take some pointers from Chipotle soon!

The rolls looked a little small to me, but were deceivingly filling. Ingredients were fresh and not too heavy and the sauces were flavorful and really authentic. The limeaid was yummy too -- not too sweet. The feel of the place is clean and simple. 

Wish they were around when I worked in the area. Perfect for a healthy but filling lunch (or dinner) for working professionals. Would be great for on-the-go or office catering too!
author: Denise H.

description: The sure simplicity of this place is what keeps bringing me back.  A few proteins, rolls, Bahn Mi, or bowl.  Toppings.  All fresh, all tasty.  I get the rolls here whenever I can, and they're always the same high quality.  Love this place.
author: Chris R.

description:
Came for lunch, typical yuppie soma/financial district fusion fare.

$7 for a banh mi is ridiculous, but I got the bun bowl for $8 and it wasn't bad.  Definitely not the right flavor for bun thit nuong but not bad. 

It's set up like a chipotle, pick what you want, bowl, roll or sandwich, and choose your ingredients. 

It's definitely an Americanized take on Vietnamese food, so I'm not sure how I feel about it.  Nice to see that Vietnamese food is getting more popular, and educating the world about foods other than pho, but I would hate it if this is what people think real Vietnamese food tastes like.
author: Tu T.

description: I got the pork spring rolls and chicken sandwich. The sandwich gets soggy fast though so not sure i would order that again. The taro chips were not that yummy to me. I tried the peanut sauce and the Vietnamese vinaigrette, both were good. It's cool how you could customize what goes inside because I love the pickled veggies so I loaded my sandwich up with that yay
author: Kathy N.

description:
3 Stars because I like the Vietnamese Bun and goi cuon (bowl and spring rolls), so there's no problem with the food. I pulled out 2 stars because of two reasons. 
One, the Vietnamese coffee was pre-made, NOT FRESH. Normally a Vietnamese coffee MUST be made fresh from expresso before anyone pours in sweetened condensed milk. I grew up with Vietnamese coffee so I was disappointed to see that my favorite coffee was made wrong. They could have brew some french roast into individual cups and let it stand until someone orders it--that way the coffee doesn't stale with the water and the condensed milk. 
Second, the stale coffee taste made me lose interest quickly. The added sweetened condensed milk wasn't stirred so it sat at the bottom of the cup. 
The store could have provided thin red straws solely for Vietnamese coffee because it was meant to drink slowly in case a person gets too jittery too fast (this coffee is traditionally very caffeinated).
I'll come back for the food, but not for the Vietnamese coffee.
author: Jackie T.

description: I wanted to love Freshroll but it was just tasteless and underwhelming. It is the Chipotle for Vietnamese food but the food is very bland. I had a rice bowl with shrimp. I know you can add sauces but the underlying ingredients are super bland and boring. The concept has potential but need work for sure. The other problem is that there is no garbage can by the door. You have to push back through the line of people waiting to order to get to the garbage. It's a bad layout.
author: Chris W.

description:
Forgettable rolls and a noisy, greasy atmosphere.  I love eating in the kitchen if it's a Provençal country house with old wooden tables and chipped crockery, but a commercial food-service prep area just doesn't have the same charm.

They're trying for a Chipotle-style assembly line, but it comes out feeling more like Subway.  The fried scallion roll option ("Crispy Deliciousness Roll" or something similar) confused nearly every customer when I was there, inspiring shouted explanations every 60 seconds.

The fried tofu was fine, the "standard" toppings selection was a nice mix (and there's a bunch of other add-ons to choose from), but I'll get mine to go next time.
author: Ken M.

description:
Hands down the best rolls I've ever had in the Bay! These rolls are super addictive and relatively healthy - which makes it even better. For $8 you get 3 massive rolls with your choice of meat (pork, chicken or shrimp) and all the fixins. I generally go with the standard, which includes: lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, jalapeno and pineapple. I've never had the vermicelli bowls, but assuming they're just as delicious as the rolls. They also have several dipping sauces to choose from. My personal favorite is the tangy citrus ginger and sweet & sour chili. 

Aside from the food - the staff is always friendly and the restaurant is clean. Service is quick, so you can get in and out in no time. Only downside is that there's limited parking in the surrounding area. I sooo wish there was a location in the FiDi!
author: Krystal C.

description:
My Go-to place for a healthy bowl of "bun".

Love the concept. Store is clean, food is fresh! Staff are friendly and efficient. I usually go for the grilled chicken vermicelli with lettuce, avocado and vietnamese vinaigrette.

I don't feel like there is MSG in this place at all, unlike so many other vietnamese places in the city. Just wish they were more consistent with the toppings because one time when I ordered half chicken half crispy tofu..  i was literally fishing for chicken! The other two times were fine so will definitely be back since it is so close to my home.

Looking forward to trying their Pho available after 3pm.*
author: Amber S.

description:
made a HUGE mistake paying $11 for spring rolls (aka freshrolls) for lunch, got hungry again in 30 minutes.

hadn't been here in a while & decided i wanted freshrolls

i basically ate an appetizer for lunch.

no grown adult should pay $11 for lunch and get an appetizer

they need to fill up those rolls!
author: Samantha W.

description:
I wish they had 10 more of these scattered around the city! I don't usually come here for lunch but if I need to pick up a quick healthy dinner this is one of my favorites. 

As mentioned many times, Freshroll is a build your own spring roll, bowl, or sandwich. They have what they called the "standard," select veggies to fill your roll with, in addition to your choice of meat. The standard is good but I like asking for everything which includes the standard plus even more items (like shredded basil). Don't worry the staff are pretty good about stuffing it all in without that sucker breaking. 

Love the citrus dipping sauce in particular but all of sauces are good. Everything is so customizable at this place you'd be hard press not to like it.
author: Erin P.

description: Love, love, love this concept! Freshroll is in a great location across from the Moscone so you can totally check it out if you're looking for something other than pre-made sandwiches from the conference center. The only comparison I can really make to it is that it is a Chipotle/Pieology style restaurant for vietnamese food. I ordered a sandwich while my coworker ordered the spring rolls and both were pretty good. You can get a side of broth for about $1.75. The baguette for my sandwich was a little too hard because it was toasted, but everything else inside of it was delicious. This place tends to get crowded during peak rush hours, so if you're going to check it out, be early!
author: Lalida S.

description:
Fast, fresh and convenient - Fresh Roll is a great option for a relatively healthy lunch.
Choose your base - either fresh rolls (3), a sandwich (bahn mi -esqe) or a fresh bowl (salad) - then add your protein and salad ingredients. 

I have only ever had their fresh rolls and usually opt for lemongrass pork or crispy tofu and ALL the salad ingredients (incl. avo) - delicious and nutritions and plenty for one. If you are super hungry though, try their taro chips. Salty, baked goodness!

 Eating there isn't that nice, so if it's a nice day head to Yerba Buena Gardens and lounge on the grass.
author: Alex D.

description:
And it's back to being ridiculously slow!  I don't know what it is or why they can't fix it but I just can't afford to spend that much time waiting for food on my lunch and then as a result not getting to enjoy my lunch.  Perhaps they could pre-roll some items and have them available for purchase where they keep their drinks and the customer could just go straight to the cashier?  Or maybe they just need more people working.  I'm not sure but they really need to come up with a system that is quicker for the lunch rush.  The line has been out the door all week so far this week and it's not just because of the amount of people - it's how long the process takes.

Sorry FreshRoll.  I want to come here at least once a week but sadly I don't think I will be coming any more.  I just can't afford the time to.
author: Amanda K.

description: Always delicious and fresh! I like the crispy tofu sandwich with added pineapple or rolls with crispy tofu and pineapple. However, I think it's getting more and more expensive. :(
author: Karolina C.

description: Didn't disappoint, I love Vietnamese food and this was on par with some of the restaurants I go to in Los Angeles.
author: Glen S.

description:
lemon grass noodle bowl with the standard! yum!

the process is super easy and quick. each ingredient is portioned just right. one of my favorite is the crunchy garlic, adds the right amount of crunch and extra flavor.
author: Carolina C.

description:
While some lament the McDonald-ization of Mexican food, i.e. Chipotle, I'm all for healthy takes on classic ethnic food as a gateway to authentic ethnic cuisine. 

Freshroll is the Chipotle of Vietnamese food: Vietnamese classic dishes remixed with organic ingredients and fresh ingredients. 

Freshroll offers spring rolls, banh mi (sandwiches), pho (noodle soup), and bun (vermicelli bowls). I've only tried the spring rolls and I really like them. Rather than get 3 spring rolls of the same kind, you can mix and match the protein filling: crispy tofu, pork, and chicken. I've tried all 3 fillings and my favorite is the crispy tofu, although pork is also really good. Another thing different about their spring rolls is the pineapple spear they include. It adds a refreshing bite of freshness and acidity. The peanut dipping sauce is really good also. 

Another thing I really like to order is the "combo" meal: lychee iced tea and taro chips. The taro chips are soooo tasty and offers a nice crunchy, starchy, salty contrast to the spring rolls. 

Definitely a welcome addition to the Union Sq/Soma lunch circuit!
author: Monelle A.

description:
I wish they had this place closer to where I lived. the spring rolls are amazing..cause you get to create them! I loved their variety and the fresh veggies they have. I love their lemongrass chicken which is to die for. 

I could easily eat at this place once a week. Pretty healthy and quick which is how I like my lunches. You can pick your dipping sauce as well. one the best part is their homemade taro chips. I usually get two orders of the chips cause they are so delicious to snack on. 

It crowds easily during lunch so make sure you come earlier than lunch time or after the rush.
author: Teresa B.

description:
I have to say 1st off, how hard this is to write because I've never really been a fan of spring rolls or vietnamese food in general.  So When my roommate dragged me kicking and screaming to this place I didn't know what to expect!! 

I was reassured by the fact that you were able to pick your own toppings and ingredients so there would be no surprises!!  From the moment I took my first bite, I was hooked, Seriously hooked. Now I go down to union square area to get Fresh Roll every week, and plan my entire trip around my lunch.  I also get another bowl to go for my lunch the next day!!
You can really see and taste how fresh the food is.  Fresh Roll is also a great place to go if your dieting, as it almost impossible to eat unhealthy here. They do their part in helping to save our natural resources as they compost and recycle everything.
 
 I can sit here and write great things about this place all day, but you are going to have to run down there and give it a whirl for yourself!!  I promise,  you'll be glad you did and like me it will become a must have stop every time you find yourself downtown..

*** HELPFUL HINT***
There is a daily lunch rush, (which can look overwhelming) but don't worry yourself about this, because the line goes really quick.. They also have a way you can order your meal online and it will be ready in minuets, then you just walk right in and pick it up and avoid the line!!  If your a busy professional working at one of the cajillion places around union square and the Moscone center, I would order it online  and go pick it up. you will bypass the entire line and be in and out in minutes! 

Rarely I will give a business a full 5 star, but this place is unbelievable!! The food has such good flavor and is healthy and fresh!!  you really can't ask for much more!!

Well I lied you can ask for more , but it's not anything that will effect the way you feel about this place..

The only change I can think to make is to  add additional seats to the dining area. Many times,  there's just not enough places to sit down. 
Request #2  open up more of them, this place is amazing and will do very well in any area!!  I guess we should consider ourselves lucky there's only one in the country and we have it right here in san francisco.  Keep up the good work Guys From the pickiest eater in the world I'm your number one fan!!!

Jason E
author: Jason E.

description:
Loved my quick lunch here! Their set up is Chipotle-esque except they specialize in Vietnamese rolls and bowls. As someone who can never resist ordering the salad rolls at pho restaurants, this place was a must-try for me. I was a bit worried that I wouldn't like the pork and chicken options because I'm so used to having shrimp, but they actually turned out to be very delicious. The meats were much more flavorful than I had anticipated and it's great that you can pick out the ingredients for your roll. Be wary of the cilantro - it is not for the faint of heart. Personally I found it a bit overpowering so I'd probably ask for less next time.

As for the sauce, their "Grandma's Peanut Sauce" was spot on. It's so critical that the sauces are good because they can easily make or break the roll. I ate two sauce containers worth of this sauce because it was so yummy :)

Only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is for the price. Although they claim that the three rolls are as filling as a bowl, I'm a little bit skeptical. The meal was a little pricey considering that I didn't feel very full afterwards. It's also an extra $2 if you want garlic shrimp to be one of your meats. The shrimp wasn't worth the extra because they were all very small and didn't have much flavor. I would stick to pork and chicken in the future. However, I love the concept and their flavors so much that I will definitely still keep coming back!
author: Sunny H.

description: The name says it all... Fresh rolls and bowls that fill you up! I prefer the 3 Rolls deal with chicken or lemongrass pork. Quality meat, fresh veggies, and it's fast. This is one of my healthier stops while in San Fran. It makes for great to-go food while staying in the hotels. I highly recommend this place!
author: Darya K.

description: I went in expecting authentic Vietnamese food, but got the most Americanized Vietnamese pho I have ever had. The broth is chicken instead of beef and there just wasn't the Vietnamese magic. Guess you can't expect much from a chain Vietnamese restaurant across from Moscone West!
author: James S.

description: Great place to go to for a quick yummy lunch. I love getting the rice and salad bowl with chicken. The produce is always fresh, and the sauces are yummy! Kind of pricey but definitely worth it.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This is one of my favorite downtown lunch options. I always get the tofu rolls and request that they be filled with tons of veggies, herbs, plus pineapple and jalapeno. The staff is always very generous with their fillings and the vegetable and herbs are always crisp and fresh. 

It may not seem like it, but three rolls is plenty satisfying for lunch. Sometimes I can't help myself and order a side of pho broth and it ends up being overkill. 

Word of warning: this place can get crowded during the lunchtime rush. Because everything is made to order you may end up waiting in line for a long time. I recommend ordering ahead--stroll in and walk away with your food while everyone else scowls at you. Easy breezy!
author: Ali S.

description:
Seems like a chain place, but I think they only have 1 location.  Right by the Metreon, next to Split Bread.  

Solid lunch option, although I'd highly recommend placing your order online to avoid the inevitably long line.  Vietnamese inspired foods with a assembly line / fast food like delivery.  You either choose a bowl, sandwich or 3 summer rolls.  Then you choose a protein - tofu, shrimp, pork or chicken and then a series of toppings and a sauce.  Decent price, fresh tasting and healthy feeling.

Definitely a regular on the lunch rotation.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
I've never been to a fast food Vietnamese restaurant like this.  It's east meets west.  What do you get when you combine Pho and Subway?  You get this place.  I ordered a rice vermicelli salad to-go with grilled pork, sprouts, jalapeno, pickled carrots, cucumber, basil, and peanut sauce.  You choose your meat and veggies, then your sauce. I wish they had this place in Portland.

Great location for conference go-ers.  It's right across the street from Moscone West.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Love this place.  Wish they'd open one in Fremont.  Great, fresh, fast, food.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
This review is long overdue. 

I was lucky and found this place walking around looking for something reasonably healthy, inexpensive and not requiring lots of time.

At first I was hesitant because there was quite a line. But I took a gamble and was not disappointed.

The line moved reasonably well. I had plenty of time to sit and relax to eat. 

The food was very tasty; lots of balanced flavors and fresh. It was presented very well and easy to consume without making a mess.

The restaurant was clean and being cleaned. One of the reasons I was able to find a seat so readily was because someone was on the floor on top of the cleanliness.

The whole operation seemed to run like a well oiled machine and the results proved it.

The first time I left, I felt a sense of pride at being part of such a successful enterprise even though I was only a consumer. I could not help but imagine how they would expand.

I visited this place several times since. I have been meaning to write a review, because it has been consistent on all levels; reasonably priced; fast, friendly service; quality fresh tasteful filling food; served in a clean environment.

They have my vote for expansion, especially if it is closer to my home.
author: Mark D.

description:
Good quality, quick food, short wait times.
Cramped place but its SF!! I would give a 3.5.
author: Shalini K.

description:
This place is awesome. I've been here several times and they always deliver. Food is fresh and prepared right in front of you. The sauces are amazing and the staff are so friendly.

I've had everything on their menu and can highly recommend it all!!!!

Just come here and you won't be disappointed. It's a great place to grab some eats to go.
author: Emme F.

description: Not a very clean place.., takes forever to get the order and for a Vietnamese food there's not a single Vietnamese person!  I would recommend a more authentic restaurant..
author: DVolt B.

description:
The food was good (I had a salad bowl with grilled chicken), service friendly.

However, I probably won't come here again with such a large conference around the corner-- the hordes of Dreamforce drones resulted in me using my entire lunch break to wait in line! While I think the restaurant probably could have been a liiiitttle quicker, the people in line were definitely making it worse by not having their orders ready by the time they got to the front.
author: Krista L.

description: Was here for lunch all week. Amazing food, quick and menu isn't confusing at all. I love their process of how they make their spring rolls. Simple yet very delicious!!! The pho after 3pm is awesome also plus the bahn mi (Vietnamese sandwich). Try it if you're nearby.
author: Jinzo X.

description:
Without a doubt my go-to lunch spot in soma.  If I don't bring my lunch to work, I usually end up here.  It's fairly difficult to find a place in SOMA that fulfills all my criteria for lunch: quick, healthy, tasty and relatively inexpensive.  This place manages to do so.  

My meal of choice: three fresh rolls (skip the noodles), chicken (extra protein it up!), lettuce, pineapple, carrots, avocado, cucumber and jalapeños if I'm feelin' it.  Grab a side, or two or three, of their freshly made "Grandmas peanut sauce" and you are set.   

Taste is always consistent (and very yummy!), I'm always full and completely satisfied after eating here.  The chicken is sooo tasty and fresh, and that sauce, just wow! I can't speak much to the other menu items as I've yet to try them, but people seem to love the sandwiches.  

Eat at fresh roll.  Get the peanut sauce. Come before 11:45 on weekdays or be prepared to wait. Order online if you can't make it before then.  

Enough said.
author: Ryan V.

description: We were looking for something fast and tasty near our hotel (Marriott) after a full day walking around the city.  We came here because we thought this place looked clean from outside.   Well, we were pleasantly surprised by the food.  The menu was limited with rolls and Pho...  we had both and were happy with both.
author: L L.

description:
Definitely a fan.

Just like Chiptole -- 

you pick which style -- ie. bowl, salad, roll or sandwich
choose your chicken
toppings
sauce!

total bill around $8

i chose a grilled chicken salad bowl with traditional troppings. it tasted very fresh and crisp but i have to admit i can do make it at home but then again, when im lazy ill take anythign!

try their taro chips!

good stuff!
author: Carol Y.

description:
TIP #1: Be prepared to wait if you go around lunch time. Order online or grab from the refrigerated case to speed things up. 

TIP #2: If you like customizable food a la Chipotle, Freshroll is a good option.

Located on the same block as Metreon and City Target, Freshroll has its share of professionals on lunch break, shoppers, and moms with strollers. The line was nearly out the door when I visited with my boyfriend, but there were many empty tables inside. Slowly inching forward was made more painful by the sight of everyone else's food being prepared on the assembly line. True to its name, the rolls at Freshroll are fresh--made right before your eyes, and best consumed immediately. 

I went for the bowl because I was extra hungry. After considering the array of meats, grains, vegetables, add-ons and sides that I could choose to include in my bowl, I decided on brown rice with grilled chicken and a ton of different vegetables. I wouldn't skip the pickled vegetables--they add a lot of juicy, tangy crunch to the otherwise plain salad vegetables. Because I ate at the restaurant, I took one bottle each of Sriracha and Grandma's peanut sauce to my table with me. While the food isn't bland--the sauces and the grilled chicken helped in the seasoning department--it is very plain, in that it's simple and clean, like something you'd find at Whole Foods. That's not a bad point in the least, but if you're looking for bold flavors and hot food, just know that even the sandwiches at Freshroll look more like salads than sandwiches. 

Was it worth the wait? I wouldn't make this a destination spot, or even a grab-and-go spot, but I would come back if I had the time to wait in line.
author: A.L. H.

description:
Came here today for lunch since my team couldn't stomach yet another monotonous lunch at the Whole Foods on Folsom. I ordered a bowl with vermicelli noodles, tofu, and a spread of veggies. The line upon arrival around 12:10 was pretty long but it moves fast. You choose either a sandwich, rice/noodle bowl, roll, or pho (only after 3pm though) and then add veggies on an assembly line. Basically this is the Chipotle version of Vietnamese food.

Pros:
+ Very healthy - nothing was oily, the sauces were light, and veggies seemed fresh.
+ Gluten free and vegan friendly
+ Tofu was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of crispy outside and salt

Cons:
- Kinda boring - like Chipotle this place gets the job done for lunch but overall flavor is lacking and you could definitely make the same thing at home for half the price.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Vietnamese Chipotle!  I got the chicken bowel with everything and brown rice.  The chicken was nicely marinated, and the veggies were fresh.   The pineapple in there was an interesting taste.  Also, was enthusiastic to see that the sauces are labelled with gluten free, nut free, vegan, etc!  Put a little vinaigrette on my bowel, but not necessary.

Felt nice and healthy afterwards.  Whoo-hoo!
author: Lily N.

description:
I've gotten the rolls once and the pho twice here.  Both are excellent, although I found getting 3 rolls to not be enough for dinner.

Everything is made with rice noodles or rice paper so it's great if you're for gluten-free.

The service is fast - they made the rolls to order (so you can pick which meats, veggies, fruits you want).  Similarly, the pho is made to order (they have the broth ready made in the back and add the vegetables and meats when you order).

The atmosphere is pretty modern - it's a bright and clean look.  The staff are really nice considering that they have to deal with lots of slow customers who don't understand how the ordering process works.
author: Louise H.

description:
Been here a couple of times--the rolls are delicous and it's great you can pick a variety. I get the pork, chicken and tofu. 

The ingredients are very fresh and the rolls are pretty tasty. I don't mind paying a premium for ingredients I can trust.
author: Mimi T.

description: Fast, no-nonsense, tasty, reasonably priced.  Probably won't win any awards... Not much else to say about it,
author: Russ C.

description:
For a Vietnamese restaurant surviving in the big city, it's pretty good. It's not extremely authentic if that's what you're looking for, but then again, it's not suppose to be - it's fusion! The restaurant is set up in sort of a fast food manner (the closest thing I can think of would be like Chipotle). You have several options - noodle bowl, sandwich, or spring rolls - along with your choice of meat, made right in front of you. Prices are cheap (~$8-10) and service is extremely fast. ingredients are fresh and the condiment section is so full of everything! 

What surprises me is how healthy it is. There are both vegetarian and protein options (tofu!) and still super filling; very rare for restaurants these days. The spring rolls were delicious; my favorite part is that you can mix and match whatever meats you want! Go crazy! The sandwich is great too, stuffed to the point where it was falling out with assorted veggies and meat. I recommend the taro chips too; sound weird, tastes great. Whoohoo!

Everything is clean and fresh, including the interior decorating. The place has big windows; lots of light coming in and light wooden colored floor and chairs. If I'm ever craving Vietnamese fusion, this will probably be my to go place!
author: Annie T.

description: My chicken sandwich with the secret sauce, pho broth, and limeade was amazing!!! I need another one.
author: Shirley A.

description: A surprising fast food eatery that is actually fresh and good. The pho broth is fresh, yummy, better than most phos in the city. Good stop after the movies and shopping! Very crowded but the lines are fast.
author: Thuy V.

description:
DELICIOUS !  

I love fresh vietnamese rolls and get them every time i see them as a appetizer in a restaurant.   I like the concept of this place and it was a perfect light lunch.  I got the 3 freshrolls, 2 pork 1 chicken and they were all good.  All the sauces were good too.  Wish they had a place like this where i live!
author: George M.

description:
I usually am not a fan of vietnamese rice paper rolls b/c they are not as naughty as the deep fried type. However, I LOVE this low carb alternative to the bowl and alternative to the wraps/burritos/lavash. I HATE lavash!!

You get 3 rolls for $7.94. I got chicken, pork and crispy tofu. Loved them all though I think the pork was the MOST naughty. 

I got the standard fillings (don't remember everything, but it includes pineapple!) minus jalepeno and I added carrots (to be healthy) and basil.
You can choose as many sauces as you want, i think. I chose the citrus salad-like dressing - tangy, made all taste good. and the standard vietnamese fish sauce.

this is a GREAT lower-carb option!!! with LOTS of veggies!

they also have rice bowl and pho option. Pho only after 3pm...
I got the lychee ice tea - oh, so good. but calories I don't need.

summary- like subway's but with asian rolls. so healthy!!
a little slow on the service. wish they could wrap and ring up faster.
author: Sophia Y.

description: This place is AWESOME --- it's like Chipotle, but with Vietnamese food.  SO good. We tried the bowls (mine with noodles and chicken and the Vietnamese sauce).  Tried the fresh rolls (awesome).  Will totally go back again.
author: Arry Y.

description:
Walked by this new place on the way to the movies. It's basically a Vietnamese fast casual restaurant. There are three basic types of food you can get: fresh rolls (basically an summer roll), banh mi, or noodle bowl.

For each of these, you get a choice of meat, veggie toppings, and sauce. The choices for meat was slightly disappointing - there were only 4.  Why isn't there beef? I guess pork works. Actually the lemongrass pork was pretty yummy. The veggie toppings had good variety, though I wish when they were making my banh mi, they asked if I want the other veggies that don't normally come on a banh mi, like scallions or bean sprouts. Load 'em up, I say!

The fresh rolls look pretty good. You get 3 for $7.95. They take three squares of rice paper, dunk them in water, then pile on the rice noodles, meat, then veggies. Then they roll them up right there. Next time, I'm definitely trying the fresh rolls. They look pretty filling.

Overall, the food was pretty good. Great flavors and portions were pretty decent. The only major complaint I have is that the assembly line is really slow. They kinda take forever with each person. They need better training. Like for example, if one person is holding up the line because they're making the fresh rolls for a customer, the other person starting off the order can totally help finish the next order in line, instead of starting a new order. Otherwise, it kinda takes the meaning out of fast casual. But other than these little hiccups, the dining experience at Freshroll is pretty great!
author: Sherry L.

description: Pretty good. I'll be back. The lemongrass pork is the best protein and the peanut sauce is the best sauce, in my opinion.
author: Jeff B.

description:
What does DVR stand for?

According to Google, DVR stands for Digital Video Recorder.

WRONG. DVR stands for Delicious Vietnamese Roll.

And that is exactly what Freshroll is. Freshroll = DVR

Although it is slightly expensive and you pay for additions like the crispy roll, the spring rolls here are delicious. They have garlicy shrimp, basil, pineapple, mint leaves, and all the other traditional good stuff that goes in spring rolls! Very flavorful and delicious, and the staff was super friendly and had a sense of humour :) 

They also hand stamp the Freshroll logo onto each and every brown bag. That's what I call a DDVR: Dedicated & Delicious Vietnamese Roll. The only reason this isn't 5 stars is because the spring rolls sort of fell apart after I started eating them, probably because they plumped them up so fat and good, so I guess that's totally acceptable.
author: Eric S.

description:
I must have walked by this place 10 times because it was right around the corner from my hotel. I looked in one evening and saw these interesting looking rolls. I looked this place up on Yelp and everyone kept referring to this place as an Asian Chipotle. Soooo I had to try it. I went there on my last night in San Francisco and it did not disappoint. 

I tried the fresh rolls with chicken and lemongrass pork. I did try one of the rolls with rice instead of the noodles. I chose the "Build Your Own" toppings as I didn't care for the all of the toppings included with the "Standard". I tried the peanut, citrus ginger, and sweet and sour chili sauces. The sweet and sour and peanut sauces were delicious and complimented the rolls very well. This was an entire, filling meal and the cheapest meal of my entire trip. I would definitely frequent this place if it were on the East Coast.
author: Lisa M.

description: I usually eat here it's decent Vietnamese inspired food. But when i got the spring roll today , this guy skimped on the chicken, he didn't use a full scoop I wish the other person made mine because everyone else got a heaping scoop. Just won't go back if I see him behind the counter. Placed is over priced to begin with at least give me my money's worth.
author: Ricky C.

description: Just added 4 outdoor tables so you can eat with your pups!  Love this place for a quick, healthy meal. I always get the chicken on a salad then douse it with tons of ginger dressing. Fast, cheap and fresh!
author: Kim W.

description:
Long line, but tasty food! I like that they label which sauces are gluten free and the staff is well enough educated that they were able to tell me the fried onions or garlic (not sure) wasn't gluten free. They also did a good job of guiding me through which ingredients could be included in a roll and still have it be safe for me to eat.

At the same time, they need to figure out some way to handle the mid-day rush better. The wait is painful.
author: Frances H.

description: I had the pork sandwich today. It was very scrumptious! Great balance of everything. I wish they had Vietnamese-style BBQ pork though.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Dropped in here for lunch today and somehow missed the rush. Be warned: very busy place during lunch hour.

Food was decent, bowl option was very generous and PINEAPPLE!!!1 

The one real detraction is the majority of clientele here are the kind of pretentious brogrammer d-bags which have increasingly invaded the city. A particularly unctuous individual in front of me in line went so far as to micromanage the amounts of meat and toppings added to the rolls he was ordering. I can't imagine how grating it must be  for the employees to put up with such behavior day in and day out.

Overall this place was pretty solid for a downtown spot. My advice: either go early or late and miss the rush/brogrammer scumbags.
author: Cortland T.

description:
This one is for my co-working compatriots in SOMA. If you're just some slack-jawed visitor to the Bay Area, stop reading, walk to the Pier 39, and jump in with your clothes on. We don't need your kind around these parts.

OK, now that's we've dispensed with hoi polloi, it's time for Straight Talk. 

(I swing a chair around and sit backwards on it in the manner befitting of Straight talk. Am I wearing a backwards snapback and an Ocean Pacific tee? You better believe it.)

Next to SIDS and flip-flops, the lunch hour queue at Freshroll is the worst thing ever. It's not that the staff are slow. Far from it: they are rolling and bowling up with incredible haste. The procedure of making your food is actually quite fast. 

The real issue is demand. The fresh rolls, bowls and sandwiches there are so tasty, the secret is out. Show up between noon and 2pm, you will meet an out-the-door line of tucked-in-button-ups, daft tourists, and Real People like me. 

This review is here to say: Place an order online! In fifteen minutes your order will be ready and you can pickup your fresh rolls like a boss. First timers should get the fresh rolls (yes, three rolls can and will fill you up) but their crispy sandwich is a must-get too.

Obligatory Title Pun: This scene is FRESH. (Crossed arms) #straighttalk

Menu Readability: Four flatscreens explain the fresh roll algorithm.

Need to mention: I always get extra jalapeños and they are SPICY. 

What this place teaches me about myself: I prefer to leave my shirt untucked.
author: Vivek S.

description:
Roll on.

Spring rolls aren't the only reason to stop by for a visit.

You can also get a deliciously packed grilled chicken bánh mì with veggies including cucumbers instead of jalapenos thanks to the friendly and attentive staff.

Made even better with plenty of hoisin sauce.

Continue on with a bowl of pho with poached chicken. Rich homemade chicken broth and plenty of noodles made for a filling and tasty dinner.

Be sure to sneak a few free samples of homemade taro chips too.

Everything is a reasonable $8 - $10 with tax and Healthy SF surcharge.

Rock on.
author: Jason B.

description:
Stopped here for lunch with a group of people from training and I was surprised by how much I liked the food. I was hesitant about the quality of the food because the name of it sounds gimmicky. It's set up like a fast-food restaurant where you watch them assemble your order. 

I ordered 3 fresh rolls. One Lemongrass pork, garlic shrimp and grilled chicken. They add vermicelli noodles and give you a choice of other items to include. I chose pickled vegetables, bean sprouts, jalapeños, and crispy goodness (fried egg roll with a scallion). I also added a lychee ice tea. The food was light and delicious and the tea was amazingly refreshing, not too sweet. The Lemongrass pork was the most flavorful meat. I would absolutely eat here again if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Michelle P.

description:
This place is awesome. 

Prices are reasonable, they offer really good tasting high quality 'Americanized Vietnamese' food which is created freshly in front of the customers. Additionally, customers get to choose their own ingredients from a plethora of options, and most importantly-- Freshroll does not ration the peanut sauce.

The only negative I can think of is that the line can be excessively long at lunch time...
author: Matthew S.

description:
this place is surprisingly good.  i was skeptical, b/c it's in the metreon, so how authentic could it be.  however, if you are looking for a light, healthy lunch, this place serves its purpose.  i got a vermicelli bowl w/ garlic shrimp and all the fixings.  i really liked the sauces that you can get, particularly the citrus ginger.  

the spring rolls are also good and are huge!
author: Helen T.

description: People complain about price but this is actually pretty standard for convention center lunch prices. 3 rolls cost about 9 bucks, which is about the same price as a super duper burger next door. For the same price, three rolls are filling, represent more food group diversity, and make me feel better about myself after eating them. Plus, they're delicious! You can mix different proteins- my recommendation is 2 pork one tofu, and you can mix and match sauces, too. Worth it, considering the market.
author: Andrea P.

description: Went there twice during the AGU conference.   First time ordered three rolls, they are good.  The second time ordered pho, it's actually worse than any pho I had in any Vietnamese restaurant in Maryland, Rochester NY and Seattle WA.  Consider this location, I feel it's overrated.  The temperature of the restaurant was also very cold, which makes eating the rolls difficult.
author: Angela L.

description: I love freshroll! It's one of my favorite places to eat downtown. The prices are great, the proportions are just right, and I feel super good and healthy after every meal. I've tried almost everything on their menu at this point. I normally get the 3 freshrolls, a tea, and a cup of pho broth. Everything looks pretty small in front of me but once I finish eating everything, I'm surprisingly full!
author: Annie Z.

description:
Americanized, Chipotle style Vietnamese spring roll/vermicelli bowl/pho place. 

It's good if you want something fresh and semi-quick - although the line can be so long you spend more time waiting for your food than you will spend eating it. It's not the best or most authentic I've had, but it's filling enough and you'll feel healthy after eating it.
author: Tina S.

description:
Spring rolls are one of my favorite food so you should trust my review when I say I am a spring roll mastah~ I am such a spring roll master.. I can even make my OWN spring rolls! And although I'm not as pro of a wrapper as these people (they wrap them really neat and quickly), the contents of my spring rolls are way better!!!

I get that they're trying to be a fusion, but at least pay homage to the basics.  Pork and shrimp prease!! I got lemon grass pork since that seemed to be a favorite of other yelpers... It wasn't that good to be honest. It was sweet and sticky.. The part where they fill your vegetables...I had such a had time picking any of the vegetables.. I got lettuce (which is standard).. and pretty much nothing else. where's the chives? or the mint leaves?! The only asian vegetable they had there was...the bean sprouts and I hate bean sprouts.

I wish they packed more noodles too!! Noodles are so cheap and they're fillers, but they had way too little noodles!! 

You think this place is good? You should come to my HOUSE! My spring rolls will be 10x better than this place!

I can even make better peanut sauce and fish sauce than them! One thing though, I liked their pickled ginger sauce.. that was pretty good. They should keep making that.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Fast, easy, relatively cheap, and delicious. It's essentially the Vietnamese version of Chipotle. I get the freshrolls and they are so good -- especially with the citrus ginger dressing. I've had great customer service here every time. The workers always make an effort to be nice and conversational. Overall, great place for a quick meal!
author: Hana K.

description:
There are such few options for something different for lunch. You got your typical salad, sandwich, soup, Asian rice plate, blah, blah, blah.

When I stepped out to forage for food today, I remembered this little shop on 4th Street on the way to Moscone Center mentioning rolls. Fresh rolls?

FreshRoll is a modern Vietnamese-American(?) shop serving all the typical Vietnamese food items: rolls, bahn mi sandwiches, or noodle/rice bowls. Since it's nice to have something healthy and fresh, I opted to get three Freshrolls ($7.95). These are rice paper wrapped rolls with your choice of meat and veggies. I chose the lemongrass pork meat and was mesmerized watching the counter person grab a small handful of cooked rice noodles and split it amongst the three rolls. The overhead menu makes things pretty easy by highlighting a standard grouping of veggies for people who have little patience or little experience in putting things together. The good news is that you can ask for any or all the veggies they have on the menu. I really liked that! It was really odd to see slices of fresh pineapple (but hey whatever!). Personally, I would recommend getting the traditional veggies like cilantro, pickled vegetables, and for the crunch-factor adding the cucumber, bell pepper, and/or bean sprouts. At the cashier, you can get a choice of sauces to take away or there are cups to fill up with your sauce of choice in case you just can't wait to dig in.
Two Freshrolls was just enough to fill me up. The third roll made for a great light dinner/snack later (Tip: don't refrigerate anything in a rice paper wrapper otherwise you'll have to microwave it to unstiffen the wrap). 

Even though my thrifty conscience was screaming in the back of my head, "You can get these rolls in the Tenderloin for about 2/3 of the price!", it's nice to be able to grab some  healthy Vietnamese food from a clean shop in the neighborhood.
author: Joanna T.

description: Brilliant concept. Viet-Chipotle! I love that they will make a variety of rolls, the way you want it, right in front of you. And, you can order a side of pho. The rolls were delish and amazingly fresh. The sauces were to die for too.  This place would totally work next to the UCI campus.  I can only hope they come down south some day....
author: Michelle S.

description: It's so so so good, super healthy and fresh and a great price. They need more locations!!!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I ate here so much to the extent that I feel obligated to review this place. This is basically a vietnamese chipotle where you can choose the carb/meat/toppings/sauce.

I usually like to get the bowl with noodles. Occasionally I will get the rolls. For the bowls, I sometimes asked them to do half noodle half salad if I want to cut my carb. 

For the meat/protein choice, I like all the time. Their lemongrass pork is pretty flavorful but a bit dry since it is pork I guess. Their chicken is pretty tender and well seasoned. Their tofu is insanely good. I usually get pork or chicken just because I am a meat lover, but I do sometimes ordered the tofu because those fried cubes are very delicious.

For the topping, I would get all the vietnamese topping like cilantro and jalapeño. I would also recommend basil if you like basil. It is not the italian basil; it is vietnamese basil.

For sauce, I like the grandma peanut sauce and I put a lot of sauce on my bowl.
author: Ruxin H.

description:
One of my new favorite spots. The food feels healthy! 

Great staff.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Wish there were walk up style Vietnamese places like this in Phoenix!
author: Richard R.

description:
Motto #375: you can't go wrong with a noodle bowl. Freshroll is just another reason why this is true! 

The bowls are affordable, quick, and supremely satisfying. They dispense sizable portions for your office-lunch-hour-appetite, and they offer plenty of ingredients to pile on without being like, "Oh you need to pay lots of dollars for this sliver of pineapple." Slather on the peanut sauce, fish sauce, and sriracha sauce and you have yourself one delicious lunch bomb.

As far as the line goes, I must say you aren't really entitled to whine about the wait. Every viable lunch spot is mobbed by hungry humans from 11:45-12:30 in this area -- it is simply the nature of the beast. Plus, the staff at Fresh Roll are clearly working their rolling little tushes off to create your custom roll situation; give them a break while they add extra pork to this roll and put just a little more crunchy goodness to that roll. 

I can also speak for Fresh Rolls's catering prowess. I ordered a roll/bahn mee/taro chip feast for a group of 130+, and Fresh Roll was able to work with my needs to make said event uber impressive. 

At a loss for your lunch destination of the day? Need a healthy yet delicious solution to a catering conundrum? Roll over to Freshroll and get your oodles of noodles all rolled up groovy-like. Yeah.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
The Chipotle of spring rolls.

I got 3 spring rolls, one lemongrass pork, one chicken, and one garlic shrimp.  My fave was definitely the pork.  The shrimp was disappointing but I guess I should've expected it since they were the itty bitty shrimps as opposed to the plump ones I adore so much.  

What made my day though was that this is the only place I've been in the city that gives you the option of adding fried green onion.  If you've been to Brodard in SoCal, then you'll be surprised to find out (or at least I was) that the amazing crunchy eggroll thing they stuff inside their rolls is actually fried green onion.  Having that one little ingredient takes a spring roll to a whole new other level.

Other than that, I was annoyed that my roll was so stuffed and broke before I even bit into it.  Made it a messier meal than it should've been.  Props for their yummy sauces though.  But sadly, once you've had Brodard spring rolls, nothing can ever live up to it.
author: Jane N.

description: Found this place yesterday afternoon , and went back yesterday night!  Tasty, healthy bowls. I got salad both times. Will try vermicelli option today:). Cheap. Only down side was portion options dramatically different between visits. Will still be back.
author: Gary L.

description:
It sucks that I only discovered this place on the second-to-last day of my internship in the city. Freshroll is a build-your-own-spring-roll place. You tell them what kind of meat (lemongrass pork, chicken, garlic shrimp), vegetables, sauces, etc. The workers were really nice and, most importantly, very efficient.
