I had the lemongrass pork roll with basil, bean sprouts, cucumber, pickled carrots, the rice noodle stuff, and lettuce. The peanut sauce was spot-on when combined with Sriracha. 

After two rolls, I was full. $9 for 3 isn't too bad when you consider the other lunch options in SF and the fact that you might food coma after eating 3 of these.
author: Anna N.

description:
To be honest, I wasn't expecting much because it looked super Americanized... but it was pretty good! Though try to avoid coming during the peak lunch hour, because the line is always out the door and slow because they make the rolls on the spot.

Go for the 3 freshrolls order ($7.95) and you can mix & match the types of meat you want. What's unique is that they add pineapple as one of the ingredients in the roll. Overall, everything is flavorful. They let you choose which sauces you want as well. I love their peanut sauce!

They also have this special topping called crispy goodness (fried scallion) that you can add for $1. I think it's meant to resemble that *crunch* you get in Brodard's spring rolls, but for some reason to me it just doesn't feel the same (probably because the roll itself is already different) so I don't think it makes that big of a difference to the freshrolls here. On another hand, they do have homemade taro chips for $2 which I would recommend.
author: Jen P.

description: I was a big fan, eating here all the time. Bummed they've raised their prices and now only let you get five ingredients in the rolls. It now seems to be about $12 for three rolls, just with the standard five ingredients - no extras. It's actually hard to tell what the actual price is since their menu and prices are so confusing! All I know is two sets of rolls set us back $24. Maybe that would be OK if you could choose all the fillings you wanted, but now you only get five. Sigh. It was a great deal before.
author: K E.

description:
Yum!  Great flavors that made a party in my mouth that I didn't want to  stop :)

It's my first time at Fresh roll and decided to do their combo- 3 rolls, taro chips, jasmine tea and extra order of pho broth.   I chose the lemongrass pork and the chicken with their recommended fillings- lettuce, cilantro, cucumbers, pineapple (yes, trust me!) and all the other goodies.  They also had sauces, my fave was the citrus ginger.  The broth was well seasoned and tasty.   The homemade taro chips had the right kind of crunch and lightly salted flavor.   I definitely may come back after 3pm to try the pho since it wasn't available during lunch time.

I definitely recommend!  Five stars!!
author: S M.

description:
I love Freshroll.  A lot.  I come here at least once a week and usually order the 3 rolls or the bowl.  I really feel like you get a decent quantity of food for $7-8 and it's so damn tasty I can't help myself.  I tried the banh mi sandwich for the first time here and was pleasantly surprised that it was as filling as the rolls and the bowl.  I also tried the pho (they only serve 50 bowls and only after 3pm) and while still good, I highly recommend the other 3 options.

All the protein that you get with your meal tastes so good.  The pork is flavorful and tender, the chicken marinated very well and the even the tofu is crispy and absorbs the other ingredients very well.  The assortment of fresh veges they have is spectacular- I always get the standard and add pickled veggies.

I can't believe I've written this much and haven't talked about the sauces yet.  In addition to the abundance of sriracha, the vinaigrette, peanut sauce, ginger and chili sauces wil compliment your pho, sandwich, rolls or bowl very well.  I can't help but drown whatever I have in a mix or various ones each times I'm there.  

While I don't fee like its the most authentic Vietnamese food you can get in SF, it's reasonably priced, incredibly tasty, quick and fresh.  GO TO FRESHROLL NOW- you won't be disappointed (except for the fact that at the time of this review it is11:07pm and they close at 9pm...so, uh yeah- if you go after reading this review this evening and find out they are closed you will be very disappointed).
author: Natan O.

description:
Came here twice with coworkers and overall I'd say that it was pleasant. I'd say this place really constitutes 3.5 stars.

The first time I went to this place, I got the rolls and while they were tasty and packed full of ingredients, they were a bit small and for $8.95, it's kind of pricey for what is normally an appetizer at most Vietnamese places. They use the same size wrappers so they're really not any bigger than other restaurants. The second time I came I opted for the bowl instead and with this I was pleasantly surprised. It's basically  the same as getting a bowl of Bun but slightly less food for about the same price. What is good about the place is they have a wealth of sauces to choose from and you can get as much as you want! All the sauces seem to be homemade and they're pretty good.

Overall, I'd say I would only come here when my coworkers really want it because otherwise I'd rather just go to a real Vietnamese place.
author: edward k.

description:
This is a Viet Chipotle. Like Chipotle, you pick the method (bowl, wrap, sandwich), protein, veggies, and sauce. Also like Chipotle, this is as authentic Vietnamese food as Chipotle is authentic Mexican food. 

Unlike Chipotle, this is not good. Not even for a quick bite. The lemongrass pork is overly dry and tough. The shrimp tasteless and obviously frozen. It's also overpriced - over $8 for 3 small rolls?? Tasteless shrimp costs extra but they give you literally 6 mini shrimps. Really? They don't even offer the basic "goi cuon" roll option - boiled pork belly with steamed shrimp. 

Overall, an overpriced, not delicious, unauthentic Vietnamese Chipotle knock off.
author: Trang N. A.

description:
3.5. I do like this place for a quick meal although it's not my short list just yet. I usually get the 3 roll combo when I come (I've been twice). The fish sauce smell can be off-putting but you'll get over it. The lines run at about 15 minutes when they're at the door. I do feel very unlocal when I go to this place since it has the chain feel to it, I'm a sell out I guess. 

Overall decent food, close to Moscone so it's a crowd favorite for conference folks. I do get a bit hungry after a meal here so it's on the lighter side of calorie intake.
author: Michael S.

description:
I usually don't like traditional spring rolls because they come with a peanut sauce. Alright, I said it. I DON'T LIKE PEANUT SAUCE. That one always gets me dirty looks. Also, I don't like the usual cold shrimp in it. But at Fresh Roll, you have a choice of chicken, pork, and tofu (maybe others?). 

An order gets you three rolls with your choice of protein and you can have each roll a different one, too. They have tons of different toppings.  My favorite is pineapple.  It adds a sweetness and a little tangy to it. And get this, they have different sauces.  I always grab the sweet chili sauce. 

It's a bit on the expensive side.  An order and a drink is about $10.  Oh, and don't forget to add the crispy goodness for 75 cents extra.  It's a skinny fried scallion they put in each roll that adds crunch and tons of savory flavor.

For all you peanut sauce lovers, they have that, too.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Americanized Vientnamese food! Been here a couple of time, only had fresh rolls.

Protein: BBQ chicken and pork are good, tofu were meh, shrimp was sad.
Other toppings: very fresh tasting! Loved the pineapples from the standard veggies, and pickled veggies added crunch!
Price: a little expensive. But given the location, it's acceptable.
Service: good. But they can use more staff during lunch hours. It was painful to watch the line inching slowly as my limited lunch time tickling away. I was baffled when the staff brags about how sometimes they get a line that goes out the door. The long line can be a good sign that the food is really good, but if the line doesn't move at all... then it's another story.

Some humble suggestions for you, Freshroll management (I am by no means a restaurant owner or foodie). How about streamlining the assembly line so the orders can move faster? Hire more people? Or prepare the ingredients in a way, so it'll be easier to put together? Like a smaller scoop that pick up just enough stuff for one roll. Instead of pulling and trying to break apart a big chunk of noodles, or trying to gauge how much ingredient is enough for the serving.
author: YY M.

description:
I mean I know this isn't a Vietnamese place but I can't help but to expect decent rolls. So yes, this review might seem a bit unfair. 

The truth is, all I was excepting was for the meat to be tender and the peanuts sauce to taste like the ones at a thai or viet restaurant. Is that too much to ask?!?! Clearly yes.

The service however, fantastic!!!!
author: jasmin t.

description: Not great. But I guess I'm not that surprised since it is right next to the mall. For real pho, go elsewhere
author: Geobio B.

description:
PSA: I think they put a LOT of sugar in their dressings because whenever I come here, I crash/feel weird afterwards even thought I eat the salads. So, I only come here when I'm prepared to deal with the consequences afterwards. 

It's still pretty good, though.
author: Maria D.

description: This place not only has amazing food, but the best staff ever! I have never been to a food establishment that had so many bright and friendly people! It's in a perfect location that provides you with exceptional service! You should definitely eat here!
author: Caitlin W.

description: Shockingly good.  It's not your typical authentic place but they make a decent banh mi.  It's fast and easy and tastes fresh.  It'd be nice if they had more of these options on Soma
author: Debbie L.

description:
Love the bowl! Everything is fresh, clean and healthy. The meat and garlic shrimp are well flavored, goes great with the noodles. 

Can't wait to try the Pho next time.
author: Yannan W.

description:
For the price and quality you can't beat it.  Quick and fresh crash and go. 

Love that you can add bacon or pineapple to your bowl/rolls. Also the sauces that they give you to choose from are pretty good. 

Grab a few rolls and sneak them into the nearby metreon theatre for a healthy theatre grub alternative.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Was skeptical at first when I walked in, but I ended up really enjoying my lunch!

It has a very simple menu. You first choose if you want rolls, the bowl, a sandwich, or pho. Then in an assembly line format, you can have the people behind the counter add the type of carb you want (vermicelli noodles, white rice, or brown rice), then a protein, then fresh veggies. The veggies were very fresh and clean. The chicken was also very tasty and well-seasoned.

The only thing that made me sad was that they don't start serving pho until 3 PM. It was a chilly, cloudy kind of day, so I was looking forward to the pho, but the vermicelli chicken noodle bowl I got was very tasty.

At the end of the line, they have a variety of sauces you can pour over your dish to flavor it even more.

Prob not a great place for a date. It's more of a stop by for a quick bite to eat type of place. Also, the portions are a good size for the price you pay. My vermicelli bowl came out to roughly $8.50 and I was able to pay with card.
author: Maki K.

description: Nothing fresh about it. rolls are hard to bite, the meat was cook hours ago. It all just sitting there.
author: Long T.

description:
Healthy and delicious!! 
Catering is great, too. They recently catered an office lunch for about 40 people, and it was insanely delicious. 
Wish they had more locations so I wouldn't have to go to the Financial District to get my fix.
author: Joyce G.

description:
First off, you must..no, MUST...bring this to NYC.  I want it.  I need it.

Secondly, I visited SF for a week and this place was around the corner from my hotel.  The only place in all of SF that I made repeat visits to.  The ingredients were fresh, crisp, not too heavy...everything I expected California food to be.  Staff was super friendly and very helpful to a couple Vietnamese spring roll novices like we were and walked us through the whole thing (as sad as that sounds).

If you are within any reasonable distance of this place you should try it.  The only issue I had was the variation in amount of protein.  1 person would stuff it silly while the other would barely give me any.  Still not enough to deter me though, would absolutely go back.  Would just need to make sure I keep on top of that next time I watch them make it.
author: Mark D.

description:
The food was good but I think the prices are kinda pricey for what you're ordering. Especially the Vietnamese sandwich...almost $8 for a sandwich?!?! That's crazy...those sandwiches are like $2-3 at your typical Vietnamese sandwich shops.  Getting food here is more of convenience, it's like a Vietnamese Chipotle, as other reviewers probably said. The bright side is that the food is pretty healthy! 

I ordered the vermicelli bowl with lemongrass chicken and went with some basic add-ons, like bean sprouts, cucumber, pickled veggies, and etc. The food is very fresh and it's easy to pick what goes in your bowl as you watch your server make it in front of you. I used the peanut sauce for my bowl. I think it was a little too sweet for peanut sauce. I was only able to finish half of the bowl (I was pretty stuffed from lunch), and I finished the other half the next morning. So I guess the price isn't too bad, considering it lasted two meals for me!
author: Ivy L.

description:
The first time I popped into Freshroll, I was expecting substandard Americanized-Vietnamese fare. It's been a year and a handful more visits since and I'm happy to say they've consistently exceeded that initial expectation.

Fresh, delicious, healthy, and generously portioned. What more could one ask for?

Tip: Get half chicken-half pork. "Hit two cravings with one order
author: Colleen W.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of summer rolls, so keep that in mind. 

The veggies were crisp and fresh, and I was able to try two different kinds of rolls, the chicken and the shrimp. Both were delicious, but I don't know. They just didn't grab me. I left a lot of it uneaten, not because it was gross, but because it was rather blah. 

The drinks were amazing, house made lemonades and iced teas. The homemade sauces are also incredible, especially the sweet chili. I wish they had tossed the filling with it before rolling it all up in that slightly rubbery, weirdly textured summer roll wrap.

I'm never going to be a fan. It's cool. I've made my peace.

The staff were very nice and super fast at their stations. Watching busy lunch spots operate in San Francisco is amazing! Hats off to all of you.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Freshroll is a great place if you have a convention at Moscone center.  Directly across from Moscone West it is a good choice if you want a break from convention center/hotel food.  

Simple menu with fresh ingredients.   

On this recent trip, we had the pork  bun bowl, bahn mi sandwich, and Vietnamese Iced Coffee.  We enjoyed them all.   We will go back when we are in the area.  One other nice thing was that we had a coupon valid from 11:00  to 1:00.  Got in the long line and we didn't get to the cashier until 1:15.  They still honored our coupon.  

Very good customer service.
author: Xiao B.

description:
Woah.  I cannot say enough good things about Freshroll.  I came here for a conference at the Moscone Convention Center.  This place was just a 5 minutes walk away.

1) A Vietnamese spring roll version of Chipotle.  You can choose which fillings go into your spring roll.  There is "The Standard," which is a set list of ingredients that go well with your protein choice.  However, you can also have additional add-on vegetables at no extra cost, such as bean sprouts, pickled carrots, and green onion.  You have a choice of sauces (sweet and sour, peanut) to pick from.  I tried them both, and they were super good.

2) Vegetarian friendly.  They provide tofu as a protein option, as well as a wealth of vegetables that they'll stuff into the rice paper wrap.  It makes for a very healthy and colorful lunch!  Also, it was VERY filling.  I could only finish one and a half.

3) Cheap.  $8 for everything.

The only downfall was the lunch-time rush.  Everything is done assembly-line style. I think we waited in line for 20 minutes when the person in front of us placed 9 orders.
author: Victoria C.

description: This is an interesting little place. It is westernized Vietnamese themed food and seems very trendy, unlike most Vietnamese places. It seems like a chain, but not sure if there are any others yet. Seems to be getting popular lately ever since they remodeled the Metreon and put in all these new little restaurants. It's pretty good, for what it is. You can get a Banh Mi (Vietnamese sandwich) - (although you have to go through a process of ordering or custom building it just to get a standard Vietnamese sandwich - which I believe most of the staff has never seen before), you can get pho, and some other things like taro chips. If you're at the Metreon or Moscone Convention Center and you're in the mood for Vietnamese, and you don't feel like making the trek to Tu Lan or Miss Saigon, this place does the trick.
author: Peter K.

description: I was craving spring rolls and this place hit the spot.  Handmade to order spring rolls with multiple meats and  sauces to choose from.
author: Cat J.

description:
Convenient Location.

Short Line at 11:39 AM.

Got Lemongrass Pork. 
You can choose what else you want on it.
So I got lots of cucumbers. 

Sauces are FREEEEE. 
So is the ice cold water. 
And the plastic cups were free too.
Free things are essentially extinct.
Hence the mention. 

Super nice workers.

It was delicious.

I will return.
author: Tergel P.

description:
This place as just okay. We got an order of the rolls with shrimp and an order of the pho and both were just okay. I make fresh rolls at home all the time that are a lot tastier with better ingredients (and a more generous helping of meat!). The dipping sauces were bland, and the peanut sauce was too watery for my taste. I like that crispy stick addition to add some crunch to the rolls. The chicken in the pho was kind of gross looking. 

Overall, probably wouldn't come back, it's nothing special, but a nice healthier alternative.
author: Piyali F.

description: This is really convenient to the Moscone center- right across from it. I came here twice for quick and healthy lunch. The second time it was quite crowded during lunch hours though the assembly line workers rolling these are fast. Freshrolls were fresh as I had hoped. I've never had one with pineapple in it but it worked. I love the unique taro chip add on option and took advantage of it.
author: Jenn K.

description: Not a good place for Bahn Mi. Chicken is too vinegary and the bread doesn't sit nice with the non-toasted bun. It's very lazily pushed forward as a Bahn Mi and it costs more than $8 with tax.  I'd say the vegetable portions are nice, but the pickled veggies are soggy and soft. Good pickled veggies are crispy or even crunchy. I waited quite a while in line for my 1min Bahn Mi, and based on cost, quality, and comparing it to all the other places I've gone to this Vietamese Sandwhich is not worth it.Typical San Franciscan downtown reviews don't know anything outside of the mall and metreon.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I actually used to go here regularly a year ago but lately the customer service hasn't been that great. It wasn't even that busy yet the cashier had over-charged me for more than a cost of an actual dinner at a Vietnamese restaurant; suddenly becoming reluctant to give me a refund when clearly it was her fault. Rather than be apologetic she quickly slid the receipt instead of being a professional and hand it to me like she was trying to evade the idea that she made a mistake, when it could have been prevented early on if she would have more paid attention by using more accuracy than speed. 

The food is great but I feel the venue could be more cleaner and way more inviting. They tend to throw way too much veggies than meat in their rice bolls but their steak pho soup and spring rolls are pretty good. 

I wouldn't go here during lunch but perhaps if they improve on having better customer service and have way more attention to detail I'd come back;  However I'd rather have real Vietnamese food for half the cost and faster service in actual Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Markus V.

description:
Very clean , food are fresh prepared everyday and incredible cheap and tasty .
Shrimp rolls with peanut sauce rock!!!!!
Their attitude is to serve us happily and healthily  . I love it !
author: TG L.

description: A solid place. I ordered three lettuce wraps with the lemon grass pork. After making lettuce wraps in my own kitchen, I was impressed with the efficiency of their operation as the concept on its own seems like it could go badly with an untrained staff member. The wraps were tasty and I liked the pork more than I expected. The peanut sauce was also tasty. A good place for a quick meal. The only thing I didn't love was watching them clean a cutting board with what looked like an old rag. Hopefully it was perfectly clean....
author: Sarah M.

description:
What I Ate
- three freshrolls (two chicken, one pork, "The Standard" veggies and avocado, with peanut sauce)
- taro chips

Would I Go Again?
While I think Freshroll has A LOT of potential, the flavor of the freshrolls just didn't do it for me.  I was fairly shocked at how bland a restaurant item containing meat, cilantro, cucumbers, pineapple, and avocado could be, but I am sad to report that almost every bite was lacking flavor.  Now, I recognize that the purpose of the many sauces is precisely to give the relatively bland freshrolls the flavor they need; however, I thought the peanut sauce was below average.  I've had much better peanut sauce in SF--I've even had better peanut sauce bought from the store.  Not surprisingly, I thought the taro chips were...yep...bland.  Again, I think the potential at Freshroll is there, but I think I would try something different on the menu if I went back.
author: Ben M.

description:
I ended up coming here on my trip to SF because it was down the street from my hotel, I wanted something fast, and I didn't want Subway.   I could tell right away when I stepped in here that this was going to be fancy fusion banh mi (AKA banh mi for white folk with money).  First off, there were professional signs, and a good clean look to the place.  This ain't my momma's banh mi shop! 

With that caveat, I do have to say, it's a unique take on banh mi, and it's pretty good.  Quality meat, good bread, fresh veggies.  I like it.  It's pricier than OG banh mi, but you get a good sized sandwich, made well, with good flavor.  I wouldn't mind coming back here to try more of the sauces.  

All in all, I like what they're trying to do here. I'm definitely a fan of attempts to expand and explore on banh mi.  If I do end up in this part of town again next time I visit, I'll give it another shot.
author: Thai D.

description: Lots of vegan options, healthy, fresh, and tasty! The 3 pack of fresh rolls is filling but you can feel good about it. The lychee ice tea is a little bitter and not as sweet as I expect lychee tea to be. The lines are really long during rush hour so come at 11a. The friendliness of the staff varies but it's not off putting. Overall, I highly recommend this spot!
author: Kathy B.

description:
Novel idea!!  I love Vietnamese food because of the pickled veggies in Pho, Vermicelli bowl, or spring rolls and to have a place where they make things FRESH is great. 

This place would get a 5/5 for me had they had 1-2 more works in the assembly line.  The line didn't seem THAT long compared to how it usually is during rush hour.  I went at 1:30pm and it took almost 35 minutes to get my food. :/ 

So its simple- you choose weather you want spring rolls, salad bowl, or Pho- what type of meat and what you want in it. 

I got the Salad bowl with salad as a base (you can choose noodles, rice, etc) and got crispy tofu and lemongrass pork.  I added avocado and my total came out to less than $10. SCORE! 

I got the peanut and sweet and sour sauce and it was perfect. 

I can't wait to come back.  I'll be better prepared for a wait though!
author: Anya R.

description:
The owner of Freshroll wanted to create something delicious and healthy for the active person who is on the go.  He succeeded!  We all love burritos...easy to eat, filling, flavorful, and fast.  But, who wants the carbs of the tortilla, the fat of the sour cream, and the heavy feeling from the beans?  (ok ok...i admit I do sometimes).  For times when you want the healthy version of a burrito, turn to Freshroll!  The rolls are wrapped with thin rice paper (um 5 calories at most?) and stuffed with veggies and protein!  There are 4 sauces to dip your rolls in: 1) peanut, 2) citrus ginger, 3) sweet & sour chili, and 4) traditional Vietnamese vinaigrette.   Very affordable also. 

The restaurant is clean and modern with a long counter that you order your food at Subway style.  You pretty much make your roll as you order, so you can pick and choose what you want in it.  The staff is very friendly, and they have a convenient location right on Mission and 4th.  Definitely a must for when you're in Union Square next time!
author: Naomi P.

description:
I absolutely live this place!!

The Good:
 - fast
 - the freshest food your will ever get!
 - great service!
 - every dish is customizable
 - excellent diet food!

The Bad:
 - no vegetarian Pho (i.e. with mushroom broth instead is chicken broth)
 - simple, good for lunch, not great for dinner unless you're on a diet
author: Amy P.

description: Pho was super tasty but just can't give it 5 stars...feels more commercial than authentic. I usually have a lot of noodles left over when I order pho (I'm more of a veggies and broth kind of gal), but this place was really light on the noodle portion.
author: Meg S.

description:
Their rolls are amazing!!! I would eat there everyday if I could!!!

I had the freshrolls with BBQ pork and peanut sauce.

They served 3 big rolls. Although they are "big" (essentially stuffed with tons of vegs) I still found myself hungry for more! Big guys  and fellow roll lovers - I suggest you order 2 portions! Yes, they are that awesome... I think 4 rolls would have been just nice for me. 

What makes this roll awesome.... 

1. The rice paper was super soft but it held all its fillings together nicely. Note: Do not try to use a napkin to pick this up! It will stick to the rice paper. Use your fingers :) 

2. The BBQ pork was so tasty! 

3. The peanut sauce! (I think you get to pick more than 1 sauce, I saw my friends have more than 1 before I knew you could. otherwise, just go with peanut.)
author: Amanda L.

description:
Since my office moved a few blocks away from Freshroll, I've turned in to quite the fan.  My first time being exposed to this tasty place was actually via a catered office lunch where they brought the essentials to build our own noodle bowl.  When I found out they were located just down the street, I went over to see what else they had to offer.  The menu is setup very similarly to Chipotle; you choose your dish (rice, noodles, spring rolls, or sandwich), then choose your meat and fillings.  I'd say the prices are pretty similar to Chipotle's as well.  

Anyways, this place is reliable, the ingredients are fresh, and the lines are always long around lunch.  I've always gotten the rice or noodle bowl, so I cannot yet vouch for the spring rolls or sandwiches  But I've never been let down.  This is the kind of place that I don't feel too guilty eating at when I'm on a health kick.  You can load your bowl up with add-on veggies and feel good about yourself.  It's a win-win. :)
author: Kristen F.

description:
This place rocks!  I love how customizable everything is.  I had shrimp spring rolls (aka Fresh Roll) and well, it's really fresh, which is absolutely essential.  I think the accompanying nuoc nam was on point.  I also appreciated the fact the rolls weren't stuff with an endless amount of noodles.  

I also had the grilled pork banh mi.  I think the bread is where most places go wrong, but not here.  The bread is delicious, which enhances the high quality ingredients.  The pork was grilled to perfection (with some caramelization). I also like the spicy aioli sauce on the banh mi.  It's different, but it works. 

Plus, the taro chips are a great and healthy side.  It's tasty and novel. It has just the right amount of salt. 

Lastly, I really enjoyed the jasmine-lychee iced tea.  I was initially skeptical.  After taking a sip, I really wish I had a gallon of it.  The iced tea is truly lightly sweetened which the subtle flavors of jasmine and lychee.  I'm going to need gallons of that from now on. 

I would definitely swing by more often if I could!
author: P L.

description: Fresh, tasty, healthy.  I ordered the rolls, shrimp, pork, chicken with their preset choice of vegis. They are delicious with the choice of sauces. I left the place with a good feeling not being hungry and not being overstuffed. Just right. Good location and service is very friendly.
author: Jeff M.

description:
If you're anything like me, you're a picky damn eater. That's why I'm drawn to these Chipotle-style eateries where you get to pick what goes into your meal and see it happening in front of your eyes. (Can't tell you how many times I've had burgers with "surprise" condiments in them, but that's another story..)

Freshroll puts in quality ingredients, and although it's more expensive than a comparable Vietnamese roll & bowl, it's definitely more cleanly - meaning much lower likelihood Montezuma will exact his revenge on your stool. The taro chips were especially great - not too oily and just crispy enough.

The workers are hit or miss.. some are really nice and peppy. Others are not.
author: Andrew M.

description: This place is like Chipotle, but American Vietnamese. You select what you want to eat and they make it right in front of you. The food is delicious, and the portions are good along with the price. I love that they offer brown rice instead of white rice. Great place to grab a quick bite to eat during your busy day. Why the missing star you might ask, it's because I feel they can clean up the back kitchen a little more to make it presentable.
author: Matthew L.

description: Not a bad place to grab some noodles. The customization was nice and with no sauce it felt like a pretty healthy meal. The crispy tofu was pretty salty, but I understand it needing to stand up against seasoned meat and not just be the stereotypical bland tofu, but next time I'd get just the noodles and toppings. Unlike most of the reviewers, I'm a fan of bland sometimes so it was a great meal.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 4

Came here on a weekend minutes before closing.

1. 3 pork and chicken freshrolls with crispy goodness and everything
~Pretty good. Freshrolls themselves were pretty good, but the only sauce I liked was the peanut sauce.

2. Homemade taro chips, 2
~Pretty good. Couldn't taste much of the taro, but they were nice and crispy.

3. Dad's jasmine lychee iced tea, 2
~Pretty good. A bit on the sweeter side, but you could definitely taste the jasmine lychee.

Service was fast.
author: David L.

description: Love coming here for their delicious spring rolls. My favorite is the dipping sauce and the crunch from the rolls. It's also fast and convenient. Their bowls are also really good too.
author: Jonathan T.

description: For a fast casual place this hits the spot! The pho is great - steak was super tender and the rolls with lemon grass pork are delish!  We will be back for sure when in the city!!
author: Sonyia G.

description:
Highlights: 
- Customized spring rolls, noodle bowls, or Vietnamese sandwiches ($6.95-$7.95+) 
- Mix and match protein offerings: lemon grass pork is my favorite. 
- Variety of veggies to top your selection off with: bean sprouts, basil, bell pepper, carrots, cilantro, cucumbers, pickled vegetables, scallions, jalapenos, and pineapple shreds. 
- Various sauces to accompany your meal: peanut sauce, citrus ginger, sweet & sour chili, and Vietnamese vinaigrette. 

Improvements: 
- Lines can get long during lunch hour or days with a convention going on at the Moscone Center. 

Tip: Go early!
author: Tracy T.

description:
I've stopped by Freshroll a couple times on my way home. The service is quick and works kind of like Chipotle, where you order at one end and you tell them what to add as you move down the line. The menu is pretty clear what the options are. 

+Spring rolls - the pork and tofu are yummy. I add basil, lettuce, carrots, bean sprouts, cucumber, bell pepper.
+Grandma's peanut sauce is yummy!
+Price (one roll for $3.95 isn't worth it, but 3 for $7.95 isn't bad)
+Convenient location in the Metreon
+Fast and friendly service
author: Katherine S.

description: Pho, fresh spring rolls, roce bowls,bahn mi- quick service, fresh ingredients, friendly service.  The jasmine lychee iced is a great! I'd come back, but the bread for the bahn mi needs to change, too think and dense, takes away from the flavors.
author: Carrie R.

description: Really good food with healthy options. The grilled chicken, tofu and beef were all good. Love the different sauces and the chips. My favorite is the peanut sauce.
author: Sunil R.

description: Perfect. Fresh & simple. Friendly staff. I love that you get to assemble what you want. Great sauces & fresh limade. Very affordable. Within walking distance of convention center. Quick & easy & delicious!
author: haylee s.

description:
I LOVE Freshroll! Their name really says it all. They make delicious, fresh and light meals that are perfect for lunch or dinner. My personal fave is the lemongrass pork with added avocado! YUM :)

I would highly suggest using their online order system  to beat the lunch rush. It'll save you time and no one likes to stand in lines. 

More than all the delicious food though, the staff is super helpful! I recently placed an order online and when I got back to work, my roll was made incorrectly. I emailed the site and within 20 minutes my order was refunded and I was given a credit toward a future order. They were so helpful and understanding which is exactly what you want as a customer. The helpfulness is not exclusive to the online staff. I've always found that the in-store staff is super nice, approachable and kind. 

Thank you Freshroll for offering such delicious lunch options downtown!
author: Lindsay O.

description: Healthy option. I like how you can mix rice and salad. I got the brown rice and salad bowl with chicken. Nothing special but I like that I can customize the bowl and the meat was tender. Jalapeños were definitely a good spicy touch. Super friendly staff, efficient service. A good lunch spot.
author: Michelle K.

description: This is the Vietnamese version of Chipolle, similar set up. The rolls are very fresh and tasty. The Pho, on the other hand, is VERY BLAND,served in a plastic bowel and small.
author: Ann S.

description:
Interesting concept that I wish they had on the east coast. The spring rolls are often my favorite part at Vietnamese joints, so I was delighted to get three GIANT spring rolls that I chose the ingredients for. This GF gal left full and happy. Lychee tea was very refreshing. Hubby's pho was super tasty as well.

Fresh ingredients and friendly staff. Quick, yummy food.
author: Candace E.

description:
I was lured into this place by some positive Yelpers and hunger. 

Here is the down low-just stay away from the Pho. 
The broth is soooooo lacking the authentic flavor. Above all overpriced for a clear misrepresentation of Vietnamese cuisine. The broth should be hotter...although all the ingredients are pre-cooked. 

Bottom line if you have never tasted REAL Pho then you will enjoy this place.
author: Sara N.

description: I like the concept that it's quick, and they do have good spring rolls. My main criticism is that they only really have tofu as their vegetarian alternative - as a Vietnamese place, I would think they would have an all vegetable options as well. However this is not the case, and  they have a VERY limited selection of veggies. I still go here when I'm hitting the movies next door, and then I just choose the tofu.
author: Marie V.

description:
Discovered the place thanks to yelp!

The rolls are excellent although some may consider them "pricy" for almost $9 after tax. But that's about average for a lunch in SF. 

I tried the chicken and pork. Pork is quite a bit better! The rolls are very consistent in quality and always taste great. It looks like the ingredients are also of high quality! A very healthy and tasty lunch alternative

Make sure to use the Peanut sauce as it is the best :)

The only ding this place receives is due to the "inefficient" line setup. Sometimes you can wait 20 min to go through a line even if it isn't very long (10ppl or less). But that's due to the nature of the rolls and the fact that they are made to order.
author: Max N.

description:
I was walking from the Moscone Center to the movie theaters and my nose brought me here.  I knew I smelled Vietnamese food, but I couldnt tell from looking at this place that it was from here.  I walked in and noticed that their menu was set up "chipotle-style".  Pick your style, pick your meat, pick your toppings, pick your sides.  Initially I wanted spring rolls, but ultimately decided on the noodle bowl.  The lemongrass pork is significantly better than the chicken, and I would recommend using the fish sauce to give your bowl some added flavor.  The portion size was good, and the flavors were pretty good.  It is more Americanized than I am used to, but not in a bad way.  I am sure this style of food appeals to more people than more traditional Viet food does.  

Prices were a bit high for what it was, but it is in SF, so you have to assume things are going to be more expensive than elsewhere. Overall, okay but not great.
author: Mike R.

description:
I really wish we could give 1/2 stars, but I understand that it makes you choose.

Went for lunch on a Tuesday at noon - long line but moved fast.  Probably waited 10 minutes from line to checkout.

Pros:
It was my first time here and I liked not have 10000 options to choose from - it's like Chipotle but for Vietnamese food.

Ordered a bowl $8.49 with pork, sandwich with pork ($6.99), Taro chips ($1.99), and 2 drinks.  Total before tip was $27 and some change.

Food / meat was good as well as the portion size & overall value.  

And as a bonus: their protein is "100% all-natural meats, meaning no hormones or antibiotics".  (Quotes because it's from their website).  

Location - near a park, plenty of seating at the restaurant (inside and out) as well as nearby in the mall and at the park.

Cons:
I was really excited about the taro chips.  They were a disappointment.  No flavor - like eating thick cardboard.  Boo.
author: L Z.

description:
Walked by here while checking out the new City Target and was surprisingly impressed!

You don't expect a Chipotle style, Americanized Vietnamese restaurant to serve authentic tasty food but I have to say its spot on. The speediness of the servers combined with the many combinations of choices adds to a great customizable experience.

The ingredients are very fresh and the textures and tastes reflect solid Vietnamese fare. Prices are also very reasonable which makes this place a solid 4.
author: Joe C.

description:
Freshly made spring rolls and good sandwiches !

Good place for fast Vietnamese food on the go downtown.
author: Mario W.

description:
This is my favorite lunch spot near my work. In fact, when I have to leave the office to purchase lunch it is always my go to. 

I have ordered the noodle bowl, the rolls and the pho. All of it is delicious. Most often I order the rolls with chicken and "the standard" veggie package. It is healthy fast (minus the long line) and always leaves me feeling... fresh! 

You can't order the pho until after 3... just a mini fyi pro tip.
author: Danielle V.

description: The lemongrass pork in a bowl and garlic shrimp spring rolls will make you salivate and crave more! I love how they let you customize the ingredients that go into your meal, and it's made fresh in an assembly-line right before your eyes. Avoid the pho/soup items if you're not a fan of MSG-flavored water. The broth missed the mark in authenticity and flavor, otherwise I'd give this place five stars!
author: Tina C.

description: Luckily stumbled on this little gem. The rolls with Lemongrass Pork and "the standard" fillings and peanut sauce is absolutely delicious!! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the service. The staff was nice and they didn't do anything wrong... They just didn't do anything great, either. But the rolls make it worth it.
author: Anjie L.

description:
I have a serious love for Vietnamese salad rolls. This place was merely ok. And for a place that's called "Freshroll" I expected a lot more. 

So I got and order of Fresh rolls, two pork and one chicken. First of all I literally waited at least 30 min for them to even take my order when I was the second person in line. To be fair the women in front of me had a ton or orders but I was barely even acknowledged. Then once they got to me they put, I swear, like maybe 3 strands of noodle in each roll. WTH?? I thought their variety of veggies and fruits to put inside it were interesting BUT mint was not an option. WHYYYY?! Overall the food was "mehhh" and I had that feeling after eating it that I wish I had gone somewhere else because it just wasn't satisfying. Maybe if they add mint to their veggie list I'll go back but until then imma pass.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Standards have already dropped. I ordered a standard Pork Banh mi online at lunctime and picked up a sandwich with gristly pork meat with only a few strands of pickled veggie on it, some cilantro and aoli. Something is missing. 
Went back a week later - ordered online and picked it up, this time a bowl. The meat is layered far underneath the vegetables so that at a cglance you cannot tell if they forgot it or how much there is. This time they didnt forget any indgredients, bu tthey skimped a bit on the pork and the mint.
As much as I love the banh mi sandwiches I wont order those anymore - just the salad bowls.
author: Nan L.

description: I thought this place was like a chain and wasn't that interested in trying it out but was in the mood for a good banh i and I got it here.  There was a convention in town so the line was out the door but they have their stuff in order and were whipping through that line.  I was impressed with how quickly they were able to make the rolls, bowls and sandwiches.  My banh mi was really tasty with fresh ingredients and my wife loved her noodle bowl.
author: Blake B.

description:
We like this place for lunch but noticed this last time, they put less filling in the rolls.  Barely any noodles and meat... they charge an extra 50 cents if you want extra pickled veggies.

Too bad another place hit by inflation!!!  =(
author: M. K.

description:
Love love the concept of this place but the taste and quality is very subpar. 

I'm very impressed with the concept because I've never seen a modern Vietnamese fast casual before. The place was clean and nice looking. I love that we get to customize what we want in our freshrolls and bowls. I love the option of adding pineapple which added a nice sweet and citrus flavor to the mix.

What I didn't like was their slow service, where they seemed to be under staffed on most nights. I thought the flavors of the meat were really bland. There was nothing exciting about them, especially the shrimp which tasted like watered-down shrimp scampi. The banh mi was very dry and definitely not worth the price. You can find much better quality banh mis down the street with better pricing as well. The pho was surpisingly not bad.

Overall I like Freshroll for the concept and fast Vietnamese food but I've had much better Vietnamese food.
author: Twitney L.

description: I had the lemongrass pork spring roll with crispy shallots and it was delicious. Get all the sauces and dip into a different one with each bite!
author: Anna H.

description: Fresh ingredients, delicious pork and chicken, quick service and filling.  What else could you ask for?
author: Kathryn C.

description:
This review is for vegetarian offering. 
I love Vietnamese food and my choice is bowl w/ tofu. At this place, I was very disappointed with their crunchy tofu. I didn't taste good at all. The 'crunchy' tasted deep-fried and very tasteless. The 'standard' additions had a poor choice of veggies compared to other locations. I recommend trying Bamboo Asia. For the same price, you get way more and tastier!
author: Tatiana G.

description: Really really nice and fresh!!!! I ordered a pork spring fresh roll. It is so great!!!! I am fall in love with the Vietnamese sauce!!!! God!!!!
author: Joanne L.

description: Tofu Banh Mi with Jasmine Lychee Tea was fresh & flavorful! Perfect quick lunch! Although there was a long line, it moved quickly & was well worth the wait. Plenty of sauces to try with convenient to-go containers. Great service all around!
author: Mei Lene Thai R.

description:
Here's an idea I wish we had back here in Texas. 

Quck, easy, custom spring rolls made a perfect dinner for a warm summer night, I tried the pho broth too and that was pretty meh. It lacked any discernible flavor. Can't say I'd recommend that as a solo dish again.
author: Josh W.

description:
I'm seriously in love with this place.  I was a visitor to the city and had a sudden craving for spring rolls.  A very good friend recommended Freshroll and I was sold the moment I walked in.  The staff were very friendly and I felt comfortable, even with a toddler in tow.  The atmosphere is open and restaurant was very clean.   We made it right before the lunch crowd, so the wait wasn't long.

I loved how I could customize my spring rolls and bowls and my order was completed fast.  My son is very picky (and impatient) and I was able to get a spring roll made to his liking.  The sauces have a unique and delicious twist and made every bite of food even more yummy. 

I highly recommend this place.  I would give it three thumbs up, if I had an extra hand.
author: Mariela K.

description: While attending Dreamforce on Howard and 4th, my friend and me wanted to grab a quick lunch so I took her to my favorite roll place! Healthy, clean (everything is made in front of you), efficient (you are in and out of the place in 7-8 min) and not too harsh on the wallet. My go to item is the Tofu spring rolls (3 pcs for $8.90). My friend opted for a Tofu bowl (which had rather chunky pieces of Tofu). On an earlier occasion, I had tried the Taro chips, I am not a fan but my hubby loved it, so I guess thats subjective.  But if i am in the area, rest assured, its ROLL time!
author: Shruti D.

description: Busy busy busy... But fast moving. I had fresh rolls with lemon grass pork- deeeeeelish, but didn't like the pineapple. Have had quite a bit experience with spring rolls and this place puts a lil different spin on them. Did not like the peanut sauce. Hubs had the Vietnamese sandwich . He liked it... But prefers the rolls or noodle dish. They need to have someone wash down the tables.
author: Evie B.

description: Fresh ingredients and crisp chicken, but a bit pricey for the portions. Nothing particularly amazing.
author: Samantha C.

description:
3.5 stars.

This place is great and convenient if you are going to Target and want a quick place to eat.  It's literally around $3 per spring roll, and there is nothing extremely special about the spring rolls besides the fact that they have pineapples in them.

Ultimately, come here if you want 1) fast, 2) mediocre and 3) convenience.
author: Andrew H.

description:
This is what happens when I go downtown with my boyfriend:

me: "Fresh rolls time!"
him: "No, not again. Let's try something new."
me: "Noooo. It is healthy AND sooooo goooooodd!"
him: "Ugh fine."
EAT
him: "Good choice, babe"

I even went here when I was working from home and I live in the lower haight. Is it just me? Did they slip an addictive substance in my roll when I was not looking? I get the 3 rolls, pork, basil, other stuff, THE CRISPY GOODNESS and AVOCADO. Taro chips please. Sometimes a soda. My fav downtown place to eat. Only thing: I wish you would add mint to the list of items.
author: Melanie S.

description:
I am a big fan of this little place. Fresh, flavorful, and rolled to order. The line can be long around lunch time so go early. You can order on-line but I recommend having it rolled while you wait. 

Shout out to the staff. They are quick, eager to please and always smiling.
author: W B.

description:
After walking past Freshroll a few times, I decided to try it today for lunch.  There was a bit of a line, but it went by very quickly.  I'm guessing this is partially because the menu is so easy to figure out.  

Step 1:  Pick your style: either fresh rolls, a bowl, or a sandwich
Step 2: Pick your protein: pork, chicken, shrimp, tofu
Step 3: Pick your veggies
Step 4: Pick your sauce

The staff is super friendly.  I ordered the fresh rolls with chicken and with the "standard" veggies (lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, jalepenos, pineapple).  It comes with 3 rolls which is PLENTY.  The price for the 3 rolls was only $7.95, which is awesome!  I was even pretty full after eating 2.  It's a "subway style" type of place, perfect for health-conscious people on-the-go.  Even if you aren't health-conscious, or on-the-go, check out this place.

I took mine to-go but you can eat there.  Going home and biting into that crunchy fresh spring roll, tasting the spicy jalepenos with the sweet pineapple, caused me to open my laptop right away and give this place a well-deserved 5 stars.


I WILL be back.
author: Juliana K.

description: Lunchtime Banh Mi. Actually I walked in thinking pho was on the menu, since I had a hankering, but apparently that's only available after 3 PM on weekdays. So adeptly switching to sandwich mode, I put in for the pork version. It's effectively Chipotle for Vietnamese food (can't you just hear the elevator pitch now?), but they did a nice job on the sandwich. Try the homemade ice tea--Lychee flavored!
author: Michael F.

description: Nice place.  A bit dirty, but it was the lunch rush.  My bread was pretty cold and hard.  I think we can during a shift change as well.
author: Audra L.

description:
I'm the type of guy who likes to frequent the same places often, and it is hard to get me to try new places. My co workers and I were at the Metreon recently buying holiday decorations and of course were hungry after.

Freshroll is a fantastic part of the "new" Metreon. Freshroll faces Moscone Center West and the 4th Street parking garage. I highly recommend stoping by there for a bite to eat next time you are downtown!

The place is clean, which is a big plus; the decor is white and green, think of an Apple Store for Spring Rolls. As I said, I am a creature of habit so when I go, I order three 3 Spring-rolls with one of each "protein" (shrimp, pork and chicken). Add your choice of greens, pick your favorite sauce (3 types as mentioned in other reviews) and you are good to go!

I feel full after eating at Freshroll, and not bloated like I just knoshed on a Burger or pizza slice. Its a healthy place for lunch or dinner, prices are right and location is superior.
author: Alexias L.

description: quick, fresh and delicious served with a smile, room to sit in or out, just what I wanted.
author: Christopher T.

description:
fresh rolls with chicken - just hold the fried shrimp things and dont dip in the peanut sauce and its GF!
bowl with lemongrass pork over greens
also GF but i didnt ask about pork seasoning.. 

double check if you are here but if you can tolerate traces of gluten and just trying cut bread grains - this is your place!
no gluten 
no msg
new favorite place
hate cilantro and love how everything is custom made so i could have it taken out!
everything clearly labeled for vegan or gluten!

and totally yummy and flavorful
author: Win H.

description:
Love this place. It's like a Vietnamese Chipotle. Can't wait for my new office nearby so I can enjoy this place even more.

Have to dock one star since they don't have Vietnamese egg rolls :(
author: Lee R.

description:
The rolls were great. I am a big fan of traditional Vietnamese cuisine, so my rolls were very simple. But they do have a good selection of ingredients if you are looking for a more modern/fusion taste.

I also got a side of the pho broth. This could be better. The broth was on the bland and simple side. Simple chicken stock. Nothing really to talk about.

I would want to come here again to try out the other menu items!

Note: This place ALWAYS has long lines during the lunch hour.
author: Eric C.

description:
Nothing wrong with this place.  The food is great: they have tons of ways to customize your rolls, from different meats to vegetables to sauces.  Everything is fresh and high quality, including the meat.  They also offer bowls and sandwiches, plus taro chips and pho broth.  

Pro tip: get the "nom nom" sauce, which is the spread they use for the sandwiches, as a dipping sauce for your rolls.  It's the jam.
author: Jace P.

description: Very good bowl of pho. I ordered the chicken pho and is amazed by the tenderness of it. Taste of the soup and noodle is awesome. Best of all, located next to Moscone and still offers affordable prices! Will definitely visit again next time when I have conference here.
author: Arthur H.

description:
Vietpotle---you yelpers are so clever with words. I'm an obstinate beast of a writer, so I'll dubb it Viet-way. But I know deep down Viet-potle does it better.

Anyway, its ok. Questionable freshness at an eye's glance but I still enjoyed the rolls immensely. You have four choices: pork, chicken, steak or tofu. Ignoring the last one we got two orders of 3 of the meats each and went to see Hobbitt next door at the Metreon. We always worry about smuggling food into the movie but Freshroll made it easy to get in with the flat "to go" cases they give you for the orders. They make sauces as well and Jamie M. enjoyed the Vietnamese vinaigrette, whereas I preferred the Home peanut (I assume home-*made*...it was good but seemed to lack sweetness).

The restaurant itself is clean and they even have meal deals you can get for $3 and the drinks for the those meal deals, if I remember correctly, have nothing to do with coke, but with teas and lemonade. Interesting.
author: Davey R.

description: A nice, healthy alternative to sandwiches and soups in this area. Ingredients are fresh, but rolling skills vary. More often than not, the rolls fall apart, so I opt for the bowl now. The limeade and Vietnamese iced coffee are pre-made and sitting in large dispensers. This may be OK for the limeade but it's a bad idea for the iced coffee. I had to throw it away after one sip; it was that nasty.
author: Aurora C.

description: The food is tasty and fresh but there is often a long line around lunch time. The location is really convenient since it's right by the metreon so it's a nice spot to get a casual bite to eat.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Pleasantly surprised! Get the rolls and you will be happy! Get the Pho and... well just don't get the Pho...

My wife and I were walking out of the AMC and looking for a place to eat lunch. We saw Freshroll and decided to try it out, and we were pleasantly surprised! 

We loved he fact you can "build" your own freshroll and rice bowls. The vegetables were fresh, the meat was marinated well, and the sauces were tasty.  

The only item that was disappointing was the Pho. Just not as good as other places. I would give the Pho a 3 Star.
author: John C.

description: Very tasty, fast and cheap. Reminds me of a Chipotle but with Vietnamese flavored. Not authentic but very tasty. For two, we were under $20. The cucumber water is a nice touch.
author: Alison M.

description: Maybe I'm too asian for this place, or maybe it's that they took a third of my lunch time just wrapping the roll.  The guy at the register saw how long it was taking and just took over and redid it.  Plus I think it's a little pricey for what it is..just stop by a hole in the wall Vietnamese place and you can probably get something much better for less.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I gotta say this place is good. American style Vietnamese food but you can't beat the taste. Sandwiches are toasted just right and the meat is moist. If you go with the rolls get the garlic shrimp. Super tasty. 

Bill came out to about $20 with a drink so a little prover side but it's expected as it's next to the metreon.
author: Darryl S.

description: I got the rolls with pork and they were good, a bit pricey though. But guess you can't really beat those cheap Vietnamese establishments in the Viet areas...
author: Trang P.

description: Best fresh spring rolls ever!! Would love to bring friends and visit again!! They have a variety of different rolls and the place is really clean. Very nice staff too. All in all, a very nice place to grab a quick bite with a lot of choices!
author: Li E.

description: Delicious food. Fast service. Nice people. You can really get whatever you want so I highly recommend it for lunch in this area.
author: Audrey S.

description:
More like 3.5 stars, since I can't call myself a fan of Freshroll. I'd go back if I wanted something light. Nothing great, nothing bad either, just overall good. 

$7.95 for 3 rolls. Extra 75 cents for the Crispy Goodness... or is it called Good Crispiness? I forgot. It looks like a thin, loosely rolled up dumpling wrapper with a single scallion strand inside, fried, and then stuck into each spring roll. Adds crunch to every bite, but don't expect to taste any scallion. Plenty of lettuce inside each roll, but I don't understand why they put so little vermicelli; the equivalent of 3 white sticks after eating 3 tootsie roll pops, why bother?

Got the Gramma Peanut Sauce. Creamy, smooth. A little more flavor in the sauce would've been perfect.

You get your choice of protein: Lemongrass Pork, Chicken, Tofu, or Shrimp (for an additional $2). I got the pork, better than I expected!

It's no Brodards, but worth a try if you're in the area.
author: Ethan L.

description: This place is great! It has superb sandwiches and bowls that leave your mouth craving for more. It is a great venue to relax at before seeing a movie or even WWDC as both are right next door. Enjoy!
author: Rob G.

description:
After my discovery of this cute little lunch place, I've been coming here every chance I get. 

Chipotle style, where you pick your ingredients and you watch them put it all together for you, it's nice to be able to customize your lunch. I always order the rolls, you can mix and match the type of meat, and add as much as you want of your favorite veggies. Don't forget the crispy goodness! The bowl is about the same...except way more noodles. Sandwiches look tiny so I never felt compelled to give them a try. 

Clean, friendly, delicious! Lines can get a little long during peak lunch times. Minus one star because it is considered a little pricey for Vietnamese food when you can buy something similar for half the price. However, for a downtown/FIDi spot it's about right.
author: Vivian D.

description: Quick and convenient. Fast food Vietnamese style. Don't go for the atmosphere and try not to watch them prepare the food but it's pretty tasty for the price.
author: Debra R.

description:
This is like Chipotle for Viet food. I like.

First you choose:
- Spring roll
- Sandwich
- Bowl

Then you choose the protein:
- Lemongrass pork
- Chicken
- Garlic Shrimp
- Tofu

Then you choose the veggies (which is a whole long list).

Then you choose the sauce:
- Peanut
- Viet Vinaigrette
- Sweet & Sour 
- Citrus Ginger

The pork bowl with extra green onion is delicious. The sandwich is kind of small and is double the price of a Viet sandwich you can get somewhere else, but this place is new and clean, which I like.
author: Jeanie F.

description:
Brilliant idea for quick and healthy Vietnamese fast food. Fresh spring rolls are so refreshing. 3 rolls can fill you up. I personally like the crispy tofu spring rolls. Dipping sauces are fun to try out for the first time. The tangy citrus ginger sauce reminds me of Japanese ponzu sauce. Peanut sauce is also good and lighter than what you have at typical Vietnamese shops although it's a little bit on the sweet side. 

Freshroll is perfect for a pre-theater meal because you won't be moving much over the next two hours!
author: Saran R.

description:
I was there right before the closing hours and...

The staff was really nice, even 10 minutes before closing, which is something I tend to find rare nowadays.

The food was awesome. 
It was exactly the right amount of everything, and everybody around me, vietnamese or not, enjoyed it.

The price was also a big plus. Finding that kind of healthy and tasty food for 8$ is also getting rare in SF these days!

I would definitely recommend anybody to go there!
author: Quentin D.

description:
A little pricy for what it is, but they have good ingredients. Very clean and minimalist decor with friendly staff. 

The bowl is tasty and filling even for my boyfriend who can eat a lot. I got the wraps that come in three. I ordered a tofu, shrimp and lemongrass pork. The shrimp costs more (an additional $1.25), and is pretty tasty, but not worth the additional charge. I would go with the pork. Tofu is not bad, too.
author: Michelle N.

description: Came back a second time and had to bump them up a star. The chicken rolls were even better than the pork or shrimp, and the gm had the same smile as the other day. Good work
author: Bree V.

description:
I really like this place! It's clean, modern, quick and the food is fresh and tasty!

We ordered the Freshrolls (3 rolls) with garlic shrimp. You can pick lemongrass pork, garlic shrimp, grilled chicken, or crispy tofu to put in your rolls, banh mi, or in your bowl. You actually can get each of the 3 rolls with something different. So ours had garlic shrimp with the standard veggies  which was lettuce, carrots, sprouts, pineapple, and some other stuff. We added some crispified onion to our Freshrolls. We also got a lemongrass pork banh mi and a jasmine iced tea. 

 The rolls were very fresh and tasty. I've never tasted them with pinapple before but I thought they were a nice addition. I also really enjoyed the sauces. They have citrus ginger, Vietnamese viniagrette (fish sauce), peanut sauce, and sweet and sour sauce. I think that the citrus ginger sauce was my favorite. The banh mi was tasty. The meat had a lot of flavor and the bread was fresh with just the right texture. My husband and I were both stuffed to the gills after our meal. The jasmine iced tea was very refreshing. 

Freshroll is great place to grab a quick and healthy meal around the Metreon. The customer service is spot on and we even shook hands with the owner, who made sure we were taken care of. We'll definitely be back!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Of all of my wonderful meals during my recent trip to SF, this one was one of my favorites. I order the three fresh rolls (pork, chicken, tofu), and I was pleasantly surprised. I'm a meat-and-potatoes guy, and the flavor a here were top notch. My favorite was the tofu!
author: Tom K.

description:
Vietnamese fast food with Chipotle-style ordering process? Sounded interesting, but ended up being nothing special. You can find better Vietnamese food anywhere in the Tenderloin, for much cheaper. The appeal of Freshroll is the customization of your meal, but that can only get you so far.

I got the Lemongrass Pork Vermicelli Noodle Bowl with Peanut Sauce. It was just okay. The lemongrass pork was a little tough and overcooked, but had a good lemongrass flavor to it. The vermicelli here is a bit thicker than it should be, which basically means that you need much more sauce to compensate for the natural blandness of plain vermicelli. I added the fried scallion, which definitely improved the overall taste of the bowl with a nice crispy texture. 

Freshroll is watered-down, generic Vietnamese food. If I'm basing it solely on the Vietnamese flavor, Freshroll just doesn't cut it. Great idea and layout, but boring and mediocre Vietnamese flavor.
author: Roy C.

description:
Freshroll is a fast food restaurent, done Vietnamese-American style influenced by Chipotle's ordering system. 

You pick a bowl, a roll or a sandwich,
then pick a protein: Tofu, Pork, Chicken or Shrimp,
then add or subtract toppings and/or sauces

The portions here are small compared to their inflated price of $5-$9 per item, it is clean inside, fairly quick to get your order. Freshroll is good by SF standards for Vietnamese food, but it is not good by any East San Jose standards (where there is a huge Vietnamese population, really amazing Vietnamese food).
author: Shannon Z.

description: Really neat place, and food is affordable yet delish. Their shrimp roll, however, is not worth the $2 extra. It simply was not as good as the Lemongrass Pork. My gosh that pork roll was amazing. The crispy tofu roll was alright, but i would get the chicken grill instead in  a heartbeat. They didnt say anything when i planked, so i like their customer service. just kidding. They are actually really nice :) Check out the bathroom too to wash your hands.. their faucet is ridiculous.
author: Eva Z.

description:
Summary: Great concept, stale food

I love Vietnamese spring rolls, so when I found a place that specializes in them I was understandably excited. Unfortunately my mouth was disappointed when I bit in. The ingredients just aren't fresh, and that makes all the difference with these rolls. The wrapper & noodles were chewy and the meat was cold & tough, no doubt from sitting out for too long.

The sauces were pretty good though, so that helped. Overall a "meh".
author: Max Z.

description:
I'm really wary of trendy new places with all 5 star reviews, but damn I love this place. I'm sure everyone has expressed this, but what Chipotle is for Mexican food, Freshroll is for fresh Vietnamese rolls. I am only reviewing the rolls, not the bowls. 

I loved everything about my rolls. I had the BBQ chicken with lettuce, noodles, cucumbers, sprouts, and cilantro, and I tried the peanut sauce as well as the house vinaigrette. 

Damn. You wouldn't think it was anything special, but something about it was just perfectly what I was craving - light, flavorful, fresh, and just food you can feel good about eating.

Friendly staff, great location, and (as embarrassed I am to admit it) one of my new favorite places.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Ok after trying both the pork banh mi and a pork rice bowl I think I have to upgrade them to four stars as they have definitely made it into my regular lunch rotation.

While I'm still not 100% sold on the rolls, the other items work well, the pork is juicy and flavorful, and ingredients are fresh. They aren't part of "the standard" veggies, but don't forget to get the pickled vegetables added (no extra cost).

The assembly people are still not the best, kind of slow and they have some trouble rolling the rolls still, but hopefully this will improve as they get more experienced.

I'm not sure if it wasn't there before or I just didn't notice it, but they do now also have an extra meat option. It's kind of pricy but a friend got the rolls with extra pork and they looked pretty delicious. 

Unlike many of the lunch options in soma, freshroll won't leave you feeling super unhealthy/stuffed, good to have that in the rotation.
author: Ely L.

description:
I go for:

The salad with tofu, all the standard fixings plus basil, sprouts, and a couple of other toppings that I'm currently forgetting. I like the Vietnamese vinaigrette and the sweet and sour sauce (you can get them both). 

It's a large, filling, and fairly healthy meal. Only thing they need to get their act together with is how long it takes them to make their meals. It might be the Chipotle of Vietnamese, but it's definitely lacking their speed.
author: Allison S.

description:
I've noticed there's a bunch of restaurants with this style popping up everywhere. When I say this style, i mean the chipotle/subway/spice kit kind of restaurant where you line up and choose your toppings. I really enjoy this place because 1) it's spring rolls and I'm vietnamese 2) It's fast and convenient 3) It's relatively healthy and most importantly 4) it's tasty. 

Must haves:
Pork, it's definitely the best tasting of all the meats there but I'd give everything a try since rolls come in 3's.
author: William L.

description:
Disappointing.

Walking by and hangry, I saw a huge line out the door and thought, 'man, this place must be GREAT!' So I stepped in line and committed. I waited for 20 minutes with an audibly grumbling stomach and high hopes. But alas, they were dashed when I tried my bbq pork noodle bowl.

The bbq pork was great...highly flavorful and slightly charred (in a good way) but everything else was meh. The noodles were super slimy, the vegetables limp and not quite fresh. The bowl seemed hastily put together with odd proportions of the different components. I also KNOW it was hastily put-together since it was made in front of me. I understand why--during lunch it's a long line Chipotle-style and the workers are rushed. But I think ratio is important...especially when I'm paying so much! Maybe Chipotle-style doesn't work for Vietnamese food.

Overall, Freshroll did not taste fresh and there's no chance I'm going back when there are plenty of hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese places that are better and cheaper. :o(
author: Lissy R.

description:
Love this place!  It's so hard to find good, fast Vietnamese food in SF (I would know, I'm Vietnamese :) + in a clean and friendly location.  But Freshroll's location is bright, you can see them making the spring rolls and sandwiches and it's clean -- bonus!  Most importantly, everything I've had here is DELISH.  

In the past week, I've tried everything on the menu.  Now I can say, the spring rolls are fresh and crunchy -- shrimp is my fave, the banh mi is perfectly toasted and perfectly buttered (mm mmm) -- pork is my fave, and the tea is amazing!!  

This spot is turning into my weekly habit...
author: Anh D.

description: Super fresh and tasty. The veggies are crisp and delicious. Only reason I don't give 5 stars is because of pretty slow service.
author: Amy S.

description:
I've been going to this place since the grand opening.  A few months ago, I would have rated this higher.  

Then
-Rice bowls get stuffed with a good heap of rice and lots of meat; could barely close the lid
-Rolls were kind of on the small side
-Lines were medium long and wait was about 10-15 min (throughput of 1 person/30-40 sec)

Now
-Rice bowls have about 0.5-1.0 inch space from the top because they give much less rice and meat
-Rolls seem to have a little more meat
-Lines were medium long, but wait has become longer; 20-25 minutes (throughput of 1 person/minute+)


Unfortunately, I'm the bowl type of guy and they seemed to have adjusted the serving size of my favorite item.  So now the value is much less.  But what killed it was the 20-25 minute wait with about 15 people in front of me.  

|--Yelpers: stop reading here--|


Did you guys become less efficient or was it just one of those days?  I stared at your assembly line, and there's always a bottleneck at the veggies and cash register section, with the rice/rice paper server running back and forth from the veggie station to help of the the traffic jam at the veggie station.

Recommendation:  Beginning of Line
Also, I recommend you find a better way to hold your spring roll rice paper stack.  The stack was held upright in a silver tin.  The server gets her glove wet when she dips the paper in water.  However, when she goes to grab more papers, the entire stack gets wet.  As a result, the entire stack ultimately sticks together.  After 10 seconds of watching the server struggling to separate the wet stack of rice papers, I see her toss the entire thing in the garbage and. I'd say at least 10-15 of rice papers were wasted.  That's about 3-5 orders right there.  Now I know that those cost less than a dollar, but why waste if you have to?  

Maybe beforehand, layout some wax paper (or any thin sheet) and place three spring roll sheets on it.  Create a big stack of these sets.  Then, when ready to use, just grab a set, lay it on your cutting board, and slide the paper off leaving the spring roll sheets on the board.  Reuse the wax paper.  This way, you don't waste any sheets and it's faster to put onto the cutting board.  Downside?  Requires preparation in advance.  But I think benefits outweigh the cost, because the savings you have from throwing away the spring roll papers probably pays for itself.  

Recommendation: Middle Part of Line
Also, you have to fix the veggie station.  It's just not working.  The problem I see is that a customer sticks with a single server, who is responsible for grabbing all the veggies and custom making that order.  The problem is that brings variance where one customer will almost always take a different amount of time than the other, so you get a traffic jam that just builds up.  

What you need to do is copy Chipotle.  No, you are not doing what Chipotle is.  There's a key difference.  In Chipotle, the server is responsible for his area of ingredients, not for sticking with the customer.  If you really think about it, each guy does one section of ingredients, whether it's the bean section or the salsa section or the lettuce/guac section and passes it on.  I suggest that you rearrange your veggie station and don't duplicate it into two.  Have one section where the veggies are arranged in a row.  

For example, have heavier/larger items such as cucumber, lettuce, pineapple at the beginning.   Then have the end of section as garnishes to put on top.  Have one server responsible for this first half, and then have her pass it on to the next server to fill out  the rest of the order.  Traffic jam?  Whoever is less busy, just help the other.   Right now, the two servers are jumping over one another and sticking with the same customer through the line.  


Recommendation: End of Line
It baffles me that with all the jamming in the veggie station, that there's another jam at the cash register.  That, I can't figure out.  I was probably too annoyed by the wait to pay attention to what's going on.  You guys use Square, which should be fast.  So I don't know you're jammed up here.  I think you guys print out a receipt and require us to sign?  Why not just skip that part?  Lots of other places ask the customer for a receipt and the response is almost always no.  This saves a ton of time. 


Whew.  This review will probably go unread, but at least I'm trying to be constructive here, which is more than I can say about many other Yelpers.  Put back your sign that says 'please be patient as we're still learning' and try adjusting.  Also, please put more ingredients in your bowls.
author: Jon K.

description:
Cool concept, poor execution. Way too many people on the assembly line and all of them are really slow. I had to repeat my order to each new person and when I finally got to the end, I was stuck with a slow cashier. This total process took 10 mins. When I finally sat down to eat and took my first bite, I was highly disappointed. The pork, while having good flavor, was really bad quality (very fatty) and it was pretty much cold. Not even room temperature.. Noodles were ok and the veggies were ok, but for some reason, the overall taste was just lacking. 

Too bad about this place. Maybe they'll make it better, but for me, the first impression was bad enough. There are way too many viet restaurants in this city to waste my time here. Plus, the price tag at this place for a bowl of pork vermicelli infuriates me. 

Won't be back.
author: Jen D.

description: Serves well in a pinch, but it's a bit overpriced for what it is--pretty basic Vietnamese-ish food. It can be pretty packed when a big convention is in town.
author: roger t.

description:
My wife just said, "I wish we had one of these next to our house." I concur. 

As it is, we will still make the trek downtown and come here again - definitely!

I got the 3 fresh rolls for $7.95, with chicken and pork. I really liked the peanut sauce (I mixed it with the Sriracha and Sweet and Sour Chili sauce for maximum flavor and spicyness!) and ate 2 rolls for a good sized meal. The price is RIGHT, folks. I have a 3rd roll for later tonight! I'm taking it home!

My wife got the fresh bowl with grilled chicken and broth. It's also priced under 7 bucks. Good one, fresh roll! :)

Yummy yummy for a great price.
author: Toby B.

description:
I can be incredibly picky (read: a snob) when it comes to fast-food places but I was pleasantly surprised with Freshroll. So much that I came in twice in one weekend!

As other reviewers have commented, the place is clean, bright, and modern.

The first time I stopped in was out of mere curiosity.  It was mid afternoon and I wasn't hungry but had heard a lot of buzz about the place.  I opted for the Vietnamese Iced Coffee which was delicious, though on the darker side of the Vietnamese coffees that I've had before.

The second time, I really wanted to try the food so I got a freshroll with pork and the standard fixings.  The girl assembling it seemed to sense my hesitation (I had some trouble locating the list of what was included in the standard) and asked to confirm whether I really wanted jalapenos.  Good thing she did, because I definitely didn't!  She even suggested the Crispy Goodness, which really is just that - pure crispy goodness if you like a little crunch in your bite.

The pork was very flavorful and moist.  I highly recommend the Crispy Goodness and the pineapple (included in the standard) really adds another dimension to the roll.  Going with the standard fixings was a great combo/ratio of tastes and textures. I got the iced tea to accompany it which I enjoyed more than the coffee (what can I say, I'm a southern girl).

Overall, a great experience. A great, flavorful, healthy meal that you could eat daily + attentive, pleasant staff.  Can't complain!
author: Sonha H.

description: Absolutely delicious.  Great prices and neat how it's Chipotle-like but with Vietnamese food.  Great place to go to if you want great Vietnamese food but don't want to spend too much.
author: Abby G.

description:
A new fast food restaurant that's opened up in the revitalized Metreon, I've noticed this place a few times over the past two months, but only managed to get in for the first time today when two of my coworkers suggested we head over there. 

There's not a lot of options... you can get rolls, sandwiches or bowls.
