Four sources of protein are offered, but then there's a lot of options for toppings (sauces, veggies, fresh herbs, even some types of fruit!) You can also pick out some sides such as chips, veggies or broth. Everything is freshly made in front of you.

What else can I say about this place other than *it's delicious*? I ordered the crispy tofu on a sandwich with standard toppings, and I was seriously ecstatic about the taste. I've never had tofu on a sandwich taste good until today, and I'd be more than happy to get this in rolls as well. My only complaint is that I wish I'd had a larger sandwich since it was so good!

The lineup is pretty long and can look intimidating but it moves pretty quick and the food is worth the wait!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Food was good.  Had their sandwich.  They use good ingredients.   Organic meats and veggies. So their prices reflect that.   Pho was smooth and not gamey tasting.  Good quick food.
author: Robert K.

description:
Color me surprised, I loved this place.

Now, I went on a Sunday afternoon, so I can't comment on the business lunch rush as things moved pretty quickly.  I got a tofu bahn mi sandwich and was so satisfied: just right portion; bright, fresh, crunchy vegetables and herbs; nicely fried tofu; zesty sauce; fresh bread....  I was so happy with this.  The only wrinkle was I wasn't allowed to say which veg I wanted, despite the signs telling me I could.  What's that about?

Another huge plus is that it's open all day.  You weekend warriors know what I'm talking about, when you've got an all day ride or a midday match and are starving at 3PM...  A lot of places are closed, and so I bet you'll find me here more often than not.
author: Monica R.

description: I came here based upon the yelp reviews and really enjoyed my three fresh rolls for a quick inexpensive and delicious lunch. Pick from a selection of four different fillings, and you can choose it as a sandwich, roll or bowl. They are made up the order and you can add additional toppings. I had extra lime and cilantro on mine and it was delicious.
author: Ron C.

description:
I intentionally held out writing a Yelp Review until I experienced Freshroll, which was destined to be my first. I first met the owner of Freshroll in 2007 when we worked together in finance, and from the beginning his game plan was to open a Vietnamese restaurant. He never deviated from that game plan, and in 2012 is living out his dream.

Having traveled throughout Vietnam a few years ago, I can safely say the best Vietnamese food is in the centrally-located city of Hue. Not surprising given the quality of Freshroll's offering, the owner's family is from Hue, Vietnam.

I wanted to get a good sampling and so I got both the pork sandwich as well as shrimp fresh roll (also known as "goi guon"). The pork sandwich was absolutely fantastic; one of the best Vietnamese sandwiches I've ever had and without a shadow of a doubt the best I've had in the US. I wasn't as much of a fan of the freshroll, but I think that would be a bi-product of: 1) I'm a goi guon snob and my bar is extremely high, and 2) I had just had the sandwich and there existed a psychological diminishing marginal returns factor, and it was tough to maintain that level of satisfaction the sando gave me.

Net-net, Freshroll is a place an excellent Vietnamese lunch that someone can get at a reasonable price. I'd recommend showing up either early (11:30) or late (2:00) because the line will get fairly long fairly quickly.
author: William R.

description:
We swung by here for some quick food after a show. This place was fast and filling. While a little apprehensive at first about how filling rolls would be, I was happy to be proven otherwise. I had two pork rolls and a chicken roll with everything in them. Their sauces were the perfect complement to the rolls.

The place has a very modern feel down to the iPad cash registers. The staff was fast and very friendly. The entire front is glass which is great for  watching the occasional crack head walk by.
author: Adrian S.

description:
*** Low Down***
My Vietnamese friends call this place a Vietnamese restaurant for white people lol. I don't care, I'm white HA! It's tasty and healthy. Very fast service too. They have enough staff working their butts off like a well oiled machine getting customers serviced quickly. 

***Show Down***
Flavorful meats.  Fresh ingredients. I come here for lunch often as its conveniently located near the Metreon. I've had the three spring roll meal as well as the bowls with brown rice. So delicious and under 10 bucks. Can't beat that!
author: Tara T.

description:
Quite good spring roles, the only problem is that the roles rip sometimes when you add extra veggies. HOpefully they solve this problem. But flavors are fresh, good penut sauce andf tasty food.
3 roles will fill you up.

The sandwhich they have is also very good, great sauce. 

The Pho is ok.
author: Dakin G.

description:
The bottom line is that the food here is pretty good.  I got one of their pork bowls which was loaded high with all sorts of delicious veggies and made to order.  The price was also reasonable for the quantity of food that you got:  around 8.50 for a very filling lunch.  I also want to go back to try their freshrolls, because they looked delicious.

The problem is the wait took FOREVER.  Around lunch time.  I think all told it was around 35 minutes from when we got in line to when we got our food.  At that rate it would have just made more sense for us to go to a sit down restaurant.

I imagine if you're around the financial district after 3:00 this place would be a great option for inexpensive dinner.  However, avoid Freshroll at all costs if you are just looking for a quick lunch.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
We were in the mood for a healthy dinner. Our group of three elected to order the following:

-an order of fresh rolls to share
-noodle bowl
-two banh mis

Everything tasted freshly prepared and was well-flavored without being overly so. The bill for everything was ~$35 or about $8 per item. 

Good portion sizes. The bread for the banh mis could have been crispier, but bread tasted fresh so not a big deal. 

Will order from here again!
author: Wendy L.

description: Girlfriend and I went to this place for dinner before watching Gaurdians of the Galaxy. Her roommate recommended it and we haven't had any viet food in a while. Pretty much a Vietnamese Chipotle/subway/have-it-your-way type of deal where you can customize your orders. I had the pork spring rolls and my lady had the chicken Pho. Definitely on point and I also enjoyed their Lychee tea and Taro chips! Will come back for a 2nd round one day.
author: Ryan V.

description:
I thought I would love this place because one, I love Vietnamese food, and two, I love healthy food...but it was just okay based on the rolls.

I was starving on a Friday before a movie and gosh, there was a line. But I was determined to wait--line is good at food places! As I watch the staffs put the rolls together, I was disappointed how little vermicelli they put in...about the size of a quarter!  But it's okay, because they do put generous amount of protein and lettuce. I was very eager to taste the meat and tofu, so I got three with one of each. They offer different sides and greens for you to put into the rolls. I got everything except for pineapple and bean sprouts.

Chicken: The most flavorful of all. It was juicy, it was tender. Yum! 
Tofu: Crispy but hmm, really bland. It would be great if they season the tofu a bit.
Pork: I see marinades and lemongrass but I couldn't really taste it. 

I got them with the traditional sauce, and it was delicious. The staffs were very nice, but I wish they weren't very consistent in whatever they put in the rolls. I also wish they could put the rolls together a little faster. Nevertheless, I am going to go back to try the bahn mi next time.
author: Mandy C.

description: I think the food here is very good. I usually get the bowl with double meat, with all the toppings. Makes it super filling and fresh. Sometimes there are a lot of people there and the line is long, but thats usually when there is conference right around the corner. My favorite is the lemongrass pork, and the pineapple complements it so well.
author: Bryan M.

description: This place is quick, fresh, simple and most importantly delish! I got a bowl with vermicelli noodles, grilled chicken, pineapple, basil, scallion, pickled veg, and avocado. Regardless of other reviews all of my veggies and add ins were fresh abc not stale nor was the meat dried out. The citrus ginger sauce and Vietnamese vinegarette was really good! Also the house made taro chips are gooood.
author: Jesse D.

description:
Stopped by for lunch and ordered the Meat Lovers in a 3-roll. LEGIT.

+Pork and chicken were moist and tasty 
+Jalapenos bring the subtle kick
+PINEAPPLE. 
+Peanut sauce was just right.
+Vietnamese iced coffee. Smooth like a baby's bottom.
+Lots of sunlight from the huge windows
+PINEAPPLE.

Next time I'm gonna try some of the other sauces and the GOROLLA!
author: Kelly H.

description:
The new SF Metreon is pretty dope. It's not the easiest place for me to get to, but it looks promising and so does Freshroll. I ventured in here just out of curiosity, because sometimes I find franchise-looking ethnic offerings to be more cleanly in appearance, and less greasy when it comes to the actual food (not entirely true, of course).

I love Vietnamese spring rolls. I've tried a lot of them, but here's the difference: 
1. Really really fresh ingredients
2. The pineapple in my Californian gave it a nice zing
3. I don't normally see some of these ingredients in the normal Viet joint and they worked well, like the bell peppers
4. Gotta do the peanut sauce! I mean, I love my fish sauce (Vietnamese Vinaigrette here), too
5. Big smiles from employees always a good sign. I felt welcome.
author: David W.

description:
Fresh Roll makes my lunch for me often. I love that I can order and customize the rolls/bowls/salads from my desk and then pick them up right at the counter avoiding the long lines. 

I normally get the rolls or salad without noodles and it is one of the healthiest options you can around the Metreon with a bevy of fresh vegetable options and grilled chicken or pork. If you're really hungry you can double the protein or add avocado. The sauce is pretty key as without them the rolls lack a lot of flavor but there are plenty of options and vats of siracha to help with that. I'd love to see them expand and offer more locations.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Fresh, Clean, Delicious and Customer Service was just awesome. 
I can see why some folks had complained about the speed because if you come during rush hour (12-1PM), it is really busy...reality is, if a place has good food, it'll always be busy so try to get there when it opens at 11:30AM or call in and place an order for pick-up. Easy Peasy! 

My favorite on the menu is lemongrass pork vermicelli bowl, and the rolls! If you're carb conscious, ask for half noodles and extra veggies. Chicken was good too and my co-workers raved about the vegetarian rolls.
author: Swan D.

description: AMAZING! So fresh, made on the spot, very hygienic place. Rolls are amazing, recommend pork, chicken and pork with peanut sauce. And beef soup! so happy i stumbled upon this place. Highly recommend!
author: Stef M.

description:
Fantastic idea - rice paper rolls, rice bowls, or pho.  Pick your ingredients and watch it put together Chipotle / Subway style.

Great vegan options.

Need to open up more locations - preferably in Arizona.
author: Gregory L.

description:
This place is a gem because it has the option of online ordering-- a must-have during the lunch time crowd!  

I've tried the noodle bowl and the spring rolls, both are a good size and fresh.  The pork is very good, tangy but savory.  There's also a variety of sauces to try.  My fave is the peanut sauce!  Staff is always friendly even on a busy day.  My only complaint is the price...I wish it didn't cost around $9 for spring rolls.
author: Rose D.

description: Vietnamese is totally the new Mexican! This place is awesome and reminds me of an Asian style Chipotle. You can order rolls, pho, or a sandwich and they are all customizable at the order station. They have yummy fillings like crispy tofu, cilantro, red bell pepper, pineapple, basil, jalapenos, and bean sprouts. The pho is amazing, but only available after 3pm M-F. The rolls come with 3 per order and they also have homemade taro chips as a side dish. The best part of Freshroll? The sauce station with Sriracha, peanut sauce, and a variety of others.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
Perfect place for #fitgirls and #spitfires looking for super healthy food on the go.

I recommend:

Brown Rice Bowl with Grilled Chicken
Brown Rice Bowl with Shrimp
Brown Rice Bowl with Tofu

or

Salad Bowl with Grilled Chicken
Salad Bowl with Shrimp
Salad Bowl with Tofu

And then - pile on the veggies! They have lettuce, bean sprouts, cilantro, cucumbers, pineapple, jalapenos, bell pepper, basil, scallions, and carrots. 

I ordered a brown rice + chicken bowl with tons of veggies and loved it. It was a little "heavy" on the brown rice (the portion size is huge) so I gave the rest to my boyfriend to finish. 

Love this place and its variety of healthy options and will definitely be back.
author: Erin P.

description:
Freshroll has busted down the door and entered into my weekly lunch rotation. And for good reason because if you are looking for a light, flavorful and new twist on lunch, Freshroll gets the job done! 

When entering Freshroll, the modular menu is similar to a Chipotle style option, as you have the ability to choose the type of lunch (Bowl, 3 Rolls, Sandwich), Protein (Chicken, Pork, Shrimp, or Vegan) and then Vegatables (a million options). Due to the ability to customize your order, you can fine tune your choices and get the exact taste you are looking for.

My go to choice is the 3 Rolls with Chicken and Pork. I like spicy foods, so I double down on extra fresh jalapenos and siracha.  The 3 rolls option is just enough food to keep you satisfied, but not so much that it makes you feel like you've crushed a burrito gut bomb before heading back to your desk for a snoozy food coma at the office.

One big gripe is the line can get long and Freshroll hasn't perfected their operational efficiency and needs to really get faster at making the rolls. If the line is over 8-10 people, your wait will be 15-20 mins, which is way too long during lunch, especially for professionals.

Regardless, Freshroll is great and a go to for anyone near 4th and Mission/Metreon area!
author: Justin O.

description: Came here after looking up quick lunch places near the Metreon this past Saturday pre-braving the Target downtown.  Went with two very hungry boys and all three of us were sooooo pleasantly surprised at how fresh and delicious the food was.  It is a Chipotle-esque take on vietnamese food.  I got the salad bowl w/chicken and all of the toppings (the ginger citrus sauce was awesome!), one boy got the sandwich with chicken and the other got the noodle bowl.  All of our plates were clean :)  It is expensive for vietnamese lunch food (banh mi are less than two dollars generally), but for the americanized fast food version it was perfect!
author: Raina D.

description:
Vegan options for sandwich, spring rolls, or bowl with rice or vermicelli.  Several complimentary bottles of sauces that you can bring to a table.

Gets crowded during lunch.
author: Wolfe S.

description:
Pretty good, but just a little expensive for what you get.

Pros:
Fresh
Made to order
Tastes good

Cons:
Small Portion.
A prices are a little high for what you get.
author: Steven F.

description: I get it. It takes a lot to roll a decent spring roll. No really, I had to literally scream what I wanted to the person rolling my spring rolls REPEATEDLY because she couldn't hear me say, "Lettuce, cilantro, pineapple." To her, I pronounced the last two ingredients in mute. In addition, she somehow managed to tear one of the rolls and had to wrap it up again in the midst of a long lunch line. THEN, she mindlessly forgot to add in one of the crispy rolls in it. HAHA. Seriously? You win for getting me all worked up. I know you're not Vietnamese so prepping spring rolls isn't within your nature, but if I was not there to witness your entire failing preparation, I would have thought you were deaf, handicapped and suffering from amnesia.
author: Jen N.

description: Vietnamese equivalent of Chipotle. Fast, seemingly fresh and healthy, and relatively inexpensive. Great for meat-eaters and vegetarians. The best part is the different sell-serve sauces/dressings they offer to go with each plate-- you can sample and experiment and make your order as saucy or unsaucy as you like. I would happily go here again for a quick, no fuss meal-on-the-go.
author: M. P.

description: I would definitely go back for the lemongrass pork spring rolls! - so tasty & flavorful I didn't even need to use any of the dipping sauces ;)
author: Jenni H.

description:
i know you might be used to the typical 3 4 dollar spring roll.. but THIS shit is the BOMB... I've had both the spring rolls and the pork banh mi.. and wow! vietnamese chipotle is the best description i can think of... 
Put in those sprouts lettuce noodles and PORK or chicken both are good.. and definitely add in the crispy thing and BAM.. seriously the best spring roll imaginable.. Make sure to add in grandma's peanut sauce
author: James H.

description:
So, I went back to try a vermicelli bowl because I felt like something light and refreshing and to my surprise, they had implemented everything that my coworkers and I had suggested in my last review about how the rolls and other dishes were put together!

The process was very streamlined, quick and easy. The food was great and exactly what I was looking for. 

Great job, guys!!
author: John D.

description:
Love the idea! Only down side is that the pho broth is not vegetarian = ( 
I opted for a bowl with lots of fresh veggies, rice, lettuce, avocado and then did a hybrid of the vinaigrette and the peanut sauce -- well played.
author: Pamela R.

description: This is totally fake Vietnamese food, but it is fresh and dependable! I get vegan fresh rolls with raw tofu instead of fried or a ginormous vegan salad with raw tofu and all them veggies in it. So clean - I only wish the taro chips were baked and not fried. I would definitely go for them then!
author: Shendi X.

description: The concept of this place is cool but I definitely prefer going to an authentic Vietnamese restaurant n getting spring rolls. They just didn't taste that good to me here. I ordered the lemongrass pork spring rolls and each bite was so salty!!!! Yikes
author: Jennifer S.

description:
YAY - a fresh, healthy fast food option in SOMA that's open late-ish!  I love this place!   YUMMM to my crispy tofu, basil, carrot, pineapple, cucumber and avocado spring roll!!  Don't forget the crispy goodness because it REALLY is crispy goodness!  Build your own burritto, asian style - how cute is that?!

It's reasonably priced.  Can't wait to try the other items on the menu!
author: Win L.

description:
This is the Vietnamese version of Chipotle, and I dig it (I also dig Chipotle, so no big surprise).

Plate choice of fresh spring rolls, bowl, Pho, or Vietnamese sandwich on French Bread.

Protein choices are garlic shrimp, crispy tofu, lemongrass pork and chicken.

There is also a choice of plant matter (leaves, vegetables, fruit) and carb (white or brown rice, vermicelli) and a host of sauces to choose from as well.

I sampled the fresh spring rolls with chicken and garlic shrimp as well as a brown rice lemongrass pork bowl with everything.

It goes without saying that just as Chipotle is not authentic Mexican food, Freshroll is not authentic Vietnamese food, however it is tasty, fresh and healthy.  And with so many authentic Vietnamese places to choose from in the Bay Area, this place fills a gap.
author: Michael A.

description:
BF and I came here with his mother Sunday afternoon.  The space is nice and clean - the best part is that they had the Niners game on.  I ordered the rolls with a different protein with all the veges.  The tofu one was quite tasty; chicken was tender, pork was nice but not so memorable.  I loved the access to all the sauces.  I especially enjoyed the peanut sauce since it wasn't too watered down or sweet.  The BF and his mom had the noodle bowls.  They were decent.

The taro chips for sampling were incredible!  They had a hearty texture and taste.  

For the bargain hunter in me, Freshroll hits the spot for a filling meal under $10.  Though it may not be as authentic as a dive in the TL, Freshroll has nice Vietnamese flavors if you are craving peanut sauce.  Freshroll may be the perfect place to grab a meal I can bring into the movies.
author: Monica L.

description:
Freshroll is great. The ingredients are fresh, they do a good job giving you a lot of food, and while the lines are usually pretty long, like Chipotle they usually move pretty fast. The location is central too--I get to make a whole bunch of errand runs at lunch at Target, Container Store, etc and then swing by for a nice healthy lunch.

Here is my one complaint--it's a little pricey-er than I'd like. I got a shrimp bowl and it cost me well over $10. If they're using locally-sourced ingredients including the shrimp, and if they're paying their workers a very nice wage, I'm ok with that. But if this shrimp is from Washington and if these guys are making around minimum wage, they need to back off on their prices by a buck or so per dish.
author: Paul C.

description: We needed more diversity in the chipotle style fast gourmet. and this definitely brought a new option, I ordered the rolls, one of my favorite dishes in the world. Exactly how I liked them ! they are fairly sized and plenty food for a grown adult, the ingredients are fresh and blend well together, the peanut sauce is also point on ! If you like chipotle you'll enjoy this place
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Essentially Vietnamese Chipotle. Not a bad thing. Reasonably priced (especially for the real estate they've got), tasty, and filling. I got 3 fresh rolls, one chicken, one pork, one crispy tofu. All of them tasted quite good I would definitely add the crunch (fried scallions), as it adds a very nice texture. Their ginger sauce is awesome.

Now that I think about it, they had a chili hot sauce but I'm not sure they had Sriracha. Slightly criminal.

I also nabbed the taro chips and the fresh limeade. Both were good, but spring rolls were definitely the highlight.

I'm generally not the biggest fan of spring rolls or of "accessible" Asian food, but I really liked this place. I'm not in downtown SF too often, but I would love to come back to try out their banh mi and bowls. I hope they expand. They have a good thing going.
author: David C.

description:
They look good....

Pork was dry and massively overcooked.  The meat tasted like it had been dropped in the grill and forgotten about only to be remembered just in time to be put in my lunch.

Sorry won't repeat.
author: Jase O.

description:
I thought this place interesting. I stumbled into this restaurant while I was shopping at the City Target. I was craving for some spring rolls. Although, their spring roll menu was nice, I choose the Vermicelli noodle bowl. This place is like an Asian Chipotle. You choose whether you want a roll or a bowl and the stuff that goes into it. I love coming here to eat b/c the ingredients are fresh. The vegetables taste fresh. I also love it b/c there is no line. I walked two blocks there, order my stuff, sit down, eat, and go back to work. 

The workers are nice. The atmosphere isn't very warm. The place is bright, white, with some green wall coloring. The place is pretty clean. The condiments are self serve, which is awesome b/c I LOVE A LOT OF SrIRACHA hot sauce. Also, I often can't decide whether I like my noodle bowel with peanut sauce or fish sauce. Here, I don't have to worry about that b/c I get to have both. One thing I don't like about this place is that the fish sauce is pretty watered down. You got to put a lot to really taste the flavor. 

Overall, it's a good experience and I will definitely go back often.
author: Lily K.

description:
Fresh Vietnamese food - love it!

I've been here twice and planning to make a regular appearance - esp when I am craving fresh / healthy food. 

The menu is simple (I think there are 4-6 items to choose from) and you can customize your meal. How many Vietnamese restaurants do you know where you can customize your meal?? I've had the spring rolls (get it with pineapple!) and the rice bowl (with brown rice) and both were delicious. Husband loves the pork and chicken. I prefer the shrimp and tofu. I've heard the ban mi sandwiches are awesome as well!

Great place to grab food before / after the mall, movie, or just passing by!
author: Jane M.

description:
It tastes fresh, it's yummy, and it seems decently good for you. I normally get the rolls, which taste kind of like a vietnamese sandwich inside of a spring roll. It's a nice substitute to eating a sandwich once in awhile. 

Best dish: lemon grass pork roll with avocado 
Food: 4/5 stars
Ambiance: Casual
Price: Staff is very fun and friendly
author: Kevi L.

description:
I decided to try this place based on a friend recommendation. I love that it's pretty straight forward and they give you all the options of sandwich, bowl , or salad. They also have meat and veggie options. They offered Spring rolls but didn't try it and had a bowl of the lemongrass pork. (ooh so yummy)

Pros:
I love that you can see them make it in front of you. You can tell them to do more/less of the veggies. Try the pickled Veggies. Those have lots of flavor! The taste is better than most places similar to here.  Also, I love that they have a variety of sauces you can use to add additional flavor to your meal. 

Cons:
If you're a commuter, it's easy to get to by Bart/Muni/walk. However if you drive, parking is $$ since there's only really the 5th/mission garage and not much street parking. Also if you have a big group, there may not always be enough seats.
author: Phillip D.

description:
Had a crispy tofu and grilled chicken sandwich.
The pickled veggie isn't sour enough
The "Nam Nam" sauce is hella fattening.  Ask to skip it!
The crispy tofu is just so-so.  Well, I guess if it's not too dry, it's good, right?
The grilled chicken is decent.

Overall, the sandwich is not a traditional Vietnamese sandwich, but it lacks the wow factor.  It's just typical sandwich.  

Would have been 3 stars if it isn't too pricey.  
I would go back only if I have to.

Cafe Dolci definitely has better sandwiches.
author: Otto L.

description:
Absolutely delicious, and all the staff are super friendly. The taro chips are thick and delicious and much tastier than normal taro chips you can buy elsewhere. The salad bowl was packed with veggies and tons of meat, all at no extra cost.  And all four sauce options are freshly made and scrumptious. 

Highest recommendation, no question.
author: J M.

description:
Its really hard to find fresh, healthy, wholesome, light lunch options. Fresh Roll is it. If you're nearby at the Moscone Center; shopping and looking for a quick meal; or your office is in the area, you really should check it out.

This is what I got:
-3 spring rolls with grilled shrimp; fresh romaine lettuce; fresh pickled tart sliced carrots and daikon; sliced jalapenos (my favorite!) and rice noodles
-Iced tea: very light; slightly sweetened (not cloyingly sweet or too sryupy); had a hint of lychee
-Bonuses: Sauces. Sauces. Sauces. I think the peanut sauce is a family recipe; but my favorite was a fresh and zesty citrus ginger dipping sauce. Tart and sweet; I always opt for peanut when I'm dipping my rolls, but I think I became a convert after this one sauce.

I personally really love Vietnamese food myself because the flavor palate is tart, contrasting, fresh and light. I really like Freshroll because they creatively take these themes and make it really accessible and "handy" - they roll it up in rice paper; or stuff it into a sandwich, or pack it into a bowl. Prices are good; staff is efficient warm and friendly.

Going in next time to try the bahn mi and dunking it into the addictive citrus ginger dipping sauce!
author: Tian L.

description:
I was looking for a traditional Vietnamese restaurant, but ended up at Freshrolls instead and I'm glad I did.

The spring rolls are fantastic.  It's basically build your own like the burrito places.  Very reasonably priced too.  I think it's $6.75 for 3 huge spring rolls.
author: Andy K.

description:
Hooray for Vietpotle.  

Had 3 chicken spring rolls, they were quite good. Meat was cooked well, the rest of the roll was...well, fresh.  I like how they've got a pretty big assortment of stuff you can add to the rolls like scallions, pineapple, etc.  

The rice paper they use is crazy though - it looked straight up like plastic when they pulled it out but then they put it in some water and voila.  

Anyway.  

Don't be discouraged if you see a long line, they shuffle people in and out just like Chipotle does.  

At first glance it seems like the 3 spring rolls might not be enough to sustain you, but I felt it was just the right amount of food to be satisfied and not feel like a fatty after your meal.  

I bet we'll see a bunch of these places pop up around the city in the near future, 'cause people seem to love this shit already.  If you work around here, this place definitely deserves to be in your lunch rotation.
author: Louie M.

description: Love this place!  Fresh, healthy, fast, and super tasty!  Kinda reminds me of Sweet Green. Please bring this to Boston!
author: Jeff K.

description:
Plenty of vegetarian options, but I choose the freshroll with tofu 9 times out of 10. It's the perfect healthy and filling lunch. Their peanut sauce is to die for! 

Order lunch online and take your food to Yerba Buena on a sunny day
author: A S.

description: Super good- it definitely hits my summer roll cravings. Love how I can build my own and customize it to my liking. The pork is nice and juicy and I love the condiments and different sauces we can choose from. The sweet and sour is great. Wish the order online app was more efficient, (seems like a long wait I comparison to going to the store and waiting), but this is my go to place if I crave some summer rolls. For three rolls, it was filling for me. But for a hungry, larger male, I feel like they would need an additional side.  If they ordered a bowl or sandwich, wish there were summer rolls as an add on.
author: Samantha G.

description: SO. GOOD. Ingredients feel super clean, very tasty, fast lines, reasonable prices. It's only a matter of time before my coworkers get sick of my suggestions that we go here.
author: Patrick S.

description: YUM!!! Had the spring rolls (pork, chicken & Tofu). These were shockingly filling and yet still refreshing. The lemongrass pork and grilled chicken tasted like the Vietnamese grilled you get in a regular Vietnamese noodle bowl, very authentic.The peanut sauce was my favorite and the "crunch" was definitely worth the extra .75. I think I could eat these every day.
author: Sonya S.

description:
Tasty! Cheap! Filling! Healthy-ish! What more could you ask for?
Was looking for something healthy-esque in the SOMA area. Yelp tells me there are rolls & bowls a few blocks away. Yelp tells me this place has a 4.5 star average. So off we go! 

The setup and ordering process reminds me of Chipotle, but like Chipotle's shiny little Vietnamese cousin. Anyway, so we got: 
- 3 freshrolls, with chicken, pork, tofu (pretty good, very filling)
- 1 freshroll sandwich, with pork (so very tasty!)
- 1 bowl, with brown rice & tofu (a bit bland, so I added diff sauces = yum!)
- 1 Jasmine ice tea (wonderfully refreshing)
Total came out to about $26. 

With each option you choose a meat/filling: pork, chicken, tofu, shrimp (may cost extra for shrimp). The pork and chicken are tasty. The tofu needed more flavor, so I  added sauces which makes it much better. I did not try the shrimp. With the bowl, you also choose rice, noodle, or salad. 

Then you add some garnish stuff: sprouts, lettuce, peppers, pineapple, light vegetables, spices, etc. There is a lot to choose from or they suggest "the standard" - which is their suggested combo of garnish. A couple of my personal faves were the pineapple and pickled vegetables.
WARNING: Be careful about getting hot peppers added - they are HOT! It came as part of "the standard" and I wasn't really aware of how hot they could be. And if it is in a roll and it sneaks up on you, then KA-POW! Call 911! Your mouth is on fire! Seriously, this stuff can get hot. So be careful.

Finally, you can add extras like soup, taro chips, etc. I got their Jasmine ice tea which was very refreshing and lightly sweetened. Also, they have several sauces you can try like ginger, sweet & sour, peanut - all are very good. I recommend trying them with your meal.

Location is on 4th, outside the newly remodeled Metreon structure. Bright and white inside. A few little signs on the counters that say something like, hey we are new and trying so please be patient with us - which I appreciate that they're just honest about that. Very friendly service! Parking lot right across on Mission, or metered street parking around the area as well.
author: Veronica H.

description: Food is good for some fresh option on a budget. I wasn't happy though when we had a large pick-up order for my co-workers that were working late. The order took more than 30 minutes over the estimated ready time, and we were shushed by the workers about our group being too loud while we were waiting for our late food...
author: Courtney C.

description: Line moves fast, fast fresh food. Great lunch spot. Love the different sauces. Service is always excellent.
author: Jill C.

description:
Probably my favorite fast food place, ever.

This is ... as everyone else seems to say ... a cross between Chipotle/Subway and Vietnamese awesomeness.   Pick a format (rolls, sandwich, or bowl), pick a protein (pork, chicken, shrimp) and pick your veggies (all fresh and crunchy).     Pick a dipping sauce and you're golden.

They say the rolls are "as filling as the bowl"... that's not true, but I still like the rolls better.  At $8, it's a good, nutritious lunch.

They could work on their sides.  Taro chips is about it.  Not my favorite.  I'd like to see a cucumber salad, or tomato rice?   But really, I didn't need a side, I just don't care for the one they have.

I wish we had one of these in San Diego (I was in SF on travel).   Please open one of these in San Diego!
author: Bill J.

description:
I have been walking by Freshroll for weeks, and it is finally open.  So I headed over for lunch today and it was delicious!

The system is pretty simple, you chose a meal (rolls, rice bowl, noodle bowl, salad, or sandwich), pick a protein (chicken, pork, shrimp, or tofu), and then add your veggies (cucumber, pickled veggies, carrot, avocado, green onions, jalapeno, basil), and pick a sauce - the peanut was really tasty.  

The best part is that you get 3 rolls in each order instead of the standard two that you get at most Vietnamese places.  So this way you are actually full from your order.  The people working there were very nice and friendly.  Just a couple of things to work on, it would be nice if we could pick different proteins for each order, I would have loved to do a pork, a tofu, and a shrimp today.  Variety is the spice of life after all.  Also, it would be nice to have fresh mint as an option inside the rolls.  This seems like a better choice than the basil that is currently on the menu.  

I cant wait to go back and have Freshroll before a movie.  The people working there confirmed that they are open until 11pm on the weekends.
author: Dana H.

description: Amazing! We got the standard fresh rolls with chicken for our protein. I could have tried lots of different combos with all their options, but we stayed with the recommended version. Their sauces were also great. My favorite was the peanut sauce. The rolls come 3 for $8.49. They are big and filling. Great clean restaurant with complimentary cucumber water.
author: Racheal B.

description:
Throw away everything you think you know about a springroll.  Freshroll comes on the scene with customization options up the wazoo.  If you score high on your [P]erceiving dimension (Briggs Myers), you might have trouble making a decision since there are more than a few good options.

There's no reason food can't be healthy and come with handfuls of meat.  It's not for everyone though.  If you prefer tiny springrolls filled mainly with noodles and 2 tiny pieces of shrimp cut in half to look like 4, you can probably find that at any Vietnamese restaurant in SF.  Otherwise, come to Freshroll if you want a magnum sized spring roll.

My only gripe is that they're too far from work to eat there every day.
author: Tommy W.

description:
The fresh rolls were pretty great. I'm a fan of the texture and the jalapeños and peanut sauce is a nice touch. The tofu was a little tough, though. 

I'll definitely be returning.
author: Adam S.

description:
Came here to grab a quick snack before a movie at the Metreon.

Service is fine, but the rolls had already ripped open before the take out lid was put on.

We paid extra to have shrimp, instead of chicken, rolls. I was surprised that they were small cooked/seasoned. They tasted fine, but not what I expected.

There was only a smidge of rice noodle in the roll, but it didn't matter since it all fell out anyways!

Ultimately, no point in getting a rolls when they're actually just a heap of mess!
author: Sharon W.

description:
I had the great fortune of meandering into Freshroll before they opened and the owners asked me to be a 'guinea pig' of sorts so they could practice on me.  Boy, was that my lucky day.  I enjoyed a delicious shrimp roll with add-ins and a thirst-quenching iced tea.

The staff was friendly and eager to please. 

I highly recommend Freshroll.
author: Garrett H.

description:
I got the Freshwich®, add crunchy bacon and avocado, it was fantastic, staff is so friendly, and food reeeeally tasty!
The only dark spot is the limited choice of beverage, but you don't really get in to drink... :)
Place is neat and clean, bright with huge windows, perfect for a quick lunch at noon, or something on the go! ++++
author: Jacques S.

description:
Good Fresh Rolls.     I know this place is new......   they really need to figure out what's best for the counter.  I kept seeing folks pass along white cutting boards?   
Here's  A Tip!    Make Fresh Rolls w/standard already made.    Too many people just standing around waiting to do there part.    The Soup was good too.    So it was the bowl of soup & 3 Fresh Rolls with Lemongrass Pork(YUM!) & a med. coke, all for 11.83.   Kinda of on the pricey side for me for lunch.   But it was good.
author: Jerry P.

description: Pho was really good. The soup wasn't greasy ..it was just right. Will come again.
author: Ron C.

description:
Vietnamese spring rolls made via assembly line--I like it in theory more than in practice. The ingredients were fresh but the actual assembly was below par. Caused by the lunch hour crowd, the assemblers were in such a hurry that the ingredients were not evenly spaced and the rolls were not tight enough to keep it from falling apart after one bite.

Don't get me wrong, I'm happy to have this spot walking distance from my office but there is definitely room for improvement.
author: Christine K.

description: Rolls are so yummy!   Healthy and fresh.  Way better that the spring rolls you get at a typical Vietnamese restaurant.  The sandwich...not so good though.  Just stick with the rolls and definitely add the 'crispy goodness'.
author: Francine K.

description:
Authentic flavors in an unauthentic setting.  Not that there is anything wrong with the setting, you just don't expect such authentic flavors from such a trendy and touristy place in the heart of downtown.  The lemongrass pork and peanut sauce are better than some places in the Tenderloin, a better known place to look for good Vietnamese food.

I would definitely go back as long as I still work in this area.  But I wouldn't be going back too often because at $7 for a sandwich and $8 for 3 small rolls, the prices aren't cheap.
author: Irene T.

description:
There's always a long line during lunch, since this is right outside the Moscone Center. Still worth it, and it goes by relatively fast. I was never a spring rolls fan until coming to Freshroll. I've only had their 3 spring rolls meal - love how you can customize the ingredients. Subway model. Lots of sauces for dipping - the citrus ginger sauce is good.

Not somewhere I can eat at often w/o getting tired of it though.
author: An Y.

description:
My sister called this the Asian chipotle of San Fran. The bf and I ordered the 3 rolls for $7.95 as a snack. We got 2 chicken and 1 lemongrass pork with "the standard" veggies. 

All in all not bad I guess for a healthier type snack. I'd recommend not to do the pineapple because I think it threw the flavoring off. The meat was tasty and well seasoned but the pineapple made everything taste wrong overall. 

Would I go again next time I visit my sis? Probably not.
author: Vicki N.

description:
Haven't had any rolls here, but they have pretty decent Pho.  Decent, not great or bad, but it hits the spot.  Good people watching at the tables in front of the windows.

Open later than most places in SoMa, yay!  Because I refuse to go to Mel's and there's only so much Super Duper I allow myself to have in a week.
author: Sar A.

description:
I loved the options for the freshrolls (who would have thought of putting pineapple in there?). I enjoyed the sauces (I highly recommend the peanut, but all that I tried were tasty). 

SO why not five stars? Well it's the tofu. As a vegetarian, it was my only protein option and I was disappointed. It was fried to death! Too fried for my taste. Probably a 2 for the tofu but a 5 for everything else. So four starts it is. 

Next time, I would ask to leave the tofu out and put extra veggies, that's the good stuff anyway :)
author: Michaela S.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and value of this little chain I've been seeing around. I finally tried it and loved the spring rolls with chicken and all the dipping sauce choices! Feels relatively healthy too.
author: Susan V.

description:
Yum! Location-wise, there's plenty of competition surrounding the restaurant but with a bright glass-front, plenty of tables, and bright clear displays of the menu, this is definitely going to be busier with Metreon being "re-opened".

Efficient servers with an assembly line type of service, although maybe the cashier could have introduced/recommended sauces at register. I know they are displayed but since the bottles next to the register aren't labeled, I think other customers might just skip them without a quick introduction to what they were. Personally I know that my vermicelli noodle bowl needed some of the Vietnamese vinagrette (nuoc mam) but if I hadn't had it before, I would have been disappointed by the tasteless bowl.

The lemongrass pork was tender and just the right temperature, and my dish left me satisfied. Their recommended tea was great, unlike other places that had watered down iced teas. I look forward to trying more items on the menu.I'm getting hungry again typing out this review the day after my visit...
author: Alexandra M.

description: A great place with some good, fresh food.  I'm glad to see they added some outdoor seating so we can sit out side with our dogs and watch the world go by while enjoying our tasty rolls.  I tried the three roll combo with pork and chicken and they were very good.  Everything was very good and very fresh.  They make the rolls for you while you wait and it can take them a while to make it.  I could see this place getting backed up with the lunch crowd and fortunately it wasn't busy when I was here.  They have a great selection of sauces and my favorite was the citrus ginger.  The only bad thing I can say about the place is that it's not exactly cheap.  $12 for three rolls, taro chips, and a drink is a bit steep, but probably on par when you consider it's right across from Moscone and part of the Metreon.  That won't keep me from coming back.
author: Scott L.

description:
This review is for Freshroll's catering service only (I haven't been to their restaurant....yet!) 

My office does catered lunches 3x/week and I LOVE finding restaurants that are organized and thoughtful in their catering services. Nam was easy to reach by email and quick to respond to all my questions. They brought us a "make your own noodle bowl" set up that worked out perfectly! My coworkers are suckers for make your own anything, so this turned out to be a perfect lunch. 

Bonus points for gluten free friendly food! Nam was great about answering all my allergy related questions and made sure that everything was safe for me. 

The second time we ordered from them, they forgot to bring the rice, but it totally worked out! We ended up having way to much food and they gave us a hefty discount. 

I highly recommend them for office catering. They are the best restaurant I've worked with so far!
author: Natalie P.

description: I thought this was a great concept, was here from out of town for a conference and decided to try it out.  I got 3 fresh rolls with a diff meat in each one.  I didn't expect it to fill me up but it did.  I think the pork left something to be desired but otherwise was fantastic.
author: Kay C.

description:
I love this place.

If you are looking for a good, economical, quick lunch in the city, Freshroll is a great spot.  I have enjoyed their bowls, sandwiches, and rolls equally.  Their ingredients are fresh, and even when the line is out the door, you will be one your way within 10 minutes.  I highly recommend adding the crispy scallion rolls to basically everything.  

They recently started serving pho after 3pm, and I hope it gets added to their daily lunch menu soon!
author: Virginia B.

description:
Been here for lunch a few times, and will definitely be coming back. Awesome meal for under $10. 

I think the freshrolls are the best thing going:
- awesome change of pace from the typical sandwich lunch
- can try out a few different types of protein, I recommend pork, but the chicken and tofu are good too
- load up on goodies, chipotle style, and make sure you try the pineapple and pickled veggies! might sound weird but it's worth it!

The sandwiches are good too, and slightly more filling, but I would stick with freshrolls or a noddle bowl because the bread is nothing special.
author: Alden Q.

description: Nausea and stomach cramps. That about sums up my experience at Freshroll. I actually thought my tofu Bahn Mi sandwich was pretty decent, although I hated the fact that they piled on a mayo sauce and that's what gave the sandwich its flavor.. I had cereal at home prior to lunch so it was definitely the Bahn Mi sandwich which left me with a not so fresh feeling. Bummer- great concept and a seemingly nice place to go for a "healthy"?? meal..
author: Ritu K.

description:
Wow. Mind. Blown....I think I found my new lunch spot. 

I went here today for the first time ever. Judging from the pictures on Yelp, their Fresh Rolls looked HUGE...arriving there, waiting in a long line that went very quickly, it's safe to say that their rolls are in fact massive. I got two chicken rolls and one lemongrass pork roll, three massive spring rolls for $8. I was pretty full after eating one, completely stuffed after eating two. I just snacked on the very last one a few hours after eating the first two. The chicken rolls are far better in my opinion, but I'm very partial to chicken over other meat. The pork just tasted a little dry and had less flavor. The chicken was tender and very good. I think my favorite part is that they let you get as much/many sauces as you want. They also have sriracha, which is close to my best friend when it comes to sauces. I'm a big sauce fan, so to be able to take as much as I needed was excellent. 

I really want to try their pho, but not sure I'll be able to during the week. I definitely see myself coming back to this place a lot. Also, everyone in the assembly line as well as the cashiers were very  nice and courteous, great service, and a very clean place too. I HIGHLY recommend this place for lunch.
author: Dawn O.

description: Update:  plus one star for responding!  Love a business that values Yelp eeviews :)  Original review: Over 30 minute wait in line at lunch time on a Thursday - not acceptable (unless the food is just THAT good, but it's not).  Get it together.  It doesn't have to take that long.  Have some pre-made selections for people who don't want to stand in line - how hard could that be?  I had the three roll special with two pork and one crispy tofu.  It was fine taste wise, but not phenomenal, by any means.
author: Cori D.

description: Chipotle meets Vietnamese food. The pho was pretty good, but I really like that you can customize your spring rolls. Nice touch!
author: Richard T.

description:
Someone accurately described Freshroll at the "Chipotle of Vietnamese food."  That really does sum it up.  I got the rolls, which they then fill with your choice of meat (pork, chicken, or shrimp) and then you add vegetables.  There are SO many options for vegetables, I was glad they had a "standard" set I could ask for.  Then they give you a sauce, and you're on your way!

The line was out the door, but it moved relatively fast.  For the amount of people working there, however, it should have moved even faster.

I'd definitely go back!  Food was delicious.
author: Ian C.

description:
I finally got a chance to eat here yesterday admist all the Dreamforce madness.  The line was long but well worth the wait.  It's no wonder that I like this place since the concept is very much similar to Chipotle.  Just waltz your way down the assembly line and pick what you want.  

Ingredients super healthy and fresh, hence the name.  I ordered the 3 rolls which comes with the following choices of protein: chicken, pork, shrimp or fried tofu.  I got one of each minus the shrimp.  You then pick the rest of the goodies that go into your roll (lettuce, pickled veggies, jalapenos, bean sprouts, pineapple, etc).  I paid a little extra for the crunchy scallion roll to give it that extra flavor and texture.  People seem to pick the peanut sauce to go with their rolls but I prefer the Vietnamese vinagrette and adding in just a dash of chili sauce.

Oh, and don't skimp...pay the extra couple bucks, make it a combo to get a drink and a side.  I highly recommend their lychee iced tea.  Really refreshing, with just a hint of lychee and their homemade taro chips are tasty.

Meat was tender and not dry which was a good surprise.  Lots of flavor.  I really enjoyed my meal here.  I wish they would open up closer to me so that I could eat here all the time. Yes, all the time since it seems so healthy!  It's like eating a wrapped up salad, perfect for on the go!
author: Amy L.

description: Cool Place. Went at lunch time so the line was long, but it moved fairly quick. the 3 rolls for $7 is a deal. I tried all of the meats and Pork is by far the one to go with.
author: Brian R.

description: This place is the bomb diggity.  For a Vietnamese spot in SOMA they're pretty spot on with their Banh Mis.  Definitely order it with "Crispy Goodness" - deep fried green onions.  This adds an extra crunch to the already delicious sammich.  Their rolls are also top notch.  You get 3 of them in an order which is a good amount of fullness, unless you're a glutton like me.  In which case, you might want to order a side of Taro chips or something.  I love this place.  Haven't tried their Pho yet though...
author: Kyle I.

description:
Love this place.
Filling but so so fresh.

I get the 3 Freshrolls, each with a different protein inside.. The Vinaigrette is the BEST (in my opinion).

BUT this place gets crazy busy - so skip the queue and order online, saves you so much time!
author: Hannah K.

description:
Pretty tasty spring rolls and Vietnamese grilled pork sandwich.  They have other dishes such as salad and noodle or rice bowls. This place is a modern restaurant, there a few seating area to eat your food, but first come first serve. When you enter the restaurant, you get in line to order your food. Their menu is posted and you first decide what you want (sandwich, spring roll, salad, etc), second you choose your meat and veggies and of the sauce. 
The spring rolls come in 3 and their pretty good size. They are made fresh, right in front of you. Also the sandwich is filled with grilled pork, but I would definitely like more veggie in my sandwich. The bread was toasted and crispy. It was good.
I would be back to try the other dishes, if I'm in the area... They are a little SLOW, so if you're in a rush, don't come here.
author: Nguyet K.

description: This place is ok, it's fast, easy Americanized Vietnamese food to go. Most of the staff had dirty shirts on though. The sauce selection is fun, topping selections are cool too.
author: Kay M.

description: This one being opposite moscone center had a huge queue durig lunchhtime.It took me a good 20 min to just get to the register.They should have process to take online order to avoid this.I had the banh mi sandwich and vietnamese coffee.The coffee had no taste.Too mild.The sandwich was ok.Tofu was uncooked and cold.Their signature sauce was good.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
First off, thanks for taking me in at closing time last night to get a quick order through. I was soooo hungry, and couldn't find a legitimate place that was open late +1

I got the 2 Pork rolls and 1 Chicken Roll. (pretty hefty in size) +2

They quote on their menu that their rolls are as filling as their bowls and since I didn't want to stuff myself to late at now and live to regret it, I choose to get the rolls. I usually get some spring rolls and a pho at Vietnamese pho noodle places, so to me these rolls were more of an appetizer for dinner type thing.

Chicken roll was good, no complaints. I'm usually a big fan of pork, and these rolls were okay. The main reason is that the pork was a big chewy and I thought it would be more tender. Anyways I echo Monica L's sentiments below.
author: Ronny L.

description: Fresh ingredients, novel concept  (Viet spring rolls done Chipotle style where you instruct the staff on what you want). Everything I tried was good, including the Taro chips. I added avocado to the rolls and that was a good choice. Cheap, clean, this place is gonna make a dollar and a cent.
author: Matt B.

description: A group of colleagues and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted something fresh, light, and local to my hotel. This place was excellent! I got the shrimp fresh rolls and they were delicious. We were all so happy with our food. The staff were very nice.
author: Amy T.

description: I had the 3 rolls for lunch. One each of tofu, pork & chicken. Pork was the best, crunch and meat in one bite. Made to order and excellent for a quick lunch.
author: Rajeev R.

description:
I want to rate this better. As fast food, the concept is awesome and I love being able to customise my spring rolls. The store is neat and clean and welcoming and the location is convenient to work. 

Where it all falls apart for me...is, well, the roll. It falls apart. Literally. I take a bite and the roll sorta unravels and the insides fall into the peanut sauce dip and then I have to fish them out and it makes a mess all over my desk. Alas. (This is not a problem I have with other spring rolls.)

Still, it's all pretty tasty and the customisation is great. So a solid three stars, capable of improving to four should this roll thing ever get solved.
author: Lis M.

description: Awesome spring rolls, Chipotle style. You basically go down the aisle selecting the meat and toppings you want. The lemongrass pork is the best, but you can also mix and match. For my order, I got 2 pork and 1 chicken. Do get the house special peanut sauce, it pairs really well with the spring rolls. It's a little bit pricey for vietnamese food, but it's in the FiDi and it's delicious, so it was worth every penny!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I really appreciate fresh and honest ingredients in a restaurant meal. If it looks like something I could make, or I understand everything that went into making my restaurant meal, then I actually like a restaurant more rather than less. Not everyone is this way, so understand that as the context for this review.

Freshroll uses fresh and easy to understand ingredients in what they provide. You see exactly what goes into your food. I have been here at least a dozen times in the past 6 months, and each time I get a brown rice bowl with either chicken or tofu. I know that the veggies and herbs they put on top are exactly what they say they are. No frills, no hidden ingredients. I think it's as close as you can get to a quality and nutritious meal outside of your own kitchen without spending over $10. Therefore, for a healthy food and fast kind of place, Freshroll is as good as it gets!
author: Sally R.

description:
OK so i have my vietnamese fast food (tofu bahn mí WTF!) favorite across from my office but i'm always happy to compair and contrast. Freshroll was pretty tasty. The sandwich was on the small side, and more veggies than protein, but still very good. 

It is certainly fast food, but the ingredients looked fresh, the sauces tasty and the staff friendly and attentive. I'll be back, i know i will.
author: Jared Z.

description:
Viet fast food chipotle assembly line style

They offer 3 options: spring rolls, bowls, or sandwiches in which all 3 are over priced. You then pick the meat and types of veggies to go with your option. They make it in front of you fresh.

I got the 3 spring rolls for $8: one pork, one chicken, and one shrimp (+1.25 wasnt worth it) I got all the veggies (bean sprouts, lettuce, cilantro, pineapple, basil, cucumbers, and pickled veggies) minus the jalapanos. 

Overall the meat was barely noticeable. I mainly tasted pineapple. The rolls tasted healthy but way overpriced compared to getting the rolls at a real viet restaurant.
author: Robert Y.

description: Sandwich is mediocre. Sauce is too much on the sweet side for me. Chicken broth was ok. Pho was not bad but not as tasty as actual Vietnamese restaurant. Price is a little high for what you get. The sign says no msg in the sauce but didn't say no msg in the soup. Makes me ponder...
author: E H.

description: This place makes some tasty rolls. For around $10, you get 3 good-sized rolls wrapped in rice paper. You can fully customize what meats and veggies go into your rolls, so I usually get a round-robin of meats. And like I said, they're really tasty and filling. They'll fill one little container of sauce of your choosing, but feel free to grab more. I've also tried their bowls, which are exactly like the rolls except with some noodles. Portion sizes are comparable, i.e. 3 rolls is approximately equal to one bowl. One note: While their rolls and bowls are great, you may want to avoid this place if you're looking for a hot meal, as that does not appear to be their specialty. But it's a great place for a lunch!
author: Daylen Y.

description: I had the chicken pho and the chicken pieces were raw. Apparently, the chef told me that they do not cook the chicken, but rather they pour hot broth onto the raw chicken in the bowl and that's it. Beware of a restaurant that doesn't know the first thing about food safety.  What's worse is that the chef told me that next time I come in, I would get raw chicken again because that's how they do it.  This is after I told him chicken needs to be cooked to a certain temperature. There won't be a next time!
author: Apple M.

description:
Love this place!!!

Totally the Vietnamese Chipotle! The ingredients were fresh, just the right amount of portion, and sneakable into the Metreon :) I had the spring rolls (GET THE BBQ PORK!!!!) with peanut sauce. 

***I actually would recommend NOT getting that "crispy goodness"... I felt that it kind of ruined the taste of the spring roll. 

***Also, I got my pineapple on the side and ate it as a snack.
author: Liz W.

description: My first time coming here I got the vietnamese sandwich with the lemongrass pork. It was ok good. Would like it if the bread were a little bit bigger. Today I came to try their vermicelli noodles. It was nice and easy to order. It was ok too but thought the vinagrette could be better -it was too sweet. There were other condiments available too which was nice. All the staff was welcoming and nice/friendly. Average food.
author: Carmen L.

description:
My first visit here I was underwhelmed by my shrimp rolls. I thought they were pretty flavorless/boring. All the shrimp was distributed into a couple of bites, leaving me munching on lettuce for the rest of my roll experience. 

After coming back a few more times I've become one of the converted. I still have a complicated relationship with the shrimp, but I'm all about the pork. 

Double meat and 'the crunchy goodness' are a real dynamic duo- very filling with lots of fun flavors + textures. 

You can choose other form factors for your meal (rice/noodle bowls, banh mi) but dipping the rolls is too much fun to pass up. The four sauces they offer are all weirdly sweet, but the sriracha is tasty.
author: Ryan D.

description:
We used to eat the rolls at Out the Door at Westfield and that was probably the best rolls around that area.  Since OTD is no longer around, we were extremely glad to see Fresh Roll in the neighborhood but were their rolls any good?

We walked in and didn't know what to expect but found out they are kind of like Chipotle as others have said.  You get to choose between sandwich, noodles or roll.   After this, you get to choose the type of meat or filling you want in there ranging from lemongrass pork to chicken to tofu (there's one more).  You then choose what condiments you want to add with it.  Lastly you get to choose the sauce.  They're extremely generous with the sauce; you can get more than one or choose two different flavors.  We got the peanut sauce and the citrus ginger; both were tasty.  The roll was also very good.  They wrapped it right in front of you and the lemongrass pork that we ordered was excellent.  This is new go to place for Vietnamese rolls.
author: Pierre L.

description: Mister Chao loves Freshroll.  Mister Chao agrees with the other reviewers that the rolls at Freshroll is fresh, filling, and fast. Mister Chao always goes back for the spring rolls and coffee every time he is in town.
author: Mister Chao ..

description:
Came here on a Saturday for lunch. Had the Crispy Tofu Sandwich with a healthy dose of Sriracha. It was pretty damn tasty. Not the best bahn mi I've ever had, but a decent solid meal in an area that was previously a wasteland for good Vietnamese (since Out The Door in the Westfield shut down). 

Their service is pretty haphazard and it's clear that they haven't quite gotten their process and line down to the stage where they're moving as smoothly and efficiently as Chipotle. I hope they iron out these issues and get there soon because the food is actually pretty decent. Will definitely come back to try their bowls and rolls next time.
author: Michael S.

description:
Remember when Vietnamese springrolls were nothing more than wasted calories from bland carbs and dry meats (or tofu), demanding obligatory peanut sauces to wash down the emptiness that is.

Well not anymore.  Freshroll packs a punch in this updated item and allows you to customize the ingredients as well (hint: get the crunchy goodness).  They don't skimp on the proteins and you definitely get your money's worth, and while they provide multiple flavors of sauces, it's not required since these are flavorful as is.

They also serve rice bowls, and salad bowls if you're looking for the low-carb route.  Definitely a great healthy option, since these are harder to come by these days.
author: Tadd L.

description:
Pros: Amazing, light, tasty food that doesn't make me fall asleep at 2:30pm. Amazing pork.

Cons: Long lines, messy to eat (rolls anyway!)

I will eat here whenever I can, but probably not when I'm in a rush or wearing something white!
author: Clara N.

description:
10 / 10

Bam.

Someone had the idea to make really good tasting unique rolls and chips and tea. And it works. I don't know what the wrap is made of but it looks and feels really cool and kind of alien.
author: Tony P.

description:
My dad and I came here today before we went to the Pistahan Festival to eat something near by. He saw it when we were walking by and wanted to try it. 

We didn't know what to expect but we wanted to share. so we got the 3 roll combo meal ($8). They put either Chicken, pork, tofu, or shrimp. and can have stuffing like lettuce, sprouts, pineapple, cucumbers, etc. and they would roll it up for you. Pay up and they have different sauces you can dip your rolls - peanut sauce (my dad can't have; hes allergic), ginger sauce, sweet and sour, and vinairgrette. 

Its a good snack, but it wont fill you up.

Probably would come back again.
author: Gen M.

description: Great, fast, healthy, inexpensive food with infinite customizability for the picky eaters in the group.
author: Ice A.

description:
I walked in to this place expecting sushi because I didn't look into it and just saw the name, but enjoyed the rice bowl with pork. 
They are still learning there so it took a minute for my food to be ready but it has the Chipotle style bar where they make it in front of you.
It's not a place I would venture to go to, but if I'm around I may stop in if there isn't much else.
author: Amanda M.

description: AMAZING.  Fresh, fast and cheap.  There are not enough places like this in San Francisco.  The Vietnamese sandwich on freshly toasted, super crunchy French break was packed with meat and veggies, a full meal.  The rolls are very tasty as well.  Some of the sauces could be a bit more interesting and less cloyingly sweet, but otherwise this will be a regular stop now.
author: Wino K.

description: Totally love this place! Sometimes after a long day at work, I'll swing by here to grab a sandwich on the way home. I normally get the grilled chicken sandwich and get pickled veggies, cilatro, basil, and jalapenos. The special sauce it comes with is delicious - smoky and sweet. They put in plenty of flavorful chicken where you don't feel like you're getting jipped on meat and the roll isn't too thick where you feel like you're getting stuffed on bread! I brought this sandwich home and my husband had some. He loved it! That's saying a lot because he doesn't even care for sandwiches. So that means this place is pretty damn good! I have gotten the combo before with iced lychee green tea and pho soup. I got the taro chips another time as well. The iced tea is refreshing but just a little tad sweet. The pho soup is amazeballs and didn't put me into msg coma. The taro chips was ... meh. Didn't care for them. Choose the pho soup over the taro chips!
author: Michelle T.

description:
This place is great -- I love coming for the fresh rolls and the noodle bowls, and I'm here at least a few times a month.  It feels like a Chipotle or Subway, but for Vietnamese food.  Good for lunch.

They have a pretty great assortment of sauces, and I've tried all of them!  

The owner noticed that I've become a regular and always greets me when I come back.  Great service and great food.
author: Peter L.

description: Love love love this place. Such a fantastic idea. So fresh and delicious sauces. I've only had the spring rolls, but they were fantastic.
author: Bella H.

description:
**the place is located on the STREET side of 4th street**

So . . . I've been meaning to come because not only do I love vietnamese/asian food but i also love healthy, affordable, and tasty food in general.

YOU WILL get that here. 

Excited for this place to be open day and NIGHT! When I'm working thru the night I can come here for dinner and not worry about the calories as you would at Chipotle or somewhere un-healthy.

There are 4 choices:  freshrolls (sort of like springrolls), Banh Mi (french baguette sandwiches w/ an asian influence), Salad, and Rice bowl & Noodle bowls. 

You then can choose your toppings and then your sauce.

SIMPLE

As stated earlier, the food is very fresh, healthy, priced correctly yet very quality.  Oh, did I mention very good?!

I've gone here twice this week and taking all of my associates at work to go on Friday!
author: Sean Y.

description: The customer service here isn't very friendly nor it is attentive. The food is just meh. It's served off a line, so the meat may be fresh or not. No fried egg rolls either, which is a staple of most Vietnamese places.
author: Sam A.

description:
Freshroll is a nice option if you want something quick and light. You pick a type of protein and then choose between a roll, rice bowl, vermicelli bowl, or banh mi. There are also a few pre-made combinations if you'd rather not create your own.

I split a chicken vermicelli bowl and a pork banh mi with my friend. The chicken was a little tough and charred, but the noodles and toppings were good. The pork was much better, but I thought the bread was a bit too thick. Overall not bad and I like being able to customize my meal. I also like that they offer vietnamese coffee, lychee iced tea, and taro chips.
author: Alice J.

description: I am normally not a foodie and will normally never drive more than a mile or two for good food, but for some reason this little casual lunch place has a spell on me that I crave their fresh rolls so bad I find myself making huge detours and walking for miles to eat here. The lemongrass pork with cilantro has to be the best combo ever.
author: Tralla L.

description: Fresh ingredients and good prices. I had the chicken salad bowl and it was delicious, I love their choice of dressings too. Only complaints are the long line and the fact that you can't order beef for lunch!
author: Natasha F.

description: Americanized spring rolls. The Chipotle's version of Vietnamese spring rolls. Their sauces are addicting n different for spring rolls. Can't get over the fact a white guy made my spring rolls. So mature, I am.
author: Hong M.

description: It's like a Vietnamese chipotle for spring rolls!  Quick and easy!  I had tofu, chicken and pork spring rolls.  It was not bad
author: Lizzy L.

description:
They put on more than a healthy order of Lemongrass Pork on the sandwich, as so it was overflowing! When someone makes a sandwich OVERFLOWING with awesome ingredients, it makes me a very happy camper.

Read my full review here! http://joeatsf.wordpress.com/2013/02/13/fresh-roll/
author: Joseph F.

description: I went yesterday with my mentor and it was awesome!!! loved every bit of it, I got the bowl with chicken and shrimp and it was perfect! geesh im looking for somthing else for lunch but I think im going to just go back for lunch today,lol OHHHHHH YEAH VERY FRESH, YUP IM GOING THERE FOR LUNCH TODAY
author: Rakita O.

description: Although I've only tried their spring rolls (which are delicious!), I'm obsessed with this place. I go to school about an hour away from the city and I find myself craving their spring rolls! All their ingredients are super fresh and paired with their dipping sauces = perfection. My favorite thing to put in the rolls is the fried tofu, but the chicken is also really good. I usually get their peanut sauce and sriracha for my dipping sauces, and they pair up with the rolls deliciously. Their staff members are all very friendly and accommodating, and the prices are reasonable for a college student on a budget. I'm really excited to try all of their other things on the menu!
author: Josephine L.

description: Tried this place for the first time recently and had their spring rolls. Think of it as a chipotle for healthier Asian style food. I got to pick the ingredients in my rolls while they made them in front of me and then they have plenty of dipping sauces on the side. Their pho is also pretty good but not like the "real" pho at an actual pho restaurant but s good nonetheless.
author: Natally A.

description: Freshroll offers quick, healthy (Americanized) Vietnamese food. The ingredients seems fresh and pretty good quality, and I dig the "chipotle style" ordering and their selection of sauces. I know it's the FiDi, but I do feel it's pretty pricey for what you get--I spent $11.15 on a shrimp salad here today which was basically a 1/4-1/3 cup of little shrimpies and some salad with veggie toppings. Unless you're getting something with rice, you're probably going to want a side to get full. I like fresh roll, but the small portions of protein (and the priciness of bumping up the portion...It's 4.50 extra for additional shrimp! Seriously?) I'll probably save fresh roll for my trying to be healthy while going to the movies meal option.
author: Meryl S.

description:
I'm a happily won-over customer of Fresh Roll.

My first experience there in mid-November wasn't that great. I mean, the food was fantastic (really fantastic), but I thought the line went far too slow. I submitted a comment about it through Fresh Roll's website online (not expecting any response), and within a few hours the owner Chad contacted me to learn more in an attempt to solve the issue. I was really impressed by the personal care he took with his business, to find out exactly why a customer was dissatisfied, and to open the dialogue (and take suggestions) on how he intends to address it going forward. 

I gave Fresh Roll another shot the very next day (during non-prime time) and have been hooked ever since. I'm ok with a slightly slower line vs. similar establishments if the food is so good (you really do have to try it!) and if the owner puts such a sincere effort into making sure customers are satisfied. Good customer service really does make a difference!!
author: C L.

description:
i had the freshrolls and freshroll iced tea. 

for the rolls, i got the lemongrass pork, chicken and shrimp. all 3 were tasty. i got the peanut and sweet & sour chili sauces. i feel like the peanut sauce wasn't "peanutty" enough; then again, i love sweet & sour chili sauces, so i can be bias. 

i liked the iced tea. it wasn't too sweet and i found it to be a nice palette cleanser. i felt like i was able to taste each roll because i would be able to refresh my taste buds.

even though it was all tasty, i wish the total didn't come out to be over $10. 3 rolls and a ice tea for over $10? definitely not a cheap meal.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Nom NoM NOM:  Fresh Roll Lemon Grass Pork with Pineapple & Citrus Sauce
Blah Blah Blah:  Assembly line was a little hectic and prices are on the higher side.

::::Lowdown::::
It was a nice sunny day and my tummy was craving for something light and tasty.  So I ventured down to Freshroll and tried their spring rolls.  I noted that the prices were higher than your usual spring rolls but you get 3x huge stuff rolls so it's actually pretty worth it.  They also have a snack option where you can buy one roll instead of 3 for less.  I chose 1x chicken, 1x pork, 1x crispy tofu.  All made the same style with picked veggies, red bell pepper, and pineapple.  For sauces i picked the go to peanut sauce and opted to try the citrus ginger one for .25 cents more.  

::::Showdown::::
The lemon grass pork with pineapple dip in that Citrus Ginger sauce was my fav.  All the flavors complemented each other perfectly and the sauce reminded me of  traditional Vietnamese Mam Nem only healthier and less fishy.  I want the recipe for this sauce!!!  The peanut was good too, but it's like what can find everywhere else.

The chicken and tofu were good, but not the best.  The grilled chicken didn't have that bonus flavor of lemongrass and the tofu were cut in these small slices that were not as filling as their meat counter part.

They have lots of other ways and combinations of designing your own roll so it will be interesting to come back next time and try something different.  The place is brand spanking new and all modern and nice, but I chose to take my rolls to the park behind the Metreon to enjoy in the sun.

::::Breakdown::::
Food: 4.5 Stars
Place: 4 Stars
Service: 3.5 Stars
Overall: 4 Stars
author: Manohak S.

description:
This place was a surprise to me.  I'm half vietnamese and have never seen a place try to appeal to a massive non-vietnamese crowd the way that Freshroll does.  They appeared to be somewhat newly opened and were quick to offer simple explanations of the ingredients and offerings.  It was obvious they were used to doing so.  They take a Chipotle approach to their business in that you choose what you want (roll, boll; etc) and they make it in front of you as you choose the type of meat and stuffings.  I had 3 different types of rolls there (there were 4 different types of meat to choose) and loved all of them and ended up coming back there 3-4 times during the week I was in San Fran.  This place is quick, cheap, and very clean.  

The only item I didn't like as much was their vietnamese coffee.  Vietnamese coffee can be hard to make in large batches and the version they had was somewhat dumbed down for a non-vietnamese pallette.  All in all it lacked the chickory and strong concentrated taste that is a signature of vietnamese coffee.  They noticed we didn't like it and asked why and were very apologetic about it.  Still a very good experience.  I recommended this place to one of my coworkers there with me on the trip and they loved it having never tried vietnamese wraps before.  

Definitely worth checking out.
author: Michael L.

description: Freshroll is Vietnamese Fast Food. You select your meat, and you have the option of rolls, sandwich, rice bowl, or pho. I got the rolls with the pork, and taro chips. My coworkers got the sandwich and the rice bowl, and the lychee tea. He said the tea wasn't very strong, but for me the food was simply delicious. Very fresh. Next time I'll go for the rice bowl..the proportion is a deal! And I didn't get to try the vinaigrette :(( The decor is very mod with white high tables and green swivel chairs. Oh and the cashier kinda winked at me when I was getting water for my table hahaha
author: Aleena S.

description: This is an Americanized version of a Vietnamese fast food restaurant. They have pho, spring rolls, and banh mi sandwiches. I had the spring rolls.. Two pork and a chicken. It was okayyyy.. I like the concept of the place, but I feel it lacks substance and flavor. I think I can get more authentic rolls at the local Lee's Sandwiches.
author: Jenn L.

description: LOVE this place.  I usually get the freshrolls with fresh tofu. The pho broth is delicious as well. My only complaint is that I wish they had the option to buy individual rolls rather than the set of three. :/
author: Wendy R.

description:
