We discovered this place by accident but we LOVE it.  Can't wait to come back here again.  I like how they make everything fresh right in front of you.  The prices are reasonable but the extras are not - which is not really necessary anyway, except for extra meat if you're a protein fiend like myself.  

I also loved the customer service here.  Very personable.  The place was shiny clean and the ambience was great.  We came here on a Sunday evening so it was not very busy at all.  

Oh, and a slew of sauces to choose from.  

By the way, I ordered some fresh rolls to go (had them for breakfast the next day - YUMMY).  They claim that the freshrolls are almost as filling as the bowls but that must be an inside joke or something because it does not even come close.  That's okay I still love this place.  5/5 hands down.
author: Yelpin T.

description: Pricey for the quality, taste a little odd.  My rolls were done by new bee,  lettuce sticking out of the roll, breaks down easily.  Not worth the price, we were hungry after the so called meal....
author: Steve D.

description:
I used to come quite often before or during a break in class at the city college across the street because you can get your order pretty quick. And I actually enjoyed it a lot and thought the quality of their fresh rolls was kind of high for a fast food type of Vietnamese joint. But I was starting to notice a slow decline in quality of the food and the energy of the employees during my last few visits. I finally came back after about a two month absence and found myself extremely disappointed in my meal. It wasn't quite the same - the "zing" in their rolls that I used to get on the first, second or third bite seemed absent now. And the vermicelli bowl just disappointed me even more. It was all just plain bland, bland, bland. Where I once found the chicken and pork to be cooked well (texture-wise) with lots of flavour i thought was now slightly tough, overcooked and lacking taste. Plus the vermicelli tasted a bit mushy too and seemed like it had been sitting out too long. 

And gosh it's expensive here. I guess I must have ignored it before and a disappointing dinner makes you think about how much you just paid. $20+ change for 3 rolls and a vermicelli bowl?? What was I thinking! Overall I'm not sure if I'll be coming here as often as I used to. I think the high traffic coming from the convention goers has finally turned them into an assembly line where quality takes a back seat to profit.
author: Mercy D.

description: LOVE spring rolls so when I found out this is customized-spring roll making place, I was STOKED. The concept is simple, it's basically build-your-own-spring-roll (and something else but I forget the other thing). I will say that at first glance, it's slightly pricier than your average spring roll and at first, I felt like the portion sizes were a little on the smaller size (you get 3 large spring rolls but it was a little light on the meat). HOWEVER, the taste is REALLY good and I actually ended up feeling pretty full and considered it a whole meal. Service is really friendly too so the whole experience is just great. Definitely gonna make this a lunch spot from now on
author: Diana Y.

description: We were looking for a quick bite after the movies.  All of us enjoy Vietnamese food (one of us is Vietnamese) and we were kinda curious but didn't have high expectations.  Turns out just what you want from Vietnamese food - very fresh veggies, mix of hot and fruit, great sauces and good meat.  It was nicely done.  All of us ordered different things and really enjoyed our meals.
author: Rhonda f.

description: Fun concept, Chipotle style spring rolls, bowls, and banh mi. We had the lemongrass pork spring rolls, tasty and totally more filling than you'd think. Peanut and ginger sauce were great.
author: Natalie D.

description: this place is great. i always feel like i'm eating a healthy meal at a reasonable price when i go there. it's really one of the better vietnamese places in the city despite not being 100% authentic. it's my summer tradition to eat here for a nice cool lunch on a hot day. i recommend the crispy goodness from time to time.
author: Ryan K.

description: been here for dinner twice in a row. clean environment and wonderful service. stick to the standard rolls with sweet and sour sauce because they are the winners by far!
author: Lulu L.

description: Just are here while at a conference at Moscone- delicious! I got the bowl with lemongrass pork, noodles, and standard toppings, and even threw on a side of chicken broth. The lemongrass pork was possibly the best I've ever had in any restaurant. The mix of ingredients was perfect and it was extremely filling while still being light. It was extremely crowded but the worked quickly and that's really to be expected at lunch hour across from a conference center. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. I will definitely come back throughout the week!
author: Lauren R.

description: Seriously, I dream of the Banh Mi's and bowls from this place. I think it is about time to make the hour drive just to have lunch here. This place is AMAZING!!!
author: Sam R.

description:
I don't mean to interrupt this review, but Saigon Sandwiches have the best Vietnamese-Style Sandwiches ever! (Kanye Satire)

I paid $9.63 for a meal that consisted of a Vietnamese style tofu sandwich and iced tea. The sandwiches here aren't terrible or bad, they just aren't worth the seven dollar price tag. I can get a bigger and tastier Vietnamese sandwich a couple blocks down on Larkin Street for a mere $3.50. 

Pros:
The Taro Chips were tasty and light. They also only cost two bucks.
The Iced Tea is lightly sweetened yet refreshing. It's also only two bucks.
Great customer service and super friendly people who are willing to take questions and give food recommendations.
They have fresh cucumber water and samples of the taro chips for customers to try for free.
Different sauces to choose from.

Cons:
Small portion size for a sandwich that costs seven dollars.
A little overpriced for street food with the exception of the chips and iced tea.
Sandwich wasn't mind-blowingly amazing, just okay and filling. For seven dollars, I'm expecting more.

A good option for people who want a healthy, light meal. For now, I'll go back to the best Vietnamese Sandwiches in town which are only a couple blocks away for a much cheaper price. Definitely a good place to try out, but they haven't completely wowed me yet. I'll go back to the Beyonce of Vietnamese Sandwiches for now.
author: Penelope R.

description: Mmm..I'm drooling just remembering the spring rolls.  The place is assembly line style and you get to choose what you want in your spring rolls.  I kinda felt hurried by the server; I chose my toppings as fast as I could.  I tried all their sauce options and loved them all, especially the peanut sauce.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Freshroll is like the Vietnamese version of Chipotle -- choose your own meat, filling and dipping sauce. The sauces were unique and different from traditional ones I've had at other restaurants. Great for a quick snack or light lunch. Love the concept and would definitely try it again!
author: Emery C.

description: I love this place. Fresh ingredients (just like the name!) and yummy food. Not a quick lunch if you are trying to get in and out. The seating isn't the best either. I would suggest calling ahead and taking it togo.
author: Gina T.

description:
Sooo yummy. The pork sandwich is absolutely to die for, but they also have lighter options that are amazing if you feel like being even healthier. All the ingredients taste/look really fresh, and are so flavorful. 

Clean, comfortable space. The staff has always been friendly but efficient (which is important, given the popularity of it).

Definitely my go-to spot before/after any Metreon movie night!
author: Laurel A.

description: Came in looking for Pho and that's the only reason this isn't 5 stars. But delicious grilled chicken sandwich. Good variety of sauces to choose from as well. All in all a good quick bite!!
author: Taylor H.

description:
We were there tonight to try their food. We ordered the beef pho, the garlic shrimp rice, and the grilled chicken rolls. The pho noodle soup was not hot enough. The broth was very bland. There was no flavor on garlic shrimp! It looked like frozen shrimp that just got defrosted. The grilled chicken also tasted very dry & bland.
The service was so so...the place was very dirty with sauces /trash all over the floor & tables. Overall this was not authentic VNmese food ever! It was such a shame to claim it as VNmese food!!!
We won't come back !
author: Huyen P.

description: Quick, convenient, fairly priced. My 1 problem is that the food was a little bland, I had to drown my rolls in Sriracha and barbecue sauce. However,  the pho was very enjoyable.
author: George K.

description: If you are in or around the Moscone Center this is a perfect lunch spot. Although busy, the service is quick and there are a decent amount of chairs considering the small size of the restaurant. The place serves fresh Vietnamese spring rolls with all types of stuff inside. You basically get rice, veggies, and surprisingly pineapple. I wasn't in a roll mood, so I got a bowl with all the same ingredients. It was pretty balanced from a flavor perspective and I loved that the kick of the fresh jalapeno was calmed by the citrus. Anyway, pop in this place for a quick, cheap bite.
author: Channa P.

description: I really enjoy Freshroll. The 3 roll combo is a great lunch, and their sandwiches are good as well. I wish that the line went a bit faster. If you don't get there before noon, you're likely to wait a lot longer than you might want to. That's the only reason Freshroll gets 4 stars. Food-wise, it's five stars to me.
author: Chris T.

description: I do like the fresh rolls and the bowls here. And I think they have a great business model here and great food. BUT, why is it that for the few times that I have been here, the person who rings me at the register, always pisses me off.  It's never even the same person. The first time, all I did was ask for a tray, because I got a combo meal. I couldn't hold it all in my hands. But when I asked the guy at the register, he looked really annoyed and said "No we don't do that here." Was it really that dumb of a question? It's fine if you don't have trays, but don't give me attitude about that. Another time, I told the girl at the register, I wanted my food to go. The girl at the register thought I said "for here". Then here comes another annoyed look. It almost seemed like it was too difficult for her to cover my fresh roll box with a plastic cover? So here I am again, struggling to hold a combo meal, but this time I'm taking it to go. And it wasn't until I already put my food in my own reusuable grocery bag, that she asked if I needed a bag. SO THOUGHTFUL. It almost seems like the people at the register are miserable. I don't want to eat food, knowing that people who serviced it to me appear to be miserable. Before I accepted the fact that their fresh rolls, banh mis, and bun are a little more in price, than other vietnamese restaurants. But I don't know if it's worth it anymore. Maybe I'll change my mind, when I see an improvement in customer service here. Until then, I'll stick with my old spots.
author: April D.

description: For a hefty price of $10.07, FreshRoll delivers a mediocre, basic, and most laughable version of  Vietnamese Chicken Noodle soup. In addition, to being simple and boring, the size of the bowl is definitely not even worth a quarter of its ridiculous price. I understand that the location of the restaurant is in the heart of a racy city bustling with trade and commerce, HOWEVER, I can think of a plethora of TRUE Vietnamese restaurants that offer better prices, sizes, and above all, FLAVOR than FreshRoll. Please, as a fellow Friscoan and , in general, lover of food, don't spend your money here unless you want a bad experience and terrible representation of Vietnamese cuisine.
author: Jason S.

description: This place is right across the street from Moscone Center, and is a great place to go for a quick meal of healthy, real food. I had a bowl of pho, and it was exactly what I needed. You can tell the meat they used was good quality because it had great flavor and texture. It wasn't overcooked at all. The broth also had good flavor. This place is a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Ellie P.

description: So good! The line can be long but it moves fast. I went two days in a row bc loved it so much. I just a single roll and the taro chips, pretty darn good!
author: brittany g.

description: Delicious food and excellent service! The staff is amazingly friendly. A wonderful place to grab a quick healthy meal. I love that they're open for dinner too.
author: Phoebe H.

description: LOVE this place. If you're getting a roll make sure to add the "crispy goodness". ALL the protein choices are good whether it's chicken, pork, tofu, or shrimp!
author: Ryan S.

description:
So nice to have a healthy option in the sea of fast food madness.

The description of it being a Vietnamese Chipotle pretty much says it all, but I'll take Freshroll over Chipotle any day.

I have 3 spring rolls, and they were kind enough to make me one chicken, one tofu, and one shrimp so I could try the different flavors. They were all good.  I topped it off with a Vietnamese coffee (similar to Thai Iced Tea,) and I was one happy camper.  

A great alternative to the food being served at the Moscone Center, where I was attending a convention.  I wish I had found it sooner.
author: Marianne G.

description: Quick, delicious, healthy, filling.  Can you ask for anything more?  I eat like twice a week for lunch.  I have tried everything and my favorite are the PORK rolls with everything except pineapple, extra cilantro.  Vietnamese vinaigrette as dipping sauce. Yum!
author: Jessica L.

description: A fast food Vietnamese style place with healthy rolls, sandwiches and pho soups. Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was helpful and friendly.
author: Joyce B.

description: I'm not exactly a Vietnamese food connoisseur  but the Freshwich was delicious. Lemongrass pork, everything on it, and I added pineapple for a little extra. Best decision of the night. Hidden gem in the Yerba Buena gardens area. Good food, good portion, for a great price. Definitely recommend.
author: Adrian A.

description:
Three freshly made lemongrass pork rolls, a side of pho soup and a really strong iced coffee. Who would not want that for lunch? ;-) 

This is going to be my next favorite resto whenever I come visit SFO. :-)
author: Monching R.

description: i'm addicted to their veg freshrolls. generally ppl behind counter n billing area are really nice. but today tried their veg soup. it's got nothing useful it... it is missing the heart veggies i have seen in soups at other vietnamese/japanese places. so for soups i will go to cha-ya or saiwalk. for rolls, i like this place n highly recommend it.
author: Malvika B.

description: This place is delicious and healthy and fresh... My only compliant is that they charge extra for shrimp and avocado but other than that
author: Sophie J.

description:
Good stuff!

Chipotle style but with Vietnamese food.   Great portions, fresh ingredients, and delicious food.
author: Ryan N.

description: Stayed at nearby hotel and was craving a Vietnamese sandwich, so lucky to have found this place. But.. It's a very Americanized sandwich for about $7 - made Chipotle style. The bread is disappointing and too thick like a Dutch Crunch roll versus the preferred lighter, flaky rolls from true Vietnamese eateries. Place is clean and service was good otherwise.
author: L W.

description: One of my most memorable memory during my 5 day vaca.  The whole concept is so creative.  These rolls taste like vietnamese sandwiches turned into spring rolls!  I love vietnamese sandwiches but sometimes I'm not feeling all that bread.
author: Giang D.

description: Flies in the food bar from where they serve the food.
author: Inigo M.

description:
my friends who had just moved back into town and i were looking for a good dinner and we went to try fresh roll!  parking is a bit difficult if you are not already in the area but there is always the parking lot at yerba buena.

we run in and they are about to close noooooooooooooooooooooo but the owner keeps them open just for us and we are so so grateful!  we ordered drinks and the lychee tea is not bad.  the limeade is not too sweet and doesnt make you want to pour water or iced tea into it.

we shared a bahn mi and also chicken springroll and everything was surprisingly delicious!  what makes the bahn mi awesome is the slightly spciy and slightly sweet sauce inside and the pile of fresh meat.  the roll was lightly toasted and tasted super fresh!  as for the springroll, its defintely not your typical fresh spring roll from the pho restaurant.  everything is really super fresh (opposite of pho reputation) from the greens to the noodles to the rice paper roll.  the meat is warm and perfectly seasoned, moist and not lacking at all.  everyone has also mentioned crispy goodness which i think is really genius!!  its like having a fried springroll and a fresh spring roll combined into one.

will definitely stop in again when im in the area and hungry
author: claudia y.

description: Fresh Roll is a top notch place that really makes me want to touch myself after I eat there. Not only is it delicious, but it also very healthy and cheap. The "Nom Nom" sauce is extremely tasty and reminds me of the stuff that comes out of my pee pee when i get really excited. The "Crunchy Goodness" is also a must have when ordering the rolls!
author: Heisenberg W.

description: Absolutely incredible - fresh, delicious and resonantly priced! It's a great option for a light lunch downtown, and the variety is just enough to be interesting but not enough to be overwhelming.
author: Ben N.

description: I love this place. I eat lunch here almost everyday. Love the peanut sauce with rolls. Cant recommend this place enough
author: Chicago D.

description: I tried the fresh rolls with 3 different filings: lemongrass pork, chicken, and tofu.. highly recommend the lemongrass pork. Very tasty and has very tantalizing smells. The chicken are Ok
author: Julyana T.

description: Loved it here! I got to build my own fresh roll. I chose the chicken (well seasoned) with pineapple, jalapeño and extra pickles vegetables. They had 5 dipping sauces to choose from. I would definitely eat here again!
author: J B.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken pho (currently only available at the Moscone Center local). There was so much I couldn't finish if and go into the fresh wrap. I bet it is as great as the soup. A do again.
author: Lilly J.

description:
I typically don't write Yelp reviews because 1.) I just can't be bothered, 2.) Yelp isn't paying me, and 3.) I'm busy traveling the world reviewing opera productions and the last thing I want to do is spend my free time writing another review. And yet here I am typing away on a Sunday night when I could very well be watching Mad Men reruns. Why? Because Freshroll is DA BOMB. You know those rolls at Slanted Door? I used to love them. But now, compared to the rolls they make at Freshroll, the Slanted Door ones are like poo poo. That's right, I said it. They're like turd logs. Freshroll is giving Charles Phan a run for his money. 

A couple of girlfriends joined me here for dinner last Friday and we were all blow away. The ingredients were super fresh. We ordered chicken and pork (really tender w/ lots of flavor) in our rolls and tried all the different dipping sauces. The sauces were good individually, but when you get all of them and mix em up together, the combination of the flavors will blow your mind. The crispy goodness (fried, crispy green onion), DAMN! My mouth is starting to water just thinking about it. And the jasmine lychee iced tea - LAWD HAVE MERCY!!! It is the perfect blend of floral and fruit, with just a hint of sweetness. If you're like me, someone who can't stand artificially flavored super sweet drinks, then this beverage is for you. It's probably one of the best iced tea beverages I have ever tasted. And the customer service was superb. We were somewhat indecisive about what to order (everything looked so good) and the owner was really helpful and patient in helping us through the selection process. Everyone else was incredibly friendly. Can't wait to bring my mom here for lunch this week! I will definitely be a regular.

NB: I have VERY discerning taste buds. Some would even call me a food snob, whatever that means. But I will tell you, the reader, that I have been to all of the top Michelin star restaurants in SF, NYC, Paris, London, Shanghai, etc. I've taken culinary trips to Italy, Spain, Turkey, Greece, Morocco, and at the end of the month I will be doing a 3-week food tour of Sicily. It's safe to say that I have tasted some of the most divine meals this world has to offer. So when I'm telling you that the food at Freshroll is outstanding, believe it.
author: Alice Z.

description: How could I not give 5 stars to a healthy SOMA lunch spot?  I love fresh spring rolls, and they earn the name at this location.  Moderately quick service, friendly people behind the counter, and the option for a cup of chicken pho broth as a side!?  Let's get real here.  Ok the pho wasn't fabulous but I love the idea.  Get the peanut sauce, and put tons of sriracha in to complement.  Also get the ginger sauce.  Walk through the Metreon and enjoy your lunch in the park.  The pork and chicken are tender and flavorful, the tofu is a bit on the dry side but still very good when smothered in sauce.  GET SOME!
author: William B.

description: Craving Vietnamese food? This is the place. A Quick, fresh, and unique restaurant that has a variety of Vietnamese choices from sandwiches to tofu bowls. I will definitely be back.
author: Max O.

description: It's an okay fast asian food restaurant. Don't get fooled by its appearance of small food. They actually make you feel pretty full. I wouldn't go there again on my own tho. "Foodwise", it's actually pretty good. But I prefer going to the actual restaurant and eat there.
author: Fong C.

description: Walked into this place on a whim after perusing Chronicle Books and was very, very pleased! I only tried the spring rolls, but the pork was well cooked, and the rolls were well wrapped - no falling apart, ingredients evenly placed, etc. The peanut sauce wasn't spicy, just flavorful and the perfect compliment to the vegetables in the roll. I'd love to go back and try more!
author: Laurie B.

description: Very fast, delicious, healthy food! I wish these were everywhere. Many great combinations to be made, and tasty sauces.
author: Reed M.

description: I happened upon Freshroll while looking for some good soup to nurse a bad cold.  I am so glad I gave their pho a shot.  The best part has to be the broth.  It is clearly made from scratch, you can smell the chicken and spices - it is so aromatic and flavorful.  The noodles are thin and the portion of beef is very generous, and thinly sliced so that it cooks perfectly in the hot broth.  I have had the beef pho two days in a row now and will keep Freshroll on my "go to" list when I need some good soup.
author: Christina P.

description: Fresh Roll is a great new twist on Vietnamese cuisine.  The rolls are excellent, and the vermicelli bowls are just as delicious!!  Definitely recommended!
author: Adam S.

description: This place looks like your typical mall franchise eatery but it was actually pretty good.  Had the grilled chicken with brown rice and their special sauce and my girl got the grilled pork.  Both were really good.  Everything was really fresh and tasty.  Love Vietnamese food and these guys actually delivered on that craving!  Pleasantly surprised.  Right next to Metreon, perfect for some pre-movie grindz!!
author: Ramon L.

description: I've been going here since Day 1 and I gotta say, even though they had a rocky start in the beginning (rolls were falling apart like crazy), FreshRoll has definitely improved!  The rolls and sauces have always been tasty since the beginning, but the rolls now don't fall apart super easily anymore, and the staff seems friendlier and more trained.  Sometimes the line is out the door during lunchtime when there is a conference going on across the street at the Moscone Center, but hey, that 15-20 minute wait is worth it for my spring roll craving! This place is definitively worth a visit.  It's a nice take on traditional Vietnamese food with a modern, Chipolte style twist.
author: T D.

description: OK.  A-OK?  Kind of industrial.  I was expecting less kind of industrial.  But okay.
author: Biggie F.

description: Expensive ass viet food but good if you don't want to walk into the tenderloin.  Portions are small.  May want to double your order.
author: Fatty A.

description: For clean Vietnamese food, this is the place to go.  But don't come here expecting real Vietnamese food.  Only the basics are here.  They use the same meat for sandwiches, noodles, and rolls.  The rolls are totally not worth it.  For the same price you get one for one third the amount of food.
author: Byron L.

description: Meh. That's the one word to describe my experience. I have no idea how this place has 4.5 stars... it makes me mis-trustful of  Yelp's reviews. I live about a five minute walk away and will not be wasting my money here again.
author: Mel S.

description: This place gets four stars because I love spring rolls! It's affordable, fast, & delicious!
author: Heather B.

description:
my new go to place in this area. 

i've had their pork freshrolls and bowls. both delish. also the taro chips are to die for. all really good and fast. and decently priced at $8 each (freshrolls and bowl)

place is on a ROLL with being so FRESH! :)
author: Janet Y.

description: I found this place as a recommendation from a co-worker. The food was great and the customer service was really friendly. Since they are a new business, they were open to constructive feedback and I thought their willingness to listen to their customers was a great approach after just opening. I wish them all the best as a new business.
author: Julie C.

description:
Yummmaayyyy!

I was super excited to see a Vietnamese place open up near my hood in the Soma/South Beach area.  I have frequented this place about 3 times since opening and I love it.  its clean, trendy, and hightech, but enough chit chat on to the food! 

The Freshroll w/ shrimp and kah runch style is my fave.  I would also recommend the Citrus sauce (a cooler version of nuoc nam).  It is pretty cool that you can get the Freshroll made to your specifications, the assembly line reminded me of a sandwhich shop, but Vietnamese.  Also, Kah runch style is when they roll a small spring roll type thing into the summer roll, it makes for a pretty neat texture profile.

If you want something even more filling than the Freshrolls i would recommend the noodle bowls.  They definitely don't skimp on the meat and one order of these bowls will certainly fill your belly.  I'd recommend extra preserved veggies if you do order this.

Last but not least the banh mi.  These banh mi are definitely some of the best i have had in the city.  Buns are grilled on the inside like an in and out burger bun, which provides a really nice crisp.  Lots of meat and the special sauce is awesome.  I'd recommend adding jalapenos for some kick, but hey I like my food spicy.  I also like getting the special sauce on the side because dipping the sandwich into the sauce makes for an awesome experience.  The special sauce reminds me of a spicy thousand island dressing but thinner and without the relish.  Super tasty.
author: Steve T.

description: Came here for lunch and ordered the Vietnamese noodle bowl with chicken, lettuce, and the add-ins option (I think it's called kuch punch?) that includes the fried onions and the vinaigrette sauce, which I would recommend for the sauces because it covers the noodles really nicely - it's perfectly tangy and has really great flavor. YUM. The peanut sauce was really good though too - I especially liked that one for our pork spring rolls. Meat was nice and juicy and perfectly seasoned.  And make sure to grab a Vietnamese iced coffee to drink. Quick, light and deliciously satisfying, I think I just found my new favorite go-to spot!
author: Michelle J.

description:
I have been here a few times and can say they have delicious rice paper rolls.
It's always very fresh and the meats are good quality.  The dipping sauces compliment the roles and hit the mark!!
Try for yourself.
author: Orry M.

description: Hardly any protein in the rice bowl. Chicken was aweful! Dark meat badly cooked with tiny small burnt pieces... Eew!! Ask them some more protein and they will charge you extra! Cold noodles and hardly any chôice of veggies. Crispy tofu is soggy!
author: varsha a.

description:
I have had several recent experiences that have compelled me to post an updated review. I was originally a big fan of this place. But for those of us who ate here when it opened the change for the worse is noticeable.

Why it is worse.

1. The staff. In my last 3 visits the staff has been, at best indifferent, if not unpleasant. In particular, one team member who rang up 2 of my last 3 visits didn't even say hi. She just said "2 fresh rolls and a chicken bowl. Any thing else?" 

Well I should be more complete. She did say one other thing on one of my visits. I'll get to that as I comment on the second issue.

2. The portions. In particular the Chicken bowls are now a joke. They now "measure" the rice. However, the staff never actually fills the measuring  bowl. They use it as a scoop. Invariably I have noticed they fill the bowl about half way and then have a little extra coming over the top of the 'scoop' and they dump that into the serving bowl. 

This ties back to my comment about being more complete in item 1. 3 visits back, when they prepped the bowl, I noticed I could easily see the bottom of the bowl and I asked if they could add a little extra rice. The prep guy did that without blinking. 

As I got to the register, the less than friendly person mentioned above, not only said "2 fresh rolls and a chicken bowl", she proceeded to say "... and 1 dollar for a side of rice". I said I didn't get a side of rice and she looked at me and said it was for the extra rice I got in the bowl. I snapped back... and I admit I 'snapped' back, because I was already irritated at this point that the initial portion was so small and she had already been less the courteous prior to her comment. I told her I have never had that happen before. She proceeded to tell me it was policy and she needed a manager. But she couldn't find one so she didn't charge the dollar but told me again it was policy. And the whole time she just kept making faces.

So lets review all the problems with this scenario. I) I would not have asked if the serving weren't so ridiculously small to begin with. II) If you have a policy to charge people for a full side of rice when they ask for a little extra rice then warn them in advance. III) Don't try to make excuses especially if you plan on removing the charge anyway. Just say 'sorry that was not mentioned when you made the request. I will of course not charge you. But for future reference....'

But frankly the larger issue is the tiny portion to begin with. 

I went tonight, which will be my last time for awhile, and they not only still did the tiny rice serving thing, they put a really small amount of chicken (not even a full level spoonful of that). There was at least a full inch between the top of the chicken and the top of the bowl. But to add insult to injury, if you look at the photos the bowls are filled to the top.

Frankly I can go to Sorobol, pay 1$ more than what Freshroll charges and get enough chicken and rice to feed both of my kids and have leftovers. But I cannot even come close to saying the same for what Freshroll is serving. And at Sorobol they are always friendly. 

I am just disappointed with how this place has changed.

The only thing that it has going for it is that the food is still tasty. 

But truthfully, tasty food doesn't really make up for poor customer service and cover for that feeling that you are being taken. 

That business model works for their primary customer, transient convention goers. But we locals expect more! 

Not sure if the restaurant today really reflects the owner's aspirations. I recall talking with him when he first opened and I don't think the place today lives up to his vision.. but people change and his restaurant sure did too.
author: Alan B.

description: THE MAN GOT SRIRACHA!  I went back again and saw little cups of my wonderful rooster sauce by the counter.  For those of you who have charred innards like myself, this is the final missing piece of the puzzle.  I also tried a Banh Mi this time, which was good, but still loving the lemongrass pork freshrolls (which I got again...customer beware, they are much more filling than they appear, could not finish my Banh Mi).
author: Phil L.

description: Yeah it's cheap, fast, fresh and good for lunch but the interior can use some more cleaning.  Not sure why some enjoy the food so much, it's just decent, and definitely a bit too bland.  It's one of the few healthier places for lunch in that area, I guess.
author: Adrian H.

description: love this place!!!  got some spring rolls with chicken. forgot the exact name but it came with a delicious crispy goodness (i think a fried wonton wrapped green onion).  the chicken was super well flavored and incredibly moist!!!  i hate some of these "vietnamese" places that fail miserably in bringing the flavor (like bun mee, gross) but fresh roll delivers big time in this area!  my bf got the pork bahn mi and the pork was succulent and the special sauce they use is to die for.   im excited to keep coming here for delicious yet healthy meals!   im also obsessed with the jasmine iced tea.  i hate overly sweetened tea... after all i am not trying to ingest 200 calories worth of sugar in my drink - the lightly sweetened jasmine iced tea here is perfect - just a hint of sweetness to enhance the fragrant jasmine flavor. i could drink it by the gallons :)
author: Olivia T.

description: Freshroll is Vietnamese with a bit of an Americanized fusion touch done right. First I have to say, the place is really clean and modern. Two adjectives I don't normally use to describe a Vietnamese restaurant. They have a nice layout, clean white lines and an open kitchen. Doesn't look like much is going on back there, as most of the food is pre prepped and ready to roll a la chipotle style. 8 dollars will get you a combo of 3 rolls ranging from tofu, bbq pork, lemon grass chicken, or garlic shrimp. Pick your toppings and sauces and you're all set. Eating here I've come to realize Vietnamese makes a perfect lunch time meal cause its light, healthy, and won't make you feel tired afterwards. Everything is also neatly packed, so you can bring it to Yerba Buena Gardens or back to the office.
author: Charlie L.

description:
This is the worst Vietnamese I have ever had. Their rolls are far from being fresh.
 
The vegetables are tasteless and semi-mushy - I  suspect they are GMOs and not organic. 

I ordered two rolls with chicken and one roll with shrimp. The chicken was blend and to my surprise I found a piece of cartilage in one of the rolls. Although the shrimp roll was a notch better, it tasted more like water down ceviche than a traditional Vietnamese shrimp. 

This is Vietnamese food banalized to people that have no palate or any knowledge what a Vietnamese cuisine is supposed to be. There is nothing fresh or Vietamese about it. The owners should change the name to 49rs Roll - it cater well to that particular kind of customer, they even have a dish named after them. 

This place is an insult to the Vietnamese culture.
author: Marcello C.

description:
There aren't a lot of places in the FiDi / Metreon area that offer a clean & healthy alternative to a soup or salad.  The rolls and banh mi were tasty, just filling enough without giving me food coma, and I really abused the chili sauce.  I came back a second time and found out they were offering cups of chicken pho broth as a side.  Since it's 55 degrees every day in SF, it's a perfect complement to your meal.  Don't forget to get the crunchy green onion stuff because it really makes a big difference in your roll.

To be honest, I'm not really a spring roll guy.  Probably because most places that offer spring rolls are in the TL and you don't really associate those restaurants with "clean & healthy."  Don't get me wrong; I like my sketchy hole-in-the-walls but maybe not every day (and certainly not when I'm in a lunch rush).

The staff was really friendly.  Since they're new, they were almost overly enthusiastic in making sure I was happy with my order.
author: David C.

description: Get the pho.  Amazing chicken broth only available m-f after 3pm and all day sat & sun
author: David W.

description:
Checked out this new place near Moscone tonight and it was great. The name says it all. You can really taste the difference when a spring roll is made fresh. I love those little packs of spring rolls at the Vietnamese market as much as anybody else but these rolls are so much better because the rolls are freshly prepared and they have lot of meat in them.

Try the Crunchy Goodness. They put a fried green onion eggroll in your Freshroll and it adds good flavor and great texture. Will definitely go back.
author: Delwin N.

description: Ordered online so I didn't have to wait when I got there. Got pork rolls. Really good with peanut sauce.
author: Marni S.

description: I wish I could eat here everyday!  Whenever I'm in FIDI I have to always stop by here!  Yum yum
author: Kat H.

description:
Diggin' Freshroll: fast, affordable counter-style spring rolls, noodle bowls, and banh mi sandwiches. If you're hungry, but looking to keep it (relatively) light , and desiring something other than the normal deli sandwich/salad fare, come check out this spot.

I had the grilled chicken spring rolls with avocado for under 10 bucks. The serving was plenty and definitely filled me up. I love me some veggies too so I was glad I could stuff my grilled chicken spring rolls with all the fix-ins. Though I arrived during a busier time the service was still very smooth and cordial. I'll definitely come back to try more on the menu.
author: Javier M.

description: I come here all the time; it's the healthiest affordable option in the area. I usually get the 3-roll combo with taro chips and a drink (all the drinks are yummy but the ice coffee is extra money). The rolls & bowls are delicious, but the service here is what puts it over the top! Even when things get busy everyone on staff is friendly and patient. I really like eating here.
author: Maryam M.

description: So I came here on its grand opening Saturday after a long day of shopping with my girlfriends at Union Square. We got super hungry and after hitting up Bloomingdales, walked to the Metreon and found this new Vietnamese place called Freshroll. I'm actually super excited a place like this opened up in SF because I am Vietnamese and from Orange County ( the best Viet food in the world) so there is a lack of good viet places to eat in the city and also I have super high standards for Viet food. I've never been to a place like it, it's like the Chiptotle concept where you put fresh meats and veggies in a rice paper and you dip in one of their many sauces. I think I ordered the 49-er roll I don't quite remember the name but it was the one with chicken. You can customize it so I substituted the  jalapeño for the tofu. Alls I got to say is that it was sooo delicious!! The rolls were big, tasty, super fresh, and the meat and sauce were very flavorful. It's the perfect low carb meal ( if u ask for no noodles)  but super satisfying at the same time. They have banh mi ( Vietnamese sandwich) on the menu also and I saw pho which I'd like to try next time. Prices were pretty cheap too, I got 3 fat rolls and it was like 7 bucks and I had 1.5 rolls left for later. I'm still thinking about the rolls a day after eating them because they were sooooo yummy but couldn't go again today because I had dinner plans in Palo Alto. I'm definitely going to be calling Freshroll on my way home from work so I can pick up some for my yummy healthy dinner.
author: Maria D.

description:
Just tried this new neighborhood spot for diet friendly options and wow!
Everything we tried was delicious and rivaling the offerings at Slanted Door, minus the steep prices. The hickey and lemongrass pork are succulent an everything is so freh and authentic.
The staff is supe nice and patient too!
Love all the sauce and topping  options...
author: Sara K.

description: Good Food very Tasty I would recommend for office catering,
author: Davon T.

description: I will give this place 4.5 stars. :) The Vietnamese Sandwiches are the bomb! Everything in the sandwiches are so fresh. Knocked half a star because of the price.
author: Crystal C.

description: Peanut sauce!! mmm So good.. Smart concept and great food. Their freshrolls are better than restaurant quality and much cleaner. Plus you can customize your own rolls. good stuff.
author: Jessica C.

description: This place was a surprisingly great find! All of my favorite foods! You get to choose exactly how you want your plate. It all tastes super fresh and feels healthy! I would definitely come back when I'm in the area!
author: Star M.

description: I went on a trip to San Francisco and my gf heard good reviews, so tried it out. From the moment we walked in I had a bad feeling. The cashier was a snot nose young kid who immediately gave us attitude. The food was terrible!! Stay away.
author: Ant L.

description: Vietnamese in a Chipotle kinda process. Tasty, fresh, fast! A little pricy for what it is, but convenient! I think they'll work out kinks over time.  The chicken is very tasty, but there was a bit much rice and kinda skimpy on avocado and other veggies.
author: Jamie W.

description:
This deceptively mom and pop shop fits in Westfield's revamp of the Metreon. Its clean, modern counter service design allows for an enjoyable eat-in experience or on the go. I work in Union Square and eat here at least once a week. 

I keep going back for their build your own spring rolls and bahn mi. My fave so far is the chicken "49er" spring rolls with crispy goodness. (Um, a green onion wrapped in rice paper and fried crispy? Yes, please!) Someday I'll branch and try their vermicelli bowls. But even then, I'll be getting their super tasty house iced tea. A little sweet, not too fruity, perfect on a sunny day.

Oh, and they take cards. Awesome.
author: Kate B.

description: I don't care if its nicknamed Vietnamese Chipotle, bc I love Chipotle too.  Fresh Roll seems like a relatively healthy option and its fairly fast and totally cheap.  I do order the rolls or bowls to the sandwich and the sauces are tasty.
author: Poppy C.

description:
I had the rolls with bbq pork and the 49er combination, which I chose because it had jalapenos.  The rolls were amazing!  The vegetables were really fresh, the bbq pork was tasty, and all the ingredients seemed to blend perfectly.  To top it off, the sweet and sour chili sauce was the perfect complement.  It was also the right amount of food and left me satisfied without feeling like I needed to go for a run immediately after.  The rolls definitely lived up to its name.

Service was also great, employing the assembly line process of serving food, which is great for someone on the go.  As far as the store itself, the decor was modern, simple, and clean.

I'll definitely come back and can't wait to try the other items on the menu.
author: Miko S.

description: I'm a super picky eater, and love healthy, fresh food. This place is amazing! I've had it twice now at a catered work event, and both times were amazing. To boot, the service is also fantastic. Also, I could eat the Spring rolls every single day.
author: Meg B.

description: Looking for a quick lunch before I catch my flight back to WA and this was just so close to the train station so I did decide to try it considering it looked like "fast" food. The line took longer than what I was expecting especially that the theme was very similar to Chipotle's. Just 2 days after a superb banh mi for just $3.00, I think that the price at this place is a little steep. However, I did enjoy the tofu bowl I ordered. The veggies were fresh and you could choose which to put in the bowl. The peanut sauce was a little disappointment though. I would not mind going back to this place again if they do decide to set up one in Seattle or Olympia.
author: Paul Q.

description:
unique concept & fantastic execution. customizable chipotle-like vietnamese rolls with healthy, fresh ingredients & delicious sauces (get the peanut sauce). i'd have gone for the food alone, but the service is also great - it's fast, everyone is friendly & it's incredibly comforting to be able to watch my food be cooked & prepared in the city. and still have it come out tasting delicious.

we ordered the 3-roll combo each & were surprised that we were actually really full afterwards (including the guys)..but not in the nasty way after eating a greasy/heavy meal. we got the tofu delight (for vegetarians) & 49er (chicken) rolls - both great. be sure to add the crispy goodness (fried green onion) for a real treat.

oh, and the taro chips - i LOVE taro chips & i daresay the ones here are some of the best i've had. they were even still warm when i had them. 

pair it with the freshroll iced tea & you will leave the place full, feeling healthy & happy!
author: Val C.

description: Meh. I was super hungry and geographically limited. A tofu noodle bowl seemed like a good vegetarian option. The tofu tasted very chemical as did the noodles. Also they pile so much stuff on top that the sauce never gets to the noodles. None of the other ingredients had much flavor either- guessing it was not very fresh. Jalapeños were not even spicy. Took forever to get it, too. My friend went next door to chipotle and had to wait for me for a solid 10ish minutes. Two stars because it was an ok quantity if you're just needing to fill up your belly. And possibly the meat options or rolls would be better. I probably wouldn't go back to find out though.
author: Abby D.

description: My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to eat last night and came across this place and we spent about two minutes looking at the menu before deciding it was for us, and we were not disappointed! The prices are incredibly good and the staff was so nice and patient while we ordered our custom rolls. They all seemed to love working there and made us feel very comfortable. It is an extremely clean and bright environment with windows that are perfect for people watching! We are already planning to go here again tomorrow, and whenever we're craving some fresh rolls!!
author: Rizzo B.

description: You get your money's worth with the three rolls they offer. You can customize and choose what goes in your roll... Kinda like subway. The ingredients are pretty fresh.
author: Franz C.

description: Fast, tasty Vietnamese lunch spot.  Their "Freshwich" with lemongrass pork, veggies, and nam nam sauce rocks, and my friend's noodle bowl was equally tasty.  Limited seating, noisy.
author: Jim S.

description: The food is good and it's nice for lunch, but they need more cashiers. The people trying to make your food move too quickly for the ONE cashier. If you plan on coming here, give yourself at least 20 minutes to wait in line if you want something custom.  Even if you order ahead it's kind of a mess because you have to cut in line to pay... I wish it was quicker I would come more often. I work a block away...
author: Ashley M.

description: Like a Vietnamese Chipotle but with inferior ingredients and no attention to detail.  Go to any Vietnamese place for spring rolls at half the price, and you'll be pleased with the quality.  Next time I'll just walk through the Tenderloin.
author: Beth B.

description: I thought my sandwich was gross, the sauce was too sweet, and the cashier wasn't too nice.
author: H B.

description: The lemongrass pork is pretty good in the salad. My issue with the salad is they stuff it into a regular size bowl unmixed. You can imagine how annoying it is to try to mix and eat this without spilling it at the beginning.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I did not like the chicken sandwich too much. I had better! In addition, the lychee drink was not appealing either.
author: Gina Y.

description: I've eaten there for the past few years and  I used to love the food.  I would go there often but that time has come to an end!! They have also changed there prices , now if u wanna pick what's on your sandwich its two dollars more. If I want green onions instead of jalapeños should I really have to pay 2 dollars? Additionally The quality has declined ( especially the pork).
author: tobdevilish i.

description: I just discovered this place at someone's suggestion when having lunch in the area. I ordered the signature fresh rolls and they were very good, as was the sauce that you choose yourself. It kind of reminds me of Chipotle for Vietnamese food in that you get to choose what goes in everything. The taro chips are a must (you can try samples when you pay) as well. It's great to have another option to eat when I'm in the area other than the food court at the mall, and it's just as fast.
author: a f.

description: Loved the Pho at Fresh Roll! Maybe send some to Crabtree as "get well soon" gift?
author: Sameer G.

description: I'm from out of town and tried Freshroll for the first time as a quick something to eat in my hotel room. SO YUMMY. After a day of random food it was just the healthy, simple taste I needed. The price for what you get is actually quite reasonable. A HUGE bowl of brown rice, crispy tofu, and tons of veggies with a yummy peanut sauce was under 10 bucks. Filling and, as the name implies, fresh.
author: Kristin S.

description: Amazing Bahn Mi. What makes this place unique is the "subway style" build your own sandwich. The ingredients are super fresh and the seasoning is perfect. Nothing is too sweet, salty, or spicy all served on a perfectly toasted sourdough roll. I would give this place 5 stars, but it can't beat the Bahn Mi I had in NYC.
author: Food S.

description: For 7 days straight last week, I was working a convention at Moscone Center and waking up at the ungodly hours of 5am and finally leaving at 6 or 7pm. That meant eating out at lunch. Freshroll was about 2 blocks away, so I decided to give them a shot. Had the 3 spring rolls for $7.95, the taro chips for $1.95, and the limeade for $1.95. So definitely more than what I usually spend on Vietnamese food, but still awesomely delicious. The spring rolls were rolled tightly, and you could taste the freshness of the pork and the shrimp. Definitely get the taro chips, they were just the right blend of sweet and oily(probably still healthier than regular potato chips.) All in all, I'd go here again-but try something different like the sandwich or the bowl option.
author: Courtney L.

description: Really nice, good tasting and fresh food. Service leaves room for more, but with the concept being Subway-ish, it is what you would expect. Would definitely go back for more rolls - the pork is to recommend!
author: Peter A.

description: Quick, cheap and healthy option. Tasty spring rolls in a convenient location.
author: Romita J.

description: It's a pretty neat concept... the freshrolls are as they say... fresh. I tried the chicken and the pork and both were tasty and yummy flavored. You have the option of the type of veggies you want. If you aren't sure, you can always say "the standard" and they will hook you up! The peanut sauce is also pretty good. And I also enjoyed the jasmine iced tea. The prices however, are a bit high for Vietnamese summer rolls and banh mi.
author: Caroline C.

description: My fave in the city.....sandwich and rolls! ESP the lemongrass pork
author: Diana S.

description: We asked FreshRolls to cater for a lunch event I held in SF. I wanted to do something healthy and different from the regular pizza. The food was excellent and loved by all attending. Everything was eaten! We will use them again.
author: silka m.

description: Fast, Fresh, delicious AND healthy! I could literally eat here everyday! I also strongly recommend their lychee iced tea, taro chips and their citrus ginger sauce IS AMAZING. I practically drank it. Finally a healthy fast food option on my lunch hour!
author: Lei L.

description:
Excellent choice if you're around the Metreon/Moscone Center and want something quick and light to go.  

My favorite combo so far is the 3 freshrolls with lemongrass pork and the sweet and sour chili sauce.  Make sure to request the fried scallion "crispy goodness" add-on, and order an extra roll or some taro chips if you're hungrier.  I also like the lychee tea!
author: S L.

description: The ingredients are fresh, the people are nice and the finished product tastes amazing. Went here during a quick work lunch and got the three rolls (two pork, one chicken). I got the "standard" toppings, minus the pineapple, plus carrots. The sauces were great -- especially the ginger sauce. Lobbying to get one of these in the DC area...I know I'll be thinking about it every time I'm looking for a quick, healthy but really satisfying/interesting lunch. Don't question...just go!
author: Autumn N.

description: Came here for lunch one day because I thought the concept of custom made fresh rolls was very innovative and I wasn't disappointed. It seems like everyone these days is opening up restaurants where they deliver fresh, fast-food fast. Some are a hit and some are a miss, but this was definitely a hit. They offer a variety of choices including fresh rolls, rice and noodle bowls, and sandwiches. I went with their standard 3 fresh rolls with fried tofu and most of their vegetables. Opted to not get the pineapple because the concept seemed a little strange to me, but I might try it on my next visit because a lot of people seemed to be getting it. You get to pick whatever sauces you want with it and since it was my first visit, I asked for all, haha. The lady at the counter seemed a little annoyed but I was curious as to which one I would like. I really enjoyed the peanut sauce and the sweet and sour - recommend both with the fresh rolls. Will be back to try their other combinations of proteins and dishes!
author: Malika R.

description: Vietnamese fast food.   You can watch them make it right in front of you. Awesome!  The rolls were great- pork was by far the best.
author: Skye W.

description: Theoretically this spot offers food that would hit a great spot on my palate. I enjoy Vietnamese foo greatly, and the fast-casual atmosphere ensures that both my taste buds and wallet remain happy. However, the problem is in the execution. My wraps, and especially my bowl, feel like a careless mishmash of ingredients rather than an actual entree of a meal. It's hard to quantify, but I just feel awkward eating such a thing.
author: Josh Q.

description: Great for a quick lunch. I got the combo meal with 3 fresh rolls, taro chips and a drink for about $12. Tasty, fresh and you can customize.
author: Christy Z.

description: Great fresh food. Creative concept. In need of a quick, cheap, yummy bite. Go. Done.
author: Chris M.

description:
I've been coming to eat at Freshroll since the time they opened. Today, when I stepped in, I noticed that they are INDEED downsizing their portions. You lose a star for that! Comeon, it's 3 freshrolls for $8. You can get these bad boys for $4 in San Jose, and it's authentic with pork and shrimp! I know rent it expensive at the Metreon, but your food cost is only less than $1.25 for all 3 rolls! If you're going to skimp out on the meat, at least sub it with more veggies/noodles! The rolls now SWIM in their container, and its apparent, at this rate, your ratings are going to go down on Yelp buddies!

Or better yet, cut out some staff like the one lady behind the cash register that handles money, touches her hair, and then your container box! That's gotta be unsanitary on some degree, I didn't complain before because the food was great for the price! Now, I'm starting to feel a little shiested. 

Word to the business owners, people come here for lunch and line out the door because it's fresh and healthy, they feel like they're getting their money's worth and the place is clean and convenient.  But if you start charging an arm and leg for 1 oz of meat, some noodles and veggies, your going to lose customers FAST my friends!
author: K C.

description: It was A-OK.  Hits the spot if you are in the area since the options are limited for vietnamese food.  I wouldn't say I loved it though - but didn't hate it either.
author: Mei C.

description: These guys are doing to Vietnamese food what Chipotle made to Mexican food. They make it accessible, fresh, clean and ready fast. Nice place for lunch when you are in downtown.
author: Gal S.

description: I was in SF for a week last month and ate here twice.  I am back again and the first day's lunch...had to go again.  Rolls are so fresh and delicious.  The pork is AMAZING.
author: Kristine M.

description:
Vietpotle says it best for this place.  I tried the salad bowl because I was hungry and it looked the most filling.  The spring rolls looked too small and the sandwich looks big once they add everything.  I will try that next time.

My salad bowl and comments:

Protein - 1/2 pork and 1/2 chicken  = YES good mix
1/2 Noodles = No.  didn't eat it all
1/2 Brown rice = Yes, its pretty good there and works with pork and chicken
Crispy goodness = NO.  I read a post saying to order it.  Should have passed.
Taro chips = YES!  but small portion

Clean and good service, and good food.  I'll be back.
author: G A.

description: Cool concept, fresh veggies, good meat. Doesn't beat authentic Vietnamese food, but worth going in for a quick meal for something like a lunch break.
author: Marilyn A.

description: Pretty good for what amounts to a Vietnamese version of Chipotle.   The chicken bowl was flavorful, although it could have used a few more veggies.  Egg rolls were fresh out of the fryer and crispy.   Good for a quick, affordable meal.
author: Chung Y.

description:
Came to Freshroll on Saturday during the usual lunch hour; I can't speak for weekday crowds, but the weekend line was moving pretty quickly.

I got 3 freshrolls with chicken (extra meat) and the "standard" additions.
- First thing I thought to myself was that these are a lot bigger and heftier than I'd imagined. Always a good idea to shell out a little more for the extra protein option. 
- They were plenty filling, even having skipped breakfast
- The wrapper is thicker than most, which provides a good chew
- Chicken was cut into thinner strips and was flavorful and meaty
- Vegetables and pineapple were fresh. Pineapple seemed like a strange addition at first but it actually works well to cut through the meat's marinade
- Peanut sauce seemed pretty standard, but familiar-tasting in a good way

Also got a lychee iced tea. It is lightly sweetened as described and provides just enough of a small bit of sweetness. The tea and lychee flavor is a good addition to their

This is a place I'd go to for a fresh, filling lunchtime meal that won't leave me feeling bad about what I just ate. Or it can make you a little feel better about what you ate/drank the night before.
author: Brian C.

description: Had fresh rolls today... Yum yum yum!! The meats ad a lot of favor n veggies were fresh. Love the selection on the different sauces. Very healthy! Will def be back,
author: Thanh N.

description: Bumping this up to five stars because their online ordering system is awesome, and there's no need to wait anymore!  The first time I used it, my order was botched and I called to let them know. They said they would comp that order, and the next would be on the house. Cool, right? A lot more than I expected. Then, one of the owners, Chad, e-mailed me to apologize.  I know that during a lunch rush, you can't expect 100% accuracy, so it really impressed me that they cared so much that the order wasn't perfect.  Of course, the next time I came in, the rolls were stellar. Win!
author: Pamela K.

description: Very nice addition to quick, inexpensive and quality lunch places. If they use rice vermicelli they can also claim to be gluten free facility.
author: Yana D.

description: Healthy and quick lunch!!!!  Stumbled upon this while at a conference.  It is build you own Thai rolls.  And the rolls were great!  I got the shrimp with all the veggies.  3 come to an order.  Loved the chili sauce to dip them in. The counter girl was friendly and explained how everything worked. Wish they had these on the east coast!
author: Jessie H.

description:
This might be my first yelp review ever, but this place was so good that I had to pay it some dues. I went there for lunch on my birthday at the advice of a friend, and got the three spring rolls option: one pork, one chicken, and one tofu. Was very happy with each of them. The veggies tasted supremely fresh and crunchy, with big, real leaves of deep green lettuce - not that shredded Iceberg you get at Chipotle. 

The ordering experience is seamless and easy, and the price is fair for what you get. I went with the spring rolls option, their recommended choice, with the standard fixins - sprouts, cucumbers, pineapple, jalepenos (love that they include those in the standard), and added pickled carrots to boot. Gotta take advantage of the unlimited veggie toppings...

The end result was an incredibly fresh-tasting set of three Vietnamese spring rolls on steroids. I was pleasantly full after eating two of the three, and am looking at the third sitting on my desk next and eagerly awaiting eating it as my mid-afternoon snack.

This is a delicious, fresh-tasting and healthy lunch option if you're in SOMA, and I highly recommend it. Definitely get grandma's peanut sauce and sriracha, and don't forget to ask for the crispy goodness!
author: Joshua E.

description: Found this shop on yelp while attending a training at a near by hotel.  Concept is really cool - fresh healthy Asian food cafeteria style.  You pick from a bowl, bahn mi (sandwich), or freshroll (spring rolls).  Then you select your meats - chicken, pork, shrimp, tofu, or a combo.  Next you pick your toppings and sauce.  I really like how they had pineapple!   I ordered the fresh rolls and had one of each type of meat.  They were good but nothing out of this world.  The sauces were just ok too.  My favorite was the sweet chili.  There are lots of places to eat near the Metreon, next time I'll try another spot.
author: Carolyn P.

description: Americanized Vietnamese food (in a good way) with a good price for San Francisco if you are looking for a light lunch or dinner. It was great to be able to pick exactly what you wanted or didn't want in your rolls. Only thing I wasn't a fan of was that they didn't have Pho 45 minutes before closing. The small line was moving slowly so I wouldn't recommend going there if you are on a short lunch break.
author: T S.

description: The rolls are filled with fresh vegetables and meats.  It's a bit pricy, but a good place for lunch once a while.
author: Tina C.

description: Freshroll is a fast food type establishment located on the outside of a mall. The selection is not huge - either spring rolls or bowls with basically the same selection of ingredients rolled up or tossed around in each, respectively. However, both are good, fresh, and a healthy cheap alternative to other fast food options. Putting it over the top is a selection of yummy sauces to drench your meal in. I couldn't choose my favorite. I was also very impressed by Freshroll's "no trash" policy wherein the remainders of your meal are divided into compost and recyclables. Should Freshroll come to Texas, I'll be visiting again!
author: Shannon G.

description: Decent. I think that most spring rolls I've had at vietnamese restaurants are cheaper and better.
author: Olivia P.

description:
i like this place.  The portions are okay for me (although meat to rice ratio could be more balanced)... which means more meat.  Nice that they offer brown rice.  It sort of reminds me of Chipotle, but Vietnamese style.  

It would be nice if the vegetable portions were more plentiful too, but that's pretty rare for these types of joints.

My question is - what exactly does "all natural" meat mean?  Does this mean no hormones or antibiotics?  Organic?  It wasn't clear to me.  

Assuming "all natural" means no hormones and antibiotics, I'm all for this place for a relatively healthy, quick meal near downtown.
author: Ava C.

description:
As a lover of Asian food, I made the trek from fidi and tried the highly anticipated Freshroll menu for the first time today.  It certainly did not disappoint!  The tender pork, fresh veggies, and vermicelli noodles made a filling, healthy, and extremely yummy lunch.  

I also loved the modern look and clean feel of the place.  Everything was spotless.  

I will be back!
author: Joanne C.

description: Great fast-food.  Ingredients are fresh and varied - get them in a rice wrap&roll, in a salad bowl, on a bed of noodles or rice.   Personnel are good-natured.
author: Anne J.

description: I loved this place! I would agree with others that the crispy goodness, though it doesn't seem much, adds a lot of flavor to your overall meal. I wasn't brave enough to try the fresh rolls, note Mexican just now exploring the flavors of the world.... Maybe next time, but the chicken rice bowl was great. I also thought the jasmine iced tea was great after being outside all day. I would definitely recommend :-)
author: Arianna V.

description:
Tried their rolls before going to SFMOMA on a Thursday evening. They were tasty, and the place's peanut sauce went extremely well with the rolls.

The owner (or manager) came to ask us if everything was good. This doesn't seem to happen often for a (kind of) fast food restaurant.

I'm a bit curious on the long-term viability of their simple menus, i.e. if it will get old and boring. They also need to be careful about how they clean and maintain the place. When my friend and I were there, we chose to eat there, and the tables, although very clean, still had a tinge of the mop smell. Also, they should really use high-quality flat panels for their menus. Theirs were not well calibrated, and when you stared at them, it looked if the images were shaking (they were not, but they seemed so because the panels were of lower quality). That's why I deducted a star.

Otherwise, an awesome choice for dinner for my future Thursday visits to MOMA.
author: Luke L.

description: How come no one thought of this before? It's brilliant. Freshly made rolls. It's simple, it's fast, it's fresh, it's delicious and it's made to order. I had their rolls and can't wait to try their soup and sandwiches. I have a feeling I will not be disappointed.
author: CatsPjs Z.

description: Stopped by here for lunch during RSA, had the noodle bowl with pork and shrimp spring rolls- both very good! Got the standard, but wish they added carrots. The menu is small so limited choices, but good taste.
author: E S.

description: They're new, so they take awhile... but when that first bite hits your mouth, you'll forget all about that! The rolls are amazing and I highly recommend the peanut sauce!
author: Ryan M.

description: This place has the best lunch option in Soma, and the rolls are fresh and delicious. I usually order the chicken spring roll, and the chicken is marinated really well. I could eat these for every meal and just moved locations, so I hope they start to offer a delivery option soon!
author: Lyndsey M.

description: I had high expectations for this place and overall my group really enjoyed their meal, but we got takeout and my order had been switched with someone roses. Had the lemongrass pork bowl, but was really looking forward to my peanut sauce and got tangy citrus ginger instead. Also, someone who ordered extra avocado lost out on that, so that was pretty disappointing. If I go back, will have to try again.
author: Stephen S.

description: I was on an outing/stroll through the Yerba Buena Gardens and decided to check out the Metreon after several years have passed since I last been and to my surprise a lot has changed. I love all the different places to eat on the first level and I was curious after seeing the Freshroll sign and something light to eat was on my mind. I love Vietnamese fresh rolls and it's such a great idea! I tend to eat vegetarian so I ordered the crispy tofu fresh rolls with all the trimmings--such a great idea to run it like a Subway or Chipotle and choose what you want in them. The pho seemed great too. The prices are fair. The selection of dipping sauces is great and all so tasty. The fresh ingredients drove me up the wall and I was in fresh roll heaven! The taro chips are great and offset the soft and chewy textures of the rolls with a nice savory crunch (though at $2 for what you get is fairly steep). The staff seemed friendly and attentive. I'll be sure to come around again next time I'm nearby.
author: Aaron G.

description: Love freshroll. Always get the grilled pork rolls and the freshmade taro chips. Yum. :)
author: Jason L.

description: This review is for the fresh spring rolls. I haven't tried anything else but I love all of their rolls.  Course the line can be long at lunch time but if you go after 2pm it's pretty fast.
author: Ris P.

description: This restaurant was OK.  I've had much better at most hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurants.  They are fast, and pricing is in line with other lunch joints in SF.  Their produce is fresh, but the flavor of the pork was meh.  The noodles were thicker than the vermicelli you typically see, which I prefer because the increased surface area allows for more sauce stickage.  Anyway, I just don't get the hype.
author: Daniel J.

description: Not much to say about this place, second time i come here, thought it deserved a second chance as the ingredients they use taste fresh. Main complaint is the customer service which is just terrible, and it takes them way too long to make anything. Like I said, food tastes fresh (the reason i give them 2 stars) but there just isnt enough meat and way too many veggies. For the price, there are much better options for vietnamese food in the city.
author: Ed H.

description: Catering job from Freshroll today for the company - first time, a bit gun shy as we're use to our normal vendors...but they definitely were winners!  Tons of ravings with the DIY salad and noodle bar with a nice assortment of veggies:  cucumbers, pickled/shredded daikon and carrots, cilantro, bean sprouts, jalapenos.  Tasty lemongrass pork, yummy grilled chicken and deep fried tofu - all perfect to to sit on top of their red leaf lettuces and rice noodles.  Four different dressings to choose from: peanut sauce, sweet chili sauce, fish sauce or citrus ginger -- all were delish. We also ordered the pork fresh rolls and veggie fresh rolls which we'll pass on next time. I didn't get a chance to try but alot of the lettuces came out of the rolls which ended up looking a bit messy - which is why the 4 star and not 5.  Delivery came on time and Michael was great with the set up.  A high recommendation to use them again! Thanks Freshroll!
author: T C.

description: Was very scrumptious.  I'll definitely be going back. Highly recommend their peanut sauce. Yum!
author: Sara P.

description: Had the rolls. They gave me another person's order, but that probably didn't matter because it was close to the same ingredients. Tasted like dried up veggies and greasy bad cuts of meat rolled up in plastic wrap.
author: G. B.

description: Love this place! Food is delicious, fresh and fast! And healthy too, with lots of veggies. My go to dish are the rolls (shrimp or tofu, although the meat ones are great too!) and a side of chicken pho soup! Hubby gets the Banh mi which is the best around (again with a ton of veggies and their super delicious mayo-sauce). We have to try the pho! I would get it more if its on the way home or closer to home! Craving it as I write this!
author: Jessica L.

description: This place has got the best spring rolls I've ever had. I am SUPER indecisive about food, especially when the menu has alot of options. Therefore, it's great that an order of the fresh rolls come with 3 rolls and you can choose to have different meat and toppings on each one so that you're not limited to eating three of the same thing. Most (by most, I mean all) spring rolls I've had before are usually stuffed with 90% noodles, one lettuce, and a shrimp cut in half. The rolls here are stuffed with meat, probably about 10-15% noodle and the rest is filled with fresh veggies, carrots, optional toppings such as jalapenos for that extra kick, pineapple, etc. The meat is very tasty and flavorfull. I think my favorite is the lemongrass pork with the 49er? topping (the one with the jalapenos). The staff here is also very patient and willing to answer any questions you may have and overall, I felt that it was a really clean and nice place to dine. The prices here are reasonable for the quality and the amount of food you get. If only they had one in the financial district, I'd be a frequent customer.
author: Anita L.

description: Perfect for people on the go.  I was there for the Dreamforce conference and everything else was just heavy, unhealthy, and took too long.  If you're looking for fast, fresh, and great tasting food, you can't do much better than this place
author: Tae L.

description: i'm very picky about my vietnamese food so naturally i was a little skeptical coming here since it appeared to be another americanized vietnamese spot, but i was very impressed... i came for lunch and ordered the grilled chicken roll with the crunchy add-on.. the flavors were spot on and the portions were generous.. i typically look for three criteria when grabbing lunch - healthy, good and cheap... most places only meet two of the three, but freshroll hit all three! i can eat well, save some money and not feel like a fat ass! i'll definitely be back..
author: Grant L.

description: Good taste, freshly made.  Had the goi cuon (spring rolls). The "grandmother" peanut sauce was excellent. The staffs were very friendly. A Vietnamese Subway equivalent.
author: Grace T.

description: this place is ok, if you are in the mood for fast and cheap.  you get quite a bit of food with your order, and there  lots of complimentary toppings to go over either a noodle or rice dish and several sauce options that you can add on your own.  i did find the meal difficult to eat however given the small size of their bowls.  every time i tried to mix stuff together, things fell out of the bowl.  and they compostable utensils they provide don't really get the job done.
author: Ash T.

description: So I came here on its grand opening Saturday after a long day of shopping with my girlfriends at Union Square. We got super hungry and after hitting up Bloomingdales, walked to the Metreon and found this new Vietnamese place called Freshroll. I'm actually super excited a place like this opened up in SF because I am Vietnamese and from Orange County ( the best Viet food in the world) so there is a lack of good viet places to eat in the city and also I have super high standards for Viet food. I think I ordered the 49-er roll I don't quite remember the name but it was the one with chicken. You can customize it so I substituted the  jalapeño for the tofu. Alls I got to say is that it was sooo delicious!! The rolls were big, tasty, super fresh, and the meat and sauce were very flavorful. It's the perfect low carb meal ( hold the noodles)  but super satisfying at the same time. They also have banh mi ( Vietnamese sandwich)  and pho which I'd like to try next time. Prices were pretty cheap too, I got 3 fat rolls and it was like 7 bucks and I had 1.5 rolls left for later. I'm actually going to be call Freshroll on my way home from work so I can pick up some dinner tonight. YUMMMMS!!
author: Maria D.

description: The place is very clean.  It is exactly well laid out for a busy crowd.  You have to crawl over the people in line to get your sauces and to the trash can.  The food is very good.  My main gripe is that they just can't handle a lunch rush.  You could see the people behind the counter struggling with getting the bread toasted and rolls takes a very long time to make.  What should have been a quick lunch took almost 40 min. from line to finish.  I will try this again, but only if it isn't busy.
author: Michael S.

description: I love everything about Fresh Roll. The staff are always friendly and the food is delicious. I love the 3 fresh rolls with pork, peanut sauce and of course the crispy goodness. The portion sizes are very filling and the rolls are packed with flavor. It's definitely worth the walk from the FiDi for Fresh Roll for lunch.
author: Katie G.

description: Great for grabbing a lunch on the go!  I walked out of here with a rice bowl that really hit the spot.  Topped with pork and the "traditional Vietnamese" toppings is the way to do. The vinaigrette sauce is the perfect compliment, and I barely used half of the dressing.  Pretty good spot for $9.  The line moved pretty quickly, hoping it continues as the restaurant gets more popular.
author: Joel F.

description: I went there on their 8th day of operations, and consider me impressed.  The service was pretty amazing and the food was delicious.  I ordered a 3 roll thing with chicken and pork, and it was so good I went back for a 4th roll.  I still need to try out their bowls and bahn mi, but the quality of the ingredients and the level of service (even chatted with the owner a little and everyone was asking for feedback) definitely makes me want to revisit.  In fact, I'm going there again tonight! =)
author: Kryzak K.

description: Was looking forward to eating here based on the reviews. I came in eagerly into the store at 8:35 hoping to order a bánh mì sandwich.  As soon as I walked in, the clerk at the counter said that they were closed. I left wondering why they were not following their own time schedule given that they were supposed to be open until 9 PM. I then went to chipotle and order a nice burrito bowl. I made it back to my hotel room and wrote this review while they were technically still supposed to be open. Sad they lost a customer because they were lazy and closed early.
author: Vasanth S.

description:
Upon entering the restaurant, I was immediately impressed with the polished, modern and refreshing decor.  I'm a huge fan of Vietnamese spring rolls and already knew that I'd be ordering some kind of roll.  Being able to create your own roll and add your personally favorite ingredients is genius!
