They also have set veggie combinations you can try with your meat.  I opted for the shrimp roll with "Californian" veggie combination which came with avocado, cucumbers and sprouts.  The rolls also already include vermicelli noodles.  In addition to the rolls, you get a choice of sauce.  The menu suggested "Citrus Ginger" with the "Californian" so I decided to try it but also ordered a peanut sauce because that's always my favorite.  I'm not a big fan of ginger, but the Citrus Ginger sauce was pretty amazing and the ginger wasn't overpowering at all.  You can never go wrong with the peanut sauce :).

Each order of rolls come with 3 rolls.  At first, I didn't think this would be enough food.  I order spring rolls at pho restaurants all the time as an appetizer and can usually eat spring rolls and half of my bowl of pho.  These Freshrolls, however, are bigger than your ordinary spring rolls and I was full after my second roll.  

My fiance chose to order a rice bowl with chicken which he said was pretty good.  The chicken was juicy and flavorful and he finished the entire bowl.

I think the easiest way to explain Freshroll is that it's the delicious and a much healthier version of a Chipotle (ironically, there will be a Chipotle opening soon next door).  I'll definitely be coming back here to try their other variations.  I also want to try their Vietnamese Sandwich, which I hear is pretty amazing.
author: Monique C.

description: Service was great, owners are 30 something guys living the dream (yep, that's right this is not backed by a large chain).  You can tell service and food quality are high priorities.  My wife and I bought 2 orders of rolls, both including chicken and pork - yes, both awesome. Food was extremely fresh, filling, and we both left feeling light and healthy on our night on the town.  It's worth the short stroll for folks in the FiDi for lunch, quick and healthy for movie goers, and perfect for out-of-towners here on conventions.  Will be coming back soon!
author: nick h.

description: I stopped by this place on my way back from the Giants game and was pleasantly surprised.  It's quick, streamlined, and the food is filling which I didn't expect.  I talked to the owner who told me they just opened a few weeks ago.  They seemed to have their process pretty well ironed out for being so new, although, it was an off-hour when I was in so not too busy.  I don't usually write yelp reviews but I will definitely be back!
author: Jeff W.

description: It's quick. It'll fill you up. It's a healthier option if you're eating downtown. Its the Chipotle of americanized vietnamese food. If you're not in a crunch, the tenderloin has far better options to get your spring roll fix (or banh mi or pho) but I do like the fresh ingredients here. I also like that you can help yourself to as much peanut sauce as you want.
author: Tina L.

description: Simple and good.  Really busy though.  Order ahead is best.  Loved the lychee tea not so much the soup.
author: Nancy N.

description:
I wish I could address this directly to the owner -- the food is fresh and great.  Unfortunately, the service needs a lot of work so my coworkers and I will NOT be returning.  Too bad as we work in the neighborhood with the public.  The cashier, who appeared to also be a shift manager (or at least bossy with the others) has no customer service ability or knowledge of her pricing/product. She tried to grossly overcharge me, but then when I said I would change my order or walk away,  wink-wink she said she would give me the price I was asking for - which is the price I should have been charged in the first place.  She blamed it on the owners pricing structure and not her own confusion.   She didn't seem to have great bandwidth, and when I tried to explain to her (in a nice tone with the best intentions) how I thought she had misunderstood the owners' pricing, she got very nasty.   Not a good start.

I would come back for the food, but unfortunately, as most restauranteurs know, bad service can chase away customers .  I am one of those.
author: sweaterhead x.

description: this place offers a new take on the vietnamese spring rolls by adding fresh pineapple and jalapenos to them!  i love the added touch of sweetness mixed with the added kick of the jalapeno!  they got slammed this week due to the dreamforce convention!  i'm sure the customers enjoyed the rolls as much as i did!  my favorites are the shrimp and tofu.  add tea and taro chips to make it a combo meal!  the chips were a bit heavy on the salt, other than that, everything was yummy!
author: Vic S.

description: Visiting San Fran for a conference and stopped in for dinner. Delicious! Fresh, clean, friendly and soooooo tasty!!!! Highly recommended.
author: Heather P.

description:
At freshroll, you get a great vietnamese sandwich.  sorry to say, but freshroll is americanized the right way, where the meat is reliable-- no mysteries.   the quality of all ingredients is extremely fresh, and the offerings are perfect for a truly healthy lunch.  some pointers:
1.  the "crispy goodness" is a necessary add-on to your rolls.  it may add some calories, but it's worth at least a try.  
2.  Pineapple is a great add-on for the sandwiches.
3.  You do NOT need the nam nam sauce for your sandwich.  they sorta assume everyone should have it, and they will put it on unless you tell them no.  There are other sauces, such as vietnamese vinegarette, that go better with the sandwich.  Bottom line:  save yourself the extra empty calories from the mayo-based nam nam sauce. 
4.  show up slightly off hours like after 2pm to avoid lines which can extend through the place out the door.  when we go in at 230-3 on saturday we do not have a long wait.  

i have been in several times, and the owner is meticulous in providing a positive experience.
author: eshwar k.

description: so healthy! i always get crispy goodness, pork, and peanut sauce. i also really liked the pho soup.
author: Anna D.

description: Delicious fresh healthy rolls for lunch!  Heard about this resturant from a co-worker and have ate here 6 times since.  Their pork banh mi sandwiches are good, however I always get the chicken or pork rolls.  Fresh rolls will continue to my resturant of choice for healthy, filling, and delicious lunch!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Been here multiple times and can't get enough.  Most of these new roll places (sushirrito, Spice kit, u-sushi) simply don't have the variety to be able to eat there on a regular basis.  Must try the Banh Mi - best meat and sauce (the nam nam sauce) that I've had.  Also - really can't go wrong w/ the standard freshroll crispy goodness - or the noodle bowls.  The sauces are great tasting and the décor of the restaurant is modern and chic.  Only regret is that it's far away from my office otherwise I'd go twice as much.
author: Michael C.

description: Tasty.  Clean.  Friendly staff with smiles.  Yeah, Chipotle inspired Vietnamese.  If you are looking for authentic this is not your place.  But tasty and filling.
author: Dave H.

description: I am so happy freshroll opened in the neighborhood.  The meals are filling and the ingredients tasty.  When I want a healthier lunch option this will be my go to place.  As a vegetarian, I can't comment on the meat, but I will say that the tofu is lack luster ( which is why i docked a star).  The first time I went, I ended up pulling it out of the rolls.  Now I skip the protein and load up on veggies.  I have tried all of the sauces and I think my favorites are citrus ginger and the chili one.  I'm addicted to the taro chips.  I have found the service really friendly, but I have never come during the lunch rush ( I have walked by and it seemed chaotic) I come for late lunch or to bring home dinner.  Some people have commented on the lack of Vietnamese authenticity, but I think the restaurant is trying to put a California twist on the Vietnamese roll, which I enjoy.
author: Whatsnext M.

description: I was so looking forward to trying this place, as fresh spring rolls are one of my favorite things to eat.  Sadly, the balance of ingredients was way off -- almost no noodles (come one, those noodles cost next to nothing), which left each roll about 1/3 the size of a real goi cuon.  Seriously, for an $8 fast food meal, I expected so much more -- this was a huge disappointment.
author: Ed K.

description: I stopped by this place after work to try it.  Has a very basic menu with 3 choices of styles (spring roll, a bowl of noodle or a bahn-mi sandwich).and a variety of ingredients/filling.  I went for the noodle.  The flavor is very fresh and light, nothing greasy.  An addition of a variety of sauces adds different dimensions to the fresh flavor.  What set them apart for me is the friendly employees and the manager who greets everyone and made sure everyone was great.  Now this is unheard of in a fast food joint but it's very refreshing.  Keep giving out good food and great service and this place will be above the rest.
author: Tabp F.

description: vietnamese fast food.  really good spring rolls.  really good service.  the place is really clean, the food is freshly prepared.
author: Kerry F.
